stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं ह्य॑ग्ने प्रथ॒मो म॒नोता॒स्या धि॒यो अभ॑वो दस्म॒ होता॑ त्वं सीं॑ वृषन्नकृणोर्दु॒ष्टरी॑तु॒ सहो॒ विश्व॑स्मै॒ सह॑से॒ सह॑ध्यै
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ hy àgne prathamó manótā- -asyā́ dhiyó ábhavo dasma hótā tváṃ sīṃ vr̥ṣann akr̥ṇor duṣṭárītu sáho víśvasmai sáhase sáhadhyai
stanzas.translation: THOU, first inventor of this prayer, O Agni, Worker of Marvels, hast become our Herald. Thou, Bull, hast made us strength which none may conquer, strength that shall overcome all other prowess.

translations.griffith: THOU, first inventor of this prayer, O Agni, Worker of Marvels, hast become our Herald. Thou, Bull, hast made us strength which none may conquer, strength that shall overcome all other prowess.

stanzas.sanskrit: अधा॒ होता॒ न्य॑सीदो॒ यजी॑यानि॒ळस्प॒द इ॒षय॒न्नीड्यः॒ सन् तं त्वा॒ नरः॑ प्रथ॒मं दे॑व॒यन्तो॑ म॒हो रा॒ये चि॒तय॑न्तो॒ अनु॑ ग्मन्
stanzas.transliteration: ádhā hótā ny àsīdo yájīyān iḷás padá iṣáyann ī́ḍyaḥ sán táṃ tvā náraḥ prathamáṃ devayánto mahó rāyé citáyanto ánu gman
stanzas.translation: As Priest thou sattest at the seat of worship, furthering us, best Offerer, meet for honour. So first to thee have pious men resorted, turning thy mind to thoughts of ample riches.

translations.griffith: As Priest thou sattest at the seat of worship, furthering us, best Offerer, meet for honour. So first to thee have pious men resorted, turning thy mind to thoughts of ample riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: वृ॒तेव॒ यन्तं॑ ब॒हुभि॑र्वस॒व्यै॒३॒॑स्त्वे र॒यिं जा॑गृ॒वांसो॒ अनु॑ ग्मन् रुश॑न्तम॒ग्निं द॑र्श॒तं बृ॒हन्तं॑ व॒पाव॑न्तं वि॒श्वहा॑ दीदि॒वांस॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: vr̥téva yántam bahúbhir vasavyaìs tvé rayíṃ jāgr̥vā́ṃso ánu gman rúśantam agníṃ darśatám br̥hántaṃ vapā́vantaṃ viśváhā dīdivā́ṃsam
stanzas.translation: In thee, still watching, they have followed riches, who goest with much wealth as with an army, The radiant Agni, lofty, fair to look on, worshipped with marrow, evermore resplendent.

translations.griffith: In thee, still watching, they have followed riches, who goest with much wealth as with an army, The radiant Agni, lofty, fair to look on, worshipped with marrow, evermore resplendent.

stanzas.sanskrit: प॒दं दे॒वस्य॒ नम॑सा॒ व्यन्तः॑ श्रव॒स्यवः॒ श्रव॑ आप॒न्नमृ॑क्तम् नामा॑नि चिद्दधिरे य॒ज्ञिया॑नि भ॒द्रायां॑ ते रणयन्त॒ संदृ॑ष्टौ
stanzas.transliteration: padáṃ devásya námasā vyántaḥ śravasyávaḥ śráva āpann ámr̥ktam nā́māni cid dadhire yajñíyāni- bhadrā́yāṃ te raṇayanta sáṃdr̥ṣṭau
stanzas.translation: They who approached the God's abode with homage, eager for glory, won them perfect glory: Yea, they gained even sacrificial titles, and found delight in thine auspicious aspect.

translations.griffith: They who approached the God's abode with homage, eager for glory, won them perfect glory: Yea, they gained even sacrificial titles, and found delight in thine auspicious aspect.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वां व॑र्धन्ति क्षि॒तयः॑ पृथि॒व्यां त्वां राय॑ उ॒भया॑सो॒ जना॑नाम् त्वं त्रा॒ता त॑रणे॒ चेत्यो॑ भूः पि॒ता मा॒ता सद॒मिन्मानु॑षाणाम्
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́ṃ vardhanti kṣitáyaḥ pr̥thivyā́ṃ tvā́ṃ rā́ya ubháyāso jánānām tváṃ trātā́ taraṇe cétyo bhūḥ pitā́ mātā́ sádam ín mā́nuṣāṇām
stanzas.translation: On earth the people magnify thee greatly, thee their celestial and terrestrial riches. Thou, Helper, must be known as our Preserver, Father and Mother of mankind for ever.

translations.griffith: On earth the people magnify thee greatly, thee their celestial and terrestrial riches. Thou, Helper, must be known as our Preserver, Father and Mother of mankind for ever.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒प॒र्येण्यः॒ स प्रि॒यो वि॒क्ष्व१॒॑ग्निर्होता॑ म॒न्द्रो नि ष॑सादा॒ यजी॑यान् तं त्वा॑ व॒यं दम॒ आ दी॑दि॒वांस॒मुप॑ ज्ञु॒बाधो॒ नम॑सा सदेम
stanzas.transliteration: saparyéṇyaḥ sá priyó vikṣv àgnír hótā mandró ní ṣasādā yájīyān táṃ tvā vayáṃ dáma ā́ dīdivā́ṃsam úpa jñubā́dho námasā sadema
stanzas.translation: Dear priest among mankind, adorable Agni hath seated him, joy-giver, skilled in worship. Let us approach thee shining in thy dwelling, kneeling upon our knees, with adoration.

translations.griffith: Dear priest among mankind, adorable Agni hath seated him, joy-giver, skilled in worship. Let us approach thee shining in thy dwelling, kneeling upon our knees, with adoration.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं त्वा॑ व॒यं सु॒ध्यो॒३॒॑ नव्य॑मग्ने सुम्ना॒यव॑ ईमहे देव॒यन्तः॑ त्वं विशो॑ अनयो॒ दीद्या॑नो दि॒वो अ॑ग्ने बृह॒ता रो॑च॒नेन॑
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ tvā vayáṃ sudhyò návyam agne sumnāyáva īmahe devayántaḥ tváṃ víśo anayo dī́dyāno divó agne br̥hatā́ rocanéna
stanzas.translation: Longing for bliss, pure-minded, God-devoted, Agni, we seek thee, such, meet to be lauded. Thou, Agni, leddest forth our men to battle, refulgent with the heaven's exalted splendour.

translations.griffith: Longing for bliss, pure-minded, God-devoted, Agni, we seek thee, such, meet to be lauded. Thou, Agni, leddest forth our men to battle, refulgent with the heaven's exalted splendour.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒शां क॒विं वि॒श्पतिं॒ शश्व॑तीनां नि॒तोश॑नं वृष॒भं च॑र्षणी॒नाम् प्रेती॑षणिमि॒षय॑न्तं पाव॒कं राज॑न्तम॒ग्निं य॑ज॒तं र॑यी॒णाम्
stanzas.transliteration: viśā́ṃ kavíṃ viśpátiṃ śáśvatīnāṃ nitóśanaṃ vr̥ṣabháṃ carṣaṇīnā́m prétīṣaṇim iṣáyantam pāvakáṃ rā́jantam agníṃ yajatáṃ rayīṇā́m
stanzas.translation: Sage of mankind, all peoples' Lord and Master, the Bull of men, the sender down of blessings, Still pressing on, promoting, purifying, Agni the Holy One, the Lord of riches.

translations.griffith: Sage of mankind, all peoples' Lord and Master, the Bull of men, the sender down of blessings, Still pressing on, promoting, purifying, Agni the Holy One, the Lord of riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: सो अ॑ग्न ईजे शश॒मे च॒ मर्तो॒ यस्त॒ आन॑ट् स॒मिधा॑ ह॒व्यदा॑तिम् य आहु॑तिं॒ परि॒ वेदा॒ नमो॑भि॒र्विश्वेत्स वा॒मा द॑धते॒ त्वोतः॑
stanzas.transliteration: só agna īje śaśamé ca márto yás ta ā́naṭ samídhā havyádātim yá ā́hutim pári védā námobhir víśvét sá vāmā́ dadhate tvótaḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni, the mortal who hath toiled and worshipped, brought thee oblations with his kindled fuel, And well knows sacrifice with adoration, gains every joy with thee to guard and help him.

translations.griffith: Agni, the mortal who hath toiled and worshipped, brought thee oblations with his kindled fuel, And well knows sacrifice with adoration, gains every joy with thee to guard and help him.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्मा उ॑ ते॒ महि॑ म॒हे वि॑धेम॒ नमो॑भिरग्ने स॒मिधो॒त ह॒व्यैः वेदी॑ सूनो सहसो गी॒र्भिरु॒क्थैरा ते॑ भ॒द्रायां॑ सुम॒तौ य॑तेम
stanzas.transliteration: asmā́ u te máhi mahé vidhema námobhir agne samídhotá havyaíḥ védī sūno sahaso gīrbhír ukthaír ā́ te bhadrā́yāṃ sumataú yatema
stanzas.translation: Mightily let us worship thee the Mighty, with reverence, Agni! fuel and oblations, With songs, O Son of Strength, with hymns, with altar: so may we strive for thine auspicious favour.

translations.griffith: Mightily let us worship thee the Mighty, with reverence, Agni! fuel and oblations, With songs, O Son of Strength, with hymns, with altar: so may we strive for thine auspicious favour.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ यस्त॒तन्थ॒ रोद॑सी॒ वि भा॒सा श्रवो॑भिश्च श्रव॒स्य१॒॑स्तरु॑त्रः बृ॒हद्भि॒र्वाजैः॒ स्थवि॑रेभिर॒स्मे रे॒वद्भि॑रग्ने वित॒रं वि भा॑हि
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yás tatántha ródasī ví bhāsā́ śrávobhiś ca śravasyàs tárutraḥ br̥hádbhir vā́jai sthávirebhir asmé revádbhir agne vitaráṃ ví bhāhi
stanzas.translation: Thou who hast covered heaven and earth with splendour and with thy glories, glorious and triumphant. Continue thou to shine on us, O Agni, with strength abundant, rich, and long enduring.

translations.griffith: Thou who hast covered heaven and earth with splendour and with thy glories, glorious and triumphant. Continue thou to shine on us, O Agni, with strength abundant, rich, and long enduring.

stanzas.sanskrit: नृ॒वद्व॑सो॒ सद॒मिद्धे॑ह्य॒स्मे भूरि॑ तो॒काय॒ तन॑याय प॒श्वः पू॒र्वीरिषो॑ बृह॒तीरा॒रेअ॑घा अ॒स्मे भ॒द्रा सौ॑श्रव॒सानि॑ सन्तु
stanzas.transliteration: nr̥vád vaso sádam íd dhehy asmé bhū́ri tokā́ya tánayāya paśváḥ pūrvī́r íṣo br̥hatī́r āré-aghāḥ- asmé bhadrā́ sauśravasā́ni santu
stanzas.translation: Vouchsafe us ever, as man needs, O Vasu, abundant wealth of kine for son and offspring. Food noble, plenteous, far from sin and evil, he with us, and fair fame to make us happy.

translations.griffith: Vouchsafe us ever, as man needs, O Vasu, abundant wealth of kine for son and offspring. Food noble, plenteous, far from sin and evil, he with us, and fair fame to make us happy.

stanzas.sanskrit: पु॒रूण्य॑ग्ने पुरु॒धा त्वा॒या वसू॑नि राजन्व॒सुता॑ ते अश्याम् पु॒रूणि॒ हि त्वे पु॑रुवार॒ सन्त्यग्ने॒ वसु॑ विध॒ते राज॑नि॒ त्वे
stanzas.transliteration: purū́ṇy agne purudhā́ tvāyā́ vásūni rājan vasútā te aśyām purū́ṇi hí tvé puruvāra sánti- ágne vásu vidhaté rā́jani tvé
stanzas.translation: May I obtain much wealth in many places by love of thee and through thy grace, King Agni; For in thee Bounteous One, in thee the Sovran, Agni, are many boons for him who serves thee.

translations.griffith: May I obtain much wealth in many places by love of thee and through thy grace, King Agni; For in thee Bounteous One, in thee the Sovran, Agni, are many boons for him who serves thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं हि क्षैत॑व॒द्यशोऽग्ने॑ मि॒त्रो न पत्य॑से त्वं वि॑चर्षणे॒ श्रवो॒ वसो॑ पु॒ष्टिं न पु॑ष्यसि
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ hí kṣaítavad yáśaḥ- -ágne mitró ná pátyase tváṃ vicarṣaṇe śrávo váso puṣṭíṃ ná puṣyasi
stanzas.translation: THOU, Agni, even as Mitra, hast a princely glory of thine own. Thou, active Vasu, makest fame increase like full prosperity.

translations.griffith: THOU, Agni, even as Mitra, hast a princely glory of thine own. Thou, active Vasu, makest fame increase like full prosperity.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वां हि ष्मा॑ चर्ष॒णयो॑ य॒ज्ञेभि॑र्गी॒र्भिरीळ॑ते त्वां वा॒जी या॑त्यवृ॒को र॑ज॒स्तूर्वि॒श्वच॑र्षणिः
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́ṃ hí ṣmā carṣaṇáyo yajñébhir gīrbhír ī́ḷate tvā́ṃ vājī́ yāty avr̥kó rajastū́r viśvácarṣaṇiḥ
stanzas.translation: For, verily, men pray to thee with sacrifices and with songs. To thee the Friendly Courser, seen of all, comes speeding through the air.

translations.griffith: For, verily, men pray to thee with sacrifices and with songs. To thee the Friendly Courser, seen of all, comes speeding through the air.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒जोष॑स्त्वा दि॒वो नरो॑ य॒ज्ञस्य॑ के॒तुमि॑न्धते यद्ध॒ स्य मानु॑षो॒ जनः॑ सुम्ना॒युर्जु॒ह्वे अ॑ध्व॒रे
stanzas.transliteration: sajóṣas tvā divó náro yajñásya ketúm indhate yád dha syá mā́nuṣo jánaḥ sumnāyúr juhvé adhvaré
stanzas.translation: Of one accord men kindle thee Heaven's signal of the sacrifice, When, craving bliss, this race of man invites thee to the solemn rite.

translations.griffith: Of one accord men kindle thee Heaven's signal of the sacrifice, When, craving bliss, this race of man invites thee to the solemn rite.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋध॒द्यस्ते॑ सु॒दान॑वे धि॒या मर्तः॑ श॒शम॑ते ऊ॒ती ष बृ॑ह॒तो दि॒वो द्वि॒षो अंहो॒ न त॑रति
stanzas.transliteration: ŕ̥dhad yás te sudā́nave dhiyā́ mártaḥ śaśámate ūtī́ ṣá br̥ható divó dviṣó áṃho ná tarati
stanzas.translation: Let the man thrive who travails sore, in prayer, far thee the Bountiful. He with the help of lofty Dyaus comes safe through straits of enmity.

translations.griffith: Let the man thrive who travails sore, in prayer, far thee the Bountiful. He with the help of lofty Dyaus comes safe through straits of enmity.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒मिधा॒ यस्त॒ आहु॑तिं॒ निशि॑तिं॒ मर्त्यो॒ नश॑त् व॒याव॑न्तं॒ स पु॑ष्यति॒ क्षय॑मग्ने श॒तायु॑षम्
stanzas.transliteration: samídhā yás ta ā́hutiṃ níśitim mártyo náśat vayā́vantaṃ sá puṣyati kṣáyam agne śatā́yuṣam
stanzas.translation: The mortal who with fuel lights thy flame and offers unto thee, Supports a house with many a branch, Agni, to live a hundred years.

translations.griffith: The mortal who with fuel lights thy flame and offers unto thee, Supports a house with many a branch, Agni, to live a hundred years.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वे॒षस्ते॑ धू॒म ऋ॑ण्वति दि॒वि षञ्छु॒क्र आत॑तः सूरो॒ न हि द्यु॒ता त्वं कृ॒पा पा॑वक॒ रोच॑से
stanzas.transliteration: tveṣás te dhūmá r̥ṇvati diví ṣáñ chukrá ā́tataḥ sū́ro ná hí dyutā́ tváṃ kr̥pā́ pāvaka rócase
stanzas.translation: Thy bright smoke lifts itself aloft, and far-extended shines in heaven. For, Purifier! like the Sun thou beamest with thy radiant glow.

translations.griffith: Thy bright smoke lifts itself aloft, and far-extended shines in heaven. For, Purifier! like the Sun thou beamest with thy radiant glow.

stanzas.sanskrit: अधा॒ हि वि॒क्ष्वीड्योऽसि॑ प्रि॒यो नो॒ अति॑थिः र॒ण्वः पु॒री॑व॒ जूर्यः॑ सू॒नुर्न त्र॑य॒याय्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ádhā hí vikṣv ī́ḍyaḥ- -ási priyó no átithiḥ raṇváḥ purī̀va jū́ryaḥ sūnúr ná trayayā́yyaḥ
stanzas.translation: For in men's houses thou must be glorified as a well-loved guest, Gay like an elder in a fort, claiming protection like a son.

translations.griffith: For in men's houses thou must be glorified as a well-loved guest, Gay like an elder in a fort, claiming protection like a son.

stanzas.sanskrit: क्रत्वा॒ हि द्रोणे॑ अ॒ज्यसेऽग्ने॑ वा॒जी न कृत्व्यः॑ परि॑ज्मेव स्व॒धा गयोऽत्यो॒ न ह्वा॒र्यः शिशुः॑
stanzas.transliteration: krátvā hí dróṇe ajyáse- -ágne vājī́ ná kŕ̥tvyaḥ párijmeva svadhā́ gáyaḥ- -átyo ná hvāryáḥ śíśuḥ
stanzas.translation: Thou, Agni, like an able steed, art urged by wisdom in the wood. Thou art like wind; food, home art thou, like a young horse that runs astray.

translations.griffith: Thou, Agni, like an able steed, art urged by wisdom in the wood. Thou art like wind; food, home art thou, like a young horse that runs astray.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं त्या चि॒दच्यु॒ताग्ने॑ प॒शुर्न यव॑से धामा॑ ह॒ यत्ते॑ अजर॒ वना॑ वृ॒श्चन्ति॒ शिक्व॑सः
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ tyā́ cid ácyutā- -ágne paśúr ná yávase dhā́mā ha yát te ajara vánā vr̥ścánti śíkvasaḥ
stanzas.translation: E'en things imperishable, thou, O Agni, like a gazing ox, Eatest, when hosts, Eternal One! of thee the Mighty rend the woods.

translations.griffith: E'en things imperishable, thou, O Agni, like a gazing ox, Eatest, when hosts, Eternal One! of thee the Mighty rend the woods.

stanzas.sanskrit: वेषि॒ ह्य॑ध्वरीय॒तामग्ने॒ होता॒ दमे॑ वि॒शाम् स॒मृधो॑ विश्पते कृणु जु॒षस्व॑ ह॒व्यम॑ङ्गिरः
stanzas.transliteration: véṣi hy àdhvarīyatā́m ágne hótā dáme viśā́m samŕ̥dho viśpate kr̥ṇu juṣásva havyám aṅgiraḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni, thou enterest as Priest the home of men who sacrifice. Lord of the people, prosper them. Accept the ofrering, Angiras!

translations.griffith: Agni, thou enterest as Priest the home of men who sacrifice. Lord of the people, prosper them. Accept the ofrering, Angiras!

stanzas.sanskrit: अच्छा॑ नो मित्रमहो देव दे॒वानग्ने॒ वोचः॑ सुम॒तिं रोद॑स्योः वी॒हि स्व॒स्तिं सु॑क्षि॒तिं दि॒वो नॄन्द्वि॒षो अंहां॑सि दुरि॒ता त॑रेम॒ ता त॑रेम॒ तवाव॑सा तरेम
stanzas.transliteration: áchā no mitramaho deva devā́n ágne vócaḥ sumatíṃ ródasyoḥ vīhí svastíṃ sukṣitíṃ divó nr̥̄́n dviṣó áṃhāṃsi duritā́ tarema tā́ tarema távā́vasā tarema
stanzas.translation: O Agni, God with Mitra's might, call hither the favour of the Gods from earth and heaven. Bring weal from heaven, that men may dwell securely. May we o'ercome the foe's malign oppressions, may we o'ercome them, through thy help o'ercome them.

translations.griffith: O Agni, God with Mitra's might, call hither the favour of the Gods from earth and heaven. Bring weal from heaven, that men may dwell securely. May we o'ercome the foe's malign oppressions, may we o'ercome them, through thy help o'ercome them.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॒ स क्षे॑षदृत॒पा ऋ॑ते॒जा उ॒रु ज्योति॑र्नशते देव॒युष्टे॑ यं त्वं मि॒त्रेण॒ वरु॑णः स॒जोषा॒ देव॒ पासि॒ त्यज॑सा॒ मर्त॒मंहः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ágne sá kṣeṣad r̥tapā́ r̥tejā́ḥ- urú jyótir naśate devayúṣ ṭe yáṃ tvám mitréṇa váruṇaḥ sajóṣāḥ- déva pā́si tyájasā mártam áṃhaḥ
stanzas.translation: TRUE, guardian of the Law, thy faithful servant wins ample light and dwells in peace, O Agni, Whom thou, as Varuṇa in accord with Mitra, guardest, O God, by banishing his trouble.

translations.griffith: TRUE, guardian of the Law, thy faithful servant wins ample light and dwells in peace, O Agni, Whom thou, as Varuṇa in accord with Mitra, guardest, O God, by banishing his trouble.

stanzas.sanskrit: ई॒जे य॒ज्ञेभिः॑ शश॒मे शमी॑भिर्ऋ॒धद्वा॑राया॒ग्नये॑ ददाश ए॒वा च॒न तं य॒शसा॒मजु॑ष्टि॒र्नांहो॒ मर्तं॑ नशते॒ न प्रदृ॑प्तिः
stanzas.transliteration: ījé yajñébhiḥ śaśamé śámībhir r̥dhádvārāyāgnáye dadāśa evā́ caná táṃ yaśásām ájuṣṭir nā́ṃho mártaṃ naśate ná prádr̥ptiḥ
stanzas.translation: He hath paid sacrifices, toiled in worship, and offered gifts to wealth-increasing Agni. Him the displeasure of the famous moves not, outrage and scorn affect not such a mortal.

translations.griffith: He hath paid sacrifices, toiled in worship, and offered gifts to wealth-increasing Agni. Him the displeasure of the famous moves not, outrage and scorn affect not such a mortal.

stanzas.sanskrit: सूरो॒ न यस्य॑ दृश॒तिर॑रे॒पा भी॒मा यदेति॑ शुच॒तस्त॒ आ धीः हेष॑स्वतः शु॒रुधो॒ नायम॒क्तोः कुत्रा॑ चिद्र॒ण्वो व॑स॒तिर्व॑ने॒जाः
stanzas.transliteration: sū́ro ná yásya dr̥śatír arepā́ḥ- bhīmā́ yád éti śucatás ta ā́ dhī́ḥ héṣasvataḥ śurúdho nā́yám aktóḥ kútrā cid raṇvó vasatír vanejā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Bright God, whose look is free from stain like Sûrya's, thou, swift, what time thou earnestly desirest, Hast gear to give us. Come with joy at evening, where, Child of Wood, thou mayest also tarry.

translations.griffith: Bright God, whose look is free from stain like Sûrya's, thou, swift, what time thou earnestly desirest, Hast gear to give us. Come with joy at evening, where, Child of Wood, thou mayest also tarry.

stanzas.sanskrit: ति॒ग्मं चि॒देम॒ महि॒ वर्पो॑ अस्य॒ भस॒दश्वो॒ न य॑मसा॒न आ॒सा वि॒जेह॑मानः पर॒शुर्न जि॒ह्वां द्र॒विर्न द्रा॑वयति॒ दारु॒ धक्ष॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: tigmáṃ cid éma máhi várpo asya bhásad áśvo ná yamasāná āsā́ vijéhamānaḥ paraśúr ná jihvā́ṃ dravír ná drāvayati dā́ru dhákṣat
stanzas.translation: Fierce is his gait and vast his wondrous body: he champeth like a horse with bit and bridle, And, darting forth his tongue, as 'twere a hatchet, burning the woods, smelteth them like a smelter.

translations.griffith: Fierce is his gait and vast his wondrous body: he champeth like a horse with bit and bridle, And, darting forth his tongue, as 'twere a hatchet, burning the woods, smelteth them like a smelter.

stanzas.sanskrit: स इदस्ते॑व॒ प्रति॑ धादसि॒ष्यञ्छिशी॑त॒ तेजोऽय॑सो॒ न धारा॑म् चि॒त्रध्र॑जतिरर॒तिर्यो अ॒क्तोर्वेर्न द्रु॒षद्वा॑ रघु॒पत्म॑जंहाः
stanzas.transliteration: sá íd ásteva práti dhād asiṣyáñ -śíśīta téjó 'yaso ná dhā́rām citrádhrajatir aratír yó aktór vér ná druṣádvā raghupátmajaṃhāḥ
stanzas.translation: Archer-like, fain toshoot, he sets his arrow, and whets his splendour like the edge of iron: The messenger of night with brilliant pathway, like a tree-roosting bird of rapid pinion.

translations.griffith: Archer-like, fain toshoot, he sets his arrow, and whets his splendour like the edge of iron: The messenger of night with brilliant pathway, like a tree-roosting bird of rapid pinion.

stanzas.sanskrit: स ईं॑ रे॒भो न प्रति॑ वस्त उ॒स्राः शो॒चिषा॑ रारपीति मि॒त्रम॑हाः नक्तं॒ य ई॑मरु॒षो यो दिवा॒ नॄनम॑र्त्यो अरु॒षो यो दिवा॒ नॄन्
stanzas.transliteration: sá īṃ rebhó ná práti vasta usrā́ḥ śocíṣā rārapīti mitrámahāḥ náktaṃ yá īm aruṣó yó dívā nr̥̄́n ámartyo aruṣó yó dívā nr̥̄́n
stanzas.translation: In beams of morn he clothes him like the singer, and bright as Mitra with his splendour crackles. Red in the night, by day the men's possession: red, he belongs to men by day, Immortal.

translations.griffith: In beams of morn he clothes him like the singer, and bright as Mitra with his splendour crackles. Red in the night, by day the men's possession: red, he belongs to men by day, Immortal.

stanzas.sanskrit: दि॒वो न यस्य॑ विध॒तो नवी॑नो॒द्वृषा॑ रु॒क्ष ओष॑धीषु नूनोत् घृणा॒ न यो ध्रज॑सा॒ पत्म॑ना॒ यन्ना रोद॑सी॒ वसु॑ना॒ दं सु॒पत्नी॑
stanzas.transliteration: divó ná yásya vidható návīnod vŕ̥ṣā rukṣá óṣadhīṣu nūnot ghŕ̥ṇā ná yó dhrájasā pátmanā yánn ā́ ródasī vásunā dáṃ supátnī
stanzas.translation: Like Heaven's when scattering beams his voice was uttered: among the plants the radiant Hero shouted, Who with his glow in rapid course came hither to fill both worlds, well-wedded Dames, with treasure.

translations.griffith: Like Heaven's when scattering beams his voice was uttered: among the plants the radiant Hero shouted, Who with his glow in rapid course came hither to fill both worlds, well-wedded Dames, with treasure.

stanzas.sanskrit: धायो॑भिर्वा॒ यो युज्ये॑भिर॒र्कैर्वि॒द्युन्न द॑विद्यो॒त्स्वेभिः॒ शुष्मैः॑ शर्धो॑ वा॒ यो म॒रुतां॑ त॒तक्ष॑ ऋ॒भुर्न त्वे॒षो र॑भसा॒नो अ॑द्यौत्
stanzas.transliteration: dhā́yobhir vā yó yújyebhir arkaír vidyún ná davidyot svébhiḥ śúṣmaiḥ śárdho vā yó marútāṃ tatákṣa r̥bhúr ná tveṣó rabhasānó adyaut
stanzas.translation: Who, with supporting streams and rays that suit him, hath flashed like lightning with his native vigour. Like the deft Maker of the band of Maruts, the bright impetuous One hath shone refulgent.

translations.griffith: Who, with supporting streams and rays that suit him, hath flashed like lightning with his native vigour. Like the deft Maker of the band of Maruts, the bright impetuous One hath shone refulgent.

stanzas.sanskrit: यथा॑ होत॒र्मनु॑षो दे॒वता॑ता य॒ज्ञेभिः॑ सूनो सहसो॒ यजा॑सि ए॒वा नो॑ अ॒द्य स॑म॒ना स॑मा॒नानु॒शन्न॑ग्न उश॒तो य॑क्षि दे॒वान्
stanzas.transliteration: yáthā hotar mánuṣo devátātā yajñébhiḥ sūno sahaso yájāsi evā́ no adyá samanā́ samānā́n uśánn agna uśató yakṣi devā́n
stanzas.translation: As at man's service of the Gods, Invoker, thou, Son of Strength, dost sacrifice and worship, So bring for us to-day all Gods together, bring willingly the willing Gods, O Agni.

translations.griffith: As at man's service of the Gods, Invoker, thou, Son of Strength, dost sacrifice and worship, So bring for us to-day all Gods together, bring willingly the willing Gods, O Agni.

stanzas.sanskrit: स नो॑ वि॒भावा॑ च॒क्षणि॒र्न वस्तो॑र॒ग्निर्व॒न्दारु॒ वेद्य॒श्चनो॑ धात् वि॒श्वायु॒र्यो अ॒मृतो॒ मर्त्ये॑षूष॒र्भुद्भूदति॑थिर्जा॒तवे॑दाः
stanzas.transliteration: sá no vibhā́vā cakṣáṇir ná vástor agnír vandā́ru védyaś cáno dhāt viśvā́yur yó amŕ̥to mártyeṣu- -uṣarbhúd bhū́d átithir jātávedāḥ
stanzas.translation: May Agni, radiant Herald of the morning, meet to be known, accept our praise with favour. Dear to all life, mid mortal men Immortal, our guest, awake at dawn, is Jâtavedas.

translations.griffith: May Agni, radiant Herald of the morning, meet to be known, accept our praise with favour. Dear to all life, mid mortal men Immortal, our guest, awake at dawn, is Jâtavedas.

stanzas.sanskrit: द्यावो॒ न यस्य॑ प॒नय॒न्त्यभ्वं॒ भासां॑सि वस्ते॒ सूर्यो॒ न शु॒क्रः वि य इ॒नोत्य॒जरः॑ पाव॒कोऽश्न॑स्य चिच्छिश्नथत्पू॒र्व्याणि॑
stanzas.transliteration: dyā́vo ná yásya panáyanty ábhvam bhā́sāṃsi vaste sū́ryo ná śukráḥ ví yá inóty ajáraḥ pāvakó áśnasya cic chiśnathat pūrvyā́ṇi
stanzas.translation: Whose might the very heavens regard with wonder: bright as the Sun he clothes himself with lustre. He who sends forth, Eternal Purifier, hath shattered e'en the ancient works of Aṣna.

translations.griffith: Whose might the very heavens regard with wonder: bright as the Sun he clothes himself with lustre. He who sends forth, Eternal Purifier, hath shattered e'en the ancient works of Aṣna.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒द्मा हि सू॑नो॒ अस्य॑द्म॒सद्वा॑ च॒क्रे अ॒ग्निर्ज॒नुषाज्मान्न॑म् स त्वं न॑ ऊर्जसन॒ ऊर्जं॑ धा॒ राजे॑व जेरवृ॒के क्षे॑ष्य॒न्तः
stanzas.transliteration: vadmā́ hí sūno ásy admasádvā cakré agnír janúṣā́jmā́nnam sá tváṃ na ūrjasana ū́rjaṃ dhāḥ- rā́jeva jer avr̥ké kṣeṣy antáḥ
stanzas.translation: Thou art a Singer, Son! our feast-companion: Agni at birth prepared his food and pathway. Therefore vouchsafe us strength, O Strength-bestower. Win like a King: foes trouble not thy dwelling.

translations.griffith: Thou art a Singer, Son! our feast-companion: Agni at birth prepared his food and pathway. Therefore vouchsafe us strength, O Strength-bestower. Win like a King: foes trouble not thy dwelling.

stanzas.sanskrit: निति॑क्ति॒ यो वा॑र॒णमन्न॒मत्ति॑ वा॒युर्न राष्ट्र्यत्ये॑त्य॒क्तून् तु॒र्याम॒ यस्त॑ आ॒दिशा॒मरा॑ती॒रत्यो॒ न ह्रुतः॒ पत॑तः परि॒ह्रुत्
stanzas.transliteration: nítikti yó vāraṇám ánnam átti vāyúr ná rā́ṣṭry áty ety aktū́n turyā́ma yás ta ādíśām árātīr átyo ná hrútaḥ pátataḥ parihrút
stanzas.translation: Even he who cats his firm hard food with swiftness,and overtakes the nights as Vâyu kingdoms. May we o'ercome those who resist thine orders, like a steed casting down the flying foemen.

translations.griffith: Even he who cats his firm hard food with swiftness,and overtakes the nights as Vâyu kingdoms. May we o'ercome those who resist thine orders, like a steed casting down the flying foemen.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ सूर्यो॒ न भा॑नु॒मद्भि॑र॒र्कैरग्ने॑ त॒तन्थ॒ रोद॑सी॒ वि भा॒सा चि॒त्रो न॑य॒त्परि॒ तमां॑स्य॒क्तः शो॒चिषा॒ पत्म॑न्नौशि॒जो न दीय॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ sū́ryo ná bhānumádbhir arkaír ágne tatántha ródasī ví bhāsā́ citró nayat pári támāṃsy aktáḥ śocíṣā pátmann auśijó ná dī́yan
stanzas.translation: Like Sûrya with his fulgent rays, O Agni, thou overspreadest both the worlds with splendour. Decked with bright colour he dispels the darkness, like Auṣija, with clear flame swifily flying.

translations.griffith: Like Sûrya with his fulgent rays, O Agni, thou overspreadest both the worlds with splendour. Decked with bright colour he dispels the darkness, like Auṣija, with clear flame swifily flying.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वां हि म॒न्द्रत॑ममर्कशो॒कैर्व॑वृ॒महे॒ महि॑ नः॒ श्रोष्य॑ग्ने इन्द्रं॒ न त्वा॒ शव॑सा दे॒वता॑ वा॒युं पृ॑णन्ति॒ राध॑सा॒ नृत॑माः
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́ṃ hí mandrátamam arkaśokaír vavr̥máhe máhi naḥ śróṣy agne índraṃ ná tvā śávasā devátā vāyúm pr̥ṇanti rā́dhasā nŕ̥tamāḥ
stanzas.translation: We have elected thee as most delightful for thy beams' glow: hear our great laud, O Agni. The best men praise thee as the peer of Indra in strength, mid Gods, like Viyu in thy bounty.

translations.griffith: We have elected thee as most delightful for thy beams' glow: hear our great laud, O Agni. The best men praise thee as the peer of Indra in strength, mid Gods, like Viyu in thy bounty.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू नो॑ अग्नेऽवृ॒केभिः॑ स्व॒स्ति वेषि॑ रा॒यः प॒थिभिः॒ पर्ष्यंहः॑ ता सू॒रिभ्यो॑ गृण॒ते रा॑सि सु॒म्नं मदे॑म श॒तहि॑माः सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ no agne 'vr̥kébhiḥ svastí véṣi rāyáḥ pathíbhiḥ párṣy áṃhaḥ tā́ sūríbhyo gr̥ṇaté rāsi sumnám mádema śatáhimāḥ suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: Now, Agni, on the tranquil paths of riches come to us for our weal: save us from sorrow. Grant chiefs and bard this boon. May we live happy, with hero children, through a hundred winters.

translations.griffith: Now, Agni, on the tranquil paths of riches come to us for our weal: save us from sorrow. Grant chiefs and bard this boon. May we live happy, with hero children, through a hundred winters.

stanzas.sanskrit: हु॒वे वः॑ सू॒नुं सह॑सो॒ युवा॑न॒मद्रो॑घवाचं म॒तिभि॒र्यवि॑ष्ठम् य इन्व॑ति॒ द्रवि॑णानि॒ प्रचे॑ता वि॒श्ववा॑राणि पुरु॒वारो॑ अ॒ध्रुक्
stanzas.transliteration: huvé vaḥ sūnúṃ sáhaso yúvānam ádroghavācam matíbhir yáviṣṭham yá ínvati dráviṇāni prácetāḥ- viśvávārāṇi puruvā́ro adhrúk
stanzas.translation: I INVOCATE your Son of Strength, the Youthful, with hymns, the Youngest God, whose speech is guileless; Sage who sends wealth comprising every treasure, bringer of many boons, devoid of malice.

translations.griffith: I INVOCATE your Son of Strength, the Youthful, with hymns, the Youngest God, whose speech is guileless; Sage who sends wealth comprising every treasure, bringer of many boons, devoid of malice.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वे वसू॑नि पुर्वणीक होतर्दो॒षा वस्तो॒रेरि॑रे य॒ज्ञिया॑सः क्षामे॑व॒ विश्वा॒ भुव॑नानि॒ यस्मि॒न्त्सं सौभ॑गानि दधि॒रे पा॑व॒के
stanzas.transliteration: tvé vásūni purvaṇīka hotar doṣā́ vástor érire yajñíyāsaḥ kṣā́meva víśvā bhúvanāni yásmin sáṃ saúbhagāni dadhiré pāvaké
stanzas.translation: At eve and morn thy pious servants bring thee their precious gifts, O Priest of many aspects, On whom, the Purifier, all things living as on firm. ground their happiness have stablished.

translations.griffith: At eve and morn thy pious servants bring thee their precious gifts, O Priest of many aspects, On whom, the Purifier, all things living as on firm. ground their happiness have stablished.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं वि॒क्षु प्र॒दिवः॑ सीद आ॒सु क्रत्वा॑ र॒थीर॑भवो॒ वार्या॑णाम् अत॑ इनोषि विध॒ते चि॑कित्वो॒ व्या॑नु॒षग्जा॑तवेदो॒ वसू॑नि
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ vikṣú pradívaḥ sīda āsú krátvā rathī́r abhavo vā́ryāṇām áta inoṣi vidhaté cikitvo vy ā̀nuṣág jātavedo vásūni
stanzas.translation: Thou from of old hast dwelt among these people, by mental power the charioteer of blessings. Hence sendest thou, O sapient Jâtavedas, to him who serves thee treasures in succession.

translations.griffith: Thou from of old hast dwelt among these people, by mental power the charioteer of blessings. Hence sendest thou, O sapient Jâtavedas, to him who serves thee treasures in succession.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो नः॒ सनु॑त्यो अभि॒दास॑दग्ने॒ यो अन्त॑रो मित्रमहो वनु॒ष्यात् तम॒जरे॑भि॒र्वृष॑भि॒स्तव॒ स्वैस्तपा॑ तपिष्ठ॒ तप॑सा॒ तप॑स्वान्
stanzas.transliteration: yó naḥ sánutyo abhidā́sad agne yó ántaro mitramaho vanuṣyā́t tám ajárebhir vŕ̥ṣabhis táva svaís tápā tapiṣṭha tápasā tápasvān
stanzas.translation: Agni, whoever secretly attacks us, the neighbour, thou with Mitra's might! who harms us, Burn him with thine own Steers for ever youthful, burning with burning heat, thou fiercest burner.

translations.griffith: Agni, whoever secretly attacks us, the neighbour, thou with Mitra's might! who harms us, Burn him with thine own Steers for ever youthful, burning with burning heat, thou fiercest burner.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्ते॑ य॒ज्ञेन॑ स॒मिधा॒ य उ॒क्थैर॒र्केभिः॑ सूनो सहसो॒ ददा॑शत् स मर्त्ये॑ष्वमृत॒ प्रचे॑ता रा॒या द्यु॒म्नेन॒ श्रव॑सा॒ वि भा॑ति
stanzas.transliteration: yás te yajñéna samídhā yá ukthaír arkébhiḥ sūno sahaso dádāśat sá mártyeṣv amr̥ta prácetāḥ- rāyā́ dyumnéna śrávasā ví bhāti
stanzas.translation: He who serves thee with sacrifice and fuel, with hymn, O Son of Strength, and chanted praises, Shines out, Immortal! in the midst of mortals, a sage, with wealth, with splendour and with glory.

translations.griffith: He who serves thee with sacrifice and fuel, with hymn, O Son of Strength, and chanted praises, Shines out, Immortal! in the midst of mortals, a sage, with wealth, with splendour and with glory.

stanzas.sanskrit: स तत्कृ॑धीषि॒तस्तूय॑मग्ने॒ स्पृधो॑ बाधस्व॒ सह॑सा॒ सह॑स्वान् यच्छ॒स्यसे॒ द्युभि॑र॒क्तो वचो॑भि॒स्तज्जु॑षस्व जरि॒तुर्घोषि॒ मन्म॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá tát kr̥dhīṣitás tū́yam agne spŕ̥dho bādhasva sáhasā sáhasvān yác chasyáse dyúbhir aktó vácobhis táj juṣasva jaritúr ghóṣi mánma
stanzas.translation: Do this, O Agni, when we urge thee, quickly, triumphant in thy might subdue our foemen. When thou art praised with words and decked with brightness, accept this chanted hymn, the singer's worship.

translations.griffith: Do this, O Agni, when we urge thee, quickly, triumphant in thy might subdue our foemen. When thou art praised with words and decked with brightness, accept this chanted hymn, the singer's worship.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒श्याम॒ तं काम॑मग्ने॒ तवो॒ती अ॒श्याम॑ र॒यिं र॑यिवः सु॒वीर॑म् अ॒श्याम॒ वाज॑म॒भि वा॒जय॑न्तो॒ऽश्याम॑ द्यु॒म्नम॑जरा॒जरं॑ ते
stanzas.transliteration: aśyā́ma táṃ kā́mam agne távotī́ aśyā́ma rayíṃ rayivaḥ suvī́ram aśyā́ma vā́jam abhí vājáyanto -aśyā́ma dyumnám ajarājáraṃ te
stanzas.translation: Help us, that we may gain this wish, O Agni, gain riches, Wealthy One! with store of heroes. Desiring strength from thee may we be strengthened, and win, Eternal! thine eternal glory.

translations.griffith: Help us, that we may gain this wish, O Agni, gain riches, Wealthy One! with store of heroes. Desiring strength from thee may we be strengthened, and win, Eternal! thine eternal glory.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र नव्य॑सा॒ सह॑सः सू॒नुमच्छा॑ य॒ज्ञेन॑ गा॒तुमव॑ इ॒च्छमा॑नः वृ॒श्चद्व॑नं कृ॒ष्णया॑मं॒ रुश॑न्तं वी॒ती होता॑रं दि॒व्यं जि॑गाति
stanzas.transliteration: prá návyasā sáhasaḥ sūnúm áchā yajñéna gātúm áva ichámānaḥ vr̥ścádvanaṃ kr̥ṣṇáyāmaṃ rúśantaṃ vītī́ hótāraṃ divyáṃ jigāti
stanzas.translation: HE who seeks furtherance and grace to help him goes to the Son of Strength with newest worship, Calling the heavenly Priest to share the banquet, who rends the wood, bright, with his blackened pathway.

translations.griffith: HE who seeks furtherance and grace to help him goes to the Son of Strength with newest worship, Calling the heavenly Priest to share the banquet, who rends the wood, bright, with his blackened pathway.
translations.macdonell: The man who seeks success and aid approaches The son of strength, with feast and newest worship. He rends the wood and has a blackened pathway, The brightly radiant and divine invoker.

stanzas.sanskrit: स श्वि॑ता॒नस्त॑न्य॒तू रो॑चन॒स्था अ॒जरे॑भि॒र्नान॑दद्भि॒र्यवि॑ष्ठः यः पा॑व॒कः पु॑रु॒तमः॑ पु॒रूणि॑ पृ॒थून्य॒ग्निर॑नु॒याति॒ भर्व॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: sá śvitānás tanyatū́ rocanasthā́ḥ- ajárebhir nā́nadadbhir yáviṣṭhaḥ yáḥ pāvakáḥ purutámaḥ purū́ṇi pr̥thū́ny agnír anuyā́ti bhárvan
stanzas.translation: White-hued and thundering he dwells in splendour, Most Youthful, with the loudvoiced and eternal- Agni, most variform, the Purifier, who follows crunching many ample forests.

translations.griffith: White-hued and thundering he dwells in splendour, Most Youthful, with the loudvoiced and eternal- Agni, most variform, the Purifier, who follows crunching many ample forests.
translations.macdonell: The shining thunderer who dwells in lustre, With his unaging, roaring flames, most youthful, Refulgent Agni, frequently recurring, Goes after many spacious woods and chews them.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि ते॒ विष्व॒ग्वात॑जूतासो अग्ने॒ भामा॑सः शुचे॒ शुच॑यश्चरन्ति तु॒वि॒म्र॒क्षासो॑ दि॒व्या नव॑ग्वा॒ वना॑ वनन्ति धृष॒ता रु॒जन्तः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ví te víṣvag vā́tajūtāso agne bhā́māsaḥ śuce śúcayaś caranti tuvimrakṣā́so divyā́ návagvāḥ- vánā vananti dhr̥ṣatā́ rujántaḥ
stanzas.translation: Incited by the wind thy flames, O Agni, move onward, Pure One! pure, in all directions. Thy most destructive heavenly Navagvas break the woods down and devastate them boldly.

translations.griffith: Incited by the wind thy flames, O Agni, move onward, Pure One! pure, in all directions. Thy most destructive heavenly Navagvas break the woods down and devastate them boldly.
translations.macdonell: Thy flames when driven by the wind, O Agni, Disperse, O pure one, pure in all directions; And thy divine Navagvas, most destructive, Lay low the woods and devastate them boldly.

stanzas.sanskrit: ये ते॑ शु॒क्रासः॒ शुच॑यः शुचिष्मः॒ क्षां वप॑न्ति॒ विषि॑तासो॒ अश्वाः॑ अध॑ भ्र॒मस्त॑ उर्वि॒या वि भा॑ति या॒तय॑मानो॒ अधि॒ सानु॒ पृश्नेः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yé te śukrā́saḥ śúcayaḥ śuciṣmaḥ kṣā́ṃ vápanti víṣitāso áśvāḥ ádha bhramás ta urviyā́ ví bhāti yātáyamāno ádhi sā́nu pŕ̥śneḥ
stanzas.translation: Thy pure white horses from their bonds are loosened: O Radiant One, they shear the ground beneath them, And far and wide shines out thy flame, and flickers rapidly moving over earth's high ridges.

translations.griffith: Thy pure white horses from their bonds are loosened: O Radiant One, they shear the ground beneath them, And far and wide shines out thy flame, and flickers rapidly moving over earth's high ridges.
translations.macdonell: Thy steeds, the bright, the pure, O radiant Agni, Let loose speed on and shave the ground beneath them. Thy whirling flame then widely shines refulgent, The highest ridges of earth's surface reaching.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध॑ जि॒ह्वा पा॑पतीति॒ प्र वृष्णो॑ गोषु॒युधो॒ नाशनिः॑ सृजा॒ना शूर॑स्येव॒ प्रसि॑तिः क्षा॒तिर॒ग्नेर्दु॒र्वर्तु॑र्भी॒मो द॑यते॒ वना॑नि
stanzas.transliteration: ádha jihvā́ pāpatīti prá vŕ̥ṣṇo goṣuyúdho nā́śániḥ sr̥jānā́ śū́rasyeva prásitiḥ kṣātír agnér durvártur bhīmó dayate vánāni
stanzas.translation: Forth darts the Bull's tongue like the sharp stone weapon discharged by him who fights to win the cattle. Agni's fierce flame is like a hero's onset: dread and resistless he destroys the forests.

translations.griffith: Forth darts the Bull's tongue like the sharp stone weapon discharged by him who fights to win the cattle. Agni's fierce flame is like a hero's onset: dread and resistless he destroys the forests.
translations.macdonell: When the bull's tongue darts forward like the missile Discharged by him who fights the cows to capture, Like hero's onset is the flame of Agni: Resistless, dreadful, he consumes the forests.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ भा॒नुना॒ पार्थि॑वानि॒ ज्रयां॑सि म॒हस्तो॒दस्य॑ धृष॒ता त॑तन्थ स बा॑ध॒स्वाप॑ भ॒या सहो॑भिः॒ स्पृधो॑ वनु॒ष्यन्व॒नुषो॒ नि जू॑र्व
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ bhānúnā pā́rthivāni jráyāṃsi mahás todásya dhr̥ṣatā́ tatantha sá bādhasvā́pa bhayā́ sáhobhiḥ- spŕ̥dho vanuṣyán vanúṣo ní jūrva
stanzas.translation: Thou with the sunlight of the great Impeller hast boldly over-spread the earth's expanses. So drive away with conquering might all perils. fighting out foemen burn up those who harm us.

translations.griffith: Thou with the sunlight of the great Impeller hast boldly over-spread the earth's expanses. So drive away with conquering might all perils. fighting out foemen burn up those who harm us.
translations.macdonell: Thou with the sunbeams of the great impeller, Hast boldly overspread the earthly spaces. So with thy mighty powers drive off all terrors; Attack our rivals and burn down our foemen,

stanzas.sanskrit: स चि॑त्र चि॒त्रं चि॒तय॑न्तम॒स्मे चित्र॑क्षत्र चि॒त्रत॑मं वयो॒धाम् च॒न्द्रं र॒यिं पु॑रु॒वीरं॑ बृ॒हन्तं॒ चन्द्र॑ च॒न्द्राभि॑र्गृण॒ते यु॑वस्व
stanzas.transliteration: sá citra citráṃ citáyantam asmé cítrakṣatra citrátamaṃ vayodhā́m candráṃ rayím puruvī́ram br̥hántaṃ cándra candrā́bhir gr̥ṇaté yuvasva
stanzas.translation: Wondrous! of wondrous power! give to the singer wealth wondrous, marked, most wonderful, lifegiving. Wealth bright, O Bright One, vast, with many heroes, give with thy bright flames to the man who lauds thee.

translations.griffith: Wondrous! of wondrous power! give to the singer wealth wondrous, marked, most wonderful, lifegiving. Wealth bright, O Bright One, vast, with many heroes, give with thy bright flames to the man who lauds thee.
translations.macdonell: Give us, O splendid one of splendid lordship, Wealth giving splendour, splendid, life-imparting. Bestow bright wealth and vast with many heroes, Bright god, with thy bright flames, upon the singer.

stanzas.sanskrit: मू॒र्धानं॑ दि॒वो अ॑र॒तिं पृ॑थि॒व्या वै॑श्वान॒रमृ॒त आ जा॒तम॒ग्निम् क॒विं स॒म्राज॒मति॑थिं॒ जना॑नामा॒सन्ना पात्रं॑ जनयन्त दे॒वाः
stanzas.transliteration: mūrdhā́naṃ divó aratím pr̥thivyā́ḥ- vaiśvānarám r̥tá ā́ jātám agním kavíṃ samrā́jam átithiṃ jánānām āsánn ā́ pā́traṃ janayanta devā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Him, messenger of earth and head of heaven, Agni Vaiṣvânara, born in holy Order, The Sage, the King, the guest of men, a vessel fit for their mouths, the Gods have generated.

translations.griffith: Him, messenger of earth and head of heaven, Agni Vaiṣvânara, born in holy Order, The Sage, the King, the guest of men, a vessel fit for their mouths, the Gods have generated.

stanzas.sanskrit: नाभिं॑ य॒ज्ञानां॒ सद॑नं रयी॒णां म॒हामा॑हा॒वम॒भि सं न॑वन्त वै॒श्वा॒न॒रं र॒थ्य॑मध्व॒राणां॑ य॒ज्ञस्य॑ के॒तुं ज॑नयन्त दे॒वाः
stanzas.transliteration: nā́bhiṃ yajñā́nāṃ sádanaṃ rayīṇā́m mahā́m āhāvám abhí sáṃ navanta vaiśvānaráṃ rathyàm adhvarā́ṇāṃ yajñásya ketúṃ janayanta devā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Him have they praised, mid-point of sacrifices, great cistern of libations, seat of riches. Vaiṣvânara, conveyer of oblations, ensign of worship, have the Gods engendered.

translations.griffith: Him have they praised, mid-point of sacrifices, great cistern of libations, seat of riches. Vaiṣvânara, conveyer of oblations, ensign of worship, have the Gods engendered.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वद्विप्रो॑ जायते वा॒ज्य॑ग्ने॒ त्वद्वी॒रासो॑ अभिमाति॒षाहः॑ वैश्वा॑नर॒ त्वम॒स्मासु॑ धेहि॒ वसू॑नि राजन्त्स्पृह॒याय्या॑णि
stanzas.transliteration: tvád vípro jāyate vājy àgne tvád vīrā́so abhimātiṣā́haḥ vaíśvānara tvám asmā́su dhehi vásūni rājan spr̥hayā́yyāṇi
stanzas.translation: From thee, O Agni, springs the mighty singer, from thee come heroes who subdue the foeman. O King, Vaiṣvânara, bestow thou on us excellent treasures worthy to belonged fo r.

translations.griffith: From thee, O Agni, springs the mighty singer, from thee come heroes who subdue the foeman. O King, Vaiṣvânara, bestow thou on us excellent treasures worthy to belonged fo r.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वां विश्वे॑ अमृत॒ जाय॑मानं॒ शिशुं॒ न दे॒वा अ॒भि सं न॑वन्ते तव॒ क्रतु॑भिरमृत॒त्वमा॑य॒न्वैश्वा॑नर॒ यत्पि॒त्रोरदी॑देः
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́ṃ víśve amr̥ta jā́yamānaṃ śíśuṃ ná devā́ abhí sáṃ navante táva krátubhir amr̥tatvám āyan vaíśvānara yát pitrór ádīdeḥ
stanzas.translation: To thee, Immortal! when to life thou springest, all the Gods sing for joy as to their infant. They by thy mental powers were made immortal, Vaiṣvânara, when thou shonest from thy Parents.

translations.griffith: To thee, Immortal! when to life thou springest, all the Gods sing for joy as to their infant. They by thy mental powers were made immortal, Vaiṣvânara, when thou shonest from thy Parents.

stanzas.sanskrit: वैश्वा॑नर॒ तव॒ तानि॑ व्र॒तानि॑ म॒हान्य॑ग्ने॒ नकि॒रा द॑धर्ष यज्जाय॑मानः पि॒त्रोरु॒पस्थेऽवि॑न्दः के॒तुं व॒युने॒ष्वह्ना॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: vaíśvānara táva tā́ni vratā́ni mahā́ny agne nákir ā́ dadharṣa yáj jā́yamānaḥ pitrór upásthe- -ávindaḥ ketúṃ vayúneṣv áhnām
stanzas.translation: Agni Vaiṣvânara, no one hath ever resisted these thy mighty ordinances, When thou, arising from thy Parents' bosom, foundest the light for days' appointed courses.

translations.griffith: Agni Vaiṣvânara, no one hath ever resisted these thy mighty ordinances, When thou, arising from thy Parents' bosom, foundest the light for days' appointed courses.

stanzas.sanskrit: वै॒श्वा॒न॒रस्य॒ विमि॑तानि॒ चक्ष॑सा॒ सानू॑नि दि॒वो अ॒मृत॑स्य के॒तुना॑ तस्येदु॒ विश्वा॒ भुव॒नाधि॑ मू॒र्धनि॑ व॒या इ॑व रुरुहुः स॒प्त वि॒स्रुहः॑
stanzas.transliteration: vaiśvānarásya vímitāni cákṣasā sā́nūni divó amŕ̥tasya ketúnā tásyéd u víśvā bhúvanā́dhi mūrdháni vayā́ iva ruruhuḥ saptá visrúhaḥ
stanzas.translation: The summits of the heaven are traversed through and through by the Immortal's light, Vaiṣvânara's brilliancy. All creatures in existence rest upon his head. The Seven swift-flowing Streams have grown like branches forth,

translations.griffith: The summits of the heaven are traversed through and through by the Immortal's light, Vaiṣvânara's brilliancy. All creatures in existence rest upon his head. The Seven swift-flowing Streams have grown like branches forth,

stanzas.sanskrit: वि यो रजां॒स्यमि॑मीत सु॒क्रतु॑र्वैश्वान॒रो वि दि॒वो रो॑च॒ना क॒विः परि॒ यो विश्वा॒ भुव॑नानि पप्र॒थेऽद॑ब्धो गो॒पा अ॒मृत॑स्य रक्षि॒ता
stanzas.transliteration: ví yó rájāṃsy ámimīta sukrátur vaiśvānaró ví divó rocanā́ kavíḥ pári yó víśvā bhúvanāni paprathé -ádabdho gopā́ amŕ̥tasya rakṣitā́
stanzas.translation: Vaiṣvânara, who measured out the realms of air, Sage very wise who made the lucid spheres of heaven, The Undeceivable who spread out all the worlds, keeper is he and guard of immortality.

translations.griffith: Vaiṣvânara, who measured out the realms of air, Sage very wise who made the lucid spheres of heaven, The Undeceivable who spread out all the worlds, keeper is he and guard of immortality.

stanzas.sanskrit: पृ॒क्षस्य॒ वृष्णो॑ अरु॒षस्य॒ नू सहः॒ प्र नु वो॑चं वि॒दथा॑ जा॒तवे॑दसः वै॒श्वा॒न॒राय॑ म॒तिर्नव्य॑सी॒ शुचिः॒ सोम॑ इव पवते॒ चारु॑र॒ग्नये॑
stanzas.transliteration: pr̥kṣásya vŕ̥ṣṇo aruṣásya nū́ sáhaḥ prá nú vocaṃ vidáthā jātávedasaḥ vaiśvānarā́ya matír návyasī śúciḥ sóma iva pavate cā́rur agnáye
stanzas.translation: AT Jâtavedas' holy gathering I will tell aloud the conquering might of the swift red-hued Steer. A pure and fresher hymn flows to Vaiṣvânara, even as for Agni lovely Soma is made pure.

translations.griffith: AT Jâtavedas' holy gathering I will tell aloud the conquering might of the swift red-hued Steer. A pure and fresher hymn flows to Vaiṣvânara, even as for Agni lovely Soma is made pure.

stanzas.sanskrit: स जाय॑मानः पर॒मे व्यो॑मनि व्र॒तान्य॒ग्निर्व्र॑त॒पा अ॑रक्षत व्य१॒॑न्तरि॑क्षममिमीत सु॒क्रतु॑र्वैश्वान॒रो म॑हि॒ना नाक॑मस्पृशत्
stanzas.transliteration: sá jā́yamānaḥ paramé vyòmani- vratā́ny agnír vratapā́ arakṣata vy àntárikṣam amimīta sukrátur vaiśvānaró mahinā́ nā́kam aspr̥śat
stanzas.translation: That Agni, when in loftiest heaven he sprang to life, Guardian of Holy Laws, kept and observed them well. Exceeding wise, he measured out the firmament. Vaiṣvânara attained to heaven by mightiness.

translations.griffith: That Agni, when in loftiest heaven he sprang to life, Guardian of Holy Laws, kept and observed them well. Exceeding wise, he measured out the firmament. Vaiṣvânara attained to heaven by mightiness.

stanzas.sanskrit: व्य॑स्तभ्ना॒द्रोद॑सी मि॒त्रो अद्भु॑तोऽन्त॒र्वाव॑दकृणो॒ज्ज्योति॑षा॒ तमः॑ वि चर्म॑णीव धि॒षणे॑ अवर्तयद्वैश्वान॒रो विश्व॑मधत्त॒ वृष्ण्य॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: vy àstabhnād ródasī mitró ádbhuto -antarvā́vad akr̥ṇoj jyótiṣā támaḥ ví cármaṇīva dhiṣáṇe avartayad vaiśvānaró víśvam adhatta vŕ̥ṣṇyam
stanzas.translation: Wonderful Mitra propped the heaven and earth apart, and covered and concealed the darkness with his light. He made the two bowls part asunder like two skins. Vaiṣvânara put forth all his creative power.

translations.griffith: Wonderful Mitra propped the heaven and earth apart, and covered and concealed the darkness with his light. He made the two bowls part asunder like two skins. Vaiṣvânara put forth all his creative power.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒पामु॒पस्थे॑ महि॒षा अ॑गृभ्णत॒ विशो॒ राजा॑न॒मुप॑ तस्थुर्ऋ॒ग्मिय॑म् आ दू॒तो अ॒ग्निम॑भरद्वि॒वस्व॑तो वैश्वान॒रं मा॑त॒रिश्वा॑ परा॒वतः॑
stanzas.transliteration: apā́m upásthe mahiṣā́ agr̥bhṇata víśo rā́jānam úpa tasthur r̥gmíyam ā́ dūtó agním abharad vivásvato vaiśvānarám mātaríśvā parāvátaḥ
stanzas.translation: The Migbty seized him in the bosom of the floods: the people waited on the King who should be praised. As envoy of Vivasvan Mâtariṣvan brought Agni Vaiṣvânara hither from far away.

translations.griffith: The Migbty seized him in the bosom of the floods: the people waited on the King who should be praised. As envoy of Vivasvan Mâtariṣvan brought Agni Vaiṣvânara hither from far away.

stanzas.sanskrit: यु॒गेयु॑गे विद॒थ्यं॑ गृ॒णद्भ्योऽग्ने॑ र॒यिं य॒शसं॑ धेहि॒ नव्य॑सीम् प॒व्येव॑ राजन्न॒घशं॑समजर नी॒चा नि वृ॑श्च व॒निनं॒ न तेज॑सा
stanzas.transliteration: yugé-yuge vidathyàṃ gr̥ṇádbhyaḥ- -ágne rayíṃ yaśásaṃ dhehi návyasīm pavyéva rājann agháśaṃsam ajara nīcā́ ní vr̥śca vanínaṃ ná téjasā
stanzas.translation: In every age bestow upon the singers wealth, worthy of holy synods, glorious, ever new. King, undecaying, as it were with sharpened bolt, smite down the sinner like a tree with lightningflash.

translations.griffith: In every age bestow upon the singers wealth, worthy of holy synods, glorious, ever new. King, undecaying, as it were with sharpened bolt, smite down the sinner like a tree with lightningflash.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्माक॑मग्ने म॒घव॑त्सु धार॒याना॑मि क्ष॒त्रम॒जरं॑ सु॒वीर्य॑म् व॒यं ज॑येम श॒तिनं॑ सह॒स्रिणं॒ वैश्वा॑नर॒ वाज॑मग्ने॒ तवो॒तिभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: asmā́kam agne maghávatsu dhāraya- -ánāmi kṣatrám ajáraṃ suvī́ryam vayáṃ jayema śatínaṃ sahasríṇaṃ vaíśvānara vā́jam agne távotíbhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Do thou bestow, O Agni, on our wealthy chiefs, rule, with good heroes, undecaying, bending not. So may we win for us strength. O Vaiṣvânara, hundredfold, thousandfold, O Agni, by thy help.

translations.griffith: Do thou bestow, O Agni, on our wealthy chiefs, rule, with good heroes, undecaying, bending not. So may we win for us strength. O Vaiṣvânara, hundredfold, thousandfold, O Agni, by thy help.

stanzas.sanskrit: अद॑ब्धेभि॒स्तव॑ गो॒पाभि॑रिष्टे॒ऽस्माकं॑ पाहि त्रिषधस्थ सू॒रीन् रक्षा॑ च नो द॒दुषां॒ शर्धो॑ अग्ने॒ वैश्वा॑नर॒ प्र च॑ तारीः॒ स्तवा॑नः
stanzas.transliteration: ádabdhebhis táva gopā́bhir iṣṭe -asmā́kam pāhi triṣadhastha sūrī́n rákṣā ca no dadúṣāṃ śárdho agne vaíśvānara prá ca tārī stávānaḥ
stanzas.translation: O thou who dwellest in three places, Helper, keep with effective guards our princely patrons. Keep our band, Agni, who have brought thee presents. Lengthen their lives, Vaiṣvânara, when lauded.

translations.griffith: O thou who dwellest in three places, Helper, keep with effective guards our princely patrons. Keep our band, Agni, who have brought thee presents. Lengthen their lives, Vaiṣvânara, when lauded.

stanzas.sanskrit: अह॑श्च कृ॒ष्णमह॒रर्जु॑नं च॒ वि व॑र्तेते॒ रज॑सी वे॒द्याभिः॑ वै॒श्वा॒न॒रो जाय॑मानो॒ न राजावा॑तिर॒ज्ज्योति॑षा॒ग्निस्तमां॑सि
stanzas.transliteration: áhaś ca kr̥ṣṇám áhar árjunaṃ ca ví vartete rájasī vedyā́bhiḥ vaiśvānaró jā́yamāno ná rā́jā- -ávātiraj jyótiṣāgnís támāṃsi
stanzas.translation: ONE half of day is dark, and bright the other: both atmospheres move on by sage devices. Agni Vaiṣvânara, when born as Sovran, hath with his lustre overcome the darkness.

translations.griffith: ONE half of day is dark, and bright the other: both atmospheres move on by sage devices. Agni Vaiṣvânara, when born as Sovran, hath with his lustre overcome the darkness.

stanzas.sanskrit: नाहं तन्तुं॒ न वि जा॑ना॒म्योतुं॒ न यं वय॑न्ति सम॒रेऽत॑मानाः कस्य॑ स्वित्पु॒त्र इ॒ह वक्त्वा॑नि प॒रो व॑दा॒त्यव॑रेण पि॒त्रा
stanzas.transliteration: nā́háṃ tántuṃ ná ví jānāmy ótuṃ ná yáṃ váyanti samaré 'tamānāḥ kásya svit putrá ihá váktvāni paró vadāty ávareṇa pitrā́
stanzas.translation: I know not either warp or woof, I know not the web they weave when moving to the contest. Whose son shall here speak words that must be spoken without assistance from the Father near him?

translations.griffith: I know not either warp or woof, I know not the web they weave when moving to the contest. Whose son shall here speak words that must be spoken without assistance from the Father near him?

stanzas.sanskrit: स इत्तन्तुं॒ स वि जा॑ना॒त्योतुं॒ स वक्त्वा॑न्यृतु॒था व॑दाति य ईं॒ चिके॑तद॒मृत॑स्य गो॒पा अ॒वश्चर॑न्प॒रो अ॒न्येन॒ पश्य॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: sá ít tántuṃ sá ví jānāty ótuṃ sá váktvāny r̥tuthā́ vadāti yá īṃ cíketad amŕ̥tasya gopā́ḥ- aváś cáran paró anyéna páśyan
stanzas.translation: For both the warp and woof he understandeth, and in due time shall speak what should be spoken, Who knoweth as the immortal world's Protector, descending, seeing with no aid from other.

translations.griffith: For both the warp and woof he understandeth, and in due time shall speak what should be spoken, Who knoweth as the immortal world's Protector, descending, seeing with no aid from other.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यं होता॑ प्रथ॒मः पश्य॑ते॒ममि॒दं ज्योति॑र॒मृतं॒ मर्त्ये॑षु अ॒यं स ज॑ज्ञे ध्रु॒व आ निष॒त्तोऽम॑र्त्यस्त॒न्वा॒३॒॑ वर्ध॑मानः
stanzas.transliteration: ayáṃ hótā prathamáḥ páśyatemám idáṃ jyótir amŕ̥tam mártyeṣu ayáṃ sá jajñe dhruvá ā́ níṣattaḥ- -ámartyas tanvā̀ várdhamānaḥ
stanzas.translation: He is the Priest, the first of all: behold him. Mid mortal men he is the light immortal. Here was he born, firm-seated in his station Immortal, ever waxing in his body.

translations.griffith: He is the Priest, the first of all: behold him. Mid mortal men he is the light immortal. Here was he born, firm-seated in his station Immortal, ever waxing in his body.

stanzas.sanskrit: ध्रु॒वं ज्योति॒र्निहि॑तं दृ॒शये॒ कं मनो॒ जवि॑ष्ठं प॒तय॑त्स्व॒न्तः विश्वे॑ दे॒वाः सम॑नसः॒ सके॑ता॒ एकं॒ क्रतु॑म॒भि वि य॑न्ति सा॒धु
stanzas.transliteration: dhruváṃ jyótir níhitaṃ dr̥śáye kám máno jáviṣṭham patáyatsv antáḥ víśve devā́ḥ sámanasaḥ sáketāḥ- ékaṃ krátum abhí ví yanti sādhú
stanzas.translation: A firm light hath been set for men to look on: among all things that fly the mind is swiftest. All Gods of one accord, with one intention, move unobstructed to a single purpose.

translations.griffith: A firm light hath been set for men to look on: among all things that fly the mind is swiftest. All Gods of one accord, with one intention, move unobstructed to a single purpose.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि मे॒ कर्णा॑ पतयतो॒ वि चक्षु॒र्वी॒३॒॑दं ज्योति॒र्हृद॑य॒ आहि॑तं॒ यत् वि मे॒ मन॑श्चरति दू॒रआ॑धीः॒ किं स्वि॑द्व॒क्ष्यामि॒ किमु॒ नू म॑निष्ये
stanzas.transliteration: ví me kárṇā patayato ví cákṣur vī̀dáṃ jyótir hŕ̥daya ā́hitaṃ yát ví me mánaś carati dūráādhīḥ kíṃ svid vakṣyā́mi kím u nū́ maniṣye
stanzas.translation: Mine ears unclose to hear, mine eye to see him; the light that harbours in my spirit broadens. Far roams my mind whose thoughts are in the distance. What shall I speak, what shall I now imagine?

translations.griffith: Mine ears unclose to hear, mine eye to see him; the light that harbours in my spirit broadens. Far roams my mind whose thoughts are in the distance. What shall I speak, what shall I now imagine?

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वे॑ दे॒वा अ॑नमस्यन्भिया॒नास्त्वाम॑ग्ने॒ तम॑सि तस्थि॒वांस॑म् वै॒श्वा॒न॒रो॑ऽवतू॒तये॒ नोऽम॑र्त्योऽवतू॒तये॑ नः
stanzas.transliteration: víśve devā́ anamasyan bhiyānā́s tvā́m agne támasi tasthivā́ṃsam vaiśvānarò 'vatūtáye naḥ- -ámartyo 'vatūtáye naḥ
stanzas.translation: All the Gods bowed them down in fear before thee, Agni, when thou wast dwelling in the darkness. Vaiṣvânara be gracious to assist us, may the Immortal favour us and help us.

translations.griffith: All the Gods bowed them down in fear before thee, Agni, when thou wast dwelling in the darkness. Vaiṣvânara be gracious to assist us, may the Immortal favour us and help us.

stanzas.sanskrit: पु॒रो वो॑ म॒न्द्रं दि॒व्यं सु॑वृ॒क्तिं प्र॑य॒ति य॒ज्ञे अ॒ग्निम॑ध्व॒रे द॑धिध्वम् पु॒र उ॒क्थेभिः॒ स हि नो॑ वि॒भावा॑ स्वध्व॒रा क॑रति जा॒तवे॑दाः
stanzas.transliteration: puró vo mandráṃ divyáṃ suvr̥ktím prayatí yajñé agním adhvaré dadhidhvam purá ukthébhiḥ sá hí no vibhā́vā svadhvarā́ karati jātávedāḥ
stanzas.translation: INSTALL at sacrifice, while the rite advances, your pleasant, heavenly Agni, meet for praises. With hymns-for he illumines us-install him. He, Jâtavedas, makes our rites successful.

translations.griffith: INSTALL at sacrifice, while the rite advances, your pleasant, heavenly Agni, meet for praises. With hymns-for he illumines us-install him. He, Jâtavedas, makes our rites successful.

stanzas.sanskrit: तमु॑ द्युमः पुर्वणीक होत॒रग्ने॑ अ॒ग्निभि॒र्मनु॑ष इधा॒नः स्तोमं॒ यम॑स्मै म॒मते॑व शू॒षं घृ॒तं न शुचि॑ म॒तयः॑ पवन्ते
stanzas.transliteration: tám u dyumaḥ purvaṇīka hotar ágne agníbhir mánuṣa idhānáḥ stómaṃ yám asmai mamáteva śūṣáṃ ghr̥táṃ ná śúci matáyaḥ pavante
stanzas.translation: Hear this laud, Radiant Priest of many aspects, O Agni with the fires of man enkindled, Laud which bards send forth pure as sacred butter, strength to this man, as 'twere for selfadvantage.

translations.griffith: Hear this laud, Radiant Priest of many aspects, O Agni with the fires of man enkindled, Laud which bards send forth pure as sacred butter, strength to this man, as 'twere for selfadvantage.

stanzas.sanskrit: पी॒पाय॒ स श्रव॑सा॒ मर्त्ये॑षु॒ यो अ॒ग्नये॑ द॒दाश॒ विप्र॑ उ॒क्थैः चि॒त्राभि॒स्तमू॒तिभि॑श्चि॒त्रशो॑चिर्व्र॒जस्य॑ सा॒ता गोम॑तो दधाति
stanzas.transliteration: pīpā́ya sá śrávasā mártyeṣu yó agnáye dadā́śa vípra ukthaíḥ citrā́bhis tám ūtíbhiś citráśocir vrajásya sātā́ gómato dadhāti
stanzas.translation: Mid mortal men that singer thrives in glory who offers gifts with hymns of praise to Agni, And the God, wondrous bright, with wondrous succours helps him to win a stable filled with cattle.

translations.griffith: Mid mortal men that singer thrives in glory who offers gifts with hymns of praise to Agni, And the God, wondrous bright, with wondrous succours helps him to win a stable filled with cattle.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ यः प॒प्रौ जाय॑मान उ॒र्वी दू॑रे॒दृशा॑ भा॒सा कृ॒ष्णाध्वा॑ अध॑ ब॒हु चि॒त्तम॒ ऊर्म्या॑यास्ति॒रः शो॒चिषा॑ ददृशे पाव॒कः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yáḥ papraú jā́yamāna urvī́ dūredŕ̥śā bhāsā́ kr̥ṣṇā́dhvā ádha bahú cit táma ū́rmyāyās tiráḥ śocíṣā dadr̥śe pāvakáḥ
stanzas.translation: He, at his birth, whose path is black behind him, filled heaven and earth with far-apparent splendour: And he himself hath been. through night's thick darkness, made manifest by light, the Purifier.

translations.griffith: He, at his birth, whose path is black behind him, filled heaven and earth with far-apparent splendour: And he himself hath been. through night's thick darkness, made manifest by light, the Purifier.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू न॑श्चि॒त्रं पु॑रु॒वाजा॑भिरू॒ती अग्ने॑ र॒यिं म॒घव॑द्भ्यश्च धेहि ये राध॑सा॒ श्रव॑सा॒ चात्य॒न्यान्त्सु॒वीर्ये॑भिश्चा॒भि सन्ति॒ जना॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ naś citrám puruvā́jābhir ūtī́ ágne rayím maghávadbhyaś ca dhehi yé rā́dhasā śrávasā cā́ty anyā́n suvī́ryebhiś cābhí sánti jánān
stanzas.translation: With thy most mighty aid, confer, O Agni, wonderful wealth on us and on our princes, Who stand preeminent, surpassing others in liberal gifts, in fame, and hero virtues.

translations.griffith: With thy most mighty aid, confer, O Agni, wonderful wealth on us and on our princes, Who stand preeminent, surpassing others in liberal gifts, in fame, and hero virtues.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मं य॒ज्ञं चनो॑ धा अग्न उ॒शन्यं त॑ आसा॒नो जु॑हु॒ते ह॒विष्मा॑न् भ॒रद्वा॑जेषु दधिषे सुवृ॒क्तिमवी॒र्वाज॑स्य॒ गध्य॑स्य सा॒तौ
stanzas.transliteration: imáṃ yajñáṃ cáno dhā agna uśán yáṃ ta āsānó juhuté havíṣmān bharádvājeṣu dadhiṣe suvr̥ktím ávīr vā́jasya gádhyasya sātaú
stanzas.translation: Agni, accept this sacrifice with gladness, which, seated here, the worshipper presenteth. Fair hymns hadst thou among the Bharadvâjas, and holpest them to gain abundant vigour.

translations.griffith: Agni, accept this sacrifice with gladness, which, seated here, the worshipper presenteth. Fair hymns hadst thou among the Bharadvâjas, and holpest them to gain abundant vigour.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि द्वेषां॑सीनु॒हि व॒र्धयेळां॒ मदे॑म श॒तहि॑माः सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ví dvéṣāṃsīnuhí vardháyéḷām mádema śatáhimāḥ suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: Scatter our foes, increase our store. May we he glad a hundred winters with brave sons.

translations.griffith: Scatter our foes, increase our store. May we he glad a hundred winters with brave sons.

stanzas.sanskrit: यज॑स्व होतरिषि॒तो यजी॑या॒नग्ने॒ बाधो॑ म॒रुतां॒ न प्रयु॑क्ति आ नो॑ मि॒त्रावरु॑णा॒ नास॑त्या॒ द्यावा॑ हो॒त्राय॑ पृथि॒वी व॑वृत्याः
stanzas.transliteration: yájasva hotar iṣitó yájīyān ágne bā́dho marútāṃ ná práyukti ā́ no mitrā́váruṇā nā́satyā dyā́vā hotrā́ya pr̥thivī́ vavr̥tyāḥ
stanzas.translation: EAGERLY Sacrifice thou, most skilful, Agni! Priest, pressing on as if the Maruts sent thee. To our oblation bring the two Nâsatyas, Mitra and Varuṇa and Earth and Heaven.

translations.griffith: EAGERLY Sacrifice thou, most skilful, Agni! Priest, pressing on as if the Maruts sent thee. To our oblation bring the two Nâsatyas, Mitra and Varuṇa and Earth and Heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं होता॑ म॒न्द्रत॑मो नो अ॒ध्रुग॒न्तर्दे॒वो वि॒दथा॒ मर्त्ये॑षु पा॒व॒कया॑ जु॒ह्वा॒३॒॑ वह्नि॑रा॒साग्ने॒ यज॑स्व त॒न्वं१॒॑ तव॒ स्वाम्
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ hótā mandrátamo no adhrúg antár devó vidáthā mártyeṣu pāvakáyā juhvā̀ váhnir āsā́- -ágne yájasva tanvàṃ táva svā́m
stanzas.translation: Thou art our guileless, most delightful Herald, the God, among mankind, of holy synods. A Priest with purifying tongue, O Agni, sacrifice with thy mouth to thine own body.

translations.griffith: Thou art our guileless, most delightful Herald, the God, among mankind, of holy synods. A Priest with purifying tongue, O Agni, sacrifice with thy mouth to thine own body.

stanzas.sanskrit: धन्या॑ चि॒द्धि त्वे धि॒षणा॒ वष्टि॒ प्र दे॒वाञ्जन्म॑ गृण॒ते यज॑ध्यै वेपि॑ष्ठो॒ अङ्गि॑रसां॒ यद्ध॒ विप्रो॒ मधु॑ च्छ॒न्दो भन॑ति रे॒भ इ॒ष्टौ
stanzas.transliteration: dhányā cid dhí tvé dhiṣáṇā váṣṭi prá devā́ñ jánma gr̥ṇaté yájadhyai vépiṣṭho áṅgirasāṃ yád dha vípro mádhu chandó bhánati rebhá iṣṭaú
stanzas.translation: For even the blessed longing that is in thee would bring the Gods down to the singer's worship, When the Angirases' sagest Sage, the Poet, sings the sweet measure at the solemn service.

translations.griffith: For even the blessed longing that is in thee would bring the Gods down to the singer's worship, When the Angirases' sagest Sage, the Poet, sings the sweet measure at the solemn service.

stanzas.sanskrit: अदि॑द्युत॒त्स्वपा॑को वि॒भावाग्ने॒ यज॑स्व॒ रोद॑सी उरू॒ची आ॒युं न यं नम॑सा रा॒तह॑व्या अ॒ञ्जन्ति॑ सुप्र॒यसं॒ पञ्च॒ जनाः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ádidyutat sv ápāko vibhā́vā- -ágne yájasva ródasī urūcī́ āyúṃ ná yáṃ námasā rātáhavyāḥ- añjánti suprayásam páñca jánāḥ
stanzas.translation: Bright hath he beamed, the wise, the far-refulgent. Worship the two widespreading Worlds, O Agni, Whom as the Living One rich in oblations the Five Tribes, bringing gifts, adorn with homage.

translations.griffith: Bright hath he beamed, the wise, the far-refulgent. Worship the two widespreading Worlds, O Agni, Whom as the Living One rich in oblations the Five Tribes, bringing gifts, adorn with homage.

stanzas.sanskrit: वृ॒ञ्जे ह॒ यन्नम॑सा ब॒र्हिर॒ग्नावया॑मि॒ स्रुग्घृ॒तव॑ती सुवृ॒क्तिः अम्य॑क्षि॒ सद्म॒ सद॑ने पृथि॒व्या अश्रा॑यि य॒ज्ञः सूर्ये॒ न चक्षुः॑
stanzas.transliteration: vr̥ñjé ha yán námasā barhír agnā́v áyāmi srúg ghr̥távatī suvr̥ktíḥ ámyakṣi sádma sádane pr̥thivyā́ḥ- áśrāyi yajñáḥ sū́rye ná cákṣuḥ
stanzas.translation: When I with reverence clip the grass for Agni, when the trimmed ladle, fullof oil, is lifted, Firm on the seat of earth is based the altar: eye-like, the sacrifice is directed Sun-ward.

translations.griffith: When I with reverence clip the grass for Agni, when the trimmed ladle, fullof oil, is lifted, Firm on the seat of earth is based the altar: eye-like, the sacrifice is directed Sun-ward.

stanzas.sanskrit: द॒श॒स्या नः॑ पुर्वणीक होतर्दे॒वेभि॑रग्ने अ॒ग्निभि॑रिधा॒नः रा॒यः सू॑नो सहसो वावसा॒ना अति॑ स्रसेम वृ॒जनं॒ नांहः॑
stanzas.transliteration: daśasyā́ naḥ purvaṇīka hotar devébhir agne agníbhir idhānáḥ rāyáḥ sūno sahaso vāvasānā́ḥ- áti srasema vr̥jánaṃ nā́ṃhaḥ
stanzas.translation: Enrich us, O thou Priest of many aspects, with the Gods, Agni, with thy fires, enkindled. O Son of Strength, clad in the robe of riches, may we escape from woe as from a prison.

translations.griffith: Enrich us, O thou Priest of many aspects, with the Gods, Agni, with thy fires, enkindled. O Son of Strength, clad in the robe of riches, may we escape from woe as from a prison.

stanzas.sanskrit: मध्ये॒ होता॑ दुरो॒णे ब॒र्हिषो॒ राळ॒ग्निस्तो॒दस्य॒ रोद॑सी॒ यज॑ध्यै अ॒यं स सू॒नुः सह॑स ऋ॒तावा॑ दू॒रात्सूर्यो॒ न शो॒चिषा॑ ततान
stanzas.transliteration: mádhye hótā duroṇé barhíṣo rā́ḷ agnís todásya ródasī yájadhyai ayáṃ sá sūnúḥ sáhasa r̥tā́vā dūrā́t sū́ryo ná śocíṣā tatāna
stanzas.translation: KING of trimmed grass, Herald within the dwelling, may Agni worship the Impeller's World-halves. He, Son of Strength, the Holy, from a distance hath spread himself abroad with light like Sûrya.

translations.griffith: KING of trimmed grass, Herald within the dwelling, may Agni worship the Impeller's World-halves. He, Son of Strength, the Holy, from a distance hath spread himself abroad with light like Sûrya.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ यस्मि॒न्त्वे स्वपा॑के यजत्र॒ यक्ष॑द्राजन्त्स॒र्वता॑तेव॒ नु द्यौः त्रि॒ष॒धस्थ॑स्तत॒रुषो॒ न जंहो॑ ह॒व्या म॒घानि॒ मानु॑षा॒ यज॑ध्यै
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yásmin tvé sv ápāke yajatra yákṣad rājan sarvátāteva nú dyaúḥ triṣadhásthas tatarúṣo ná jáṃho havyā́ maghā́ni mā́nuṣā yájadhyai
stanzas.translation: In thee, most wise, shall Dyaus, for full perfection, King! Holy One! pronounce the call to worship. Found in three places, like the Speeder's footstep, come to present men's riches as oblations!

translations.griffith: In thee, most wise, shall Dyaus, for full perfection, King! Holy One! pronounce the call to worship. Found in three places, like the Speeder's footstep, come to present men's riches as oblations!

stanzas.sanskrit: तेजि॑ष्ठा॒ यस्या॑र॒तिर्व॑ने॒राट् तो॒दो अध्व॒न्न वृ॑धसा॒नो अ॑द्यौत् अ॒द्रो॒घो न द्र॑वि॒ता चे॑तति॒ त्मन्नम॑र्त्योऽव॒र्त्र ओष॑धीषु
stanzas.transliteration: téjiṣṭhā yásyāratír vanerā́ṭ todó ádhvan ná vr̥dhasānó adyaut adroghó ná dravitā́ cetati tmánn ámartyo 'vartrá óṣadhīṣu
stanzas.translation: Whose blaze most splendid, sovran in the forest, shines waxing on his way like the – Impeller. He knows himself, like as a guileless smelter, not to be stayed among the plants, Immortal.

translations.griffith: Whose blaze most splendid, sovran in the forest, shines waxing on his way like the – Impeller. He knows himself, like as a guileless smelter, not to be stayed among the plants, Immortal.

stanzas.sanskrit: सास्माके॑भिरे॒तरी॒ न शू॒षैर॒ग्निः ष्ट॑वे॒ दम॒ आ जा॒तवे॑दाः द्र्व॑न्नो व॒न्वन्क्रत्वा॒ नार्वो॒स्रः पि॒तेव॑ जार॒यायि॑ य॒ज्ञैः
stanzas.transliteration: sā́smā́kebhir etárī ná śūṣaír agní ṣṭave dáma ā́ jātávedāḥ drvànno vanván krátvā nā́rvā- -usráḥ pitéva jārayā́yi yajñaíḥ
stanzas.translation: Our friends extol him like a steed for vigour even Agni in the dwelling, Jâtave~as. Trce-fed, he fights with power as doth a champion, like Dawn's Sire to be praised with sacrifices.

translations.griffith: Our friends extol him like a steed for vigour even Agni in the dwelling, Jâtave~as. Trce-fed, he fights with power as doth a champion, like Dawn's Sire to be praised with sacrifices.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध॑ स्मास्य पनयन्ति॒ भासो॒ वृथा॒ यत्तक्ष॑दनु॒याति॑ पृ॒थ्वीम् स॒द्यो यः स्य॒न्द्रो विषि॑तो॒ धवी॑यानृ॒णो न ता॒युरति॒ धन्वा॑ राट्
stanzas.transliteration: ádha smāsya panayanti bhā́so vŕ̥thā yát tákṣad anuyā́ti pr̥thvī́m sadyó yáḥ syandró víṣito dhávīyān r̥ṇó ná tāyúr áti dhánvā rāṭ
stanzas.translation: Men wonder at his shining glows when, paring the woods with case, o'er the broad earth he goeth, And, like a rushing flood, loosed quickly, burneth, swift as a guilty thief, o'er desert places.

translations.griffith: Men wonder at his shining glows when, paring the woods with case, o'er the broad earth he goeth, And, like a rushing flood, loosed quickly, burneth, swift as a guilty thief, o'er desert places.

stanzas.sanskrit: स त्वं नो॑ अर्व॒न्निदा॑या॒ विश्वे॑भिरग्ने अ॒ग्निभि॑रिधा॒नः वेषि॑ रा॒यो वि या॑सि दु॒च्छुना॒ मदे॑म श॒तहि॑माः सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá tváṃ no arvan nídāyāḥ- víśvebhir agne agníbhir idhānáḥ véṣi rāyó ví yāsi duchúnāḥ- mádema śatáhimāḥ suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: So mighty thou protectest us from slander, O Champion, Agni! with all fires enkindled. Bring opulence and drive away affliction. May brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.

translations.griffith: So mighty thou protectest us from slander, O Champion, Agni! with all fires enkindled. Bring opulence and drive away affliction. May brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वद्विश्वा॑ सुभग॒ सौभ॑गा॒न्यग्ने॒ वि य॑न्ति व॒निनो॒ न व॒याः श्रु॒ष्टी र॒यिर्वाजो॑ वृत्र॒तूर्ये॑ दि॒वो वृ॒ष्टिरीड्यो॑ री॒तिर॒पाम्
stanzas.transliteration: tvád víśvā subhaga saúbhagāni- ágne ví yanti vaníno ná vayā́ḥ śruṣṭī́ rayír vā́jo vr̥tratū́rye divó vr̥ṣṭír ī́ḍyo rītír apā́m
stanzas.translation: FROM thee, as branches from a tree, O Agni, from thee, Auspicious God! spring all our blessings- Wealth swiftly, strength in battle with our foemen, the rain besought of heaven, the flow of waters.

translations.griffith: FROM thee, as branches from a tree, O Agni, from thee, Auspicious God! spring all our blessings- Wealth swiftly, strength in battle with our foemen, the rain besought of heaven, the flow of waters.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं भगो॑ न॒ आ हि रत्न॑मि॒षे परि॑ज्मेव क्षयसि द॒स्मव॑र्चाः अग्ने॑ मि॒त्रो न बृ॑ह॒त ऋ॒तस्यासि॑ क्ष॒त्ता वा॒मस्य॑ देव॒ भूरेः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tvám bhágo na ā́ hí rátnam iṣé párijmeva kṣayasi dasmávarcāḥ ágne mitró ná br̥hatá r̥tásya- -ási kṣattā́ vāmásya deva bhū́reḥ
stanzas.translation: Thou art our Bhaga to send wealth thou dwellest, like circumambient air, with wondrous splendour. Friend art thou of the lofty Law, like Mitra, Controller, Agni! God! of many a blessing.

translations.griffith: Thou art our Bhaga to send wealth thou dwellest, like circumambient air, with wondrous splendour. Friend art thou of the lofty Law, like Mitra, Controller, Agni! God! of many a blessing.

stanzas.sanskrit: स सत्प॑तिः॒ शव॑सा हन्ति वृ॒त्रमग्ने॒ विप्रो॒ वि प॒णेर्भ॑र्ति॒ वाज॑म् यं त्वं प्र॑चेत ऋतजात रा॒या स॒जोषा॒ नप्त्रा॒पां हि॒नोषि॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá sátpatiḥ śávasā hanti vr̥trám ágne vípro ví paṇér bharti vā́jam yáṃ tvám praceta r̥tajāta rāyā́ sajóṣā náptrāpā́ṃ hinóṣi
stanzas.translation: Agni! the hero slays with might his foeman; the singer bears away the Paṇi's booty- Even he whom thou, Sage, born in Law, incitest by wealth, accordant with the Child of Waters.

translations.griffith: Agni! the hero slays with might his foeman; the singer bears away the Paṇi's booty- Even he whom thou, Sage, born in Law, incitest by wealth, accordant with the Child of Waters.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्ते॑ सूनो सहसो गी॒र्भिरु॒क्थैर्य॒ज्ञैर्मर्तो॒ निशि॑तिं वे॒द्यान॑ट् विश्वं॒ स दे॑व॒ प्रति॒ वार॑मग्ने ध॒त्ते धा॒न्यं१॒॑ पत्य॑ते वस॒व्यैः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yás te sūno sahaso gīrbhír ukthaír yajñaír márto níśitiṃ vedyā́naṭ víśvaṃ sá deva práti vā́ram agne dhatté dhānyàm pátyate vasavyaìḥ
stanzas.translation: The man who, Son of Strength! with sacrifices, hymns, lauds, attracts thy fervour to the altar, Enjoys each precious thing, O God, O Agni, gains wealth of corn and is the lord of treasures.

translations.griffith: The man who, Son of Strength! with sacrifices, hymns, lauds, attracts thy fervour to the altar, Enjoys each precious thing, O God, O Agni, gains wealth of corn and is the lord of treasures.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता नृभ्य॒ आ सौ॑श्रव॒सा सु॒वीराग्ने॑ सूनो सहसः पु॒ष्यसे॑ धाः कृ॒णोषि॒ यच्छव॑सा॒ भूरि॑ प॒श्वो वयो॒ वृका॑या॒रये॒ जसु॑रये
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ nŕ̥bhya ā́ sauśravasā́ suvī́rā- -ágne sūno sahasaḥ puṣyáse dhāḥ kr̥ṇóṣi yác chávasā bhū́ri paśvó váyo vŕ̥kāyāráye jásuraye
stanzas.translation: Grant, Son of Strength, to men for their subsistence such things as bring high fame and hero children. For thou with might givest much food in cattle even to the wicked wolf when he is hungry.

translations.griffith: Grant, Son of Strength, to men for their subsistence such things as bring high fame and hero children. For thou with might givest much food in cattle even to the wicked wolf when he is hungry.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒द्मा सू॑नो सहसो नो॒ विहा॑या॒ अग्ने॑ तो॒कं तन॑यं वा॒जि नो॑ दाः विश्वा॑भिर्गी॒र्भिर॒भि पू॒र्तिम॑श्यां॒ मदे॑म श॒तहि॑माः सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: vadmā́ sūno sahaso no víhāyāḥ- ágne tokáṃ tánayaṃ vājí no dāḥ víśvābhir gīrbhír abhí pūrtím aśyām mádema śatáhimāḥ suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: Eloquent, Son of Strength, Most Mighty, Agni, vouchsafe us seed and offspring, full of vigour. May I by all my songs obtain abundance. May brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.

translations.griffith: Eloquent, Son of Strength, Most Mighty, Agni, vouchsafe us seed and offspring, full of vigour. May I by all my songs obtain abundance. May brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्ना यो मर्त्यो॒ दुवो॒ धियं॑ जु॒जोष॑ धी॒तिभिः॑ भस॒न्नु ष प्र पू॒र्व्य इषं॑ वुरी॒ताव॑से
stanzas.transliteration: agnā́ yó mártyo dúvo dhíyaṃ jujóṣa dhītíbhiḥ bhásan nú ṣá prá pūrvyáḥ- íṣaṃ vurītā́vase
stanzas.translation: WHOSO to Agni hath endeared his thought and service by his hymns, That mortal cats before the rest, and finds sufficiency of food.

translations.griffith: WHOSO to Agni hath endeared his thought and service by his hymns, That mortal cats before the rest, and finds sufficiency of food.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निरिद्धि प्रचे॑ता अ॒ग्निर्वे॒धस्त॑म॒ ऋषिः॑ अ॒ग्निं होता॑रमीळते य॒ज्ञेषु॒ मनु॑षो॒ विशः॑
stanzas.transliteration: agnír íd dhí prácetāḥ- agnír vedhástama ŕ̥ṣiḥ agníṃ hótāram īḷate yajñéṣu mánuṣo víśaḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni, in truth, is passing wise, most skilled in ordering, a Seer. At sacrifices Manus' sons glorify Agni as their Priest.

translations.griffith: Agni, in truth, is passing wise, most skilled in ordering, a Seer. At sacrifices Manus' sons glorify Agni as their Priest.

stanzas.sanskrit: नाना॒ ह्य१॒॑ग्नेऽव॑से॒ स्पर्ध॑न्ते॒ रायो॑ अ॒र्यः तूर्व॑न्तो॒ दस्यु॑मा॒यवो॑ व्र॒तैः सीक्ष॑न्तो अव्र॒तम्
stanzas.transliteration: nā́nā hy àgné 'vase spárdhante rā́yo aryáḥ tū́rvanto dásyum āyávo vrataíḥ sī́kṣanto avratám
stanzas.translation: The foeman's wealth in many a place, Agni, is emulous to help. Men fight the fiend, and seek by rites to overcome the riteless foe.

translations.griffith: The foeman's wealth in many a place, Agni, is emulous to help. Men fight the fiend, and seek by rites to overcome the riteless foe.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निर॒प्सामृ॑ती॒षहं॑ वी॒रं द॑दाति॒ सत्प॑तिम् यस्य॒ त्रस॑न्ति॒ शव॑सः सं॒चक्षि॒ शत्र॑वो भि॒या
stanzas.transliteration: agnír apsā́m r̥tīṣáhaṃ vīráṃ dadāti sátpatim yásya trásanti śávasaḥ saṃcákṣi śátravo bhiyā́
stanzas.translation: Agni bestows the hero chief, winner of waters, firm in fray. Soon as they look upon his might his enemies tremble in alarm.

translations.griffith: Agni bestows the hero chief, winner of waters, firm in fray. Soon as they look upon his might his enemies tremble in alarm.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निर्हि वि॒द्मना॑ नि॒दो दे॒वो मर्त॑मुरु॒ष्यति॑ स॒हावा॒ यस्यावृ॑तो र॒यिर्वाजे॒ष्ववृ॑तः
stanzas.transliteration: agnír hí vidmánā nidó devó mártam uruṣyáti sahā́vā yásyā́vr̥to rayír vā́jeṣv ávr̥taḥ
stanzas.translation: For with his wisdom Agni, God, protects the mortal from reproach, Whose conquering wealth is never checked, is never checked in deeds of might.

translations.griffith: For with his wisdom Agni, God, protects the mortal from reproach, Whose conquering wealth is never checked, is never checked in deeds of might.

stanzas.sanskrit: अच्छा॑ नो मित्रमहो देव दे॒वानग्ने॒ वोचः॑ सुम॒तिं रोद॑स्योः वी॒हि स्व॒स्तिं सु॑क्षि॒तिं दि॒वो नॄन्द्वि॒षो अंहां॑सि दुरि॒ता त॑रेम॒ ता त॑रेम॒ तवाव॑सा तरेम
stanzas.transliteration: áchā no mitramaho deva devā́n ágne vócaḥ sumatíṃ ródasyoḥ vīhí svastíṃ sukṣitíṃ divó nr̥̄́n dviṣó áṃhāṃsi duritā́ tarema tā́ tarema távā́vasā tarema
stanzas.translation: O Agni, God with Mitra's might call hither the favour of the Gods from earth and heaven. Bring weal from heaven that men may dwell securely. May we o'ercome the foe's malign oppressions, may we o'ercome them, through thy help o'ercome them.

translations.griffith: O Agni, God with Mitra's might call hither the favour of the Gods from earth and heaven. Bring weal from heaven that men may dwell securely. May we o'ercome the foe's malign oppressions, may we o'ercome them, through thy help o'ercome them.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒ममू॒ षु वो॒ अति॑थिमुष॒र्बुधं॒ विश्वा॑सां वि॒शां पति॑मृञ्जसे गि॒रा वेतीद्दि॒वो ज॒नुषा॒ कच्चि॒दा शुचि॒र्ज्योक्चि॑दत्ति॒ गर्भो॒ यदच्यु॑तम्
stanzas.transliteration: imám ū ṣú vo átithim uṣarbúdhaṃ víśvāsāṃ viśā́m pátim r̥ñjase girā́ vétī́d divó janúṣā kác cid ā́ śúcir jyók cid atti gárbho yád ácyutam
stanzas.translation: WITH this my song I strive to reach this guest of yours, who wakes at early morn, the Lord of all the tribes. Each time he comes from heaven, the Pure One from of old: from ancient days the Child cats everlasting food.

translations.griffith: WITH this my song I strive to reach this guest of yours, who wakes at early morn, the Lord of all the tribes. Each time he comes from heaven, the Pure One from of old: from ancient days the Child cats everlasting food.

stanzas.sanskrit: मि॒त्रं न यं सुधि॑तं॒ भृग॑वो द॒धुर्वन॒स्पता॒वीड्य॑मू॒र्ध्वशो॑चिषम् स त्वं सुप्री॑तो वी॒तह॑व्ये अद्भुत॒ प्रश॑स्तिभिर्महयसे दि॒वेदि॑वे
stanzas.transliteration: mitráṃ ná yáṃ súdhitam bhŕ̥gavo dadhúr vánaspátāv ī́ḍyam ūrdhváśociṣam sá tváṃ súprīto vītáhavye adbhuta práśastibhir mahayase divé-dive
stanzas.translation: Whom, well-disposed, the Bhr̥igus stablished as a Friend, whom men must glorify, high-flaming in the wood. As such, most friendly, thou art every day extolled in lauds by Vîtahavya, O thou wondrous God.

translations.griffith: Whom, well-disposed, the Bhr̥igus stablished as a Friend, whom men must glorify, high-flaming in the wood. As such, most friendly, thou art every day extolled in lauds by Vîtahavya, O thou wondrous God.

stanzas.sanskrit: स त्वं दक्ष॑स्यावृ॒को वृ॒धो भू॑र॒र्यः पर॒स्यान्त॑रस्य॒ तरु॑षः रा॒यः सू॑नो सहसो॒ मर्त्ये॒ष्वा छ॒र्दिर्य॑च्छ वी॒तह॑व्याय स॒प्रथो॑ भ॒रद्वा॑जाय स॒प्रथः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá tváṃ dákṣasyāvr̥kó vr̥dhó bhūr aryáḥ párasyā́ntarasya táruṣaḥ rāyáḥ sūno sahaso mártyeṣv~ā́ chardír yacha vītáhavyāya saprátho bharádvājāya sapráthaḥ
stanzas.translation: Be thou the foeless helper of the skilful man, subduer of the enemy near or far away. Bestow a wealthy home on men, O Son of Strength. Give Vîtahavya riches spreading far and wide, give Bharadvâja wide-spread wealth.

translations.griffith: Be thou the foeless helper of the skilful man, subduer of the enemy near or far away. Bestow a wealthy home on men, O Son of Strength. Give Vîtahavya riches spreading far and wide, give Bharadvâja wide-spread wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: द्यु॒ता॒नं वो॒ अति॑थिं॒ स्व॑र्णरम॒ग्निं होता॑रं॒ मनु॑षः स्वध्व॒रम् विप्रं॒ न द्यु॒क्षव॑चसं सुवृ॒क्तिभि॑र्हव्य॒वाह॑मर॒तिं दे॒वमृ॑ञ्जसे
stanzas.transliteration: dyutānáṃ vo átithiṃ svàrṇaram agníṃ hótāram mánuṣaḥ svadhvarám vípraṃ ná dyukṣávacasaṃ suvr̥ktíbhir havyavā́ham aratíṃ devám r̥ñjase
stanzas.translation: Him, your refulgent guest, Agni who comes from heaven, the Herald of mankind, well-skilled in sacred rites, Who, like a holy singer, utters heavenly words, oblation-bearer, envoy, God, I seek with hymns.

translations.griffith: Him, your refulgent guest, Agni who comes from heaven, the Herald of mankind, well-skilled in sacred rites, Who, like a holy singer, utters heavenly words, oblation-bearer, envoy, God, I seek with hymns.

stanzas.sanskrit: पा॒व॒कया॒ यश्चि॒तय॑न्त्या कृ॒पा क्षाम॑न्रुरु॒च उ॒षसो॒ न भा॒नुना॑ तूर्व॒न्न याम॒न्नेत॑शस्य॒ नू रण॒ आ यो घृ॒णे न त॑तृषा॒णो अ॒जरः॑
stanzas.transliteration: pāvakáyā yáś citáyantyā kr̥pā́ kṣā́man rurucá uṣáso ná bhānúnā tū́rvan ná yā́mann étaśasya nū́ ráṇe- ā́ yó ghr̥ṇé ná tatr̥ṣāṇó ajáraḥ
stanzas.translation: Who with his purifying, eye-attracting form hath shone upon the earth as with the light of Dawn; Who speeding on, as in the fight of Etaia, cometh, untouched by age, as one athirst in heat.

translations.griffith: Who with his purifying, eye-attracting form hath shone upon the earth as with the light of Dawn; Who speeding on, as in the fight of Etaia, cometh, untouched by age, as one athirst in heat.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निम॑ग्निं वः स॒मिधा॑ दुवस्यत प्रि॒यम्प्रि॑यं वो॒ अति॑थिं गृणी॒षणि॑ उप॑ वो गी॒र्भिर॒मृतं॑ विवासत दे॒वो दे॒वेषु॒ वन॑ते॒ हि वार्यं॑ दे॒वो दे॒वेषु॒ वन॑ते॒ हि नो॒ दुवः॑
stanzas.transliteration: agním-agniṃ vaḥ samídhā duvasyata priyám-priyaṃ vo átithiṃ gr̥ṇīṣáṇi úpa vo gīrbhír amŕ̥taṃ vivāsata devó devéṣu vánate hí vā́ryaṃ devó devéṣu vánate hí no dúvaḥ
stanzas.translation: Worship ye Agni, Agni, with your log of wood; praise your beloved, your beloved guest with songs. Invite ye the Immortal hither with your hymns. A God among the Gods, he loveth what is choice, loveth our service, God mid Gods.

translations.griffith: Worship ye Agni, Agni, with your log of wood; praise your beloved, your beloved guest with songs. Invite ye the Immortal hither with your hymns. A God among the Gods, he loveth what is choice, loveth our service, God mid Gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: समि॑द्धम॒ग्निं स॒मिधा॑ गि॒रा गृ॑णे॒ शुचिं॑ पाव॒कं पु॒रो अ॑ध्व॒रे ध्रु॒वम् विप्रं॒ होता॑रं पुरु॒वार॑म॒द्रुहं॑ क॒विं सु॒म्नैरी॑महे जा॒तवे॑दसम्
stanzas.transliteration: sámiddham agníṃ samídhā girā́ gr̥ṇe śúcim pāvakám puró adhvaré dhruvám vípraṃ hótāram puruvā́ram adrúhaṃ kavíṃ sumnaír īmahe jātávedasam
stanzas.translation: Agni inflamed with fuel in my song I sing, pure, Cleanser, steadlast, set in tront at sacrifice. Wise Jâtavedas we implore with prayers for bliss the Priest, the holy Singer, bounteous, void of guile.

translations.griffith: Agni inflamed with fuel in my song I sing, pure, Cleanser, steadlast, set in tront at sacrifice. Wise Jâtavedas we implore with prayers for bliss the Priest, the holy Singer, bounteous, void of guile.
