stanzas.sanskrit: त्वां दू॒तम॑ग्ने अ॒मृतं॑ यु॒गेयु॑गे हव्य॒वाहं॑ दधिरे पा॒युमीड्य॑म् दे॒वास॑श्च॒ मर्ता॑सश्च॒ जागृ॑विं वि॒भुं वि॒श्पतिं॒ नम॑सा॒ नि षे॑दिरे
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́ṃ dūtám agne amŕ̥taṃ yugé-yuge havyavā́haṃ dadhire pāyúm ī́ḍyam devā́saś ca mártāsaś ca jā́gr̥viṃ vibhúṃ viśpátiṃ námasā ní ṣedire
stanzas.translation: Men, Agni, in each age have made thee, Deathiess One, their envoy, offering-bearer, guard adorable. With reverence Gods and mortals have established thee, the ever-watchful, omnipresent Household Lord.

translations.griffith: Men, Agni, in each age have made thee, Deathiess One, their envoy, offering-bearer, guard adorable. With reverence Gods and mortals have established thee, the ever-watchful, omnipresent Household Lord.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒भूष॑न्नग्न उ॒भयाँ॒ अनु॑ व्र॒ता दू॒तो दे॒वानां॒ रज॑सी॒ समी॑यसे यत्ते॑ धी॒तिं सु॑म॒तिमा॑वृणी॒महेऽध॑ स्मा नस्त्रि॒वरू॑थः शि॒वो भ॑व
stanzas.transliteration: vibhū́ṣann agna ubháyām̐ ánu vratā́ dūtó devā́nāṃ rájasī sám īyase yát te dhītíṃ sumatím āvr̥ṇīmáhe- -ádha smā nas trivárūthaḥ śivó bhava
stanzas.translation: Thou, Agni, ordering the works and ways of both, as envoy of the Gods traversest both the worlds. When we lay claim to thy regard and gracious fare, be thou to us a thriceprotecting friendly guard.

translations.griffith: Thou, Agni, ordering the works and ways of both, as envoy of the Gods traversest both the worlds. When we lay claim to thy regard and gracious fare, be thou to us a thriceprotecting friendly guard.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं सु॒प्रती॑कं सु॒दृशं॒ स्वञ्च॒मवि॑द्वांसो वि॒दुष्ट॑रं सपेम स य॑क्ष॒द्विश्वा॑ व॒युना॑नि वि॒द्वान्प्र ह॒व्यम॒ग्निर॒मृते॑षु वोचत्
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ suprátīkaṃ sudŕ̥śaṃ sváñcam ávidvāṃso vidúṣṭaraṃ sapema sá yakṣad víśvā vayúnāni vidvā́n prá havyám agnír amŕ̥teṣu vocat
stanzas.translation: Him fair of face, rapid, and fair to look on, him very wise may we who know not follow. Let him who knows all rules invite for worship, Agru announce our offering to the Immortals.

translations.griffith: Him fair of face, rapid, and fair to look on, him very wise may we who know not follow. Let him who knows all rules invite for worship, Agru announce our offering to the Immortals.

stanzas.sanskrit: तम॑ग्ने पास्यु॒त तं पि॑पर्षि॒ यस्त॒ आन॑ट् क॒वये॑ शूर धी॒तिम् य॒ज्ञस्य॑ वा॒ निशि॑तिं॒ वोदि॑तिं वा॒ तमित्पृ॑णक्षि॒ शव॑सो॒त रा॒या
stanzas.transliteration: tám agne pāsy utá tám piparṣi yás ta ā́naṭ kaváye śūra dhītím yajñásya vā níśitiṃ vóditiṃ vā tám ít pr̥ṇakṣi śávasotá rāyā́
stanzas.translation: Him, Agni, thou deliverest and savest who brings him prayer to thee the Wise, O Hero, The end of sacrifice or its inception; yea, thou endowest him with power and riches.

translations.griffith: Him, Agni, thou deliverest and savest who brings him prayer to thee the Wise, O Hero, The end of sacrifice or its inception; yea, thou endowest him with power and riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वम॑ग्ने वनुष्य॒तो नि पा॑हि॒ त्वमु॑ नः सहसावन्नव॒द्यात् सं त्वा॑ ध्वस्म॒न्वद॒भ्ये॑तु॒ पाथः॒ सं र॒यिः स्पृ॑ह॒याय्यः॑ सह॒स्री
stanzas.transliteration: tvám agne vanuṣyató ní pāhi tvám u naḥ sahasāvann avadyā́t sáṃ tvā dhvasmanvád abhy ètu pā́thaḥ sáṃ rayí spr̥hayā́yyaḥ sahasrī́
stanzas.translation: Guard us from him who would assail us, Agni; preserve us, O thou Victor, from dishonour. Here let the place of darkening come upon thee: may wealth be ours, desirable in thousands.

translations.griffith: Guard us from him who would assail us, Agni; preserve us, O thou Victor, from dishonour. Here let the place of darkening come upon thee: may wealth be ours, desirable in thousands.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निर्होता॑ गृ॒हप॑तिः॒ स राजा॒ विश्वा॑ वेद॒ जनि॑मा जा॒तवे॑दाः दे॒वाना॑मु॒त यो मर्त्या॑नां॒ यजि॑ष्ठः॒ स प्र य॑जतामृ॒तावा॑
stanzas.transliteration: agnír hótā gr̥hápatiḥ sá rā́jā víśvā veda jánimā jātávedāḥ devā́nām utá yó mártyānāṃ yájiṣṭhaḥ sá prá yajatām r̥tā́vā
stanzas.translation: Agni, the Priest, is King, Lord of the homestead, he, Jatayedas, knows all generations. Most skilful worshipper mid Gods and mortals, may he begin the sacrifice, the Holy.

translations.griffith: Agni, the Priest, is King, Lord of the homestead, he, Jatayedas, knows all generations. Most skilful worshipper mid Gods and mortals, may he begin the sacrifice, the Holy.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॒ यद॒द्य वि॒शो अ॑ध्वरस्य होतः॒ पाव॑कशोचे॒ वेष्ट्वं हि यज्वा॑ ऋ॒ता य॑जासि महि॒ना वि यद्भूर्ह॒व्या व॑ह यविष्ठ॒ या ते॑ अ॒द्य
stanzas.transliteration: ágne yád adyá viśó adhvarasya hotaḥ pā́vakaśoce véṣ ṭváṃ hí yájvā r̥tā́ yajāsi mahinā́ ví yád bhū́r havyā́ vaha yaviṣṭha yā́ te adyá
stanzas.translation: Whate'er to-day thou, bright-flamed Priest, enjoyest from the man's rite-for thou art sacrificer Worship, for duly dost thou spread in greatness: bear off thine ofrerings of to-day, Most Youthful.

translations.griffith: Whate'er to-day thou, bright-flamed Priest, enjoyest from the man's rite-for thou art sacrificer Worship, for duly dost thou spread in greatness: bear off thine ofrerings of to-day, Most Youthful.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भि प्रयां॑सि॒ सुधि॑तानि॒ हि ख्यो नि त्वा॑ दधीत॒ रोद॑सी॒ यज॑ध्यै अवा॑ नो मघव॒न्वाज॑साता॒वग्ने॒ विश्वा॑नि दुरि॒ता त॑रेम॒ ता त॑रेम॒ तवाव॑सा तरेम
stanzas.transliteration: abhí práyāṃsi súdhitāni hí khyó ní tvā dadhīta ródasī yájadhyai ávā no maghavan vā́jasātāv ágne víśvāni duritā́ tarema tā́ tarema távā́vasā tarema
stanzas.translation: Look thou upon the viands duly laid for thee. Fain would he set thee here to worship Heaven and,Earth. Help us, O liberal Agni, in the strife for spoil, so that we may o'ercome all things that trouble us, o'ercome, o'ercome them with thy help.

translations.griffith: Look thou upon the viands duly laid for thee. Fain would he set thee here to worship Heaven and,Earth. Help us, O liberal Agni, in the strife for spoil, so that we may o'ercome all things that trouble us, o'ercome, o'ercome them with thy help.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॒ विश्वे॑भिः स्वनीक दे॒वैरूर्णा॑वन्तं प्रथ॒मः सी॑द॒ योनि॑म् कु॒ला॒यिनं॑ घृ॒तव॑न्तं सवि॒त्रे य॒ज्ञं न॑य॒ यज॑मानाय सा॒धु
stanzas.transliteration: ágne víśvebhiḥ svanīka devaír ū́rṇāvantam prathamáḥ sīda yónim kulāyínaṃ ghr̥távantaṃ savitré yajñáṃ naya yájamānāya sādhú
stanzas.translation: Together with all Gods, O fair-faced Agni, be seated first upon the woollined altar, Nest-like, bedewed with oil. Bear this our worship to Savitar who sacrifices rightly.

translations.griffith: Together with all Gods, O fair-faced Agni, be seated first upon the woollined altar, Nest-like, bedewed with oil. Bear this our worship to Savitar who sacrifices rightly.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒ममु॒ त्यम॑थर्व॒वद॒ग्निं म॑न्थन्ति वे॒धसः॑ यम॑ङ्कू॒यन्त॒मान॑य॒न्नमू॑रं श्या॒व्या॑भ्यः
stanzas.transliteration: imám u tyám atharvavád agním manthanti vedhásaḥ yám aṅkūyántam ā́nayann ámūraṃ śyāvyā̀bhyaḥ
stanzas.translation: Here the arranging priests, as did Atharvan, rub this Agni forth, Whom, not bewildered, as he moved in winding ways, they brought from gloom.

translations.griffith: Here the arranging priests, as did Atharvan, rub this Agni forth, Whom, not bewildered, as he moved in winding ways, they brought from gloom.

stanzas.sanskrit: जनि॑ष्वा दे॒ववी॑तये स॒र्वता॑ता स्व॒स्तये॑ आ दे॒वान्व॑क्ष्य॒मृताँ॑ ऋता॒वृधो॑ य॒ज्ञं दे॒वेषु॑ पिस्पृशः
stanzas.transliteration: jániṣvā devávītaye sarvátātā svastáye ā́ devā́n vakṣy amŕ̥tām̐ r̥tāvŕ̥dho yajñáṃ devéṣu pispr̥śaḥ
stanzas.translation: For the Gods' banquet be thou born, for full perfection and for weal. Bring the Immortal Gods who strengthen holy Law: so let our sacrifice reach the Gods.

translations.griffith: For the Gods' banquet be thou born, for full perfection and for weal. Bring the Immortal Gods who strengthen holy Law: so let our sacrifice reach the Gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒यमु॑ त्वा गृहपते जनाना॒मग्ने॒ अक॑र्म स॒मिधा॑ बृ॒हन्त॑म् अ॒स्थू॒रि नो॒ गार्ह॑पत्यानि सन्तु ति॒ग्मेन॑ न॒स्तेज॑सा॒ सं शि॑शाधि
stanzas.transliteration: vayám u tvā gr̥hapate janānām ágne ákarma samídhā br̥hántam asthūrí no gā́rhapatyāni santu tigména nas téjasā sáṃ śiśādhi
stanzas.translation: O Agni, Lord and Master of men's homesteads, with kindled fuel we have made thee mighty. Let not our household gear be found defective. Sharpen us with thy penetrating splendour.

translations.griffith: O Agni, Lord and Master of men's homesteads, with kindled fuel we have made thee mighty. Let not our household gear be found defective. Sharpen us with thy penetrating splendour.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वम॑ग्ने य॒ज्ञानां॒ होता॒ विश्वे॑षां हि॒तः दे॒वेभि॒र्मानु॑षे॒ जने॑
stanzas.transliteration: tvám agne yajñā́nāṃ hótā víśveṣāṃ hitáḥ devébhir mā́nuṣe jáne
stanzas.translation: PRIEST of all sacrifices hast thou been appointed by the Gods, Agni, amid the race of man.

translations.griffith: PRIEST of all sacrifices hast thou been appointed by the Gods, Agni, amid the race of man.

stanzas.sanskrit: स नो॑ म॒न्द्राभि॑रध्व॒रे जि॒ह्वाभि॑र्यजा म॒हः आ दे॒वान्व॑क्षि॒ यक्षि॑ च
stanzas.transliteration: sá no mandrā́bhir adhvaré jihvā́bhir yajā maháḥ ā́ devā́n vakṣi yákṣi ca
stanzas.translation: So with thy joyous tongues for us sacrifice nobly in this rite. Bring thou the Gods and worship them.

translations.griffith: So with thy joyous tongues for us sacrifice nobly in this rite. Bring thou the Gods and worship them.

stanzas.sanskrit: वेत्था॒ हि वे॑धो॒ अध्व॑नः प॒थश्च॑ दे॒वाञ्ज॑सा अग्ने॑ य॒ज्ञेषु॑ सुक्रतो
stanzas.transliteration: vétthā hí vedho ádhvanaḥ patháś ca devā́ñjasā ágne yajñéṣu sukrato
stanzas.translation: For well, O God, Disposer, thou knowest, straight on, the paths and ways, Agni, most wise in sacrifice.

translations.griffith: For well, O God, Disposer, thou knowest, straight on, the paths and ways, Agni, most wise in sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वामी॑ळे॒ अध॑ द्वि॒ता भ॑र॒तो वा॒जिभिः॑ शु॒नम् ई॒जे य॒ज्ञेषु॑ य॒ज्ञिय॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́m īḷe ádha dvitā́ bharató vājíbhiḥ śunám ījé yajñéṣu yajñíyam
stanzas.translation: Thee, too, hath Bharata of old, with mighty men, implored for bliss. And worshipped thee the worshipful.

translations.griffith: Thee, too, hath Bharata of old, with mighty men, implored for bliss. And worshipped thee the worshipful.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वमि॒मा वार्या॑ पु॒रु दिवो॑दासाय सुन्व॒ते भ॒रद्वा॑जाय दा॒शुषे॑
stanzas.transliteration: tvám imā́ vā́ryā purú dívodāsāya sunvaté bharádvājāya dāśúṣe
stanzas.translation: Thou givest these abundant boons to Divodâsa pouring forth, To Bharadvâja offering gifts.

translations.griffith: Thou givest these abundant boons to Divodâsa pouring forth, To Bharadvâja offering gifts.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं दू॒तो अम॑र्त्य॒ आ व॑हा॒ दैव्यं॒ जन॑म् शृ॒ण्वन्विप्र॑स्य सुष्टु॒तिम्
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ dūtó ámartyaḥ- ā́ vahā daívyaṃ jánam śr̥ṇván víprasya suṣṭutím
stanzas.translation: Do thou, Immortal Messenger, bring hither the Celestial Folk; Hearing the singer's eulogy.

translations.griffith: Do thou, Immortal Messenger, bring hither the Celestial Folk; Hearing the singer's eulogy.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वाम॑ग्ने स्वा॒ध्यो॒३॒॑ मर्ता॑सो दे॒ववी॑तये य॒ज्ञेषु॑ दे॒वमी॑ळते
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́m agne svādhyò mártāso devávītaye yajñéṣu devám īḷate
stanzas.translation: Mortals with pious thought implore thee, Agni, God, at holy rites, To come unto the feast of Gods.

translations.griffith: Mortals with pious thought implore thee, Agni, God, at holy rites, To come unto the feast of Gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: तव॒ प्र य॑क्षि सं॒दृश॑मु॒त क्रतुं॑ सु॒दान॑वः विश्वे॑ जुषन्त का॒मिनः॑
stanzas.transliteration: táva prá yakṣi saṃdŕ̥śam utá krátuṃ sudā́navaḥ víśve juṣanta kāmínaḥ
stanzas.translation: I glorify thine aspect and the might of thee the Bountilul. All those who love shall joy in thee,

translations.griffith: I glorify thine aspect and the might of thee the Bountilul. All those who love shall joy in thee,

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं होता॒ मनु॑र्हितो॒ वह्नि॑रा॒सा वि॒दुष्ट॑रः अग्ने॒ यक्षि॑ दि॒वो विशः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ hótā mánurhitaḥ- váhnir āsā́ vidúṣṭaraḥ ágne yákṣi divó víśaḥ
stanzas.translation: Invoker placed by Manus, thou, Agni, art near, the wisest Priest: Pay worship to the Tribes of Heaven.

translations.griffith: Invoker placed by Manus, thou, Agni, art near, the wisest Priest: Pay worship to the Tribes of Heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्न॒ आ या॑हि वी॒तये॑ गृणा॒नो ह॒व्यदा॑तये नि होता॑ सत्सि ब॒र्हिषि॑
stanzas.transliteration: ágna ā́ yāhi vītáye gr̥ṇānó havyádātaye ní hótā satsi barhíṣi
stanzas.translation: Come, Agni, lauded, to the feast; come to the offering of the gifts. As Priest be seated on the grass.

translations.griffith: Come, Agni, lauded, to the feast; come to the offering of the gifts. As Priest be seated on the grass.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं त्वा॑ स॒मिद्भि॑रङ्गिरो घृ॒तेन॑ वर्धयामसि बृ॒हच्छो॑चा यविष्ठ्य
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ tvā samídbhir aṅgiro ghr̥téna vardhayāmasi br̥hác chocā yaviṣṭhya
stanzas.translation: So, Angiras, we make thee strong with fuel and with holy oil. Blaze high, thou youngest of the Gods.

translations.griffith: So, Angiras, we make thee strong with fuel and with holy oil. Blaze high, thou youngest of the Gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: स नः॑ पृ॒थु श्र॒वाय्य॒मच्छा॑ देव विवाससि बृ॒हद॑ग्ने सु॒वीर्य॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: sá naḥ pr̥thú śravā́yyam áchā deva vivāsasi br̥hád agne suvī́ryam
stanzas.translation: For us thou winnest, Agni, God, heroic strength exceeding great, Far-spreading and of high renown.

translations.griffith: For us thou winnest, Agni, God, heroic strength exceeding great, Far-spreading and of high renown.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वाम॑ग्ने॒ पुष्क॑रा॒दध्यथ॑र्वा॒ निर॑मन्थत मू॒र्ध्नो विश्व॑स्य वा॒घतः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́m agne púṣkarād ádhi- átharvā nír amanthata mūrdhnó víśvasya vāghátaḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni, Atharvan brought thee forth, by rubbing, from the lotus-flower, The head of Viṣva, of the Priest.

translations.griffith: Agni, Atharvan brought thee forth, by rubbing, from the lotus-flower, The head of Viṣva, of the Priest.

stanzas.sanskrit: तमु॑ त्वा द॒ध्यङ्ङृषिः॑ पु॒त्र ई॑धे॒ अथ॑र्वणः वृ॒त्र॒हणं॑ पुरंद॒रम्
stanzas.transliteration: tám u tvā dadhyáṅṅ ŕ̥ṣiḥ putrá īdhe átharvaṇaḥ vr̥traháṇam puraṃdarám
stanzas.translation: Thee. Vr̥itra's slayer, breaker down of castles, hath Atharvan's son, Dadhyac the R̥ishi, lighted up.

translations.griffith: Thee. Vr̥itra's slayer, breaker down of castles, hath Atharvan's son, Dadhyac the R̥ishi, lighted up.

stanzas.sanskrit: तमु॑ त्वा पा॒थ्यो वृषा॒ समी॑धे दस्यु॒हन्त॑मम् ध॒नं॒ज॒यं रणे॑रणे
stanzas.transliteration: tám u tvā pāthyó vŕ̥ṣā sám īdhe dasyuhántamam dhanaṃjayáṃ ráṇe-raṇe
stanzas.translation: The hero Pâthya kindled thee the Dasyus'. most destructive foe, Winner of spoil in every fight.

translations.griffith: The hero Pâthya kindled thee the Dasyus'. most destructive foe, Winner of spoil in every fight.

stanzas.sanskrit: एह्यू॒ षु ब्रवा॑णि॒ तेऽग्न॑ इ॒त्थेत॑रा॒ गिरः॑ ए॒भिर्व॑र्धास॒ इन्दु॑भिः
stanzas.transliteration: éhy ū ṣú brávāṇi te- -ágna itthétarā gíraḥ ebhír vardhāsa índubhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Come, here, O Agni, will I sing verily other songs to thee, And with these drops shalt thou grow strong.

translations.griffith: Come, here, O Agni, will I sing verily other songs to thee, And with these drops shalt thou grow strong.

stanzas.sanskrit: यत्र॒ क्व॑ च ते॒ मनो॒ दक्षं॑ दधस॒ उत्त॑रम् तत्रा॒ सदः॑ कृणवसे
stanzas.transliteration: yátra kvà ca te máno dákṣaṃ dadhasa úttaram tátrā sádaḥ kr̥ṇavase
stanzas.translation: Where'er thy mind applies itself, vigour preeminent bast thou: There wilt thou gain a dwelling-place.

translations.griffith: Where'er thy mind applies itself, vigour preeminent bast thou: There wilt thou gain a dwelling-place.

stanzas.sanskrit: न॒हि ते॑ पू॒र्तम॑क्षि॒पद्भुव॑न्नेमानां वसो अथा॒ दुवो॑ वनवसे
stanzas.transliteration: nahí te pūrtám akṣipád bhúvan nemānāṃ vaso áthā dúvo vanavase
stanzas.translation: Not for a moment only lasts thy bounty, good to many a one! Our service therefore shalt thou gain.

translations.griffith: Not for a moment only lasts thy bounty, good to many a one! Our service therefore shalt thou gain.

stanzas.sanskrit: आग्निर॑गामि॒ भार॑तो वृत्र॒हा पु॑रु॒चेत॑नः दिवो॑दासस्य॒ सत्प॑तिः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́gnír agāmi bhā́rato vr̥trahā́ purucétanaḥ dívodāsasya sátpatiḥ
stanzas.translation: Agni, the Bharata, hath been sought, the Vr̥itra-slayer, marked of all, Yea, Divodâsa's Hero Lord.

translations.griffith: Agni, the Bharata, hath been sought, the Vr̥itra-slayer, marked of all, Yea, Divodâsa's Hero Lord.

stanzas.sanskrit: स हि विश्वाति॒ पार्थि॑वा र॒यिं दाश॑न्महित्व॒ना व॒न्वन्नवा॑तो॒ अस्तृ॑तः
stanzas.transliteration: sá hí víśvā́ti pā́rthivā rayíṃ dā́śan mahitvanā́ vanvánn ávāto ástr̥taḥ
stanzas.translation: For he gave riches that surpass in greatness all the things of earth, Fighting untroubled, unsubdued.

translations.griffith: For he gave riches that surpass in greatness all the things of earth, Fighting untroubled, unsubdued.

stanzas.sanskrit: स प्र॑त्न॒वन्नवी॑य॒साग्ने॑ द्यु॒म्नेन॑ सं॒यता॑ बृ॒हत्त॑तन्थ भा॒नुना॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá pratnaván návīyasā- -ágne dyumnéna saṃyátā br̥hát tatantha bhānúnā
stanzas.translation: Thou, Agni, as in days of old, with recent glory, gathered light, Hast overspread the lofty heaven.

translations.griffith: Thou, Agni, as in days of old, with recent glory, gathered light, Hast overspread the lofty heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र वः॑ सखायो अ॒ग्नये॒ स्तोमं॑ य॒ज्ञं च॑ धृष्णु॒या अर्च॒ गाय॑ च वे॒धसे॑
stanzas.transliteration: prá vaḥ sakhāyo agnáye stómaṃ yajñáṃ ca dhr̥ṣṇuyā́ árca gā́ya ca vedháse
stanzas.translation: Bring to your Agni, O my friends, boldly your laud and sacrifice: Give the Disposer praise and song.

translations.griffith: Bring to your Agni, O my friends, boldly your laud and sacrifice: Give the Disposer praise and song.

stanzas.sanskrit: स हि यो मानु॑षा यु॒गा सीद॒द्धोता॑ क॒विक्र॑तुः दू॒तश्च॑ हव्य॒वाह॑नः
stanzas.transliteration: sá hí yó mā́nuṣā yugā́ sī́dad dhótā kavíkratuḥ dūtáś ca havyavā́hanaḥ
stanzas.translation: For as sagacious Herald he hath sat through every age of man, Oblation-bearing messenger.

translations.griffith: For as sagacious Herald he hath sat through every age of man, Oblation-bearing messenger.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता राजा॑ना॒ शुचि॑व्रतादि॒त्यान्मारु॑तं ग॒णम् वसो॒ यक्षी॒ह रोद॑सी
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ rā́jānā śúcivratā- ādityā́n mā́rutaṃ gaṇám váso yákṣīhá ródasī
stanzas.translation: Bring those Two Kings whose ways are pure, Âdityas, and the Marut host, Excellent God! and Heaven and Earth.

translations.griffith: Bring those Two Kings whose ways are pure, Âdityas, and the Marut host, Excellent God! and Heaven and Earth.

stanzas.sanskrit: वस्वी॑ ते अग्ने॒ संदृ॑ष्टिरिषय॒ते मर्त्या॑य ऊर्जो॑ नपाद॒मृत॑स्य
stanzas.transliteration: vásvī te agne sáṃdr̥ṣṭir iṣayaté mártyāya ū́rjo napād amŕ̥tasya
stanzas.translation: For strong and active mortal man, excellent, Agni, is the look Of thee Immortal, Son of Strength

translations.griffith: For strong and active mortal man, excellent, Agni, is the look Of thee Immortal, Son of Strength

stanzas.sanskrit: क्रत्वा॒ दा अ॑स्तु॒ श्रेष्ठो॒ऽद्य त्वा॑ व॒न्वन्त्सु॒रेक्णाः॑ मर्त॑ आनाश सुवृ॒क्तिम्
stanzas.transliteration: krátvā dā́ astu śréṣṭho -adyá tvā vanván surékṇāḥ márta ānāśa suvr̥ktím
stanzas.translation: Rich through his wisdom, noblest be the giver serving thee to-day: The man hath brought his hymn of praise.

translations.griffith: Rich through his wisdom, noblest be the giver serving thee to-day: The man hath brought his hymn of praise.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते ते॑ अग्ने॒ त्वोता॑ इ॒षय॑न्तो॒ विश्व॒मायुः॑ तर॑न्तो अ॒र्यो अरा॑तीर्व॒न्वन्तो॑ अ॒र्यो अरा॑तीः
stanzas.transliteration: té te agne tvótāḥ- iṣáyanto víśvam ā́yuḥ táranto aryó árātīr vanvánto aryó árātīḥ
stanzas.translation: These, Agni, these are helped by thee, who strong and active all their lives, O'ercome the malice of the foe, fight down the malice ofthe foe.

translations.griffith: These, Agni, these are helped by thee, who strong and active all their lives, O'ercome the malice of the foe, fight down the malice ofthe foe.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निस्ति॒ग्मेन॑ शो॒चिषा॒ यास॒द्विश्वं॒ न्य१॒॑त्रिण॑म् अ॒ग्निर्नो॑ वनते र॒यिम्
stanzas.transliteration: agnís tigména śocíṣā yā́sad víśvaṃ ny àtríṇam agnír no vanate rayím
stanzas.translation: May Agni with his pointed blaze cast down each fierce devouring fiend May Agni win us wealth by war.

translations.griffith: May Agni with his pointed blaze cast down each fierce devouring fiend May Agni win us wealth by war.

stanzas.sanskrit: सु॒वीरं॑ र॒यिमा भ॑र॒ जात॑वेदो॒ विच॑र्षणे ज॒हि रक्षां॑सि सुक्रतो
stanzas.transliteration: suvī́raṃ rayím ā́ bhara jā́tavedo vícarṣaṇe jahí rákṣāṃsi sukrato
stanzas.translation: O active Jâtavedas, bring riches with store of hero sons: Slay thou the demons, O Most Wise.

translations.griffith: O active Jâtavedas, bring riches with store of hero sons: Slay thou the demons, O Most Wise.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं नः॑ पा॒ह्यंह॑सो॒ जात॑वेदो अघाय॒तः रक्षा॑ णो ब्रह्मणस्कवे
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ naḥ pāhy áṃhaso jā́tavedo aghāyatáḥ rákṣā ṇo brahmaṇas kave
stanzas.translation: Keep us, O Jâtavedas, from the troubling of the man of sin: Guard us thou Sage who knowest prayer.

translations.griffith: Keep us, O Jâtavedas, from the troubling of the man of sin: Guard us thou Sage who knowest prayer.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो नो॑ अग्ने दु॒रेव॒ आ मर्तो॑ व॒धाय॒ दाश॑ति तस्मा॑न्नः पा॒ह्यंह॑सः
stanzas.transliteration: yó no agne duréva~ā́ márto vadhā́ya dā́śati tásmān naḥ pāhy áṃhasaḥ
stanzas.translation: Whatever sinner, Agni, brings oblations to procure our death, Save us from woe that he would work.

translations.griffith: Whatever sinner, Agni, brings oblations to procure our death, Save us from woe that he would work.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं तं दे॑व जि॒ह्वया॒ परि॑ बाधस्व दु॒ष्कृत॑म् मर्तो॒ यो नो॒ जिघां॑सति
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ táṃ deva jihváyā pári bādhasva duṣkŕ̥tam márto yó no jíghāṃsati
stanzas.translation: Drive from us with thy tongue, O God, the man who doeth evil deeds, The mortal who would strike us dead.

translations.griffith: Drive from us with thy tongue, O God, the man who doeth evil deeds, The mortal who would strike us dead.

stanzas.sanskrit: भ॒रद्वा॑जाय स॒प्रथः॒ शर्म॑ यच्छ सहन्त्य अग्ने॒ वरे॑ण्यं॒ वसु॑
stanzas.transliteration: bharádvājāya sapráthaḥ śárma yacha sahantya ágne váreṇyaṃ vásu
stanzas.translation: Give shelter reaching far and wide to Bharadvâja, conquering Lord! Agni, send wealth most excellent.

translations.griffith: Give shelter reaching far and wide to Bharadvâja, conquering Lord! Agni, send wealth most excellent.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निर्वृ॒त्राणि॑ जङ्घनद्द्रविण॒स्युर्वि॑प॒न्यया॑ समि॑द्धः शु॒क्र आहु॑तः
stanzas.transliteration: agnír vr̥trā́ṇi jaṅghanad draviṇasyúr vipanyáyā sámiddhaḥ śukrá ā́hutaḥ
stanzas.translation: May Agni slay the Vr̥itras,– fain for riches, through the lord of song, Served with oblation, kindled, bright.

translations.griffith: May Agni slay the Vr̥itras,– fain for riches, through the lord of song, Served with oblation, kindled, bright.

stanzas.sanskrit: गर्भे॑ मा॒तुः पि॒तुष्पि॒ता वि॑दिद्युता॒नो अ॒क्षरे॑ सीद॑न्नृ॒तस्य॒ योनि॒मा
stanzas.transliteration: gárbhe mātúḥ pitúṣ pitā́ vididyutānó akṣáre sī́dann r̥tásya yónim ā́
stanzas.translation: His Father's Father, shining in his Mother's everlasting side, Set on the seat of holy Law.

translations.griffith: His Father's Father, shining in his Mother's everlasting side, Set on the seat of holy Law.

stanzas.sanskrit: ब्रह्म॑ प्र॒जाव॒दा भ॑र॒ जात॑वेदो॒ विच॑र्षणे अग्ने॒ यद्दी॒दय॑द्दि॒वि
stanzas.transliteration: bráhma prajā́vad ā́ bhara jā́tavedo vícarṣaṇe ágne yád dīdáyad diví
stanzas.translation: O active Jâtavedas, bring devotion that wins progeny, Agni, that it may shine to heaven.

translations.griffith: O active Jâtavedas, bring devotion that wins progeny, Agni, that it may shine to heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: उप॑ त्वा र॒ण्वसं॑दृशं॒ प्रय॑स्वन्तः सहस्कृत अग्ने॑ ससृ॒ज्महे॒ गिरः॑
stanzas.transliteration: úpa tvā raṇvásaṃdr̥śam práyasvantaḥ sahaskr̥ta ágne sasr̥jmáhe gíraḥ
stanzas.translation: O Child of Strength, to thee whose look is lovely we with dainty food, O Agni, have poured forth our songs.

translations.griffith: O Child of Strength, to thee whose look is lovely we with dainty food, O Agni, have poured forth our songs.

stanzas.sanskrit: उप॑ च्छा॒यामि॑व॒ घृणे॒रग॑न्म॒ शर्म॑ ते व॒यम् अग्ने॒ हिर॑ण्यसंदृशः
stanzas.transliteration: úpa chāyā́m iva ghŕ̥ṇer áganma śárma te vayám ágne híraṇyasaṃdr̥śaḥ
stanzas.translation: To thee for shelter are we come, as to the shade from fervent heat Agni, who glitterest like gold.

translations.griffith: To thee for shelter are we come, as to the shade from fervent heat Agni, who glitterest like gold.

stanzas.sanskrit: य उ॒ग्र इ॑व शर्य॒हा ति॒ग्मशृ॑ङ्गो॒ न वंस॑गः अग्ने॒ पुरो॑ रु॒रोजि॑थ
stanzas.transliteration: yá ugrá iva śaryahā́ tigmáśr̥ṅgo ná váṃsagaḥ ágne púro rurójitha
stanzas.translation: Mighty as one who slays with shafts, or like a bull with sharpened horn, Agni, thou breakest down the forts.

translations.griffith: Mighty as one who slays with shafts, or like a bull with sharpened horn, Agni, thou breakest down the forts.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ यं हस्ते॒ न खा॒दिनं॒ शिशुं॑ जा॒तं न बिभ्र॑ति वि॒शाम॒ग्निं स्व॑ध्व॒रम्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yáṃ háste ná khādínaṃ śíśuṃ jātáṃ ná bíbhrati viśā́m agníṃ svadhvarám
stanzas.translation: Whom, like an infant newly born, devourer, in their arms they bear, Men's Agni, skilled in holy rites.

translations.griffith: Whom, like an infant newly born, devourer, in their arms they bear, Men's Agni, skilled in holy rites.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र दे॒वं दे॒ववी॑तये॒ भर॑ता वसु॒वित्त॑मम् आ स्वे योनौ॒ नि षी॑दतु
stanzas.transliteration: prá deváṃ devávītaye bháratā vasuvíttamam ā́ své yónau ní ṣīdatu
stanzas.translation: Bear to the banquet of the Gods the God best finder-out of wealth, Let him he seated in his place.

translations.griffith: Bear to the banquet of the Gods the God best finder-out of wealth, Let him he seated in his place.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ जा॒तं जा॒तवे॑दसि प्रि॒यं शि॑शी॒ताति॑थिम् स्यो॒न आ गृ॒हप॑तिम्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ jātáṃ jātávedasi priyáṃ śiśītā́tithim syoná ā́ gr̥hápatim
stanzas.translation: In Jâtavedas kindle ye the dear guest who hath now appeared In a soft place, the homestead's Lord.

translations.griffith: In Jâtavedas kindle ye the dear guest who hath now appeared In a soft place, the homestead's Lord.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्ने॑ यु॒क्ष्वा हि ये तवाश्वा॑सो देव सा॒धवः॑ अरं॒ वह॑न्ति म॒न्यवे॑
stanzas.transliteration: ágne yukṣvā́ hí yé táva- -áśvāso deva sādhávaḥ áraṃ váhanti manyáve
stanzas.translation: Harness, O Agni, O thou God, thy steeds which are most excellent: They bear thee as thy spirit wills.

translations.griffith: Harness, O Agni, O thou God, thy steeds which are most excellent: They bear thee as thy spirit wills.

stanzas.sanskrit: अच्छा॑ नो या॒ह्या व॑हा॒भि प्रयां॑सि वी॒तये॑ आ दे॒वान्त्सोम॑पीतये
stanzas.transliteration: áchā no yāhy ā́ vaha- -abhí práyāṃsi vītáye ā́ devā́n sómapītaye
stanzas.translation: Come hither, bring the Gods to us to taste the sacrificial feast, To drink the draught of Soma juice.

translations.griffith: Come hither, bring the Gods to us to taste the sacrificial feast, To drink the draught of Soma juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: उद॑ग्ने भारत द्यु॒मदज॑स्रेण॒ दवि॑द्युतत् शोचा॒ वि भा॑ह्यजर
stanzas.transliteration: úd agne bhārata dyumád ájasreṇa dávidyutat śócā ví bhāhy ajara
stanzas.translation: O Agni of the Bharatas, blaze high with everlasting might, Shine forth and gleam, Eternal One.

translations.griffith: O Agni of the Bharatas, blaze high with everlasting might, Shine forth and gleam, Eternal One.

stanzas.sanskrit: वी॒ती यो दे॒वं मर्तो॑ दुव॒स्येद॒ग्निमी॑ळीताध्व॒रे ह॒विष्मा॑न् होता॑रं सत्य॒यजं॒ रोद॑स्योरुत्ता॒नह॑स्तो॒ नम॒सा वि॑वासेत्
stanzas.transliteration: vītī́ yó devám márto duvasyéd agním īḷītādhvaré havíṣmān hótāraṃ satyayájaṃ ródasyoḥ uttānáhasto námasā́ vivāset
stanzas.translation: The mortal man who serves the God with banquet, and, bringing gifts at sacrifice, lauds Agni, May well attract, with prayer and hands uplifted, the Priest of Heaven and Earth, true Sacrificer.

translations.griffith: The mortal man who serves the God with banquet, and, bringing gifts at sacrifice, lauds Agni, May well attract, with prayer and hands uplifted, the Priest of Heaven and Earth, true Sacrificer.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ ते॑ अग्न ऋ॒चा ह॒विर्हृ॒दा त॒ष्टं भ॑रामसि ते ते॑ भवन्तू॒क्षण॑ ऋष॒भासो॑ व॒शा उ॒त
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ te agna r̥cā́ havíḥ hr̥dā́ taṣṭám bharāmasi té te bhavantūkṣáṇaḥ- r̥ṣabhā́so vaśā́ utá
stanzas.translation: Agni, we bring thee, with our hymn, oblation fashioned in the heart. Let these be oxen unto thee, let these be bulls and kine to thee.

translations.griffith: Agni, we bring thee, with our hymn, oblation fashioned in the heart. Let these be oxen unto thee, let these be bulls and kine to thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निं दे॒वासो॑ अग्रि॒यमि॒न्धते॑ वृत्र॒हन्त॑मम् येना॒ वसू॒न्याभृ॑ता तृ॒ळ्हा रक्षां॑सि वा॒जिना॑
stanzas.transliteration: agníṃ devā́so agriyám indháte vr̥trahántamam yénā vásūny ā́bhr̥tā tr̥ḷhā́ rákṣāṃsi vājínā
stanzas.translation: The Gods enkindle Agni, best slayer of Vr̥itra, first in rank, The Mighty, One who brings us wealth and crushes down the Raksasas.

translations.griffith: The Gods enkindle Agni, best slayer of Vr̥itra, first in rank, The Mighty, One who brings us wealth and crushes down the Raksasas.

stanzas.sanskrit: पिबा॒ सोम॑म॒भि यमु॑ग्र॒ तर्द॑ ऊ॒र्वं गव्यं॒ महि॑ गृणा॒न इ॑न्द्र वि यो धृ॑ष्णो॒ वधि॑षो वज्रहस्त॒ विश्वा॑ वृ॒त्रम॑मि॒त्रिया॒ शवो॑भिः
stanzas.transliteration: píbā sómam abhí yám ugra tárdaḥ- ūrváṃ gávyam máhi gr̥ṇāná indra ví yó dhr̥ṣṇo vádhiṣo vajrahasta víśvā vr̥trám amitríyā śávobhiḥ
stanzas.translation: DRINK Soma, Mighty One, for which, when lauded, thou breakest through the cattle-stall, O Indra; Thou who, O Bold One, armed with thunder smotest Vr̥itra with might, and every hostile being.

translations.griffith: DRINK Soma, Mighty One, for which, when lauded, thou breakest through the cattle-stall, O Indra; Thou who, O Bold One, armed with thunder smotest Vr̥itra with might, and every hostile being.

stanzas.sanskrit: स ईं॑ पाहि॒ य ऋ॑जी॒षी तरु॑त्रो॒ यः शिप्र॑वान्वृष॒भो यो म॑ती॒नाम् यो गो॑त्र॒भिद्व॑ज्र॒भृद्यो ह॑रि॒ष्ठाः स इ॑न्द्र चि॒त्राँ अ॒भि तृ॑न्धि॒ वाजा॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: sá īm pāhi yá r̥jīṣī́ tárutro yáḥ śípravān vr̥ṣabhó yó matīnā́m yó gotrabhíd vajrabhŕ̥d yó hariṣṭhā́ḥ sá indra citrā́m̐ abhí tr̥ndhi vā́jān
stanzas.translation: Drink it thou God who art impetuous victor, Lord of our hymns, with beauteousjaws, the Hero, Render of kine-stalls, car-borne, thunder-wielding, so pierce thy way to wondrous strength, O Indra.

translations.griffith: Drink it thou God who art impetuous victor, Lord of our hymns, with beauteousjaws, the Hero, Render of kine-stalls, car-borne, thunder-wielding, so pierce thy way to wondrous strength, O Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वा पा॑हि प्र॒त्नथा॒ मन्द॑तु त्वा श्रु॒धि ब्रह्म॑ वावृ॒धस्वो॒त गी॒र्भिः आ॒विः सूर्यं॑ कृणु॒हि पी॑पि॒हीषो॑ ज॒हि शत्रूँ॑र॒भि गा इ॑न्द्र तृन्धि
stanzas.transliteration: evā́ pāhi pratnáthā mándatu tvā śrudhí bráhma vāvr̥dhásvotá gīrbhíḥ āvíḥ sū́ryaṃ kr̥ṇuhí pīpihī́ṣo jahí śátrūm̐r abhí gā́ indra tr̥ndhi
stanzas.translation: Drink as of old, and let the draught delight thee. hear thou our prayer and let our songs exalt thee. Make the Sun visible, make food abundant, slaughter the foes, pierce through and free the cattle.

translations.griffith: Drink as of old, and let the draught delight thee. hear thou our prayer and let our songs exalt thee. Make the Sun visible, make food abundant, slaughter the foes, pierce through and free the cattle.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते त्वा॒ मदा॑ बृ॒हदि॑न्द्र स्वधाव इ॒मे पी॒ता उ॑क्षयन्त द्यु॒मन्त॑म् म॒हामनू॑नं त॒वसं॒ विभू॑तिं मत्स॒रासो॑ जर्हृषन्त प्र॒साह॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: té tvā mádā br̥hád indra svadhāvaḥ- imé pītā́ ukṣayanta dyumántam mahā́m ánūnaṃ tavásaṃ víbhūtim matsarā́so jarhr̥ṣanta prasā́ham
stanzas.translation: These gladdening drops, O Indra, Self-sustainer, quaffed shall augment thee in thy mighty splendour. Yea, let the cheering drops delight thee greatly, great, perfect, strong, powerful, all-subduing.

translations.griffith: These gladdening drops, O Indra, Self-sustainer, quaffed shall augment thee in thy mighty splendour. Yea, let the cheering drops delight thee greatly, great, perfect, strong, powerful, all-subduing.

stanzas.sanskrit: येभिः॒ सूर्य॑मु॒षसं॑ मन्दसा॒नोऽवा॑स॒योऽप॑ दृ॒ळ्हानि॒ दर्द्र॑त् म॒हामद्रिं॒ परि॒ गा इ॑न्द्र॒ सन्तं॑ नु॒त्था अच्यु॑तं॒ सद॑स॒स्परि॒ स्वात्
stanzas.transliteration: yébhiḥ sū́ryam uṣásam mandasānó -ávāsayó 'pa dr̥ḷhā́ni dárdrat mahā́m ádrim pári gā́ indra sántaṃ nutthā́ ácyutaṃ sádasas pári svā́t
stanzas.translation: Gladdened whereby, bursting the firm enclosures, thou gavest splendour to the Sun and Morning. The mighty rock that compassed in the cattle, ne'er moved, thou shookest from its seat, O Indra.

translations.griffith: Gladdened whereby, bursting the firm enclosures, thou gavest splendour to the Sun and Morning. The mighty rock that compassed in the cattle, ne'er moved, thou shookest from its seat, O Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: तव॒ क्रत्वा॒ तव॒ तद्दं॒सना॑भिरा॒मासु॑ प॒क्वं शच्या॒ नि दी॑धः और्णो॒र्दुर॑ उ॒स्रिया॑भ्यो॒ वि दृ॒ळ्होदू॒र्वाद्गा अ॑सृजो॒ अङ्गि॑रस्वान्
stanzas.transliteration: táva krátvā táva tád daṃsánābhir āmā́su pakváṃ śácyā ní dīdhaḥ aúrṇor dúra usríyābhyo ví dr̥ḷhā́- -úd ūrvā́d gā́ asr̥jo áṅgirasvān
stanzas.translation: Thou with thy wisdom, power, and works of wonder, hast stored the ripe milk in the raw cows' udders Unbarred the firm doors for the kine of Morning, and, with the Angirases, set free the cattle.

translations.griffith: Thou with thy wisdom, power, and works of wonder, hast stored the ripe milk in the raw cows' udders Unbarred the firm doors for the kine of Morning, and, with the Angirases, set free the cattle.

stanzas.sanskrit: प॒प्राथ॒ क्षां महि॒ दंसो॒ व्यु१॒॑र्वीमुप॒ द्यामृ॒ष्वो बृ॒हदि॑न्द्र स्तभायः अधा॑रयो॒ रोद॑सी दे॒वपु॑त्रे प्र॒त्ने मा॒तरा॑ य॒ह्वी ऋ॒तस्य॑
stanzas.transliteration: paprā́tha kṣā́m máhi dáṃso vy ùrvī́m úpa dyā́m r̥ṣvó br̥hád indra stabhāyaḥ ádhārayo ródasī deváputre pratné mātárā yahvī́ r̥tásya
stanzas.translation: Thou hast spread out wide earth, a mighty marvel, and, high thyself, propped lofty heaven, O Indra. Both worlds, whose Sons are Gods, thou hast supported, young, Mothers from old time ofholy Order.

translations.griffith: Thou hast spread out wide earth, a mighty marvel, and, high thyself, propped lofty heaven, O Indra. Both worlds, whose Sons are Gods, thou hast supported, young, Mothers from old time ofholy Order.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध॑ त्वा॒ विश्वे॑ पु॒र इ॑न्द्र दे॒वा एकं॑ त॒वसं॑ दधिरे॒ भरा॑य अदे॑वो॒ यद॒भ्यौहि॑ष्ट दे॒वान्त्स्व॑र्षाता वृणत॒ इन्द्र॒मत्र॑
stanzas.transliteration: ádha tvā víśve purá indra devā́ḥ- ékaṃ tavásaṃ dadhire bhárāya ádevo yád abhy aúhiṣṭa devā́n svàrṣātā vr̥ṇata índram átra
stanzas.translation: Yea, Indra, all the Deities installed thee their one strong Champion in the van for battle. What time the godless was the Gods' assailant, Indra they chose to win the light of heaven.

translations.griffith: Yea, Indra, all the Deities installed thee their one strong Champion in the van for battle. What time the godless was the Gods' assailant, Indra they chose to win the light of heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध॒ द्यौश्चि॑त्ते॒ अप॒ सा नु वज्रा॑द्द्वि॒तान॑मद्भि॒यसा॒ स्वस्य॑ म॒न्योः अहिं॒ यदिन्द्रो॑ अ॒भ्योह॑सानं॒ नि चि॑द्वि॒श्वायुः॑ श॒यथे॑ ज॒घान॑
stanzas.transliteration: ádha dyaúś cit te ápa sā́ nú vájrād dvitā́namad bhiyásā svásya manyóḥ áhiṃ yád índro abhyóhasānaṃ ní cid viśvā́yuḥ śayáthe jaghā́na
stanzas.translation: Yea, e'en that heaven itself of old bent backward before thy bolt, in terror of its anger, When Indra, life of every living creature, smote down within his lair the assailing Dragon.

translations.griffith: Yea, e'en that heaven itself of old bent backward before thy bolt, in terror of its anger, When Indra, life of every living creature, smote down within his lair the assailing Dragon.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध॒ त्वष्टा॑ ते म॒ह उ॑ग्र॒ वज्रं॑ स॒हस्र॑भृष्टिं ववृतच्छ॒ताश्रि॑म् निका॑मम॒रम॑णसं॒ येन॒ नव॑न्त॒महिं॒ सं पि॑णगृजीषिन्
stanzas.transliteration: ádha tváṣṭā te mahá ugra vájraṃ sahásrabhr̥ṣṭiṃ vavr̥tac chatā́śrim níkāmam arámaṇasaṃ yéna návantam áhiṃ sám piṇag r̥jīṣin
stanzas.translation: Yea, Strong One! Tvashṭar turned for thee, the Mighty, the bolt with thousand spikes and hundred edges, Eager and prompt at will, wherewith thou crushedst the boasting Dragon, O impetuous Hero.

translations.griffith: Yea, Strong One! Tvashṭar turned for thee, the Mighty, the bolt with thousand spikes and hundred edges, Eager and prompt at will, wherewith thou crushedst the boasting Dragon, O impetuous Hero.

stanzas.sanskrit: वर्धा॒न्यं विश्वे॑ म॒रुतः॑ स॒जोषाः॒ पच॑च्छ॒तं म॑हि॒षाँ इ॑न्द्र॒ तुभ्य॑म् पू॒षा विष्णु॒स्त्रीणि॒ सरां॑सि धावन्वृत्र॒हणं॑ मदि॒रमं॒शुम॑स्मै
stanzas.transliteration: várdhān yáṃ víśve marútaḥ sajóṣāḥ pácac chatám mahiṣā́m̐ indra túbhyam pūṣā́ víṣṇus trī́ṇi sárāṃsi dhāvan vr̥traháṇam madirám aṃśúm asmai
stanzas.translation: He dressed a hundred buffaloes, O Indra, for thee whom all accordant Maruts strengthen. He, Pûshan Vishṇu, poured forth three great vessels to him, the juice that cheers, that slaughters Vr̥itra.

translations.griffith: He dressed a hundred buffaloes, O Indra, for thee whom all accordant Maruts strengthen. He, Pûshan Vishṇu, poured forth three great vessels to him, the juice that cheers, that slaughters Vr̥itra.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ क्षोदो॒ महि॑ वृ॒तं न॒दीनां॒ परि॑ष्ठितमसृज ऊ॒र्मिम॒पाम् तासा॒मनु॑ प्र॒वत॑ इन्द्र॒ पन्थां॒ प्रार्द॑यो॒ नीची॑र॒पसः॑ समु॒द्रम्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ kṣódo máhi vr̥táṃ nadī́nām páriṣṭhitam asr̥ja ūrmím apā́m tā́sām ánu praváta indra pánthām prā́rdayo nī́cīr apásaḥ samudrám
stanzas.translation: Thou settest free the rushing wave of waters, the floods' great swell encompassed and obstructed. Along steep slopes their course thou tumedst, Indra, directed downward, speeding to the ocean.

translations.griffith: Thou settest free the rushing wave of waters, the floods' great swell encompassed and obstructed. Along steep slopes their course thou tumedst, Indra, directed downward, speeding to the ocean.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वा ता विश्वा॑ चकृ॒वांस॒मिन्द्रं॑ म॒हामु॒ग्रम॑जु॒र्यं स॑हो॒दाम् सु॒वीरं॑ त्वा स्वायु॒धं सु॒वज्र॒मा ब्रह्म॒ नव्य॒मव॑से ववृत्यात्
stanzas.transliteration: evā́ tā́ víśvā cakr̥vā́ṃsam índram mahā́m ugrám ajuryáṃ sahodā́m suvī́raṃ tvā svāyudháṃ suvájram ā́ bráhma návyam ávase vavr̥tyāt
stanzas.translation: So may our new prayer bring thee to protect us, thee well-armed Hero with thy bolt of thunder, Indra, who made these worlds, the Strong, the ty, who never groweth old, the victory-giver.

translations.griffith: So may our new prayer bring thee to protect us, thee well-armed Hero with thy bolt of thunder, Indra, who made these worlds, the Strong, the ty, who never groweth old, the victory-giver.

stanzas.sanskrit: स नो॒ वाजा॑य॒ श्रव॑स इ॒षे च॑ रा॒ये धे॑हि द्यु॒मत॑ इन्द्र॒ विप्रा॑न् भ॒रद्वा॑जे नृ॒वत॑ इन्द्र सू॒रीन्दि॒वि च॑ स्मैधि॒ पार्ये॑ न इन्द्र
stanzas.transliteration: sá no vā́jāya śrávasa iṣé ca rāyé dhehi dyumáta indra víprān bharádvāje nr̥váta indra sūrī́n diví ca smaidhi pā́rye na indra
stanzas.translation: So, Indra, form us brilliant holy singers for strength, for glory, and for food and riches. Give Bharadvâja hero patrons, Indra Indra, be ours upon the day of trial.

translations.griffith: So, Indra, form us brilliant holy singers for strength, for glory, and for food and riches. Give Bharadvâja hero patrons, Indra Indra, be ours upon the day of trial.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒या वाजं॑ दे॒वहि॑तं सनेम॒ मदे॑म श॒तहि॑माः सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ayā́ vā́jaṃ deváhitaṃ sanema mádema śatáhimāḥ suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: With this may we obtain strength God-appointed, and brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.

translations.griffith: With this may we obtain strength God-appointed, and brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.

stanzas.sanskrit: तमु॑ ष्टुहि॒ यो अ॒भिभू॑त्योजा व॒न्वन्नवा॑तः पुरुहू॒त इन्द्रः॑ अषा॑ळ्हमु॒ग्रं सह॑मानमा॒भिर्गी॒र्भिर्व॑र्ध वृष॒भं च॑र्षणी॒नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: tám u ṣṭuhi yó abhíbhūtyojāḥ- vanvánn ávātaḥ puruhūtá índraḥ áṣāḷham ugráṃ sáhamānam ābhír gīrbhír vardha vr̥ṣabháṃ carṣaṇīnā́m
stanzas.translation: GLORIFY him whose might is all-surpassing, Indra the much-invoked who fights uninjured. Magnify with these songs the never-vanquished, the Strong, the Bull of men, the Mighty Victor.

translations.griffith: GLORIFY him whose might is all-surpassing, Indra the much-invoked who fights uninjured. Magnify with these songs the never-vanquished, the Strong, the Bull of men, the Mighty Victor.

stanzas.sanskrit: स यु॒ध्मः सत्वा॑ खज॒कृत्स॒मद्वा॑ तुविम्र॒क्षो न॑दनु॒माँ ऋ॑जी॒षी बृ॒हद्रे॑णु॒श्च्यव॑नो॒ मानु॑षीणा॒मेकः॑ कृष्टी॒नाम॑भवत्स॒हावा॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá yudhmáḥ sátvā khajakŕ̥t samádvā tuvimrakṣó nadanumā́m̐ r̥jīṣī́ br̥hádreṇuś cyávano mā́nuṣīṇām ékaḥ kr̥ṣṭīnā́m abhavat sahā́vā
stanzas.translation: He, Champion, Hero, Warrior, Lord of battles, impetuous, loudly roaring, great destroyer, Who whirls the dust on high, alone, oerthrower, hath made all races of mankind his subjects.

translations.griffith: He, Champion, Hero, Warrior, Lord of battles, impetuous, loudly roaring, great destroyer, Who whirls the dust on high, alone, oerthrower, hath made all races of mankind his subjects.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं ह॒ नु त्यद॑दमायो॒ दस्यूँ॒रेकः॑ कृ॒ष्टीर॑वनो॒रार्या॑य अस्ति॑ स्वि॒न्नु वी॒र्यं१॒॑ तत्त॑ इन्द्र॒ न स्वि॑दस्ति॒ तदृ॑तु॒था वि वो॑चः
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ ha nú tyád adamāyo dásyūm̐r ékaḥ kr̥ṣṭī́r avanor ā́ryāya ásti svin nú vīryàṃ tát ta indra ná svid asti tád r̥tuthā́ ví vocaḥ
stanzas.translation: Thou, thou alone, hast tamed the Dasyus; singly thou hast subdued the people for the Ârya. In this, or is it not, thine hero exploit, Indra? Declare it at the proper season.

translations.griffith: Thou, thou alone, hast tamed the Dasyus; singly thou hast subdued the people for the Ârya. In this, or is it not, thine hero exploit, Indra? Declare it at the proper season.

stanzas.sanskrit: सदिद्धि ते॑ तुविजा॒तस्य॒ मन्ये॒ सहः॑ सहिष्ठ तुर॒तस्तु॒रस्य॑ उ॒ग्रमु॒ग्रस्य॑ त॒वस॒स्तवी॒योऽर॑ध्रस्य रध्र॒तुरो॑ बभूव
stanzas.transliteration: sád íd dhí te tuvijātásya mánye sáhaḥ sahiṣṭha turatás turásya ugrám ugrásya tavásas távīyaḥ- -áradhrasya radhratúro babhūva
stanzas.translation: For true, I deem, thy strength is, thine the Mighty, thine, O Most Potent, thine the Conquering Victor; Strong, of the strong, Most Mighty, of the mighty, thine, driver of the churl to acts of bounty.

translations.griffith: For true, I deem, thy strength is, thine the Mighty, thine, O Most Potent, thine the Conquering Victor; Strong, of the strong, Most Mighty, of the mighty, thine, driver of the churl to acts of bounty.

stanzas.sanskrit: तन्नः॑ प्र॒त्नं स॒ख्यम॑स्तु यु॒ष्मे इ॒त्था वद॑द्भिर्व॒लमङ्गि॑रोभिः हन्न॑च्युतच्युद्दस्मे॒षय॑न्तमृ॒णोः पुरो॒ वि दुरो॑ अस्य॒ विश्वाः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tán naḥ pratnáṃ sakhyám astu yuṣmé itthā́ vádadbhir valám áṅgirobhiḥ hánn acyutacyud dasmeṣáyantam r̥ṇóḥ púro ví dúro asya víśvāḥ
stanzas.translation: Be this our ancient bond of friendship with you and with Angirases here who speak of Vala. Thou, Wondrous, Shaker of things firm, didst smite him in his fresh strength, and force his doors and castles.

translations.griffith: Be this our ancient bond of friendship with you and with Angirases here who speak of Vala. Thou, Wondrous, Shaker of things firm, didst smite him in his fresh strength, and force his doors and castles.

stanzas.sanskrit: स हि धी॒भिर्हव्यो॒ अस्त्यु॒ग्र ई॑शान॒कृन्म॑ह॒ति वृ॑त्र॒तूर्ये॑ स तो॒कसा॑ता॒ तन॑ये॒ स व॒ज्री वि॑तन्त॒साय्यो॑ अभवत्स॒मत्सु॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá hí dhībhír hávyo ásty ugráḥ- īśānakŕ̥n mahatí vr̥tratū́rye sá tokásātā tánaye sá vajrī́ vitantasā́yyo abhavat samátsu
stanzas.translation: With holy thoughts must he be called, the Mighty, showing his power in the great fight with Vr̥itra. He must be called to give us seed and offspring, the Thunderer must he moved and sped to battle.

translations.griffith: With holy thoughts must he be called, the Mighty, showing his power in the great fight with Vr̥itra. He must be called to give us seed and offspring, the Thunderer must he moved and sped to battle.

stanzas.sanskrit: स म॒ज्मना॒ जनि॑म॒ मानु॑षाणा॒मम॑र्त्येन॒ नाम्नाति॒ प्र स॑र्स्रे स द्यु॒म्नेन॒ स शव॑सो॒त रा॒या स वी॒र्ये॑ण॒ नृत॑मः॒ समो॑काः
stanzas.transliteration: sá majmánā jánima mā́nuṣāṇām ámartyena nā́mnā́ti prá sarsre sá dyumnéna sá śávasotá rāyā́ sá vīryèṇa nŕ̥tamaḥ sámokāḥ
stanzas.translation: He in his might, with name that lives for ever, hath far surpassed all human generations. He, most heroic, hath his home with splendour, with glory and with riches and with valour.

translations.griffith: He in his might, with name that lives for ever, hath far surpassed all human generations. He, most heroic, hath his home with splendour, with glory and with riches and with valour.

stanzas.sanskrit: स यो न मु॒हे न मिथू॒ जनो॒ भूत्सु॒मन्तु॑नामा॒ चुमु॑रिं॒ धुनिं॑ च वृ॒णक्पिप्रुं॒ शम्ब॑रं॒ शुष्ण॒मिन्द्रः॑ पु॒रां च्यौ॒त्नाय॑ श॒यथा॑य॒ नू चि॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: sá yó ná muhé ná míthū jáno bhū́t sumántunāmā cúmuriṃ dhúniṃ ca vr̥ṇák pípruṃ śámbaraṃ śúṣṇam índraḥ purā́ṃ cyautnā́ya śayáthāya nū́ cit
stanzas.translation: Stranger to guile, who ne'er was false or faithless, bearing a name that may be well remembered, Indra crushed Chumuri, Dhuni, Ṣambara, Pipru, and Ṣushṇa, that their castles fell in ruin.

translations.griffith: Stranger to guile, who ne'er was false or faithless, bearing a name that may be well remembered, Indra crushed Chumuri, Dhuni, Ṣambara, Pipru, and Ṣushṇa, that their castles fell in ruin.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒दाव॑ता॒ त्वक्ष॑सा॒ पन्य॑सा च वृत्र॒हत्या॑य॒ रथ॑मिन्द्र तिष्ठ धि॒ष्व वज्रं॒ हस्त॒ आ द॑क्षिण॒त्राभि प्र म॑न्द पुरुदत्र मा॒याः
stanzas.transliteration: udā́vatā tvákṣasā pányasā ca vr̥trahátyāya rátham indra tiṣṭha dhiṣvá vájraṃ hásta ā́ dakṣiṇatrā́- -abhí prá manda purudatra māyā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: With saving might that must be praised and lauded, Indra, ascend thy car to smite down Vr̥itra. In thy right hand hold fast thy bolt of thunder, and weaken, Bounteous Lord, his art and magic.

translations.griffith: With saving might that must be praised and lauded, Indra, ascend thy car to smite down Vr̥itra. In thy right hand hold fast thy bolt of thunder, and weaken, Bounteous Lord, his art and magic.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग्निर्न शुष्कं॒ वन॑मिन्द्र हे॒ती रक्षो॒ नि ध॑क्ष्य॒शनि॒र्न भी॒मा ग॒म्भी॒रय॑ ऋ॒ष्वया॒ यो रु॒रोजाध्वा॑नयद्दुरि॒ता द॒म्भय॑च्च
stanzas.transliteration: agnír ná śúṣkaṃ vánam indra hetī́ rákṣo ní dhakṣy aśánir ná bhīmā́ gambhīráya r̥ṣváyā yó rurója- -ádhvānayad duritā́ dambháyac ca
stanzas.translation: As Agni, as the dart burns the dry forest, like the dread shaft burn down the fiends, O Indra; Thou who with high deep-reaching spear hast broken, hast covered over mischief and destroyed it.

translations.griffith: As Agni, as the dart burns the dry forest, like the dread shaft burn down the fiends, O Indra; Thou who with high deep-reaching spear hast broken, hast covered over mischief and destroyed it.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ स॒हस्रं॑ प॒थिभि॑रिन्द्र रा॒या तुवि॑द्युम्न तुवि॒वाजे॑भिर॒र्वाक् या॒हि सू॑नो सहसो॒ यस्य॒ नू चि॒ददे॑व॒ ईशे॑ पुरुहूत॒ योतोः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ sahásram pathíbhir indra rāyā́ túvidyumna tuvivā́jebhir arvā́k yāhí sūno sahaso yásya nū́ cid ádeva ī́śe puruhūta yótoḥ
stanzas.translation: With wealth, by thousand paths come hither, Agni, paths that bring ample strength, O thou Most Splendid. Come, Son of Strength, o'er whom, Invoked of many! the godless hath no power to keep thee distant.

translations.griffith: With wealth, by thousand paths come hither, Agni, paths that bring ample strength, O thou Most Splendid. Come, Son of Strength, o'er whom, Invoked of many! the godless hath no power to keep thee distant.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र तु॑विद्यु॒म्नस्य॒ स्थवि॑रस्य॒ घृष्वे॑र्दि॒वो र॑रप्शे महि॒मा पृ॑थि॒व्याः नास्य॒ शत्रु॒र्न प्र॑ति॒मान॑मस्ति॒ न प्र॑ति॒ष्ठिः पु॑रुमा॒यस्य॒ सह्योः॑
stanzas.transliteration: prá tuvidyumnásya sthávirasya ghŕ̥ṣver divó rarapśe mahimā́ pr̥thivyā́ḥ nā́sya śátrur ná pratimā́nam asti ná pratiṣṭhíḥ purumāyásya sáhyoḥ
stanzas.translation: From heaven, from earth is bruited forth the greatness of him the firm, the fiery, the resplendent. No foe hath he, no counterpart, no refuge is there from him the Conqueror full of wisdom

translations.griffith: From heaven, from earth is bruited forth the greatness of him the firm, the fiery, the resplendent. No foe hath he, no counterpart, no refuge is there from him the Conqueror full of wisdom

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र तत्ते॑ अ॒द्या कर॑णं कृ॒तं भू॒त्कुत्सं॒ यदा॒युम॑तिथि॒ग्वम॑स्मै पु॒रू स॒हस्रा॒ नि शि॑शा अ॒भि क्षामुत्तूर्व॑याणं धृष॒ता नि॑नेथ
stanzas.transliteration: prá tát te adyā́ káraṇaṃ kr̥tám bhūt kútsaṃ yád āyúm atithigvám asmai purū́ sahásrā ní śiśā abhí kṣā́m út tū́rvayāṇaṃ dhr̥ṣatā́ ninetha
stanzas.translation: This day the deed that thou hast done is famous, when thou, for him, with many thousand others Laidest low Kutsa, Âyu, Âtithigva, and boldly didst deliver Tûrvayâṇa.

translations.griffith: This day the deed that thou hast done is famous, when thou, for him, with many thousand others Laidest low Kutsa, Âyu, Âtithigva, and boldly didst deliver Tûrvayâṇa.

stanzas.sanskrit: अनु॒ त्वाहि॑घ्ने॒ अध॑ देव दे॒वा मद॒न्विश्वे॑ क॒वित॑मं कवी॒नाम् करो॒ यत्र॒ वरि॑वो बाधि॒ताय॑ दि॒वे जना॑य त॒न्वे॑ गृणा॒नः
stanzas.transliteration: ánu tvā́highne ádha deva devā́ḥ- mádan víśve kavítamaṃ kavīnā́m káro yátra várivo bādhitā́ya divé jánāya tanvè gr̥ṇānáḥ
stanzas.translation: In thee, O God, the wisest of the Sages, all Gods were joyful when thou slewest Ahi. When lauded for thyself, thou gavest freedom to sore-afflicted Heaven and to the people.

translations.griffith: In thee, O God, the wisest of the Sages, all Gods were joyful when thou slewest Ahi. When lauded for thyself, thou gavest freedom to sore-afflicted Heaven and to the people.

stanzas.sanskrit: अनु॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी तत्त॒ ओजोऽम॑र्त्या जिहत इन्द्र दे॒वाः कृ॒ष्वा कृ॑त्नो॒ अकृ॑तं॒ यत्ते॒ अस्त्यु॒क्थं नवी॑यो जनयस्व य॒ज्ञैः
stanzas.transliteration: ánu dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ tát ta ójaḥ- -ámartyā jihata indra devā́ḥ kr̥ṣvā́ kr̥tno ákr̥taṃ yát te ásti- uktháṃ návīyo janayasva yajñaíḥ
stanzas.translation: This power of thine both heaven and earth acknowledge, the deathless Gods acknowledge it, O Indra. Do what thou ne'er hast done, O Mighty Worker: beget a new hymn at thy sacrifices.

translations.griffith: This power of thine both heaven and earth acknowledge, the deathless Gods acknowledge it, O Indra. Do what thou ne'er hast done, O Mighty Worker: beget a new hymn at thy sacrifices.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒हाँ इन्द्रो॑ नृ॒वदा च॑र्षणि॒प्रा उ॒त द्वि॒बर्हा॑ अमि॒नः सहो॑भिः अ॒स्म॒द्र्य॑ग्वावृधे वी॒र्या॑यो॒रुः पृ॒थुः सुकृ॑तः क॒र्तृभि॑र्भूत्
stanzas.transliteration: mahā́m̐ índro nr̥vád ā́ carṣaṇiprā́ḥ- utá dvibárhā amináḥ sáhobhiḥ asmadryàg vāvr̥dhe vīryā̀ya- -urúḥ pr̥thúḥ súkr̥taḥ kartŕ̥bhir bhūt
stanzas.translation: GREAT, hero-like controlling men is Indra, unwasting in his powers, doubled in vastness. He, turned to us, hath grown to hero vigour: broad, wide, he hath been decked by those who serve him.

translations.griffith: GREAT, hero-like controlling men is Indra, unwasting in his powers, doubled in vastness. He, turned to us, hath grown to hero vigour: broad, wide, he hath been decked by those who serve him.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॑मे॒व धि॒षणा॑ सा॒तये॑ धाद्बृ॒हन्त॑मृ॒ष्वम॒जरं॒ युवा॑नम् अषा॑ळ्हेन॒ शव॑सा शूशु॒वांसं॑ स॒द्यश्चि॒द्यो वा॑वृ॒धे असा॑मि
stanzas.transliteration: índram evá dhiṣáṇā sātáye dhād br̥hántam r̥ṣvám ajáraṃ yúvānam áṣāḷhena śávasā śūśuvā́ṃsaṃ sadyáś cid yó vāvr̥dhé ásāmi
stanzas.translation: The bowl made Indra swift to gather booty, the High, the Lofty, Youthful, Undecaying, Him who hath waxed by strength which none may conquer, and even at once grown to complete perfection.

translations.griffith: The bowl made Indra swift to gather booty, the High, the Lofty, Youthful, Undecaying, Him who hath waxed by strength which none may conquer, and even at once grown to complete perfection.

stanzas.sanskrit: पृ॒थू क॒रस्ना॑ बहु॒ला गभ॑स्ती अस्म॒द्र्य१॒॑क्सं मि॑मीहि॒ श्रवां॑सि यू॒थेव॑ प॒श्वः प॑शु॒पा दमू॑ना अ॒स्माँ इ॑न्द्रा॒भ्या व॑वृत्स्वा॒जौ
stanzas.transliteration: pr̥thū́ karásnā bahulā́ gábhastī asmadryàk sám mimīhi śrávāṃsi yūthéva paśváḥ paśupā́ dámūnāḥ- asmā́m̐ indrābhy ā́ vavr̥tsvājaú
stanzas.translation: Stretch out those hands of thine, extend to us-ward thy wide capacious arms, and grant us glory. Like as the household herdsman guards the cattle, so move thou round about us in the combat.

translations.griffith: Stretch out those hands of thine, extend to us-ward thy wide capacious arms, and grant us glory. Like as the household herdsman guards the cattle, so move thou round about us in the combat.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं व॒ इन्द्रं॑ च॒तिन॑मस्य शा॒कैरि॒ह नू॒नं वा॑ज॒यन्तो॑ हुवेम यथा॑ चि॒त्पूर्वे॑ जरि॒तार॑ आ॒सुरने॑द्या अनव॒द्या अरि॑ष्टाः
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ va índraṃ catínam asya śākaír ihá nūnáṃ vājayánto huvema yáthā cit pū́rve jaritā́ra āsúr ánedyā anavadyā́ áriṣṭāḥ
stanzas.translation: Now, fain for strength, let us invite your Indra hither, who lieth hidden with his Heroes,– Free from all blame, without reproach, uninjured, e'en as were those who sang, of old, his praises.

translations.griffith: Now, fain for strength, let us invite your Indra hither, who lieth hidden with his Heroes,– Free from all blame, without reproach, uninjured, e'en as were those who sang, of old, his praises.

stanzas.sanskrit: धृ॒तव्र॑तो धन॒दाः सोम॑वृद्धः॒ स हि वा॒मस्य॒ वसु॑नः पुरु॒क्षुः सं ज॑ग्मिरे प॒थ्या॒३॒॑ रायो॑ अस्मिन्त्समु॒द्रे न सिन्ध॑वो॒ याद॑मानाः
stanzas.transliteration: dhr̥távrato dhanadā́ḥ sómavr̥ddhaḥ sá hí vāmásya vásunaḥ purukṣúḥ sáṃ jagmire pathyā̀ rā́yo asmin samudré ná síndhavo yā́damānāḥ
stanzas.translation: With steadfast laws, wealth-giver, strong through Soma, he hath much fair and precious food to feed us. In him unite all paths that lead to riches, like rivers that commingle with the ocean.

translations.griffith: With steadfast laws, wealth-giver, strong through Soma, he hath much fair and precious food to feed us. In him unite all paths that lead to riches, like rivers that commingle with the ocean.

stanzas.sanskrit: शवि॑ष्ठं न॒ आ भ॑र शूर॒ शव॒ ओजि॑ष्ठ॒मोजो॑ अभिभूत उ॒ग्रम् विश्वा॑ द्यु॒म्ना वृष्ण्या॒ मानु॑षाणाम॒स्मभ्यं॑ दा हरिवो माद॒यध्यै॑
stanzas.transliteration: śáviṣṭhaṃ na ā́ bhara śūra śávaḥ- ójiṣṭham ójo abhibhūta ugrám víśvā dyumnā́ vŕ̥ṣṇyā mā́nuṣāṇām asmábhyaṃ dā harivo mādayádhyai
stanzas.translation: Bring unto us the mightiest might, O Hero, strong and most potent force, thou great Subduer! All splendid vigorous powers of men vouchsafe us, Lord of Bay Steeds, that they may make us joyful.

translations.griffith: Bring unto us the mightiest might, O Hero, strong and most potent force, thou great Subduer! All splendid vigorous powers of men vouchsafe us, Lord of Bay Steeds, that they may make us joyful.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्ते॒ मदः॑ पृतना॒षाळमृ॑ध्र॒ इन्द्र॒ तं न॒ आ भ॑र शूशु॒वांस॑म् येन॑ तो॒कस्य॒ तन॑यस्य सा॒तौ मं॑सी॒महि॑ जिगी॒वांस॒स्त्वोताः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yás te mádaḥ pr̥tanāṣā́ḷ ámr̥dhraḥ- índra táṃ na ā́ bhara śūśuvā́ṃsam yéna tokásya tánayasya sātaú maṃsīmáhi jigīvā́ṃsas tvótāḥ
stanzas.translation: Bring us, grown mighty in its strength, O Indra, thy friendly rapturous joy that wins the battle, Wherewith by thee assisted and triumphant, we may laud thee in gaining seed and offspring.

translations.griffith: Bring us, grown mighty in its strength, O Indra, thy friendly rapturous joy that wins the battle, Wherewith by thee assisted and triumphant, we may laud thee in gaining seed and offspring.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ नो॑ भर॒ वृष॑णं॒ शुष्म॑मिन्द्र धन॒स्पृतं॑ शूशु॒वांसं॑ सु॒दक्ष॑म् येन॒ वंसा॑म॒ पृत॑नासु॒ शत्रू॒न्तवो॒तिभि॑रु॒त जा॒मीँरजा॑मीन्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ no bhara vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ śúṣmam indra dhanaspŕ̥taṃ śūśuvā́ṃsaṃ sudákṣam yéna váṃsāma pŕ̥tanāsu śátrūn távotíbhir utá jāmī́m̐r ájāmīn
stanzas.translation: Indra, bestow on us the power heroic skilled and exceeding strong, that wins the booty, Wherewith, by thine assistance, we may conquer our foes in battle, be they kin or stranger.

translations.griffith: Indra, bestow on us the power heroic skilled and exceeding strong, that wins the booty, Wherewith, by thine assistance, we may conquer our foes in battle, be they kin or stranger.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ ते॒ शुष्मो॑ वृष॒भ ए॑तु प॒श्चादोत्त॒राद॑ध॒रादा पु॒रस्ता॑त् आ वि॒श्वतो॑ अ॒भि समे॑त्व॒र्वाङिन्द्र॑ द्यु॒म्नं स्व॑र्वद्धेह्य॒स्मे
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ te śúṣmo vr̥ṣabhá etu paścā́d óttarā́d adharā́d ā́ purástāt ā́ viśváto abhí sám etv arvā́ṅ índra dyumnáṃ svàrvad dhehy asmé
stanzas.translation: Let thine heroic strength come from behind us, before us, from above us or below us. From every side may it approach us, Indra. Give us the glory of the realm of splendour.

translations.griffith: Let thine heroic strength come from behind us, before us, from above us or below us. From every side may it approach us, Indra. Give us the glory of the realm of splendour.

stanzas.sanskrit: नृ॒वत्त॑ इन्द्र॒ नृत॑माभिरू॒ती वं॑सी॒महि॑ वा॒मं श्रोम॑तेभिः ईक्षे॒ हि वस्व॑ उ॒भय॑स्य राज॒न्धा रत्नं॒ महि॑ स्थू॒रं बृ॒हन्त॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: nr̥vát ta indra nŕ̥tamābhir ūtī́ vaṃsīmáhi vāmáṃ śrómatebhiḥ ī́kṣe hí vásva ubháyasya rājan dhā́ rátnam máhi sthūrám br̥hántam
stanzas.translation: With most heroic aid from thee, like heroes Indra, may we win wealth by deeds glory. Thou, King, art Lord of earthly, heavenly treasure: vouchsafe us riches vast, sublime, and lasting.

translations.griffith: With most heroic aid from thee, like heroes Indra, may we win wealth by deeds glory. Thou, King, art Lord of earthly, heavenly treasure: vouchsafe us riches vast, sublime, and lasting.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒रुत्व॑न्तं वृष॒भं वा॑वृधा॒नमक॑वारिं दि॒व्यं शा॒समिन्द्र॑म् वि॒श्वा॒साह॒मव॑से॒ नूत॑नायो॒ग्रं स॑हो॒दामि॒ह तं हु॑वेम
stanzas.transliteration: marútvantaṃ vr̥ṣabháṃ vāvr̥dhānám ákavāriṃ divyáṃ śāsám índram viśvāsā́ham ávase nū́tanāya- -ugráṃ sahodā́m ihá táṃ huvema
stanzas.translation: The Bull, whose strength hath waxed, whom Maruts follow, free-giving Indra, the Celestial Ruler, Mighty, all-conquering, the victory-giver, him let us call to grant us new protection.

translations.griffith: The Bull, whose strength hath waxed, whom Maruts follow, free-giving Indra, the Celestial Ruler, Mighty, all-conquering, the victory-giver, him let us call to grant us new protection.

stanzas.sanskrit: जनं॑ वज्रि॒न्महि॑ चि॒न्मन्य॑मानमे॒भ्यो नृभ्यो॑ रन्धया॒ येष्वस्मि॑ अधा॒ हि त्वा॑ पृथि॒व्यां शूर॑सातौ॒ हवा॑महे॒ तन॑ये॒ गोष्व॒प्सु
stanzas.transliteration: jánaṃ vajrin máhi cin mányamānam ebhyó nŕ̥bhyo randhayā yéṣv ásmi ádhā hí tvā pr̥thivyā́ṃ śū́rasātau hávāmahe tánaye góṣv apsú
stanzas.translation: Give up the people who are high and haughty to these men and to me, O Thunder-wielder! Therefore upon the earth do we invoke thee, where heroes win, for sons and kine and waters.

translations.griffith: Give up the people who are high and haughty to these men and to me, O Thunder-wielder! Therefore upon the earth do we invoke thee, where heroes win, for sons and kine and waters.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒यं त॑ ए॒भिः पु॑रुहूत स॒ख्यैः शत्रोः॑शत्रो॒रुत्त॑र॒ इत्स्या॑म घ्नन्तो॑ वृ॒त्राण्यु॒भया॑नि शूर रा॒या म॑देम बृह॒ता त्वोताः॑
stanzas.transliteration: vayáṃ ta ebhíḥ puruhūta sakhyaíḥ śátroḥ-śatror úttara ít syāma ghnánto vr̥trā́ṇy ubháyāni śūra rāyā́ madema br̥hatā́ tvótāḥ
stanzas.translation: Through these thy friendships, God invoked of many! may we be victors over every foeman. Slaying both kinds of foe, may we, O Hero, be happy, helped by thee, with ample riches.

translations.griffith: Through these thy friendships, God invoked of many! may we be victors over every foeman. Slaying both kinds of foe, may we, O Hero, be happy, helped by thee, with ample riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: द्यौर्न य इ॑न्द्रा॒भि भूमा॒र्यस्त॒स्थौ र॒यिः शव॑सा पृ॒त्सु जना॑न् तं नः॑ स॒हस्र॑भरमुर्वरा॒सां द॒द्धि सू॑नो सहसो वृत्र॒तुर॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: dyaúr ná yá indrābhí bhū́māryás tasthaú rayíḥ śávasā pr̥tsú jánān táṃ naḥ sahásrabharam urvarāsā́ṃ daddhí sūno sahaso vr̥tratúram
stanzas.translation: GIVE us wealth, Indra, that with might, as heaven o'ertops the earth, o'ercomes our foes in battle Wealth that brings thousands and that wins the corn-lands, wealth, Son of Strength! that vanquishes the foeman.

translations.griffith: GIVE us wealth, Indra, that with might, as heaven o'ertops the earth, o'ercomes our foes in battle Wealth that brings thousands and that wins the corn-lands, wealth, Son of Strength! that vanquishes the foeman.

stanzas.sanskrit: दि॒वो न तुभ्य॒मन्वि॑न्द्र स॒त्रासु॒र्यं॑ दे॒वेभि॑र्धायि॒ विश्व॑म् अहिं॒ यद्वृ॒त्रम॒पो व॑व्रि॒वांसं॒ हन्नृ॑जीषि॒न्विष्णु॑ना सचा॒नः
stanzas.transliteration: divó ná túbhyam ánv indra satrā́- -asuryàṃ devébhir dhāyi víśvam áhiṃ yád vr̥trám apó vavrivā́ṃsaṃ hánn r̥jīṣin víṣṇunā sacānáḥ
stanzas.translation: Even as the power of Dyaus, to thee, O Indra, all Asura sway was by the Gods entrusted, When thou, Impetuous! leagued with Vishṇu, slewest Vr̥itra the Dragon who enclosed the waters.

translations.griffith: Even as the power of Dyaus, to thee, O Indra, all Asura sway was by the Gods entrusted, When thou, Impetuous! leagued with Vishṇu, slewest Vr̥itra the Dragon who enclosed the waters.

stanzas.sanskrit: तूर्व॒न्नोजी॑यान्त॒वस॒स्तवी॑यान्कृ॒तब्र॒ह्मेन्द्रो॑ वृ॒द्धम॑हाः राजा॑भव॒न्मधु॑नः सो॒म्यस्य॒ विश्वा॑सां॒ यत्पु॒रां द॒र्त्नुमाव॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: tū́rvann ójīyān tavásas távīyān kr̥tábrahméndro vr̥ddhámahāḥ rā́jābhavan mádhunaḥ somyásya víśvāsāṃ yát purā́ṃ dartnúm ā́vat
stanzas.translation: Indra, Strong, Victor, Mightier than the mighty, addressed with prayer and perfect in his splendour, Lord of the bolt that breaketh forts in pieces, became the King of the sweet juice of Soma..

translations.griffith: Indra, Strong, Victor, Mightier than the mighty, addressed with prayer and perfect in his splendour, Lord of the bolt that breaketh forts in pieces, became the King of the sweet juice of Soma..

stanzas.sanskrit: श॒तैर॑पद्रन्प॒णय॑ इ॒न्द्रात्र॒ दशो॑णये क॒वये॒ऽर्कसा॑तौ व॒धैः शुष्ण॑स्या॒शुष॑स्य मा॒याः पि॒त्वो नारि॑रेची॒त्किं च॒न प्र
stanzas.transliteration: śataír apadran paṇáya indrā́tra dáśoṇaye kaváye 'rkásātau vadhaíḥ śúṣṇasyāśúṣasya māyā́ḥ pitvó nā́rirecīt kíṃ caná prá
stanzas.translation: There, Indra, while the light was won, the Paṇis fled, 'neath a hundred blows, for wise Dasoni, And greedy Ṣushṇa's magical devices nor left he any of their food remaining.

translations.griffith: There, Indra, while the light was won, the Paṇis fled, 'neath a hundred blows, for wise Dasoni, And greedy Ṣushṇa's magical devices nor left he any of their food remaining.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒हो द्रु॒हो अप॑ वि॒श्वायु॑ धायि॒ वज्र॑स्य॒ यत्पत॑ने॒ पादि॒ शुष्णः॑ उ॒रु ष स॒रथं॒ सार॑थये क॒रिन्द्रः॒ कुत्सा॑य॒ सूर्य॑स्य सा॒तौ
stanzas.transliteration: mahó druhó ápa viśvā́yu dhāyi vájrasya yát pátane pā́di śúṣṇaḥ urú ṣá saráthaṃ sā́rathaye kar índraḥ kútsāya sū́ryasya sātaú
stanzas.translation: What time the thunder fell and Ṣushṇa perished, all life's support from the great Druh was taken. Indra made room for his car-drivcr Kutsa who sate beside him, when he gained the sunlight.

translations.griffith: What time the thunder fell and Ṣushṇa perished, all life's support from the great Druh was taken. Indra made room for his car-drivcr Kutsa who sate beside him, when he gained the sunlight.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र श्ये॒नो न म॑दि॒रमं॒शुम॑स्मै॒ शिरो॑ दा॒सस्य॒ नमु॑चेर्मथा॒यन् प्राव॒न्नमीं॑ सा॒प्यं स॒सन्तं॑ पृ॒णग्रा॒या समि॒षा सं स्व॒स्ति
stanzas.transliteration: prá śyenó ná madirám aṃśúm asmai śíro dāsásya námucer mathāyán prā́van námīṃ sāpyáṃ sasántam pr̥ṇág rāyā́ sám iṣā́ sáṃ svastí
stanzas.translation: As the Hawk rent for him the stalk that gladdens, he wrenched the head from Namuci the Dâsa. He guarded Namî, Sayya's son, in slumber, and sated him with food, success, and riches.

translations.griffith: As the Hawk rent for him the stalk that gladdens, he wrenched the head from Namuci the Dâsa. He guarded Namî, Sayya's son, in slumber, and sated him with food, success, and riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि पिप्रो॒रहि॑मायस्य दृ॒ळ्हाः पुरो॑ वज्रि॒ञ्छव॑सा॒ न द॑र्दः सुदा॑म॒न्तद्रेक्णो॑ अप्रमृ॒ष्यमृ॒जिश्व॑ने दा॒त्रं दा॒शुषे॑ दाः
stanzas.transliteration: ví pípror áhimāyasya dr̥ḷhā́ḥ púro vajriñ chávasā ná dardaḥ súdāman tád rékṇo apramr̥ṣyám r̥jíśvane dātráṃ dāśúṣe dāḥ
stanzas.translation: Thou, thunder-armed, with thy great might hast shattered Pipru's strong forts who knew the wiles of serpents. Thou gavest to thy worshipper R̥ijiṣvan imperishable Wealth, O Bounteous Giver.

translations.griffith: Thou, thunder-armed, with thy great might hast shattered Pipru's strong forts who knew the wiles of serpents. Thou gavest to thy worshipper R̥ijiṣvan imperishable Wealth, O Bounteous Giver.

stanzas.sanskrit: स वे॑त॒सुं दश॑मायं॒ दशो॑णिं॒ तूतु॑जि॒मिन्द्रः॑ स्वभि॒ष्टिसु॑म्नः आ तुग्रं॒ शश्व॒दिभं॒ द्योत॑नाय मा॒तुर्न सी॒मुप॑ सृजा इ॒यध्यै॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá vetasúṃ dáśamāyaṃ dáśoṇiṃ tū́tujim índraḥ svabhiṣṭísumnaḥ ā́ túgraṃ śáśvad íbhaṃ dyótanāya mātúr ná sīm úpa sr̥jā iyádhyai
stanzas.translation: The crafty Vetasu, the swift Dasni, and Tugra speedily with all his servants, Hath Indra, gladdening with strong assistance, forced near as 'twere to glorify the Mother.

translations.griffith: The crafty Vetasu, the swift Dasni, and Tugra speedily with all his servants, Hath Indra, gladdening with strong assistance, forced near as 'twere to glorify the Mother.

stanzas.sanskrit: स ईं॒ स्पृधो॑ वनते॒ अप्र॑तीतो॒ बिभ्र॒द्वज्रं॑ वृत्र॒हणं॒ गभ॑स्तौ तिष्ठ॒द्धरी॒ अध्यस्ते॑व॒ गर्ते॑ वचो॒युजा॑ वहत॒ इन्द्र॑मृ॒ष्वम्
stanzas.transliteration: sá īṃ spŕ̥dho vanate ápratīto bíbhrad vájraṃ vr̥traháṇaṃ gábhastau tíṣṭhad dhárī ádhy ásteva gárte vacoyújā vahata índram r̥ṣvám
stanzas.translation: Resistless, with the hosts he battles, bearing in both his arms the Vr̥itra-slaying thunder. He mounts his Bays, as the car-seat an archer: yoked at a word they bear the lofty Indra.

translations.griffith: Resistless, with the hosts he battles, bearing in both his arms the Vr̥itra-slaying thunder. He mounts his Bays, as the car-seat an archer: yoked at a word they bear the lofty Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒नेम॒ तेऽव॑सा॒ नव्य॑ इन्द्र॒ प्र पू॒रवः॑ स्तवन्त ए॒ना य॒ज्ञैः स॒प्त यत्पुरः॒ शर्म॒ शार॑दी॒र्दर्द्धन्दासीः॑ पुरु॒कुत्सा॑य॒ शिक्ष॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: sanéma té 'vasā návya indra prá pūráva stavanta enā́ yajñaíḥ saptá yát púraḥ śárma śā́radīr dárt -hán dā́sīḥ purukútsāya śíkṣan
stanzas.translation: May we, O Indra, gain by thy new favour: so Pûrus laud thee, with their sacrifices, That thou hast wrecked seven autumn forts, their shelter, slain Dâsa tribes and aided Purukutsa.

translations.griffith: May we, O Indra, gain by thy new favour: so Pûrus laud thee, with their sacrifices, That thou hast wrecked seven autumn forts, their shelter, slain Dâsa tribes and aided Purukutsa.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं वृ॒ध इ॑न्द्र पू॒र्व्यो भू॑र्वरिव॒स्यन्नु॒शने॑ का॒व्याय॑ परा॒ नव॑वास्त्वमनु॒देयं॑ म॒हे पि॒त्रे द॑दाथ॒ स्वं नपा॑तम्
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ vr̥dhá indra pūrvyó bhūr varivasyánn uśáne kāvyā́ya párā návavāstvam anudéyam mahé pitré dadātha sváṃ nápātam
stanzas.translation: Favouring Uṣanâ the son of Kavi, thou wast his ancient strengthener, O Indra. Thou gavest Navavâstva. as a present, to the great father gavest back his grandson.

translations.griffith: Favouring Uṣanâ the son of Kavi, thou wast his ancient strengthener, O Indra. Thou gavest Navavâstva. as a present, to the great father gavest back his grandson.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं धुनि॑रिन्द्र॒ धुनि॑मतीर्ऋ॒णोर॒पः सी॒रा न स्रव॑न्तीः प्र यत्स॑मु॒द्रमति॑ शूर॒ पर्षि॑ पा॒रया॑ तु॒र्वशं॒ यदुं॑ स्व॒स्ति
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ dhúnir indra dhúnimatīr r̥ṇór apáḥ sīrā́ ná srávantīḥ prá yát samudrám áti śūra párṣi pāráyā turváśaṃ yáduṃ svastí
stanzas.translation: Thou, roaring Indra, drovest on the waters that made a roaring sound like rushing rivers, What time, O Hero, o'er the sea thou broughtest, in safety broughtest Turvaṣa and Yadu.

translations.griffith: Thou, roaring Indra, drovest on the waters that made a roaring sound like rushing rivers, What time, O Hero, o'er the sea thou broughtest, in safety broughtest Turvaṣa and Yadu.

stanzas.sanskrit: तव॑ ह॒ त्यदि॑न्द्र॒ विश्व॑मा॒जौ स॒स्तो धुनी॒चुमु॑री॒ या ह॒ सिष्व॑प् दी॒दय॒दित्तुभ्यं॒ सोमे॑भिः सु॒न्वन्द॒भीति॑रि॒ध्मभृ॑तिः प॒क्थ्य१॒॑र्कैः
stanzas.transliteration: táva ha tyád indra víśvam ājaú sastó dhúnīcúmurī yā́ ha síṣvap dīdáyad ít túbhyaṃ sómebhiḥ sunván dabhī́tir idhmábhr̥tiḥ pakthy àrkaíḥ
stanzas.translation: This Indra, was thy work in war: thou sentest Dhuni and Chumuri to sleep and slumber. Dabhîti lit the flame for thee, and worshipped with fuel, hymns, poured Soma, dressed oblations.

translations.griffith: This Indra, was thy work in war: thou sentest Dhuni and Chumuri to sleep and slumber. Dabhîti lit the flame for thee, and worshipped with fuel, hymns, poured Soma, dressed oblations.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मा उ॑ त्वा पुरु॒तम॑स्य का॒रोर्हव्यं॑ वीर॒ हव्या॑ हवन्ते धियो॑ रथे॒ष्ठाम॒जरं॒ नवी॑यो र॒यिर्विभू॑तिरीयते वच॒स्या
stanzas.transliteration: imā́ u tvā purutámasya kārór hávyaṃ vīra hávyā havante dhíyo ratheṣṭhā́m ajáraṃ návīyo rayír víbhūtir īyate vacasyā́
stanzas.translation: THESE the most constant singer's invocations call thee who art to be invoked, O Hero; Hymns call anew the chariot-borne, Eternal: by eloquence men gain abundant riches.

translations.griffith: THESE the most constant singer's invocations call thee who art to be invoked, O Hero; Hymns call anew the chariot-borne, Eternal: by eloquence men gain abundant riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: तमु॑ स्तुष॒ इन्द्रं॒ यो विदा॑नो॒ गिर्वा॑हसं गी॒र्भिर्य॒ज्ञवृ॑द्धम् यस्य॒ दिव॒मति॑ म॒ह्ना पृ॑थि॒व्याः पु॑रुमा॒यस्य॑ रिरि॒चे म॑हि॒त्वम्
stanzas.transliteration: tám u stuṣa índraṃ yó vídāno gírvāhasaṃ gīrbhír yajñávr̥ddham yásya dívam áti mahnā́ pr̥thivyā́ḥ purumāyásya riricé mahitvám
stanzas.translation: I praise that Indra, known to all men, honoured with songs, extolled with hymns at sacrifices, Whose majesty, rich in wondrous arts, surpasseth the magnitude of earth, and heaven in greatness.

translations.griffith: I praise that Indra, known to all men, honoured with songs, extolled with hymns at sacrifices, Whose majesty, rich in wondrous arts, surpasseth the magnitude of earth, and heaven in greatness.

stanzas.sanskrit: स इत्तमो॑ऽवयु॒नं त॑त॒न्वत्सूर्ये॑ण व॒युन॑वच्चकार क॒दा ते॒ मर्ता॑ अ॒मृत॑स्य॒ धामेय॑क्षन्तो॒ न मि॑नन्ति स्वधावः
stanzas.transliteration: sá ít támo 'vayunáṃ tatanvát sū́ryeṇa vayúnavac cakāra kadā́ te mártā amŕ̥tasya dhā́ma- -íyakṣanto ná minanti svadhāvaḥ
stanzas.translation: He hath made pathways, with the Sun to aid him, throughout the darkness that extended pathless. Mortals who yearn to worship ne'er dishonour, O Mighty God, thy Law who art Immortal.

translations.griffith: He hath made pathways, with the Sun to aid him, throughout the darkness that extended pathless. Mortals who yearn to worship ne'er dishonour, O Mighty God, thy Law who art Immortal.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्ता च॒कार॒ स कुह॑ स्वि॒दिन्द्रः॒ कमा जनं॑ चरति॒ कासु॑ वि॒क्षु कस्ते॑ य॒ज्ञो मन॑से॒ शं वरा॑य॒ को अ॒र्क इ॑न्द्र कत॒मः स होता॑
stanzas.transliteration: yás tā́ cakā́ra sá kúha svid índraḥ kám ā́ jánaṃ carati kā́su vikṣú kás te yajñó mánase śáṃ várāya kó arká indra katamáḥ sá hótā
stanzas.translation: And he who did these things, where is that Indra? among what tribes? what people doth he visit? What sacrifice contents thy mind , and wishes? What priest among them all? what hymn, O Indra?

translations.griffith: And he who did these things, where is that Indra? among what tribes? what people doth he visit? What sacrifice contents thy mind , and wishes? What priest among them all? what hymn, O Indra?

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒दा हि ते॒ वेवि॑षतः पुरा॒जाः प्र॒त्नास॑ आ॒सुः पु॑रुकृ॒त्सखा॑यः ये म॑ध्य॒मास॑ उ॒त नूत॑नास उ॒ताव॒मस्य॑ पुरुहूत बोधि
stanzas.transliteration: idā́ hí te véviṣataḥ purājā́ḥ pratnā́sa āsúḥ purukr̥t sákhāyaḥ yé madhyamā́sa utá nū́tanāsaḥ- utā́vamásya puruhūta bodhi
stanzas.translation: Yea, here were they who, born of old, have served thee, thy friends of ancient time, thou active Worker. Bethink thee now of these, Invoked of many! the midmost and the recent, and the youngest.

translations.griffith: Yea, here were they who, born of old, have served thee, thy friends of ancient time, thou active Worker. Bethink thee now of these, Invoked of many! the midmost and the recent, and the youngest.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं पृ॒च्छन्तोऽव॑रासः॒ परा॑णि प्र॒त्ना त॑ इन्द्र॒ श्रुत्यानु॑ येमुः अर्चा॑मसि वीर ब्रह्मवाहो॒ यादे॒व वि॒द्म तात्त्वा॑ म॒हान्त॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: tám pr̥chántó 'varāsaḥ párāṇi pratnā́ ta indra śrútyā́nu yemuḥ árcāmasi vīra brahmavāho yā́d evá vidmá tā́t tvā mahā́ntam
stanzas.translation: Inquiring after him, thy later servants, Indra, have gained thy former old traditions. Hero, to whom the prayer is brought, we praise thee as great for that wherein we know thee mighty.

translations.griffith: Inquiring after him, thy later servants, Indra, have gained thy former old traditions. Hero, to whom the prayer is brought, we praise thee as great for that wherein we know thee mighty.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भि त्वा॒ पाजो॑ र॒क्षसो॒ वि त॑स्थे॒ महि॑ जज्ञा॒नम॒भि तत्सु ति॑ष्ठ तव॑ प्र॒त्नेन॒ युज्ये॑न॒ सख्या॒ वज्रे॑ण धृष्णो॒ अप॒ ता नु॑दस्व
stanzas.transliteration: abhí tvā pā́jo rakṣáso ví tasthe máhi jajñānám abhí tát sú tiṣṭha táva pratnéna yújyena sákhyā vájreṇa dhr̥ṣṇo ápa tā́ nudasva
stanzas.translation: The demon's strength is gathered fast against thee: great as that strength hath grown, go forth to meet it. With thine own ancient friend and companion, the thunderbolt, brave Champion! drive it backward.

translations.griffith: The demon's strength is gathered fast against thee: great as that strength hath grown, go forth to meet it. With thine own ancient friend and companion, the thunderbolt, brave Champion! drive it backward.

stanzas.sanskrit: स तु श्रु॑धीन्द्र॒ नूत॑नस्य ब्रह्मण्य॒तो वी॑र कारुधायः त्वं ह्या॒३॒॑पिः प्र॒दिवि॑ पितॄ॒णां शश्व॑द्ब॒भूथ॑ सु॒हव॒ एष्टौ॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá tú śrudhīndra nū́tanasya brahmaṇyató vīra kārudhāyaḥ tváṃ hy ā̀píḥ pradívi pitr̥̄ṇā́ṃ śáśvad babhū́tha suháva éṣṭau
stanzas.translation: Hear, too, the prayer of this thy present beadsman, O Indra, Hero, cherishing the singer. For thou wast aye our fathers' Friend aforetime, still swift to listen to their supplication.

translations.griffith: Hear, too, the prayer of this thy present beadsman, O Indra, Hero, cherishing the singer. For thou wast aye our fathers' Friend aforetime, still swift to listen to their supplication.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रोतये॒ वरु॑णं मि॒त्रमिन्द्रं॑ म॒रुतः॑ कृ॒ष्वाव॑से नो अ॒द्य प्र पू॒षणं॒ विष्णु॑म॒ग्निं पुरं॑धिं सवि॒तार॒मोष॑धीः॒ पर्व॑ताँश्च
stanzas.transliteration: prótáye váruṇam mitrám índram marútaḥ kr̥ṣvā́vase no adyá prá pūṣáṇaṃ víṣṇum agním púraṃdhiṃ savitā́ram óṣadhīḥ párvatāṃś ca
stanzas.translation: Bring to our help this day, for our protection, Varuṇa, Mitra , Indra, and the Maruts, Pûshan and Vishṇu, Agni and Purandhi, Savitar also, and the Plants and Mountains.

translations.griffith: Bring to our help this day, for our protection, Varuṇa, Mitra , Indra, and the Maruts, Pûshan and Vishṇu, Agni and Purandhi, Savitar also, and the Plants and Mountains.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒म उ॑ त्वा पुरुशाक प्रयज्यो जरि॒तारो॑ अ॒भ्य॑र्चन्त्य॒र्कैः श्रु॒धी हव॒मा हु॑व॒तो हु॑वा॒नो न त्वावाँ॑ अ॒न्यो अ॑मृत॒ त्वद॑स्ति
stanzas.transliteration: imá u tvā puruśāka prayajyo jaritā́ro abhy àrcanty arkaíḥ śrudhī́ hávam ā́ huvató huvānó ná tvā́vām̐ anyó amr̥ta tvád asti
stanzas.translation: The singers here exalt with hymns and praises thee who art very Mighty and Most Holy. Hear, when invoked, the invoker's invocation. Beside thee there is nonelike thee, Immortal!

translations.griffith: The singers here exalt with hymns and praises thee who art very Mighty and Most Holy. Hear, when invoked, the invoker's invocation. Beside thee there is nonelike thee, Immortal!

stanzas.sanskrit: नू म॒ आ वाच॒मुप॑ याहि वि॒द्वान्विश्वे॑भिः सूनो सहसो॒ यज॑त्रैः ये अ॑ग्निजि॒ह्वा ऋ॑त॒साप॑ आ॒सुर्ये मनुं॑ च॒क्रुरुप॑रं॒ दसा॑य
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ ma ā́ vā́cam úpa yāhi vidvā́n víśvebhiḥ sūno sahaso yájatraiḥ yé agnijihvā́ r̥tasā́pa āsúr yé mánuṃ cakrúr úparaṃ dásāya
stanzas.translation: Now to my words come quickly thou who knowest, O Son of Strength, with all who claim our worship, Who visit sacred rites, whose tongue is Agni, Gods who made Manu stronger than the Dasyu.

translations.griffith: Now to my words come quickly thou who knowest, O Son of Strength, with all who claim our worship, Who visit sacred rites, whose tongue is Agni, Gods who made Manu stronger than the Dasyu.

stanzas.sanskrit: स नो॑ बोधि पुरए॒ता सु॒गेषू॒त दु॒र्गेषु॑ पथि॒कृद्विदा॑नः ये अश्र॑मास उ॒रवो॒ वहि॑ष्ठा॒स्तेभि॑र्न इन्द्रा॒भि व॑क्षि॒ वाज॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: sá no bodhi puraetā́ sugéṣu- -utá durgéṣu pathikŕ̥d vídānaḥ yé áśramāsa urávo váhiṣṭhās tébhir na indrābhí vakṣi vā́jam
stanzas.translation: On good and evil ways be thou our Leader, thou who art known to all as Path-preparer. Bring power to us, O Indra, with thy Horses, Steeds that are best to draw, broad-backed, unwearied.

translations.griffith: On good and evil ways be thou our Leader, thou who art known to all as Path-preparer. Bring power to us, O Indra, with thy Horses, Steeds that are best to draw, broad-backed, unwearied.

stanzas.sanskrit: य एक॒ इद्धव्य॑श्चर्षणी॒नामिन्द्रं॒ तं गी॒र्भिर॒भ्य॑र्च आ॒भिः यः पत्य॑ते वृष॒भो वृष्ण्या॑वान्त्स॒त्यः सत्वा॑ पुरुमा॒यः सह॑स्वान्
stanzas.transliteration: yá éka íd dhávyaś carṣaṇīnā́m índraṃ táṃ gīrbhír abhy àrca ābhíḥ yáḥ pátyate vr̥ṣabhó vŕ̥ṣṇyāvān satyáḥ sátvā purumāyáḥ sáhasvān
stanzas.translation: WITH these my hymns I glorify that Indra who is alone to be invoked by mortals, The Lord, the Mighty One, of manly vigour, victorious, Hero, true, and full of wisdom.

translations.griffith: WITH these my hymns I glorify that Indra who is alone to be invoked by mortals, The Lord, the Mighty One, of manly vigour, victorious, Hero, true, and full of wisdom.

stanzas.sanskrit: तमु॑ नः॒ पूर्वे॑ पि॒तरो॒ नव॑ग्वाः स॒प्त विप्रा॑सो अ॒भि वा॒जय॑न्तः न॒क्ष॒द्दा॒भं ततु॑रिं पर्वते॒ष्ठामद्रो॑घवाचं म॒तिभिः॒ शवि॑ष्ठम्
stanzas.transliteration: tám u naḥ pū́rve pitáro návagvāḥ saptá víprāso abhí vājáyantaḥ nakṣaddābháṃ táturim parvateṣṭhā́m ádroghavācam matíbhiḥ śáviṣṭham
stanzas.translation: Our sires of old,. Navagvas, sages seven, while urging him to show his might, extolled him, Dwelling on heights, swift, smiting down opponents, guileless in word, and in his thoughts most mighty.

translations.griffith: Our sires of old,. Navagvas, sages seven, while urging him to show his might, extolled him, Dwelling on heights, swift, smiting down opponents, guileless in word, and in his thoughts most mighty.

stanzas.sanskrit: तमी॑मह॒ इन्द्र॑मस्य रा॒यः पु॑रु॒वीर॑स्य नृ॒वतः॑ पुरु॒क्षोः यो अस्कृ॑धोयुर॒जरः॒ स्व॑र्वा॒न्तमा भ॑र हरिवो माद॒यध्यै॑
stanzas.transliteration: tám īmaha índram asya rāyáḥ puruvī́rasya nr̥vátaḥ purukṣóḥ yó áskr̥dhoyur ajáraḥ svàrvān tám ā́ bhara harivo mādayádhyai
stanzas.translation: We seek that Indra to obtain his riches that bring much food, and men, and store of heroes. Bring us, Lord of Bay Steeds, to make us joyful, celestial wealth, abundant, undecaying.

translations.griffith: We seek that Indra to obtain his riches that bring much food, and men, and store of heroes. Bring us, Lord of Bay Steeds, to make us joyful, celestial wealth, abundant, undecaying.
