stanzas.sanskrit: तन्नो॒ वि वो॑चो॒ यदि॑ ते पु॒रा चि॑ज्जरि॒तार॑ आन॒शुः सु॒म्नमि॑न्द्र कस्ते॑ भा॒गः किं वयो॑ दुध्र खिद्वः॒ पुरु॑हूत पुरूवसोऽसुर॒घ्नः
stanzas.transliteration: tán no ví voco yádi te purā́ cij jaritā́ra ānaśúḥ sumnám indra kás te bhāgáḥ kíṃ váyo dudhra khidvaḥ púruhūta purūvaso 'suraghnáḥ
stanzas.translation: Tell thou us this, if at thy hand aforetime the earlier singers have obtained good fortune, What is thy share and portion, Strong Subduer, Asura-slayer, rich, invoked of many?

translations.griffith: Tell thou us this, if at thy hand aforetime the earlier singers have obtained good fortune, What is thy share and portion, Strong Subduer, Asura-slayer, rich, invoked of many?

stanzas.sanskrit: तं पृ॒च्छन्ती॒ वज्र॑हस्तं रथे॒ष्ठामिन्द्रं॒ वेपी॒ वक्व॑री॒ यस्य॒ नू गीः तु॒वि॒ग्रा॒भं तु॑विकू॒र्मिं र॑भो॒दां गा॒तुमि॑षे॒ नक्ष॑ते॒ तुम्र॒मच्छ॑
stanzas.transliteration: tám pr̥chántī vájrahastaṃ ratheṣṭhā́m índraṃ vépī vákvarī yásya nū́ gī́ḥ tuvigrābháṃ tuvikūrmíṃ rabhodā́m gātúm iṣe nákṣate túmram ácha
stanzas.translation: He who for car-borne Indra, armed with thunder, hath a hymn, craving, deeply-piercing, fluent, Who sends a song effectual, firmly-grasping, and strength-bestowing, he comes near the mighty.

translations.griffith: He who for car-borne Indra, armed with thunder, hath a hymn, craving, deeply-piercing, fluent, Who sends a song effectual, firmly-grasping, and strength-bestowing, he comes near the mighty.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒या ह॒ त्यं मा॒यया॑ वावृधा॒नं म॑नो॒जुवा॑ स्वतवः॒ पर्व॑तेन अच्यु॑ता चिद्वीळि॒ता स्वो॑जो रु॒जो वि दृ॒ळ्हा धृ॑ष॒ता वि॑रप्शिन्
stanzas.transliteration: ayā́ ha tyám māyáyā vāvr̥dhānám manojúvā svatavaḥ párvatena ácyutā cid vīḷitā́ svojo rujó ví dr̥ḷhā́ dhr̥ṣatā́ virapśin
stanzas.translation: Strong of thyself, thou by this art hast shattered, with thought-swift Parvata, him who waxed against thee, And, Mightiest! roaring! boldly rent in pieces things that were firmly fixed and never shaken.

translations.griffith: Strong of thyself, thou by this art hast shattered, with thought-swift Parvata, him who waxed against thee, And, Mightiest! roaring! boldly rent in pieces things that were firmly fixed and never shaken.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं वो॑ धि॒या नव्य॑स्या॒ शवि॑ष्ठं प्र॒त्नं प्र॑त्न॒वत्प॑रितंस॒यध्यै॑ स नो॑ वक्षदनिमा॒नः सु॒वह्मेन्द्रो॒ विश्वा॒न्यति॑ दु॒र्गहा॑णि
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ vo dhiyā́ návyasyā śáviṣṭham pratnám pratnavát paritaṃsayádhyai sá no vakṣad animānáḥ suváhmā- -índro víśvāny áti durgáhāṇi
stanzas.translation: Him will we fit for you with new devotion, the strongest Ancient One, in ancient manner. So may that Indra, boundless, faithful Leader, conduct us o'er all places hard to traverse.

translations.griffith: Him will we fit for you with new devotion, the strongest Ancient One, in ancient manner. So may that Indra, boundless, faithful Leader, conduct us o'er all places hard to traverse.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ जना॑य॒ द्रुह्व॑णे॒ पार्थि॑वानि दि॒व्यानि॑ दीपयो॒ऽन्तरि॑क्षा तपा॑ वृषन्वि॒श्वतः॑ शो॒चिषा॒ तान्ब्र॑ह्म॒द्विषे॑ शोचय॒ क्षाम॒पश्च॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ jánāya drúhvaṇe pā́rthivāni divyā́ni dīpayo 'ntárikṣā tápā vr̥ṣan viśvátaḥ śocíṣā tā́n brahmadvíṣe śocaya kṣā́m apáś ca
stanzas.translation: Thou for the people who oppress hast kindled the earthly firmament and that of heaven. With heat, O Bull, on every side consume them: heat earth and flood for him who hates devotion.

translations.griffith: Thou for the people who oppress hast kindled the earthly firmament and that of heaven. With heat, O Bull, on every side consume them: heat earth and flood for him who hates devotion.

stanzas.sanskrit: भुवो॒ जन॑स्य दि॒व्यस्य॒ राजा॒ पार्थि॑वस्य॒ जग॑तस्त्वेषसंदृक् धि॒ष्व वज्रं॒ दक्षि॑ण इन्द्र॒ हस्ते॒ विश्वा॑ अजुर्य दयसे॒ वि मा॒याः
stanzas.transliteration: bhúvo jánasya divyásya rā́jā pā́rthivasya jágatas tveṣasaṃdr̥k dhiṣvá vájraṃ dákṣiṇa indra háste víśvā ajurya dayase ví māyā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Of all the Heavenly Folk, of earthly creatures thou art the King, O God of splendid aspect. In thy right hand, O Indra, grasp die thunder: Eternal! thou destroyest all enchantments.

translations.griffith: Of all the Heavenly Folk, of earthly creatures thou art the King, O God of splendid aspect. In thy right hand, O Indra, grasp die thunder: Eternal! thou destroyest all enchantments.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ सं॒यत॑मिन्द्र णः स्व॒स्तिं श॑त्रु॒तूर्या॑य बृह॒तीममृ॑ध्राम् यया॒ दासा॒न्यार्या॑णि वृ॒त्रा करो॑ वज्रिन्त्सु॒तुका॒ नाहु॑षाणि
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ saṃyátam indra ṇaḥ svastíṃ śatrutū́ryāya br̥hatī́m ámr̥dhrām yáyā dā́sāny ā́ryāṇi vr̥trā́ káro vajrin sutúkā nā́huṣāṇi
stanzas.translation: Give us confirmed prosperity, O Indra, vast and exhaustless for the foe's subduing. Strengthen therewith the Arya's hate and Dâsa's, and let the arms of Nahushas be mighty.

translations.griffith: Give us confirmed prosperity, O Indra, vast and exhaustless for the foe's subduing. Strengthen therewith the Arya's hate and Dâsa's, and let the arms of Nahushas be mighty.

stanzas.sanskrit: स नो॑ नि॒युद्भिः॑ पुरुहूत वेधो वि॒श्ववा॑राभि॒रा ग॑हि प्रयज्यो न या अदे॑वो॒ वर॑ते॒ न दे॒व आभि॑र्याहि॒ तूय॒मा म॑द्र्य॒द्रिक्
stanzas.transliteration: sá no niyúdbhiḥ puruhūta vedho viśvávārābhir ā́ gahi prayajyo ná yā́ ádevo várate ná deváḥ- ā́bhir yāhi tū́yam ā́ madryadrík
stanzas.translation: Come with thy team which brings all blessings hither, Disposer, much-invoked, exceeding holy. Thou whom no fiend, no God can stay or hinder, come swittly with these Steeds in my direction.

translations.griffith: Come with thy team which brings all blessings hither, Disposer, much-invoked, exceeding holy. Thou whom no fiend, no God can stay or hinder, come swittly with these Steeds in my direction.

stanzas.sanskrit: सु॒त इत्त्वं निमि॑श्ल इन्द्र॒ सोमे॒ स्तोमे॒ ब्रह्म॑णि श॒स्यमा॑न उ॒क्थे यद्वा॑ यु॒क्ताभ्यां॑ मघव॒न्हरि॑भ्यां॒ बिभ्र॒द्वज्रं॑ बा॒ह्वोरि॑न्द्र॒ यासि॑
stanzas.transliteration: sutá ít tváṃ nímiśla indra sóme stóme bráhmaṇi śasyámāna ukthé yád vā yuktā́bhyām maghavan háribhyām bíbhrad vájram bāhvór indra yā́si
stanzas.translation: THOU art attached to pressed-out Soma, Indra, at laud, at prayer, and when the hymn is chanted; Or when with yoked Bays, Maghavan, thou comest, O Indra, bearing in thine arms the thunder.

translations.griffith: THOU art attached to pressed-out Soma, Indra, at laud, at prayer, and when the hymn is chanted; Or when with yoked Bays, Maghavan, thou comest, O Indra, bearing in thine arms the thunder.

stanzas.sanskrit: यद्वा॑ दि॒वि पार्ये॒ सुष्वि॑मिन्द्र वृत्र॒हत्येऽव॑सि॒ शूर॑सातौ यद्वा॒ दक्ष॑स्य बि॒भ्युषो॒ अबि॑भ्य॒दर॑न्धयः॒ शर्ध॑त इन्द्र॒ दस्यू॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: yád vā diví pā́rye súṣvim indra vr̥trahátyé 'vasi śū́rasātau yád vā dákṣasya bibhyúṣo ábibhyad árandhayaḥ śárdhata indra dásyūn
stanzas.translation: Or when on that decisive day thou holpest the presser of the juice at Vr̥itra's slaughter; Or when thou, while the strong one feared, undaunted, gavest to death, Indra, the daring Dasyus.

translations.griffith: Or when on that decisive day thou holpest the presser of the juice at Vr̥itra's slaughter; Or when thou, while the strong one feared, undaunted, gavest to death, Indra, the daring Dasyus.

stanzas.sanskrit: पाता॑ सु॒तमिन्द्रो॑ अस्तु॒ सोमं॑ प्रणे॒नीरु॒ग्रो ज॑रि॒तार॑मू॒ती कर्ता॑ वी॒राय॒ सुष्व॑य उ लो॒कं दाता॒ वसु॑ स्तुव॒ते की॒रये॑ चित्
stanzas.transliteration: pā́tā sutám índro astu sómam praṇenī́r ugró jaritā́ram ūtī́ kártā vīrā́ya súṣvaya ulokáṃ dā́tā vásu stuvaté kīráye cit
stanzas.translation: Let Indra drink the pressed-out Soma, Helper and mighty Guide of him who sings his praises. He gives the hero room who pours oblations, and treasure even to the lowly singer.

translations.griffith: Let Indra drink the pressed-out Soma, Helper and mighty Guide of him who sings his praises. He gives the hero room who pours oblations, and treasure even to the lowly singer.

stanzas.sanskrit: गन्तेया॑न्ति॒ सव॑ना॒ हरि॑भ्यां ब॒भ्रिर्वज्रं॑ प॒पिः सोमं॑ द॒दिर्गाः कर्ता॑ वी॒रं नर्यं॒ सर्व॑वीरं॒ श्रोता॒ हवं॑ गृण॒तः स्तोम॑वाहाः
stanzas.transliteration: gántéyānti sávanā háribhyām babhrír vájram papíḥ sómaṃ dadír gā́ḥ kártā vīráṃ náryaṃ sárvavīraṃ śrótā hávaṃ gr̥ṇatá stómavāhāḥ
stanzas.translation: E'en humble rites with his Bay steeds he visits: he wields the bolt, drinks Soma, gives us cattle. He makes the valiant rich in store of heroes, accepts our praise and hears the singer's calling.

translations.griffith: E'en humble rites with his Bay steeds he visits: he wields the bolt, drinks Soma, gives us cattle. He makes the valiant rich in store of heroes, accepts our praise and hears the singer's calling.

stanzas.sanskrit: अस्मै॑ व॒यं यद्वा॒वान॒ तद्वि॑विष्म॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ यो नः॑ प्र॒दिवो॒ अप॒स्कः सु॒ते सोमे॑ स्तु॒मसि॒ शंस॑दु॒क्थेन्द्रा॑य॒ ब्रह्म॒ वर्ध॑नं॒ यथास॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: ásmai vayáṃ yád vāvā́na tád viviṣmaḥ- índrāya yó naḥ pradívo ápas káḥ suté sóme stumási śáṃsad ukthā́- -índrāya bráhma várdhanaṃ yáthā́sat
stanzas.translation: What he hath longed for we have brought to Indra, who from the days of old hath done us service. While Soma flows we will sing hymn, and laud him, so that our prayer may streng. then Indra's vigour.

translations.griffith: What he hath longed for we have brought to Indra, who from the days of old hath done us service. While Soma flows we will sing hymn, and laud him, so that our prayer may streng. then Indra's vigour.

stanzas.sanskrit: ब्रह्मा॑णि॒ हि च॑कृ॒षे वर्ध॑नानि॒ ताव॑त्त इन्द्र म॒तिभि॑र्विविष्मः सु॒ते सोमे॑ सुतपाः॒ शंत॑मानि॒ राण्ड्या॑ क्रियास्म॒ वक्ष॑णानि य॒ज्ञैः
stanzas.transliteration: bráhmāṇi hí cakr̥ṣé várdhanāni tā́vat ta indra matíbhir viviṣmaḥ suté sóme sutapāḥ śáṃtamāni rā́ṇḍyā kriyāsma vákṣaṇāni yajñaíḥ
stanzas.translation: Thou hast made prayer the means of thine exalting, therefore we wait on thee with hymns, O Indra. May we, by the pressed Soma, Somadrinker! bring thee, with sacrifice, blissful sweet refreshment.

translations.griffith: Thou hast made prayer the means of thine exalting, therefore we wait on thee with hymns, O Indra. May we, by the pressed Soma, Somadrinker! bring thee, with sacrifice, blissful sweet refreshment.

stanzas.sanskrit: स नो॑ बोधि पुरो॒ळाशं॒ ररा॑णः॒ पिबा॒ तु सोमं॒ गोऋ॑जीकमिन्द्र एदं ब॒र्हिर्यज॑मानस्य सीदो॒रुं कृ॑धि त्वाय॒त उ॑ लो॒कम्
stanzas.transliteration: sá no bodhi puroḷā́śaṃ rárāṇaḥ píbā tú sómaṃ gór̥jīkam indra édám barhír yájamānasya sīda- -urúṃ kr̥dhi tvāyatá ulokám
stanzas.translation: Mark well our sacrificial cake, delighted Indra, drink Soma and the milk commingled. Here on the sacrificer's grass be seated: give ample room to thy devoted servant.

translations.griffith: Mark well our sacrificial cake, delighted Indra, drink Soma and the milk commingled. Here on the sacrificer's grass be seated: give ample room to thy devoted servant.

stanzas.sanskrit: स म॑न्दस्वा॒ ह्यनु॒ जोष॑मुग्र॒ प्र त्वा॑ य॒ज्ञास॑ इ॒मे अ॑श्नुवन्तु प्रेमे हवा॑सः पुरुहू॒तम॒स्मे आ त्वे॒यं धीरव॑स इन्द्र यम्याः
stanzas.transliteration: sá mandasvā hy ánu jóṣam ugra prá tvā yajñā́sa imé aśnuvantu prémé hávāsaḥ puruhūtám asmé ā́ tveyáṃ dhī́r ávasa indra yamyāḥ
stanzas.translation: O Mighty One, be joyful as thou willest. Let these our sacrifices reach and find thee; And may this hymn and these our invocations turn thee, whom many men invoke, to help us.

translations.griffith: O Mighty One, be joyful as thou willest. Let these our sacrifices reach and find thee; And may this hymn and these our invocations turn thee, whom many men invoke, to help us.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं वः॑ सखायः॒ सं यथा॑ सु॒तेषु॒ सोमे॑भिरीं पृणता भो॒जमिन्द्र॑म् कु॒वित्तस्मा॒ अस॑ति नो॒ भरा॑य॒ न सुष्वि॒मिन्द्रोऽव॑से मृधाति
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ vaḥ sakhāyaḥ sáṃ yáthā sutéṣu sómebhir īm pr̥ṇatā bhojám índram kuvít tásmā ásati no bhárāya ná súṣvim índró 'vase mr̥dhāti
stanzas.translation: Friends, when thejuices flow, replenish duly your own, your bounteous Indra with the Soma. Will it not aid him to support us? Indra. spares him who sheds the juice to win his favour.

translations.griffith: Friends, when thejuices flow, replenish duly your own, your bounteous Indra with the Soma. Will it not aid him to support us? Indra. spares him who sheds the juice to win his favour.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वेदिन्द्रः॑ सु॒ते अ॑स्तावि॒ सोमे॑ भ॒रद्वा॑जेषु॒ क्षय॒दिन्म॒घोनः॑ अस॒द्यथा॑ जरि॒त्र उ॒त सू॒रिरिन्द्रो॑ रा॒यो वि॒श्ववा॑रस्य दा॒ता
stanzas.transliteration: evéd índraḥ suté astāvi sóme bharádvājeṣu kṣáyad ín maghónaḥ ásad yáthā jaritrá utá sūrír índro rāyó viśvávārasya dātā́
stanzas.translation: While Soma flowed, thus Indra hath been lauded, Ruler of nobles, mid the Bharadvâjas, That Indra may become the singer's patron and give him wealth in every kind of treasure.

translations.griffith: While Soma flowed, thus Indra hath been lauded, Ruler of nobles, mid the Bharadvâjas, That Indra may become the singer's patron and give him wealth in every kind of treasure.

stanzas.sanskrit: वृषा॒ मद॒ इन्द्रे॒ श्लोक॑ उ॒क्था सचा॒ सोमे॑षु सुत॒पा ऋ॑जी॒षी अ॒र्च॒त्र्यो॑ म॒घवा॒ नृभ्य॑ उ॒क्थैर्द्यु॒क्षो राजा॑ गि॒रामक्षि॑तोतिः
stanzas.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣā máda índre ślóka ukthā́ sácā sómeṣu sutapā́ r̥jīṣī́ arcatryò maghávā nŕ̥bhya ukthaír dyukṣó rā́jā girā́m ákṣitotiḥ
stanzas.translation: STRONG rapturous joy, praise, glory are with Indra: impetuous God, he quaffs the juice of Soma: That Maghavan whom men must laud with singing, Heaven-dweller, King of songs, whose help is lasting.

translations.griffith: STRONG rapturous joy, praise, glory are with Indra: impetuous God, he quaffs the juice of Soma: That Maghavan whom men must laud with singing, Heaven-dweller, King of songs, whose help is lasting.

stanzas.sanskrit: ततु॑रिर्वी॒रो नर्यो॒ विचे॑ताः॒ श्रोता॒ हवं॑ गृण॒त उ॒र्व्यू॑तिः वसुः॒ शंसो॑ न॒रां का॒रुधा॑या वा॒जी स्तु॒तो वि॒दथे॑ दाति॒ वाज॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: táturir vīró náryo vícetāḥ śrótā hávaṃ gr̥ṇatá urvyū̀tiḥ vásuḥ śáṃso narā́ṃ kārúdhāyāḥ- vājī́ stutó vidáthe dāti vā́jam
stanzas.translation: He, Friend of man, most wise, victorious Hero, hears, with far-reaching aid, the singer call him. Excellent, Praise of Men, the bard's Supporter, Strong, he gives strength, extolled in holy synod.

translations.griffith: He, Friend of man, most wise, victorious Hero, hears, with far-reaching aid, the singer call him. Excellent, Praise of Men, the bard's Supporter, Strong, he gives strength, extolled in holy synod.

stanzas.sanskrit: अक्षो॒ न च॒क्र्योः॑ शूर बृ॒हन्प्र ते॑ म॒ह्ना रि॑रिचे॒ रोद॑स्योः वृ॒क्षस्य॒ नु ते॑ पुरुहूत व॒या व्यू॒३॒॑तयो॑ रुरुहुरिन्द्र पू॒र्वीः
stanzas.transliteration: ákṣo ná cakryòḥ śūra br̥hán prá te mahnā́ ririce ródasyoḥ vr̥kṣásya nú te puruhūta vayā́ḥ- vy ū̀táyo ruruhur indra pūrvī́ḥ
stanzas.translation: The lofty axle of thy wheels, O Hero, is not surpassed by heaven and earth in greatness. Like branches of a tree, Invoked of many manifold aids spring forth from thee, O Indra.

translations.griffith: The lofty axle of thy wheels, O Hero, is not surpassed by heaven and earth in greatness. Like branches of a tree, Invoked of many manifold aids spring forth from thee, O Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: शची॑वतस्ते पुरुशाक॒ शाका॒ गवा॑मिव स्रु॒तयः॑ सं॒चर॑णीः व॒त्सानां॒ न त॒न्तय॑स्त इन्द्र॒ दाम॑न्वन्तो अदा॒मानः॑ सुदामन्
stanzas.transliteration: śácīvatas te puruśāka śā́kāḥ- gávām iva srutáyaḥ saṃcáraṇīḥ vatsā́nāṃ ná tantáyas ta indra dā́manvanto adāmā́naḥ sudāman
stanzas.translation: Strong Lord, thine energies, endowed with vigour, are like the paths of kine converging homeward. Like bonds of cord, Indra, that bind the younglings, no bonds are they, O thou of boundless bounty.

translations.griffith: Strong Lord, thine energies, endowed with vigour, are like the paths of kine converging homeward. Like bonds of cord, Indra, that bind the younglings, no bonds are they, O thou of boundless bounty.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒न्यद॒द्य कर्व॑रम॒न्यदु॒ श्वोऽस॑च्च॒ सन्मुहु॑राच॒क्रिरिन्द्रः॑ मि॒त्रो नो॒ अत्र॒ वरु॑णश्च पू॒षार्यो वश॑स्य पर्ये॒तास्ति॑
stanzas.transliteration: anyád adyá kárvaram anyád u śvó -ásac ca sán múhur ācakrír índraḥ mitró no átra váruṇaś ca pūṣā́- -aryó váśasya paryetā́sti
stanzas.translation: One act to-day, another act tomorrow oft Indra makes what is not yet existeni. Here have we Mitra, Varuṇa, and Pûshan to overcome the foeman's domination.

translations.griffith: One act to-day, another act tomorrow oft Indra makes what is not yet existeni. Here have we Mitra, Varuṇa, and Pûshan to overcome the foeman's domination.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि त्वदापो॒ न पर्व॑तस्य पृ॒ष्ठादु॒क्थेभि॑रिन्द्रानयन्त य॒ज्ञैः तं त्वा॒भिः सु॑ष्टु॒तिभि॑र्वा॒जय॑न्त आ॒जिं न ज॑ग्मुर्गिर्वाहो॒ अश्वाः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ví tvád ā́po ná párvatasya pr̥ṣṭhā́d ukthébhir indrānayanta yajñaíḥ táṃ tvābhíḥ suṣṭutíbhir vājáyantaḥ- ājíṃ ná jagmur girvāho áśvāḥ
stanzas.translation: By song and sacrifice men brought the waters from thee, as from a mountain's ridge, O Indra. Urging thy might, with these fair lauds they seek thee, O theme of song, as horses rush tobattle.

translations.griffith: By song and sacrifice men brought the waters from thee, as from a mountain's ridge, O Indra. Urging thy might, with these fair lauds they seek thee, O theme of song, as horses rush tobattle.

stanzas.sanskrit: न यं जर॑न्ति श॒रदो॒ न मासा॒ न द्याव॒ इन्द्र॑मवक॒र्शय॑न्ति वृ॒द्धस्य॑ चिद्वर्धतामस्य त॒नूः स्तोमे॑भिरु॒क्थैश्च॑ श॒स्यमा॑ना
stanzas.transliteration: ná yáṃ járanti śarádo ná mā́sāḥ- ná dyā́va índram avakarśáyanti vr̥ddhásya cid vardhatām asya tanū́ḥ- stómebhir ukthaíś ca śasyámānā
stanzas.translation: That Indra whom nor months nor autumn seasons wither with age, nor fleeting days enfeeble,– Still may his body Wax, e'en now so mighty, glorified by the lauds and hymns that praise him.

translations.griffith: That Indra whom nor months nor autumn seasons wither with age, nor fleeting days enfeeble,– Still may his body Wax, e'en now so mighty, glorified by the lauds and hymns that praise him.

stanzas.sanskrit: न वी॒ळवे॒ नम॑ते॒ न स्थि॒राय॒ न शर्ध॑ते॒ दस्यु॑जूताय स्त॒वान् अज्रा॒ इन्द्र॑स्य गि॒रय॑श्चिदृ॒ष्वा ग॑म्भी॒रे चि॑द्भवति गा॒धम॑स्मै
stanzas.transliteration: ná vīḷáve námate ná sthirā́ya ná śárdhate dásyujūtāya stavā́n ájrā índrasya giráyaś cid r̥ṣvā́ḥ- gambhīré cid bhavati gādhám asmai
stanzas.translation: Extolled, he bends not to the strong, the steadfast, nor to the bold incited by the Dasyu. High mountains are as level plains to Indra: even in the deep he finds firm ground to rest on.

translations.griffith: Extolled, he bends not to the strong, the steadfast, nor to the bold incited by the Dasyu. High mountains are as level plains to Indra: even in the deep he finds firm ground to rest on.

stanzas.sanskrit: ग॒म्भी॒रेण॑ न उ॒रुणा॑मत्रि॒न्प्रेषो य॑न्धि सुतपाव॒न्वाजा॑न् स्था ऊ॒ षु ऊ॒र्ध्व ऊ॒ती अरि॑षण्यन्न॒क्तोर्व्यु॑ष्टौ॒ परि॑तक्म्यायाम्
stanzas.transliteration: gambhīréṇa na urúṇāmatrin préṣó yandhi sutapāvan vā́jān sthā́ ū ṣú ūrdhvá ūtī́ áriṣaṇyann aktór vyùṣṭau páritakmyāyām
stanzas.translation: Impetuous Speeder through all depth and distance, give strengthening food, thou drinker of the juices. Stand up erect to help us, unreluctant, what time the gloom of night brightens to morning.

translations.griffith: Impetuous Speeder through all depth and distance, give strengthening food, thou drinker of the juices. Stand up erect to help us, unreluctant, what time the gloom of night brightens to morning.

stanzas.sanskrit: सच॑स्व ना॒यमव॑से अ॒भीक॑ इ॒तो वा॒ तमि॑न्द्र पाहि रि॒षः अ॒मा चै॑न॒मर॑ण्ये पाहि रि॒षो मदे॑म श॒तहि॑माः सु॒वीराः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sácasva nāyám ávase abhī́ke- itó vā tám indra pāhi riṣáḥ amā́ cainam áraṇye pāhi riṣó mádema śatáhimāḥ suvī́rāḥ
stanzas.translation: Hasting to help, come hither and protect him, keep him from harm when he is here, O Indra. At home, abroad, from injury preserve him. May brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.

translations.griffith: Hasting to help, come hither and protect him, keep him from harm when he is here, O Indra. At home, abroad, from injury preserve him. May brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.

stanzas.sanskrit: या त॑ ऊ॒तिर॑व॒मा या प॑र॒मा या म॑ध्य॒मेन्द्र॑ शुष्मि॒न्नस्ति॑ ताभि॑रू॒ षु वृ॑त्र॒हत्ये॑ऽवीर्न ए॒भिश्च॒ वाजै॑र्म॒हान्न॑ उग्र
stanzas.transliteration: yā́ ta ūtír avamā́ yā́ paramā́ yā́ madhyaméndra śuṣminn ásti tā́bhir ū ṣú vr̥trahátye 'vīr naḥ- ebhíś ca vā́jair mahā́n na ugra
stanzas.translation: WITH thine assistance, O thou Mighty Indra, be it the least, the midmost, or the highest,– Great with those aids and by these powers support us, Strong God! in battle that subdues our foemen.

translations.griffith: WITH thine assistance, O thou Mighty Indra, be it the least, the midmost, or the highest,– Great with those aids and by these powers support us, Strong God! in battle that subdues our foemen.

stanzas.sanskrit: आभिः॒ स्पृधो॑ मिथ॒तीररि॑षण्यन्न॒मित्र॑स्य व्यथया म॒न्युमि॑न्द्र आभि॒र्विश्वा॑ अभि॒युजो॒ विषू॑ची॒रार्या॑य॒ विशोऽव॑ तारी॒र्दासीः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́bhi spŕ̥dho mithatī́r áriṣaṇyann amítrasya vyathayā manyúm indra ā́bhir víśvā abhiyújo víṣūcīr ā́ryāya víśó 'va tārīr dā́sīḥ
stanzas.translation: With these discomfit hosts that fight against us, and check the opponent's wrath, thyself uninjured. With these chase all our foes to every quarter: subdue the tribes of Dâsas to the Ârya.

translations.griffith: With these discomfit hosts that fight against us, and check the opponent's wrath, thyself uninjured. With these chase all our foes to every quarter: subdue the tribes of Dâsas to the Ârya.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॑ जा॒मय॑ उ॒त येऽजा॑मयोऽर्वाची॒नासो॑ व॒नुषो॑ युयु॒ज्रे त्वमे॑षां विथु॒रा शवां॑सि ज॒हि वृष्ण्या॑नि कृणु॒ही परा॑चः
stanzas.transliteration: índra jāmáya utá yé 'jāmayo -arvācīnā́so vanúṣo yuyujré tvám eṣāṃ vithurā́ śávāṃsi jahí vŕ̥ṣṇyāni kr̥ṇuhī́ párācaḥ
stanzas.translation: Those who array themselves as foes to smite us, O Indra, be they kin or be they strangers,– Strike thou their manly strength that it be feeble, and drive in headlong flight our foemen backward.

translations.griffith: Those who array themselves as foes to smite us, O Indra, be they kin or be they strangers,– Strike thou their manly strength that it be feeble, and drive in headlong flight our foemen backward.

stanzas.sanskrit: शूरो॑ वा॒ शूरं॑ वनते॒ शरी॑रैस्तनू॒रुचा॒ तरु॑षि॒ यत्कृ॒ण्वैते॑ तो॒के वा॒ गोषु॒ तन॑ये॒ यद॒प्सु वि क्रन्द॑सी उ॒र्वरा॑सु॒ ब्रवै॑ते
stanzas.transliteration: śū́ro vā śū́raṃ vanate śárīrais tanūrúcā táruṣi yát kr̥ṇvaíte toké vā góṣu tánaye yád apsú ví krándasī urvárāsu brávaite
stanzas.translation: With strength of limb the hero slays the hero, when bright in arms they range them for the combat. When two opposing hosts contend in battle for seed and offspring, waters, kine, or corn-lands.

translations.griffith: With strength of limb the hero slays the hero, when bright in arms they range them for the combat. When two opposing hosts contend in battle for seed and offspring, waters, kine, or corn-lands.

stanzas.sanskrit: न॒हि त्वा॒ शूरो॒ न तु॒रो न धृ॒ष्णुर्न त्वा॑ यो॒धो मन्य॑मानो यु॒योध॑ इन्द्र॒ नकि॑ष्ट्वा॒ प्रत्य॑स्त्येषां॒ विश्वा॑ जा॒तान्य॒भ्य॑सि॒ तानि॑
stanzas.transliteration: nahí tvā śū́ro ná turó ná dhr̥ṣṇúr ná tvā yodhó mányamāno yuyódha índra nákiṣ ṭvā práty asty eṣāṃ víśvā jātā́ny abhy àsi tā́ni
stanzas.translation: Yet no strong man hath conquered thee, no hero, no brave, no warrior trusting in his valour. Not one of these is match for thee, O Indra. Thou far surpassest all these living creatures.

translations.griffith: Yet no strong man hath conquered thee, no hero, no brave, no warrior trusting in his valour. Not one of these is match for thee, O Indra. Thou far surpassest all these living creatures.

stanzas.sanskrit: स प॑त्यत उ॒भयो॑र्नृ॒म्णम॒योर्यदी॑ वे॒धसः॑ समि॒थे हव॑न्ते वृ॒त्रे वा॑ म॒हो नृ॒वति॒ क्षये॑ वा॒ व्यच॑स्वन्ता॒ यदि॑ वितन्त॒सैते॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá patyata ubháyor nr̥mṇám ayór yádī vedhásaḥ samithé hávante vr̥tré vā mahó nr̥váti kṣáye vā vyácasvantā yádi vitantasaíte
stanzas.translation: He is the Lord of both these armies' valour when the commanders call them to the conflict: When with their ranks expanded they are fighting with a great foe or for a home with heroes.

translations.griffith: He is the Lord of both these armies' valour when the commanders call them to the conflict: When with their ranks expanded they are fighting with a great foe or for a home with heroes.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध॑ स्मा ते चर्ष॒णयो॒ यदेजा॒निन्द्र॑ त्रा॒तोत भ॑वा वरू॒ता अ॒स्माका॑सो॒ ये नृत॑मासो अ॒र्य इन्द्र॑ सू॒रयो॑ दधि॒रे पु॒रो नः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ádha smā te carṣaṇáyo yád éjān índra trātótá bhavā varūtā́ asmā́kāso yé nŕ̥tamāso aryáḥ- índra sūráyo dadhiré puró naḥ
stanzas.translation: And when the people stir themselves for battle, be thou their saviour, Indra, and protector, And theirs, thy manliest of our friends, the pious, the chiefs who have installed us priests, O Indra.

translations.griffith: And when the people stir themselves for battle, be thou their saviour, Indra, and protector, And theirs, thy manliest of our friends, the pious, the chiefs who have installed us priests, O Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: अनु॑ ते दायि म॒ह इ॑न्द्रि॒याय॑ स॒त्रा ते॒ विश्व॒मनु॑ वृत्र॒हत्ये॑ अनु॑ क्ष॒त्रमनु॒ सहो॑ यज॒त्रेन्द्र॑ दे॒वेभि॒रनु॑ ते नृ॒षह्ये॑
stanzas.transliteration: ánu te dāyi mahá indriyā́ya satrā́ te víśvam ánu vr̥trahátye ánu kṣatrám ánu sáho yajatra- -índra devébhir ánu te nr̥ṣáhye
stanzas.translation: To thee for high dominion hath been for evermore, for slaughtering the Vr̥itras, All lordly power and might, O Holy Indra, given by Gods for victory in battle.

translations.griffith: To thee for high dominion hath been for evermore, for slaughtering the Vr̥itras, All lordly power and might, O Holy Indra, given by Gods for victory in battle.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वा नः॒ स्पृधः॒ सम॑जा स॒मत्स्विन्द्र॑ रार॒न्धि मि॑थ॒तीरदे॑वीः वि॒द्याम॒ वस्तो॒रव॑सा गृ॒णन्तो॑ भ॒रद्वा॑जा उ॒त त॑ इन्द्र नू॒नम्
stanzas.transliteration: evā́ na spŕ̥dhaḥ sám ajā samátsu- índra rārandhí mithatī́r ádevīḥ vidyā́ma vástor ávasā gr̥ṇánto bharádvājā utá ta indra nūnám
stanzas.translation: So urge our hosts together in the combats: yield up the godless bands that fight against us. Singing, at morn may we find thee with favour, yea, Indra, and e'en now, we Bharadvâjas.

translations.griffith: So urge our hosts together in the combats: yield up the godless bands that fight against us. Singing, at morn may we find thee with favour, yea, Indra, and e'en now, we Bharadvâjas.

stanzas.sanskrit: श्रु॒धी न॑ इन्द्र॒ ह्वया॑मसि त्वा म॒हो वाज॑स्य सा॒तौ वा॑वृषा॒णाः सं यद्विशोऽय॑न्त॒ शूर॑साता उ॒ग्रं नोऽवः॒ पार्ये॒ अह॑न्दाः
stanzas.transliteration: śrudhī́ na indra hváyāmasi tvā mahó vā́jasya sātaú vāvr̥ṣāṇā́ḥ sáṃ yád víśó 'yanta śū́rasātau- ugráṃ nó 'vaḥ pā́rye áhan dāḥ
stanzas.translation: O INDRA, hear us. Raining down the Soma, we call on thee to win us mighty valour. Give us strong succour on the day of trial, when the tribes gather on the field of battle.

translations.griffith: O INDRA, hear us. Raining down the Soma, we call on thee to win us mighty valour. Give us strong succour on the day of trial, when the tribes gather on the field of battle.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वां वा॒जी ह॑वते वाजिने॒यो म॒हो वाज॑स्य॒ गध्य॑स्य सा॒तौ त्वां वृ॒त्रेष्वि॑न्द्र॒ सत्प॑तिं॒ तरु॑त्रं॒ त्वां च॑ष्टे मुष्टि॒हा गोषु॒ युध्य॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́ṃ vājī́ havate vājineyó mahó vā́jasya gádhyasya sātaú tvā́ṃ vr̥tréṣv indra sátpatiṃ tárutraṃ tvā́ṃ caṣṭe muṣṭihā́ góṣu yúdhyan
stanzas.translation: The warrior, son of warrior sire, invokes thee, to gain great strength that may be won as booty: To thee, the brave man's Lord, the fiends' subduer, he looks when fighting hand to hand for cattle.

translations.griffith: The warrior, son of warrior sire, invokes thee, to gain great strength that may be won as booty: To thee, the brave man's Lord, the fiends' subduer, he looks when fighting hand to hand for cattle.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं क॒विं चो॑दयो॒ऽर्कसा॑तौ॒ त्वं कुत्सा॑य॒ शुष्णं॑ दा॒शुषे॑ वर्क् त्वं शिरो॑ अम॒र्मणः॒ परा॑हन्नतिथि॒ग्वाय॒ शंस्यं॑ करि॒ष्यन्
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ kavíṃ codayo 'rkásātau tváṃ kútsāya śúṣṇaṃ dāśúṣe vark tváṃ śíro amarmáṇaḥ párāhann atithigvā́ya śáṃsyaṃ kariṣyán
stanzas.translation: Thou didst impel the sage to win the daylight, didst ruin Ṣushṇa for the pious Kutsa. The invulnerable demon's head thou clavest when thou wouldst win the praise of Âtithigva.

translations.griffith: Thou didst impel the sage to win the daylight, didst ruin Ṣushṇa for the pious Kutsa. The invulnerable demon's head thou clavest when thou wouldst win the praise of Âtithigva.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं रथं॒ प्र भ॑रो यो॒धमृ॒ष्वमावो॒ युध्य॑न्तं वृष॒भं दश॑द्युम् त्वं तुग्रं॑ वेत॒सवे॒ सचा॑ह॒न्त्वं तुजिं॑ गृ॒णन्त॑मिन्द्र तूतोः
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ rátham prá bharo yodhám r̥ṣvám ā́vo yúdhyantaṃ vr̥ṣabháṃ dáśadyum tváṃ túgraṃ vetasáve sácāhan tváṃ tújiṃ gr̥ṇántam indra tūtoḥ
stanzas.translation: The lofty battle-car thou broughtest forward; thou holpest Daṣadyu the strong when fighting. Along with Vetasu thou slewest Tugra, and madest Tuji strong, who praised thee, Indra.

translations.griffith: The lofty battle-car thou broughtest forward; thou holpest Daṣadyu the strong when fighting. Along with Vetasu thou slewest Tugra, and madest Tuji strong, who praised thee, Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं तदु॒क्थमि॑न्द्र ब॒र्हणा॑ कः॒ प्र यच्छ॒ता स॒हस्रा॑ शूर॒ दर्षि॑ अव॑ गि॒रेर्दासं॒ शम्ब॑रं ह॒न्प्रावो॒ दिवो॑दासं चि॒त्राभि॑रू॒ती
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ tád ukthám indra barháṇā kaḥ prá yác chatā́ sahásrā śūra dárṣi áva girér dā́saṃ śámbaraṃ han prā́vo dívodāsaṃ citrā́bhir ūtī́
stanzas.translation: Thou madest good the laud, what time thou rentest a hundred thousand fighting foes, O Hero, Slewest the Dâsa Ṣambara of the mountain, and with strange aids didst succour Divodâsa.

translations.griffith: Thou madest good the laud, what time thou rentest a hundred thousand fighting foes, O Hero, Slewest the Dâsa Ṣambara of the mountain, and with strange aids didst succour Divodâsa.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं श्र॒द्धाभि॑र्मन्दसा॒नः सोमै॑र्द॒भीत॑ये॒ चुमु॑रिमिन्द्र सिष्वप् त्वं र॒जिं पिठी॑नसे दश॒स्यन्त्श॒ष्टिं स॒हस्रा॒ शच्या॒ सचा॑हन्
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ śraddhā́bhir mandasānáḥ sómair dabhī́taye cúmurim indra siṣvap tváṃ rajím píṭhīnase daśasyán ṣaṣṭíṃ sahásrā śácyā sácāhan
stanzas.translation: Made glad with Soma-draughts and faith, thou sentest Chumuri to his sleep, to please Dabhîti. Thou, kindly giving Raji to Piṭhînas, slewest with might, at once, the sixty thousand.

translations.griffith: Made glad with Soma-draughts and faith, thou sentest Chumuri to his sleep, to please Dabhîti. Thou, kindly giving Raji to Piṭhînas, slewest with might, at once, the sixty thousand.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒हं च॒न तत्सू॒रिभि॑रानश्यां॒ तव॒ ज्याय॑ इन्द्र सु॒म्नमोजः॑ त्वया॒ यत्स्तव॑न्ते सधवीर वी॒रास्त्रि॒वरू॑थेन॒ नहु॑षा शविष्ठ
stanzas.transliteration: aháṃ caná tát sūríbhir ānaśyāṃ táva jyā́ya indra sumnám ójaḥ tváyā yát stávante sadhavīra vīrā́s trivárūthena náhuṣā śaviṣṭha
stanzas.translation: May I too, with the liberal chiefs, O Indra, acquire thy blin supreme and domination, When, Mightiest! Hero-girt! Nahusha heroes boast them in thee, the triply-strong Defender.

translations.griffith: May I too, with the liberal chiefs, O Indra, acquire thy blin supreme and domination, When, Mightiest! Hero-girt! Nahusha heroes boast them in thee, the triply-strong Defender.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒यं ते॑ अ॒स्यामि॑न्द्र द्यु॒म्नहू॑तौ॒ सखा॑यः स्याम महिन॒ प्रेष्ठाः॑ प्रात॑र्दनिः क्षत्र॒श्रीर॑स्तु॒ श्रेष्ठो॑ घ॒ने वृ॒त्राणां॑ स॒नये॒ धना॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: vayáṃ te asyā́m indra dyumnáhūtau sákhāyaḥ syāma mahina préṣṭhāḥ prā́tardaniḥ kṣatraśrī́r astu śréṣṭho ghané vr̥trā́ṇāṃ sanáye dhánānām
stanzas.translation: So may we he thy friends, thy best beloved, O Indra, at this holy invocation. Best be Pratardani, illustrious ruler, in slaying foemen and in gaining riches.

translations.griffith: So may we he thy friends, thy best beloved, O Indra, at this holy invocation. Best be Pratardani, illustrious ruler, in slaying foemen and in gaining riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: किम॑स्य॒ मदे॒ किम्व॑स्य पी॒ताविन्द्रः॒ किम॑स्य स॒ख्ये च॑कार रणा॑ वा॒ ये नि॒षदि॒ किं ते अ॑स्य पु॒रा वि॑विद्रे॒ किमु॒ नूत॑नासः
stanzas.transliteration: kím asya máde kím v asya pītā́v índraḥ kím asya sakhyé cakāra ráṇā vā yé niṣádi kíṃ té asya purā́ vividre kím u nū́tanāsaḥ
stanzas.translation: WHAT deed hath Indra done in the wild transport, in quaffing or in friendship with, the Soma? What joys have men of ancient times or recent obtained within the chamber of libation?

translations.griffith: WHAT deed hath Indra done in the wild transport, in quaffing or in friendship with, the Soma? What joys have men of ancient times or recent obtained within the chamber of libation?

stanzas.sanskrit: सद॑स्य॒ मदे॒ सद्व॑स्य पी॒ताविन्द्रः॒ सद॑स्य स॒ख्ये च॑कार रणा॑ वा॒ ये नि॒षदि॒ सत्ते अ॑स्य पु॒रा वि॑विद्रे॒ सदु॒ नूत॑नासः
stanzas.transliteration: sád asya máde sád v asya pītā́v índraḥ sád asya sakhyé cakāra ráṇā vā yé niṣádi sát té asya purā́ vividre sád u nū́tanāsaḥ
stanzas.translation: In its wild joy Indra hath proved him faithful, faithful in quaffing, faithful in its friendship. His truth is the delight that in this chamber the men of old and recent times have tasted.

translations.griffith: In its wild joy Indra hath proved him faithful, faithful in quaffing, faithful in its friendship. His truth is the delight that in this chamber the men of old and recent times have tasted.

stanzas.sanskrit: न॒हि नु ते॑ महि॒मनः॑ समस्य॒ न म॑घवन्मघव॒त्त्वस्य॑ वि॒द्म न राध॑सोराधसो॒ नूत॑न॒स्येन्द्र॒ नकि॑र्ददृश इन्द्रि॒यं ते॑
stanzas.transliteration: nahí nú te mahimánaḥ samasya ná maghavan maghavattvásya vidmá ná rā́dhaso-rādhaso nū́tanasya- -índra nákir dadr̥śa indriyáṃ te
stanzas.translation: All thy vast power, O Maghavan, we know not, know not the riches of thy full abundance. No one hath seen that might of thine, productive of bounty every day renewed, O Indra.

translations.griffith: All thy vast power, O Maghavan, we know not, know not the riches of thy full abundance. No one hath seen that might of thine, productive of bounty every day renewed, O Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒तत्त्यत्त॑ इन्द्रि॒यम॑चेति॒ येनाव॑धीर्व॒रशि॑खस्य॒ शेषः॑ वज्र॑स्य॒ यत्ते॒ निह॑तस्य॒ शुष्मा॑त्स्व॒नाच्चि॑दिन्द्र पर॒मो द॒दार॑
stanzas.transliteration: etát tyát ta indriyám aceti yénā́vadhīr varáśikhasya śéṣaḥ vájrasya yát te níhatasya śúṣmāt svanā́c cid indra paramó dadā́ra
stanzas.translation: This one great power of thine our eyes have witnessed, wherewith thou slewest Varaṣikha's children, When by the force of thy descending thunder, at the mere solund, their boldest was demolished.

translations.griffith: This one great power of thine our eyes have witnessed, wherewith thou slewest Varaṣikha's children, When by the force of thy descending thunder, at the mere solund, their boldest was demolished.

stanzas.sanskrit: वधी॒दिन्द्रो॑ व॒रशि॑खस्य॒ शेषो॑ऽभ्याव॒र्तिने॑ चायमा॒नाय॒ शिक्ष॑न् वृ॒चीव॑तो॒ यद्ध॑रियू॒पीया॑यां॒ हन्पूर्वे॒ अर्धे॑ भि॒यसाप॑रो॒ दर्त्
stanzas.transliteration: vádhīd índro varáśikhasya śéṣo -abhyāvartíne cāyamānā́ya śíkṣan vr̥cī́vato yád dhariyūpī́yāyāṃ hán pū́rve árdhe bhiyásā́paro dárt
stanzas.translation: In aid of Abhyâvartin Châyamâna, Indra destroyed the seed of Varaṣikha. At Hariyûpîyâ he smote the vanguard of the Vr̥ichîvans, and the rear fled frighted.

translations.griffith: In aid of Abhyâvartin Châyamâna, Indra destroyed the seed of Varaṣikha. At Hariyûpîyâ he smote the vanguard of the Vr̥ichîvans, and the rear fled frighted.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्रिं॒शच्छ॑तं व॒र्मिण॑ इन्द्र सा॒कं य॒व्याव॑त्यां पुरुहूत श्रव॒स्या वृ॒चीव॑न्तः॒ शर॑वे॒ पत्य॑मानाः॒ पात्रा॑ भिन्दा॒ना न्य॒र्थान्या॑यन्
stanzas.transliteration: triṃśácchataṃ varmíṇa indra sākáṃ yavyā́vatyām puruhūta śravasyā́ vr̥cī́vantaḥ śárave pátyamānāḥ pā́trā bhindānā́ nyarthā́ny āyan
stanzas.translation: Three thousand, mailed, in quest of fame, together, on the Yavyâvatî, O much-sought Indra, Vr̥ichîvan's sons, falling before the arrow, like bursting vessels went to their destruction.

translations.griffith: Three thousand, mailed, in quest of fame, together, on the Yavyâvatî, O much-sought Indra, Vr̥ichîvan's sons, falling before the arrow, like bursting vessels went to their destruction.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्य॒ गावा॑वरु॒षा सू॑यव॒स्यू अ॒न्तरू॒ षु चर॑तो॒ रेरि॑हाणा स सृञ्ज॑याय तु॒र्वशं॒ परा॑दाद्वृ॒चीव॑तो दैववा॒ताय॒ शिक्ष॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: yásya gā́vāv aruṣā́ sūyavasyū́ antár ū ṣú cárato rérihāṇā sá sŕ̥ñjayāya turváśam párādād vr̥cī́vato daivavātā́ya śíkṣan
stanzas.translation: He, whose two red Steers, seeking goodly pasture, plying their tongues move on 'twixt earth and heaven, Gave Turvaṣa to Sr̥injaya, and, to aid him, gave the Vr̥ichîvans up to Daivavata.

translations.griffith: He, whose two red Steers, seeking goodly pasture, plying their tongues move on 'twixt earth and heaven, Gave Turvaṣa to Sr̥injaya, and, to aid him, gave the Vr̥ichîvans up to Daivavata.

stanzas.sanskrit: द्व॒याँ अ॑ग्ने र॒थिनो॑ विंश॒तिं गा व॒धूम॑तो म॒घवा॒ मह्यं॑ स॒म्राट् अ॒भ्या॒व॒र्ती चा॑यमा॒नो द॑दाति दू॒णाशे॒यं दक्षि॑णा पार्थ॒वाना॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: dvayā́m̐ agne rathíno viṃśatíṃ gā́ḥ- vadhū́mato maghávā máhyaṃ samrā́ṭ abhyāvartī́ cāyamānó dadāti dūṇā́śeyáṃ dákṣiṇā pārthavā́nām
stanzas.translation: Two wagon-teams, with damsels, twenty oxen, O Agni, Abhyâvartin Châyamâna, The liberal Sovran, giveth me. This guerdon of Pr̥ithu's seed is hard to win from others.

translations.griffith: Two wagon-teams, with damsels, twenty oxen, O Agni, Abhyâvartin Châyamâna, The liberal Sovran, giveth me. This guerdon of Pr̥ithu's seed is hard to win from others.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ गावो॑ अग्मन्नु॒त भ॒द्रम॑क्र॒न्त्सीद॑न्तु गो॒ष्ठे र॒णय॑न्त्व॒स्मे प्र॒जाव॑तीः पुरु॒रूपा॑ इ॒ह स्यु॒रिन्द्रा॑य पू॒र्वीरु॒षसो॒ दुहा॑नाः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ gā́vo agmann utá bhadrám akran sī́dantu goṣṭhé raṇáyantv asmé prajā́vatīḥ pururū́pā ihá syur índrāya pūrvī́r uṣáso dúhānāḥ
stanzas.translation: THE Kine have come and brought good fortune: let them rest in the cow-pen and be happy near us. Here let them stay prolific, many-coloured, and yield through many morns their milk for Indra.

translations.griffith: THE Kine have come and brought good fortune: let them rest in the cow-pen and be happy near us. Here let them stay prolific, many-coloured, and yield through many morns their milk for Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रो॒ यज्व॑ने पृण॒ते च॑ शिक्ष॒त्युपेद्द॑दाति॒ न स्वं मु॑षायति भूयो॑भूयो र॒यिमिद॑स्य व॒र्धय॒न्नभि॑न्ने खि॒ल्ये नि द॑धाति देव॒युम्
stanzas.transliteration: índro yájvane pr̥ṇaté ca śikṣati- úpéd dadāti ná svám muṣāyati bhū́yo-bhūyo rayím íd asya vardháyann ábhinne khilyé ní dadhāti devayúm
stanzas.translation: Indra aids him who offers sacrifice and gifts: he takes not what is his, and gives him more thereto. Increasing ever more and ever more his wealth, he makes the pious dwell within unbroken bounds.

translations.griffith: Indra aids him who offers sacrifice and gifts: he takes not what is his, and gives him more thereto. Increasing ever more and ever more his wealth, he makes the pious dwell within unbroken bounds.

stanzas.sanskrit: न ता न॑शन्ति॒ न द॑भाति॒ तस्क॑रो॒ नासा॑मामि॒त्रो व्यथि॒रा द॑धर्षति दे॒वाँश्च॒ याभि॒र्यज॑ते॒ ददा॑ति च॒ ज्योगित्ताभिः॑ सचते॒ गोप॑तिः स॒ह
stanzas.transliteration: ná tā́ naśanti ná dabhāti táskaro nā́sām āmitró vyáthir ā́ dadharṣati devā́ṃś ca yā́bhir yájate dádāti ca jyóg ít tā́bhiḥ sacate gópatiḥ sahá
stanzas.translation: These are ne'er lost, no robber ever injures them: no evil-minded foe attempts to harass them. The master of the Kine lives many a year with these, the Cows whereby he pours his gifts and serves the Gods.

translations.griffith: These are ne'er lost, no robber ever injures them: no evil-minded foe attempts to harass them. The master of the Kine lives many a year with these, the Cows whereby he pours his gifts and serves the Gods.

stanzas.sanskrit: न ता अर्वा॑ रे॒णुक॑काटो अश्नुते॒ न सं॑स्कृत॒त्रमुप॑ यन्ति॒ ता अ॒भि उ॒रु॒गा॒यमभ॑यं॒ तस्य॒ ता अनु॒ गावो॒ मर्त॑स्य॒ वि च॑रन्ति॒ यज्व॑नः
stanzas.transliteration: ná tā́ árvā reṇúkakāṭo aśnute ná saṃskr̥tatrám úpa yanti tā́ abhí urugāyám ábhayaṃ tásya tā́ ánu gā́vo mártasya ví caranti yájvanaḥ
stanzas.translation: The charger with his dusty brow o'ertakes them not, and never to the shambles do they take their way. These Cows, the cattle of the pious worshipper, roam over widespread pasture where no danger is.

translations.griffith: The charger with his dusty brow o'ertakes them not, and never to the shambles do they take their way. These Cows, the cattle of the pious worshipper, roam over widespread pasture where no danger is.

stanzas.sanskrit: गावो॒ भगो॒ गाव॒ इन्द्रो॑ मे अच्छा॒न्गावः॒ सोम॑स्य प्रथ॒मस्य॑ भ॒क्षः इ॒मा या गावः॒ स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्र॑ इ॒च्छामीद्धृ॒दा मन॑सा चि॒दिन्द्र॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: gā́vo bhágo gā́va índro me achān gā́vaḥ sómasya prathamásya bhakṣáḥ imā́ yā́ gā́vaḥ sá janāsa índraḥ- ichā́mī́d dhr̥dā́ mánasā cid índram
stanzas.translation: To me the Cows seem Bhaga, they seem Indra, they seem a portion of the first-poured Soma. These present Cows, they, O ye Indra. I long for Indra with my heart and spirit.

translations.griffith: To me the Cows seem Bhaga, they seem Indra, they seem a portion of the first-poured Soma. These present Cows, they, O ye Indra. I long for Indra with my heart and spirit.

stanzas.sanskrit: यू॒यं गा॑वो मेदयथा कृ॒शं चि॑दश्री॒रं चि॑त्कृणुथा सु॒प्रती॑कम् भ॒द्रं गृ॒हं कृ॑णुथ भद्रवाचो बृ॒हद्वो॒ वय॑ उच्यते स॒भासु॑
stanzas.transliteration: yūyáṃ gāvo medayathā kr̥śáṃ cid aśrīráṃ cit kr̥ṇuthā suprátīkam bhadráṃ gr̥háṃ kr̥ṇutha bhadravāco br̥hád vo váya ucyate sabhā́su
stanzas.translation: O Cows, ye fatten e'en the worn and wasted, and make the unlovely beautiful tolook on. Prosper my house, ye with auspicious voices. Your power is glorified in our assemblies.

translations.griffith: O Cows, ye fatten e'en the worn and wasted, and make the unlovely beautiful tolook on. Prosper my house, ye with auspicious voices. Your power is glorified in our assemblies.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र॒जाव॑तीः सू॒यव॑सं रि॒शन्तीः॑ शु॒द्धा अ॒पः सु॑प्रपा॒णे पिब॑न्तीः मा वः॑ स्ते॒न ई॑शत॒ माघशं॑सः॒ परि॑ वो हे॒ती रु॒द्रस्य॑ वृज्याः
stanzas.transliteration: prajā́vatīḥ sūyávasaṃ riśántīḥ śuddhā́ apáḥ suprapāṇé píbantīḥ mā́ va stená īśata mā́gháśaṃsaḥ pári vo hetī́ rudrásya vr̥jyāḥ
stanzas.translation: Crop goodly pasturage and be prolific drink pure sweet water at good drinking places. Never be thief or sinful man your matter, and may the dart of Rudra still avoid you.

translations.griffith: Crop goodly pasturage and be prolific drink pure sweet water at good drinking places. Never be thief or sinful man your matter, and may the dart of Rudra still avoid you.

stanzas.sanskrit: उपे॒दमु॑प॒पर्च॑नमा॒सु गोषूप॑ पृच्यताम् उप॑ ऋष॒भस्य॒ रेत॒स्युपे॑न्द्र॒ तव॑ वी॒र्ये॑
stanzas.transliteration: úpedám upapárcanam āsú góṣū́pa pr̥cyatām úpa r̥ṣabhásya rétasi- úpendra táva vīryè
stanzas.translation: Now let this close admixture be close intermigled with these Cows, Mixt with the Steer's prolific flow, and, Indra, with thy hero might.

translations.griffith: Now let this close admixture be close intermigled with these Cows, Mixt with the Steer's prolific flow, and, Indra, with thy hero might.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रं॑ वो॒ नरः॑ स॒ख्याय॑ सेपुर्म॒हो यन्तः॑ सुम॒तये॑ चका॒नाः म॒हो हि दा॒ता वज्र॑हस्तो॒ अस्ति॑ म॒हामु॑ र॒ण्वमव॑से यजध्वम्
stanzas.transliteration: índraṃ vo náraḥ sakhyā́ya sepur mahó yántaḥ sumatáye cakānā́ḥ mahó hí dātā́ vájrahasto ásti mahā́m u raṇvám ávase yajadhvam
stanzas.translation: YOUR men have followed Indra for his friendship, and for his loving-kindness glorified him. For he bestows great wealth, the Thunder-wielder: worship him, Great and Kind, to win his favour.

translations.griffith: YOUR men have followed Indra for his friendship, and for his loving-kindness glorified him. For he bestows great wealth, the Thunder-wielder: worship him, Great and Kind, to win his favour.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ यस्मि॒न्हस्ते॒ नर्या॑ मिमि॒क्षुरा रथे॑ हिर॒ण्यये॑ रथे॒ष्ठाः आ र॒श्मयो॒ गभ॑स्त्योः स्थू॒रयो॒राध्व॒न्नश्वा॑सो॒ वृष॑णो युजा॒नाः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yásmin háste náryā mimikṣúr ā́ ráthe hiraṇyáye ratheṣṭhā́ḥ ā́ raśmáyo gábhastyo sthūráyor ā́dhvann áśvāso vŕ̥ṣaṇo yujānā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Him to whose hand, men closely cling, and drivers stand on his golden chariot firmly stationed. With his firm arms he holds the reins; his Horses, the Stallions, are yoked ready for the journey.

translations.griffith: Him to whose hand, men closely cling, and drivers stand on his golden chariot firmly stationed. With his firm arms he holds the reins; his Horses, the Stallions, are yoked ready for the journey.

stanzas.sanskrit: श्रि॒ये ते॒ पादा॒ दुव॒ आ मि॑मिक्षुर्धृ॒ष्णुर्व॒ज्री शव॑सा॒ दक्षि॑णावान् वसा॑नो॒ अत्कं॑ सुर॒भिं दृ॒शे कं स्व१॒॑र्ण नृ॑तविषि॒रो ब॑भूथ
stanzas.transliteration: śriyé te pā́dā dúva ā́ mimikṣur dhr̥ṣṇúr vajrī́ śávasā dákṣiṇāvān vásāno átkaṃ surabhíṃ dr̥śé káṃ svàr ṇá nr̥tav iṣiró babhūtha
stanzas.translation: Thy devotees embrace thy feet for glory. Bold, thunder-armed, rich, through thy strength, in guerdon, Robed in a garment fair as heaven to look on, thou hast displayed thee like an active dancer.

translations.griffith: Thy devotees embrace thy feet for glory. Bold, thunder-armed, rich, through thy strength, in guerdon, Robed in a garment fair as heaven to look on, thou hast displayed thee like an active dancer.

stanzas.sanskrit: स सोम॒ आमि॑श्लतमः सु॒तो भू॒द्यस्मि॑न्प॒क्तिः प॒च्यते॒ सन्ति॑ धा॒नाः इन्द्रं॒ नरः॑ स्तु॒वन्तो॑ ब्रह्मका॒रा उ॒क्था शंस॑न्तो दे॒ववा॑ततमाः
stanzas.transliteration: sá sóma ā́miślatamaḥ sutó bhūd yásmin paktíḥ pacyáte sánti dhānā́ḥ índraṃ nára stuvánto brahmakārā́ḥ- ukthā́ śáṃsanto devávātatamāḥ
stanzas.translation: That Soma when effused hath best consistence, for which the food is dressed and grain is mingled; By which the men who pray, extolling Indra chief favourites of Gods, recite their praises.

translations.griffith: That Soma when effused hath best consistence, for which the food is dressed and grain is mingled; By which the men who pray, extolling Indra chief favourites of Gods, recite their praises.

stanzas.sanskrit: न ते॒ अन्तः॒ शव॑सो धाय्य॒स्य वि तु बा॑बधे॒ रोद॑सी महि॒त्वा आ ता सू॒रिः पृ॑णति॒ तूतु॑जानो यू॒थेवा॒प्सु स॒मीज॑मान ऊ॒ती
stanzas.transliteration: ná te ántaḥ śávaso dhāyy asyá ví tú bābadhe ródasī mahitvā́ ā́ tā́ sūríḥ pr̥ṇati tū́tujāno yūthévāpsú samī́jamāna ūtī́
stanzas.translation: No limit of thy might hath been appointed, which by its greatness sundered earth and heaven. These the Prince filleth full with strong endeavour, driving, as 'twere, with help his flocks to waters.

translations.griffith: No limit of thy might hath been appointed, which by its greatness sundered earth and heaven. These the Prince filleth full with strong endeavour, driving, as 'twere, with help his flocks to waters.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वेदिन्द्रः॑ सु॒हव॑ ऋ॒ष्वो अ॑स्तू॒ती अनू॑ती हिरिशि॒प्रः सत्वा॑ ए॒वा हि जा॒तो अस॑मात्योजाः पु॒रू च॑ वृ॒त्रा ह॑नति॒ नि दस्यू॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: evéd índraḥ suháva r̥ṣvó astu- -ūtī́ ánūtī hiriśipráḥ sátvā evā́ hí jātó ásamātyojāḥ purū́ ca vr̥trā́ hanati ní dásyūn
stanzas.translation: So be the lofty Indra prompt to listen, Helper unaided, golden-visored Hero. Yea, so may he, shown forth in might unequalled, smite down the many Vr̥itras and the Dasyus.

translations.griffith: So be the lofty Indra prompt to listen, Helper unaided, golden-visored Hero. Yea, so may he, shown forth in might unequalled, smite down the many Vr̥itras and the Dasyus.

stanzas.sanskrit: भूय॒ इद्वा॑वृधे वी॒र्या॑यँ॒ एको॑ अजु॒र्यो द॑यते॒ वसू॑नि प्र रि॑रिचे दि॒व इन्द्रः॑ पृथि॒व्या अ॒र्धमिद॑स्य॒ प्रति॒ रोद॑सी उ॒भे
stanzas.transliteration: bhū́ya íd vāvr̥dhe vīryā̀yam̐ éko ajuryó dayate vásūni prá ririce divá índraḥ pr̥thivyā́ḥ- ardhám íd asya práti ródasī ubhé
stanzas.translation: INDRA hath waxed yet more for hero prowess, alone, Eternal, he bestoweth treasures. Indra transcendeth both the worlds in greatness: one half of him equalleth earth and heaven.

translations.griffith: INDRA hath waxed yet more for hero prowess, alone, Eternal, he bestoweth treasures. Indra transcendeth both the worlds in greatness: one half of him equalleth earth and heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: अधा॑ मन्ये बृ॒हद॑सु॒र्य॑मस्य॒ यानि॑ दा॒धार॒ नकि॒रा मि॑नाति दि॒वेदि॑वे॒ सूर्यो॑ दर्श॒तो भू॒द्वि सद्मा॑न्युर्वि॒या सु॒क्रतु॑र्धात्
stanzas.transliteration: ádhā manye br̥hád asuryàm asya yā́ni dādhā́ra nákir ā́ mināti divé-dive sū́ryo darśató bhūd ví sádmāny urviyā́ sukrátur dhāt
stanzas.translation: Yea, mighty I esteem his Godlike nature: none hindereth what he hath once determined. Near and afar he spread and set the regions, and every day the Sun became apparent.

translations.griffith: Yea, mighty I esteem his Godlike nature: none hindereth what he hath once determined. Near and afar he spread and set the regions, and every day the Sun became apparent.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒द्या चि॒न्नू चि॒त्तदपो॑ न॒दीनां॒ यदा॑भ्यो॒ अर॑दो गा॒तुमि॑न्द्र नि पर्व॑ता अद्म॒सदो॒ न से॑दु॒स्त्वया॑ दृ॒ळ्हानि॑ सुक्रतो॒ रजां॑सि
stanzas.transliteration: adyā́ cin nū́ cit tád ápo nadī́nāṃ yád ābhyo árado gātúm indra ní párvatā admasádo ná sedus tváyā dr̥ḷhā́ni sukrato rájāṃsi
stanzas.translation: E'en now endures thine exploit of the Rivers, when, Indra, for their floods thou clavest passage. Like men who sit at meat the mountains settled: by thee, Most Wise! the regions were made steadfast.

translations.griffith: E'en now endures thine exploit of the Rivers, when, Indra, for their floods thou clavest passage. Like men who sit at meat the mountains settled: by thee, Most Wise! the regions were made steadfast.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒त्यमित्तन्न त्वावाँ॑ अ॒न्यो अ॒स्तीन्द्र॑ दे॒वो न मर्त्यो॒ ज्याया॑न् अह॒न्नहिं॑ परि॒शया॑न॒मर्णोऽवा॑सृजो अ॒पो अच्छा॑ समु॒द्रम्
stanzas.transliteration: satyám ít tán ná tvā́vām̐ anyó asti- -índra devó ná mártyo jyā́yān áhann áhim pariśáyānam árṇaḥ- -ávāsr̥jo apó áchā samudrám
stanzas.translation: This is the truth, none else is like thee, Indra, no God superior to thee, no mortal. Thou slewest Ahi who besieged the waters, and lettest loose the streams to hurry seaward.

translations.griffith: This is the truth, none else is like thee, Indra, no God superior to thee, no mortal. Thou slewest Ahi who besieged the waters, and lettest loose the streams to hurry seaward.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वम॒पो वि दुरो॒ विषू॑ची॒रिन्द्र॑ दृ॒ळ्हम॑रुजः॒ पर्व॑तस्य राजा॑भवो॒ जग॑तश्चर्षणी॒नां सा॒कं सूर्यं॑ ज॒नय॒न्द्यामु॒षास॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: tvám apó ví dúro víṣūcīr índra dr̥ḷhám arujaḥ párvatasya rā́jābhavo jágataś carṣaṇīnā́ṃ sākáṃ sū́ryaṃ janáyan dyā́m uṣā́sam
stanzas.translation: Indra, thou breakest up the floods and portals on all sides, and the firmness of the mountain. Thou art the King of men, of all that liveth, engendering at once Sun, Heaven, and Morning.

translations.griffith: Indra, thou breakest up the floods and portals on all sides, and the firmness of the mountain. Thou art the King of men, of all that liveth, engendering at once Sun, Heaven, and Morning.

stanzas.sanskrit: अभू॒रेको॑ रयिपते रयी॒णामा हस्त॑योरधिथा इन्द्र कृ॒ष्टीः वि तो॒के अ॒प्सु तन॑ये च॒ सूरेऽवो॑चन्त चर्ष॒णयो॒ विवा॑चः
stanzas.transliteration: ábhūr éko rayipate rayīṇā́m ā́ hástayor adhithā indra kr̥ṣṭī́ḥ ví toké apsú tánaye ca sū́re- -ávocanta carṣaṇáyo vívācaḥ
stanzas.translation: SOLE Lord of wealth art thou, O Lord of riches: thou in thine hands hast held the people, Indra! Men have invoked thee with contending voices for seed and waters, progeny and sunlight.

translations.griffith: SOLE Lord of wealth art thou, O Lord of riches: thou in thine hands hast held the people, Indra! Men have invoked thee with contending voices for seed and waters, progeny and sunlight.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वद्भि॒येन्द्र॒ पार्थि॑वानि॒ विश्वाच्यु॑ता चिच्च्यावयन्ते॒ रजां॑सि द्यावा॒क्षामा॒ पर्व॑तासो॒ वना॑नि॒ विश्वं॑ दृ॒ळ्हं भ॑यते॒ अज्म॒न्ना ते॑
stanzas.transliteration: tvád bhiyéndra pā́rthivāni víśvā- -ácyutā cic cyāvayante rájāṃsi dyā́vākṣā́mā párvatāso vánāni víśvaṃ dr̥ḷhám bhayate ájmann ā́ te
stanzas.translation: Through fear of thee, O Indra, all the regions of earth, though naught may move them, shake and tremble. All that is firm is frightened at thy coming, -the earth, the heaven, the mountain, and the forest.

translations.griffith: Through fear of thee, O Indra, all the regions of earth, though naught may move them, shake and tremble. All that is firm is frightened at thy coming, -the earth, the heaven, the mountain, and the forest.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं कुत्से॑ना॒भि शुष्ण॑मिन्द्रा॒शुषं॑ युध्य॒ कुय॑वं॒ गवि॑ष्टौ दश॑ प्रपि॒त्वे अध॒ सूर्य॑स्य मुषा॒यश्च॒क्रमवि॑वे॒ रपां॑सि
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ kútsenābhí śúṣṇam indra- -aśúṣaṃ yudhya kúyavaṃ gáviṣṭau dáśa prapitvé ádha sū́ryasya muṣāyáś cakrám áviver ápāṃsi
stanzas.translation: With Kutsa, Indra! thou didst conquer Ṣushṇa, voracious, bane of crops, in fight for cattle. In the close fray thou rentest him: thou stolest the Sun's wheel and didst drive away misfortunes.

translations.griffith: With Kutsa, Indra! thou didst conquer Ṣushṇa, voracious, bane of crops, in fight for cattle. In the close fray thou rentest him: thou stolest the Sun's wheel and didst drive away misfortunes.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं श॒तान्यव॒ शम्ब॑रस्य॒ पुरो॑ जघन्थाप्र॒तीनि॒ दस्योः॑ अशि॑क्षो॒ यत्र॒ शच्या॑ शचीवो॒ दिवो॑दासाय सुन्व॒ते सु॑तक्रे भ॒रद्वा॑जाय गृण॒ते वसू॑नि
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ śatā́ny áva śámbarasya púro jaghanthāpratī́ni dásyoḥ áśikṣo yátra śácyā śacīvo dívodāsāya sunvaté sutakre bharádvājāya gr̥ṇaté vásūni
stanzas.translation: Thou smotest to the ground the hundred castles, impregnable, of Ṣambara the Dasyu, When, Strong, with might thou holpest Divodâsa who poured libations out, O Soma-buyer, and madest Bharadvâja rich who praised thee.

translations.griffith: Thou smotest to the ground the hundred castles, impregnable, of Ṣambara the Dasyu, When, Strong, with might thou holpest Divodâsa who poured libations out, O Soma-buyer, and madest Bharadvâja rich who praised thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: स स॑त्यसत्वन्मह॒ते रणा॑य॒ रथ॒मा ति॑ष्ठ तुविनृम्ण भी॒मम् या॒हि प्र॑पथि॒न्नव॒सोप॑ म॒द्रिक्प्र च॑ श्रुत श्रावय चर्ष॒णिभ्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá satyasatvan mahaté ráṇāya rátham ā́ tiṣṭha tuvinr̥mṇa bhīmám yāhí prapathinn ávasópa madrík prá ca śruta śrāvaya carṣaṇíbhyaḥ
stanzas.translation: As such, true Hero, for great joy of battle mount thy terrific car, O Brave and Manly. Come with thine help to me, thou distant Roamer, and, glorious God, spread among men my glory.

translations.griffith: As such, true Hero, for great joy of battle mount thy terrific car, O Brave and Manly. Come with thine help to me, thou distant Roamer, and, glorious God, spread among men my glory.

stanzas.sanskrit: अपू॑र्व्या पुरु॒तमा॑न्यस्मै म॒हे वी॒राय॑ त॒वसे॑ तु॒राय॑ वि॒र॒प्शिने॑ व॒ज्रिणे॒ शंत॑मानि॒ वचां॑स्या॒सा स्थवि॑राय तक्षम्
stanzas.transliteration: ápūrvyā purutámāny asmai mahé vīrā́ya taváse turā́ya virapśíne vajríṇe śáṃtamāni vácāṃsy āsā́ sthávirāya takṣam
stanzas.translation: I WITH my lips have fashioned for this Hero words never matched, most plentiful and auspicious, For him the Ancient, Great, Strong, Energetic, the very mighty Wielder of the Thunder.

translations.griffith: I WITH my lips have fashioned for this Hero words never matched, most plentiful and auspicious, For him the Ancient, Great, Strong, Energetic, the very mighty Wielder of the Thunder.

stanzas.sanskrit: स मा॒तरा॒ सूर्ये॑णा कवी॒नामवा॑सयद्रु॒जदद्रिं॑ गृणा॒नः स्वा॒धीभि॒र्ऋक्व॑भिर्वावशा॒न उदु॒स्रिया॑णामसृजन्नि॒दान॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: sá mātárā sū́ryeṇā kavīnā́m ávāsayad rujád ádriṃ gr̥ṇānáḥ svādhī́bhir ŕ̥kvabhir vāvaśānáḥ- úd usríyāṇām asr̥jan nidā́nam
stanzas.translation: Amid the sages, with the Sun he brightened the Parents: glorified, he burst the mountain; And, roaring with the holy-thoughted singers, he loosed the bond that held the beams of Morning.

translations.griffith: Amid the sages, with the Sun he brightened the Parents: glorified, he burst the mountain; And, roaring with the holy-thoughted singers, he loosed the bond that held the beams of Morning.

stanzas.sanskrit: स वह्नि॑भि॒र्ऋक्व॑भि॒र्गोषु॒ शश्व॑न्मि॒तज्ञु॑भिः पुरु॒कृत्वा॑ जिगाय पुरः॑ पुरो॒हा सखि॑भिः सखी॒यन्दृ॒ळ्हा रु॑रोज क॒विभिः॑ क॒विः सन्
stanzas.transliteration: sá váhnibhir ŕ̥kvabhir góṣu śáśvan mitájñubhiḥ purukŕ̥tvā jigāya púraḥ purohā́ sákhibhiḥ sakhīyán dr̥ḷhā́ ruroja kavíbhiḥ kavíḥ sán
stanzas.translation: Famed for great deeds, with priests who kneel and laud him, he still hath conquered in the frays for cattle, And broken down the forts, the Fort-destroyer, a Friend with friends, a Sage among the sages.

translations.griffith: Famed for great deeds, with priests who kneel and laud him, he still hath conquered in the frays for cattle, And broken down the forts, the Fort-destroyer, a Friend with friends, a Sage among the sages.

stanzas.sanskrit: स नी॒व्या॑भिर्जरि॒तार॒मच्छा॑ म॒हो वाजे॑भिर्म॒हद्भि॑श्च॒ शुष्मैः॑ पु॒रु॒वीरा॑भिर्वृषभ क्षिती॒नामा गि॑र्वणः सुवि॒ताय॒ प्र या॑हि
stanzas.transliteration: sá nīvyā̀bhir jaritā́ram áchā mahó vā́jebhir mahádbhiś ca śúṣmaiḥ puruvī́rābhir vr̥ṣabha kṣitīnā́m ā́ girvaṇaḥ suvitā́ya prá yāhi
stanzas.translation: Come with thy girthed mares, with abundant vigour and plenteous strength to him who sings thy praises. Come hither, borne by mares with many heroes, Lover of song! Steer! for the people's welfare.

translations.griffith: Come with thy girthed mares, with abundant vigour and plenteous strength to him who sings thy praises. Come hither, borne by mares with many heroes, Lover of song! Steer! for the people's welfare.

stanzas.sanskrit: स सर्गे॑ण॒ शव॑सा त॒क्तो अत्यै॑र॒प इन्द्रो॑ दक्षिण॒तस्तु॑रा॒षाट् इ॒त्था सृ॑जा॒ना अन॑पावृ॒दर्थं॑ दि॒वेदि॑वे विविषुरप्रमृ॒ष्यम्
stanzas.transliteration: sá sárgeṇa śávasā taktó átyair apá índro dakṣiṇatás turāṣā́ṭ itthā́ sr̥jānā́ ánapāvr̥d árthaṃ divé-dive viviṣur apramr̥ṣyám
stanzas.translation: Indra with rush and might, sped by his Coursers, hath swiftly won the waters from the southward. Thus set at liberty the rivers daily flow to their goal, incessant and exhaustless.

translations.griffith: Indra with rush and might, sped by his Coursers, hath swiftly won the waters from the southward. Thus set at liberty the rivers daily flow to their goal, incessant and exhaustless.

stanzas.sanskrit: य ओजि॑ष्ठ इन्द्र॒ तं सु नो॑ दा॒ मदो॑ वृषन्त्स्वभि॒ष्टिर्दास्वा॑न् सौव॑श्व्यं॒ यो व॒नव॒त्स्वश्वो॑ वृ॒त्रा स॒मत्सु॑ सा॒सह॑द॒मित्रा॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: yá ójiṣṭha indra táṃ sú no dāḥ- mádo vr̥ṣan svabhiṣṭír dā́svān saúvaśvyaṃ yó vanávat sváśvo vr̥trā́ samátsu sāsáhad amítrān
stanzas.translation: GIVE us the rapture that is mightiest, Indra, prompt to bestow and swift to aid, O Hero, That wins with brave steeds where brave steeds encounter, and quells the Vr̥itras and the foes in battle.

translations.griffith: GIVE us the rapture that is mightiest, Indra, prompt to bestow and swift to aid, O Hero, That wins with brave steeds where brave steeds encounter, and quells the Vr̥itras and the foes in battle.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वां ही॒३॒॑न्द्राव॑से॒ विवा॑चो॒ हव॑न्ते चर्ष॒णयः॒ शूर॑सातौ त्वं विप्रे॑भि॒र्वि प॒णीँर॑शाय॒स्त्वोत॒ इत्सनि॑ता॒ वाज॒मर्वा॑
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́ṃ hī̀ndrā́vase vívāco hávante carṣaṇáyaḥ śū́rasātau tváṃ víprebhir ví paṇī́m̐r aśāyas tvóta ít sánitā vā́jam árvā
stanzas.translation: For with loud voice the tribes invoke thee, Indra, to aid them in the battlefield of heroes. Thou, with the singers, hast pierced through the Paṇis: the charger whom thou aidest wins the booty.

translations.griffith: For with loud voice the tribes invoke thee, Indra, to aid them in the battlefield of heroes. Thou, with the singers, hast pierced through the Paṇis: the charger whom thou aidest wins the booty.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं ताँ इ॑न्द्रो॒भयाँ॑ अ॒मित्रा॒न्दासा॑ वृ॒त्राण्यार्या॑ च शूर वधी॒र्वने॑व॒ सुधि॑तेभि॒रत्कै॒रा पृ॒त्सु द॑र्षि नृ॒णां नृ॑तम
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ tā́m̐ indrobháyām̐ amítrān dā́sā vr̥trā́ṇy ā́ryā ca śūra vádhīr váneva súdhitebhir átkair ā́ pr̥tsú darṣi nr̥ṇā́ṃ nr̥tama
stanzas.translation: Both races, Indra, of opposing foemen, O Hero, both the Ârya and the Dâsa, Hast thou struck down like woods with well-shot lightnings: thou rentest them in fight, most manly Chieftain!

translations.griffith: Both races, Indra, of opposing foemen, O Hero, both the Ârya and the Dâsa, Hast thou struck down like woods with well-shot lightnings: thou rentest them in fight, most manly Chieftain!

stanzas.sanskrit: स त्वं न॑ इ॒न्द्राक॑वाभिरू॒ती सखा॑ वि॒श्वायु॑रवि॒ता वृ॒धे भूः॑ स्व॑र्षाता॒ यद्ध्वया॑मसि त्वा॒ युध्य॑न्तो ने॒मधि॑ता पृ॒त्सु शू॑र
stanzas.transliteration: sá tváṃ na indrā́kavābhir ūtī́ sákhā viśvā́yur avitā́ vr̥dhé bhūḥ svàrṣātā yád dhváyāmasi tvā yúdhyanto nemádhitā pr̥tsú śūra
stanzas.translation: Indra, befriend us with no scanty succour, prosper and aid us, Loved of all that liveth, When, fighting for the sunlight, we invoke thee, O Hero, in the fray, in war's division.

translations.griffith: Indra, befriend us with no scanty succour, prosper and aid us, Loved of all that liveth, When, fighting for the sunlight, we invoke thee, O Hero, in the fray, in war's division.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू॒नं न॑ इन्द्राप॒राय॑ च स्या॒ भवा॑ मृळी॒क उ॒त नो॑ अ॒भिष्टौ॑ इ॒त्था गृ॒णन्तो॑ म॒हिन॑स्य॒ शर्म॑न्दि॒वि ष्या॑म॒ पार्ये॑ गो॒षत॑माः
stanzas.transliteration: nūnáṃ na indrāparā́ya ca syāḥ- bhávā mr̥ḷīká utá no abhíṣṭau itthā́ gr̥ṇánto mahínasya śárman diví ṣyāma pā́rye goṣátamāḥ
stanzas.translation: Be ours, O Indra, now and for the future, be graciously inclined and near to help us. Thus may we, singing, sheltered by the Mighty, win many cattle on the day of trial.

translations.griffith: Be ours, O Indra, now and for the future, be graciously inclined and near to help us. Thus may we, singing, sheltered by the Mighty, win many cattle on the day of trial.

stanzas.sanskrit: सं च॒ त्वे ज॒ग्मुर्गिर॑ इन्द्र पू॒र्वीर्वि च॒ त्वद्य॑न्ति वि॒भ्वो॑ मनी॒षाः पु॒रा नू॒नं च॑ स्तु॒तय॒ ऋषी॑णां पस्पृ॒ध्र इन्द्रे॒ अध्यु॑क्था॒र्का
stanzas.transliteration: sáṃ ca tvé jagmúr gíra indra pūrvī́r ví ca tvád yanti vibhvò manīṣā́ḥ purā́ nūnáṃ ca stutáya ŕ̥ṣīṇām paspr̥dhrá índre ádhy ukthārkā́
stanzas.translation: FULL Many songs have met in thee, O Indra, and many a noble thought from thee proceedeth. Now and of old the eulogies of sages, their holy hymns and lauds, have yearned for Indra.

translations.griffith: FULL Many songs have met in thee, O Indra, and many a noble thought from thee proceedeth. Now and of old the eulogies of sages, their holy hymns and lauds, have yearned for Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: पु॒रु॒हू॒तो यः पु॑रुगू॒र्त ऋभ्वाँ॒ एकः॑ पुरुप्रश॒स्तो अस्ति॑ य॒ज्ञैः रथो॒ न म॒हे शव॑से युजा॒नो॒३॒॑ऽस्माभि॒रिन्द्रो॑ अनु॒माद्यो॑ भूत्
stanzas.transliteration: puruhūtó yáḥ purugūrtá ŕ̥bhvām̐ ékaḥ purupraśastó ásti yajñaíḥ rátho ná mahé śávase yujānáḥ- -asmā́bhir índro anumā́dyo bhūt
stanzas.translation: He, praised of many, bold, invoked of many, alone is glorified at sacrifices. Like a car harnessed for some great achievement, Indra must be the cause of our rejoicing.

translations.griffith: He, praised of many, bold, invoked of many, alone is glorified at sacrifices. Like a car harnessed for some great achievement, Indra must be the cause of our rejoicing.

stanzas.sanskrit: न यं हिंस॑न्ति धी॒तयो॒ न वाणी॒रिन्द्रं॒ नक्ष॒न्तीद॒भि व॒र्धय॑न्तीः यदि॑ स्तो॒तारः॑ श॒तं यत्स॒हस्रं॑ गृ॒णन्ति॒ गिर्व॑णसं॒ शं तद॑स्मै
stanzas.transliteration: ná yáṃ híṃsanti dhītáyo ná vā́ṇīr índraṃ nákṣantī́d abhí vardháyantīḥ yádi stotā́raḥ śatáṃ yát sahásraṃ gr̥ṇánti gírvaṇasaṃ śáṃ tád asmai
stanzas.translation: They make their way to Indra and exalt him, bim whom no prayers and no laudations trouble; For when a hundred or a thousand singers. laud him who loves the song their praise delights him.

translations.griffith: They make their way to Indra and exalt him, bim whom no prayers and no laudations trouble; For when a hundred or a thousand singers. laud him who loves the song their praise delights him.

stanzas.sanskrit: अस्मा॑ ए॒तद्दि॒व्य१॒॑र्चेव॑ मा॒सा मि॑मि॒क्ष इन्द्रे॒ न्य॑यामि॒ सोमः॑ जनं॒ न धन्व॑न्न॒भि सं यदापः॑ स॒त्रा वा॑वृधु॒र्हव॑नानि य॒ज्ञैः
stanzas.transliteration: ásmā etád divy àrcéva māsā́ mimikṣá índre ny àyāmi sómaḥ jánaṃ ná dhánvann abhí sáṃ yád ā́paḥ satrā́ vāvr̥dhur hávanāni yajñaíḥ
stanzas.translation: As brightness mingles with the Moon in heaven, the offered Soma yearns to mix with Indra. Like water brought to men in desert places, our gifts at sacrifice have still refreshed him.

translations.griffith: As brightness mingles with the Moon in heaven, the offered Soma yearns to mix with Indra. Like water brought to men in desert places, our gifts at sacrifice have still refreshed him.

stanzas.sanskrit: अस्मा॑ ए॒तन्मह्या॑ङ्गू॒षम॑स्मा॒ इन्द्रा॑य स्तो॒त्रं म॒तिभि॑रवाचि अस॒द्यथा॑ मह॒ति वृ॑त्र॒तूर्य॒ इन्द्रो॑ वि॒श्वायु॑रवि॒ता वृ॒धश्च॑
stanzas.transliteration: ásmā etán máhy āṅgūṣám asmai- índrāya stotrám matíbhir avāci ásad yáthā mahatí vr̥tratū́rye- índro viśvā́yur avitā́ vr̥dháś ca
stanzas.translation: To him this mighty eulogy, to Indra hath this our laud been uttered by the poets, That in the great encounter with the foemen, Loved of all life, Indra may guard and help us.

translations.griffith: To him this mighty eulogy, to Indra hath this our laud been uttered by the poets, That in the great encounter with the foemen, Loved of all life, Indra may guard and help us.

stanzas.sanskrit: क॒दा भु॑व॒न्रथ॑क्षयाणि॒ ब्रह्म॑ क॒दा स्तो॒त्रे स॑हस्रपो॒ष्यं॑ दाः क॒दा स्तोमं॑ वासयोऽस्य रा॒या क॒दा धियः॑ करसि॒ वाज॑रत्नाः
stanzas.transliteration: kadā́ bhuvan ráthakṣayāṇi bráhma kadā́ stotré sahasrapoṣyàṃ dāḥ kadā́ stómaṃ vāsayo 'sya rāyā́ kadā́ dhíyaḥ karasi vā́jaratnāḥ
stanzas.translation: WHEN shall our prayers rest in thy car beside thee? When dost thou give the singer food for thousands? When wilt thou clothe this poet's laud with plenty, and when wilt thou enrich our hymns with booty?

translations.griffith: WHEN shall our prayers rest in thy car beside thee? When dost thou give the singer food for thousands? When wilt thou clothe this poet's laud with plenty, and when wilt thou enrich our hymns with booty?

stanzas.sanskrit: कर्हि॑ स्वि॒त्तदि॑न्द्र॒ यन्नृभि॒र्नॄन्वी॒रैर्वी॒रान्नी॒ळया॑से॒ जया॒जीन् त्रि॒धातु॒ गा अधि॑ जयासि॒ गोष्विन्द्र॑ द्यु॒म्नं स्व॑र्वद्धेह्य॒स्मे
stanzas.transliteration: kárhi svit tád indra yán nŕ̥bhir nr̥̄́n vīraír vīrā́n nīḷáyāse jáyājī́n tridhā́tu gā́ ádhi jayāsi góṣu- índra dyumnáṃ svàrvad dhehy asmé
stanzas.translation: When wilt thou gather men with men, O Indra, heroes with heroes, and prevail in combat? Thou shalt win triply kine in frays for cattle, so, Indra, give thou us celestial glory.

translations.griffith: When wilt thou gather men with men, O Indra, heroes with heroes, and prevail in combat? Thou shalt win triply kine in frays for cattle, so, Indra, give thou us celestial glory.

stanzas.sanskrit: कर्हि॑ स्वि॒त्तदि॑न्द्र॒ यज्ज॑रि॒त्रे वि॒श्वप्सु॒ ब्रह्म॑ कृ॒णवः॑ शविष्ठ क॒दा धियो॒ न नि॒युतो॑ युवासे क॒दा गोम॑घा॒ हव॑नानि गच्छाः
stanzas.transliteration: kárhi svit tád indra yáj jaritré viśvápsu bráhma kr̥ṇávaḥ śaviṣṭha kadā́ dhíyo ná niyúto yuvāse kadā́ gómaghā hávanāni gachāḥ
stanzas.translation: Yea, when wilt thou, O Indra, thou Most Mighty, make the prayer all-sustaining for the singer? When wilt thou yoke, as we yoke songs, thy Horses, and come to offerings that bring wealth in cattle?

translations.griffith: Yea, when wilt thou, O Indra, thou Most Mighty, make the prayer all-sustaining for the singer? When wilt thou yoke, as we yoke songs, thy Horses, and come to offerings that bring wealth in cattle?

stanzas.sanskrit: स गोम॑घा जरि॒त्रे अश्व॑श्चन्द्रा॒ वाज॑श्रवसो॒ अधि॑ धेहि॒ पृक्षः॑ पी॒पि॒हीषः॑ सु॒दुघा॑मिन्द्र धे॒नुं भ॒रद्वा॑जेषु सु॒रुचो॑ रुरुच्याः
stanzas.transliteration: sá gómaghā jaritré áśvaścandrāḥ- vā́jaśravaso ádhi dhehi pŕ̥kṣaḥ pīpihī́ṣaḥ sudúghām indra dhenúm bharádvājeṣu surúco rurucyāḥ
stanzas.translation: Grant to the Singer food with store of cattle, splendid with horses and the fame of riches. Send food to swell the milch-cow good at milking: bright be its shine among the Bharadvâjas.

translations.griffith: Grant to the Singer food with store of cattle, splendid with horses and the fame of riches. Send food to swell the milch-cow good at milking: bright be its shine among the Bharadvâjas.

stanzas.sanskrit: तमा नू॒नं वृ॒जन॑म॒न्यथा॑ चि॒च्छूरो॒ यच्छ॑क्र॒ वि दुरो॑ गृणी॒षे मा निर॑रं शुक्र॒दुघ॑स्य धे॒नोरा॑ङ्गिर॒सान्ब्रह्म॑णा विप्र जिन्व
stanzas.transliteration: tám ā́ nūnáṃ vr̥jánam anyáthā cic -śū́ro yác chakra ví dúro gr̥ṇīṣé mā́ nír araṃ śukradúghasya dhenór āṅgirasā́n bráhmaṇā vipra jinva
stanzas.translation: Lead otherwise this present foeman, Ṣakra! Hence art thou praised as Hero, foe destroyer Him who gives pure gifts may I praise unceasing. Sage, quicken the Angirases by devotion.

translations.griffith: Lead otherwise this present foeman, Ṣakra! Hence art thou praised as Hero, foe destroyer Him who gives pure gifts may I praise unceasing. Sage, quicken the Angirases by devotion.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒त्रा मदा॑स॒स्तव॑ वि॒श्वज॑न्याः स॒त्रा रायोऽध॒ ये पार्थि॑वासः स॒त्रा वाजा॑नामभवो विभ॒क्ता यद्दे॒वेषु॑ धा॒रय॑था असु॒र्य॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: satrā́ mádāsas táva viśvájanyāḥ satrā́ rā́yó 'dha yé pā́rthivāsaḥ satrā́ vā́jānām abhavo vibhaktā́ yád devéṣu dhāráyathā asuryàm
stanzas.translation: THY raptures ever were for all men's profit: so evermore have been thine earthly riches. Thou still hast been the dealer-forth of vigour, since among Gods thou hast had power and Godhead.

translations.griffith: THY raptures ever were for all men's profit: so evermore have been thine earthly riches. Thou still hast been the dealer-forth of vigour, since among Gods thou hast had power and Godhead.

stanzas.sanskrit: अनु॒ प्र ये॑जे॒ जन॒ ओजो॑ अस्य स॒त्रा द॑धिरे॒ अनु॑ वी॒र्या॑य स्यू॒म॒गृभे॒ दुध॒येऽर्व॑ते च॒ क्रतुं॑ वृञ्ज॒न्त्यपि॑ वृत्र॒हत्ये॑
stanzas.transliteration: ánu prá yeje jána ójo asya satrā́ dadhire ánu vīryā̀ya syūmagŕ̥bhe dúdhayé 'rvate ca krátuṃ vr̥ñjanty ápi vr̥trahátye
stanzas.translation: Men have obtained his strength by sacrificing, and ever urged him, on to hero valour. For the rein-seizing, the impetuous Charger they furnished power even for Vr̥itra's slaughter.

translations.griffith: Men have obtained his strength by sacrificing, and ever urged him, on to hero valour. For the rein-seizing, the impetuous Charger they furnished power even for Vr̥itra's slaughter.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं स॒ध्रीची॑रू॒तयो॒ वृष्ण्या॑नि॒ पौंस्या॑नि नि॒युतः॑ सश्चु॒रिन्द्र॑म् स॒मु॒द्रं न सिन्ध॑व उ॒क्थशु॑ष्मा उरु॒व्यच॑सं॒ गिर॒ आ वि॑शन्ति
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ sadhrī́cīr ūtáyo vŕ̥ṣṇyāni paúṃsyāni niyútaḥ saścur índram samudráṃ ná síndhava uktháśuṣmāḥ- uruvyácasaṃ gíra ā́ viśanti
stanzas.translation: Associate with him, as teams of horses, help, manly might, and vigour follow Indra. As rivers reach the sea, so, strong with praises, our holy songs reach him the Comprehensive.

translations.griffith: Associate with him, as teams of horses, help, manly might, and vigour follow Indra. As rivers reach the sea, so, strong with praises, our holy songs reach him the Comprehensive.

stanzas.sanskrit: स रा॒यस्खामुप॑ सृजा गृणा॒नः पु॑रुश्च॒न्द्रस्य॒ त्वमि॑न्द्र॒ वस्वः॑ पति॑र्बभू॒थास॑मो॒ जना॑ना॒मेको॒ विश्व॑स्य॒ भुव॑नस्य॒ राजा॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá rāyás khā́m úpa sr̥jā gr̥ṇānáḥ puruścandrásya tvám indra vásvaḥ pátir babhūthā́samo jánānām éko víśvasya bhúvanasya rā́jā
stanzas.translation: Lauded by us, let flow the spring, O Indra, of excellent and brightly-shining riches. For thou art Lord of men, without an equal: of all the world thou art the only Sovran.

translations.griffith: Lauded by us, let flow the spring, O Indra, of excellent and brightly-shining riches. For thou art Lord of men, without an equal: of all the world thou art the only Sovran.

stanzas.sanskrit: स तु श्रु॑धि॒ श्रुत्या॒ यो दु॑वो॒युर्द्यौर्न भूमा॒भि रायो॑ अ॒र्यः असो॒ यथा॑ नः॒ शव॑सा चका॒नो यु॒गेयु॑गे॒ वय॑सा॒ चेकि॑तानः
stanzas.transliteration: sá tú śrudhi śrútyā yó duvoyúr dyaúr ná bhū́mābhí rā́yo aryáḥ áso yáthā naḥ śávasā cakānó yugé-yuge váyasā cékitānaḥ
stanzas.translation: Hear what thou mayst hear, thou who, fain for worship, as heaven girds earth, guardest thy servant's treasure; Tlat thou mayst be our own, joying in power, famed through thy might in every generation.

translations.griffith: Hear what thou mayst hear, thou who, fain for worship, as heaven girds earth, guardest thy servant's treasure; Tlat thou mayst be our own, joying in power, famed through thy might in every generation.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒र्वाग्रथं॑ वि॒श्ववा॑रं त उ॒ग्रेन्द्र॑ यु॒क्तासो॒ हर॑यो वहन्तु की॒रिश्चि॒द्धि त्वा॒ हव॑ते॒ स्व॑र्वानृधी॒महि॑ सध॒माद॑स्ते अ॒द्य
stanzas.transliteration: arvā́g ráthaṃ viśvávāraṃ ta ugra- -índra yuktā́so hárayo vahantu kīríś cid dhí tvā hávate svàrvān r̥dhīmáhi sadhamā́das te adyá
stanzas.translation: LET thy Bay Horses, yoked, O mighty Indra, bring thy car hither fraught with every blessing. For thee, the Heavenly, e'en the poor invoketh: may we this day, thy feast-companions, prosper.

translations.griffith: LET thy Bay Horses, yoked, O mighty Indra, bring thy car hither fraught with every blessing. For thee, the Heavenly, e'en the poor invoketh: may we this day, thy feast-companions, prosper.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रो द्रोणे॒ हर॑यः॒ कर्मा॑ग्मन्पुना॒नास॒ ऋज्य॑न्तो अभूवन् इन्द्रो॑ नो अ॒स्य पू॒र्व्यः प॑पीयाद्द्यु॒क्षो मद॑स्य सो॒म्यस्य॒ राजा॑
stanzas.transliteration: pró dróṇe hárayaḥ kármāgman punānā́sa ŕ̥jyanto abhūvan índro no asyá pūrvyáḥ papīyād dyukṣó mádasya somyásya rā́jā
stanzas.translation: Forth to the vat the brown drops flow for service, and purified proceed directly forward. May Indra drink of this, our guest aforetime, Celestial King of the strong draught of Soma.

translations.griffith: Forth to the vat the brown drops flow for service, and purified proceed directly forward. May Indra drink of this, our guest aforetime, Celestial King of the strong draught of Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ॒स॒स्रा॒णासः॑ शवसा॒नमच्छेन्द्रं॑ सुच॒क्रे र॒थ्या॑सो॒ अश्वाः॑ अ॒भि श्रव॒ ऋज्य॑न्तो वहेयु॒र्नू चि॒न्नु वा॒योर॒मृतं॒ वि द॑स्येत्
stanzas.transliteration: āsasrāṇā́saḥ śavasānám áchā- -índraṃ sucakré rathyā̀so áśvāḥ abhí śráva ŕ̥jyanto vaheyur nū́ cin nú vāyór amŕ̥taṃ ví dasyet
stanzas.translation: Bringing us hitherward all-potent Indra on well-wheeled chariot, may the Steeds who bear him Convey him on the road direct to glory, and ne'er may Vâyu's Amrit cease and fail him.

translations.griffith: Bringing us hitherward all-potent Indra on well-wheeled chariot, may the Steeds who bear him Convey him on the road direct to glory, and ne'er may Vâyu's Amrit cease and fail him.

stanzas.sanskrit: वरि॑ष्ठो अस्य॒ दक्षि॑णामिय॒र्तीन्द्रो॑ म॒घोनां॑ तुविकू॒र्मित॑मः यया॑ वज्रिवः परि॒यास्यंहो॑ म॒घा च॑ धृष्णो॒ दय॑से॒ वि सू॒रीन्
stanzas.transliteration: váriṣṭho asya dákṣiṇām iyarti- -índro maghónāṃ tuvikūrmítamaḥ yáyā vajrivaḥ pariyā́sy áṃho maghā́ ca dhr̥ṣṇo dáyase ví sūrī́n
stanzas.translation: Supreme, he stirs this man to give the guerdon,– Indra, most efficacious of the princes,– Wherewith, O Thunderer, thou removest sorrow, and, Bold One! partest wealth among the nobles.

translations.griffith: Supreme, he stirs this man to give the guerdon,– Indra, most efficacious of the princes,– Wherewith, O Thunderer, thou removest sorrow, and, Bold One! partest wealth among the nobles.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रो॒ वाज॑स्य॒ स्थवि॑रस्य दा॒तेन्द्रो॑ गी॒र्भिर्व॑र्धतां वृ॒द्धम॑हाः इन्द्रो॑ वृ॒त्रं हनि॑ष्ठो अस्तु॒ सत्वा ता सू॒रिः पृ॑णति॒ तूतु॑जानः
stanzas.transliteration: índro vā́jasya sthávirasya dātā́- -índro gīrbhír vardhatāṃ vr̥ddhámahāḥ índro vr̥tráṃ hániṣṭho astu sátvā- ā́ tā́ sūríḥ pr̥ṇati tū́tujāno
stanzas.translation: Indra is hewho gives enduring vigour: may our songs magnify the God Most Mighty. Best Vr̥itra-slayer be the Hero Indra these things he gives as Prince, with strong endeavour.

translations.griffith: Indra is hewho gives enduring vigour: may our songs magnify the God Most Mighty. Best Vr̥itra-slayer be the Hero Indra these things he gives as Prince, with strong endeavour.

stanzas.sanskrit: अपा॑दि॒त उदु॑ नश्चि॒त्रत॑मो म॒हीं भ॑र्षद्द्यु॒मती॒मिन्द्र॑हूतिम् पन्य॑सीं धी॒तिं दैव्य॑स्य॒ याम॒ञ्जन॑स्य रा॒तिं व॑नते सु॒दानुः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ápād itá úd u naś citrátamo mahī́m bharṣad dyumátīm índrahūtim pányasīṃ dhītíṃ daívyasya yā́mañ jánasya rātíṃ vanate sudā́nuḥ
stanzas.translation: HE hath drunk hence, Most Marvellous, and carried away our great and splendid call on Indra. The Bounteous, when we serve the Gods, accepteth song yet more famous and the gifts we bring him.

translations.griffith: HE hath drunk hence, Most Marvellous, and carried away our great and splendid call on Indra. The Bounteous, when we serve the Gods, accepteth song yet more famous and the gifts we bring him.

stanzas.sanskrit: दू॒राच्चि॒दा व॑सतो अस्य॒ कर्णा॒ घोषा॒दिन्द्र॑स्य तन्यति ब्रुवा॒णः एयमे॑नं दे॒वहू॑तिर्ववृत्यान्म॒द्र्य१॒॑गिन्द्र॑मि॒यमृ॒च्यमा॑ना
stanzas.transliteration: dūrā́c cid ā́ vasato asya kárṇā ghóṣād índrasya tanyati bruvāṇáḥ éyám enaṃ deváhūtir vavr̥tyāt- madryàg índram iyám r̥cyámānā
stanzas.translation: The speaker filleth with a cry to Indra his ears who cometh nigh e'en from a distance. May this my call bring Indra to my presence, this call to Gods composed in sacred verses.

translations.griffith: The speaker filleth with a cry to Indra his ears who cometh nigh e'en from a distance. May this my call bring Indra to my presence, this call to Gods composed in sacred verses.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं वो॑ धि॒या प॑र॒मया॑ पुरा॒जाम॒जर॒मिन्द्र॑म॒भ्य॑नूष्य॒र्कैः ब्रह्मा॑ च॒ गिरो॑ दधि॒रे सम॑स्मिन्म॒हाँश्च॒ स्तोमो॒ अधि॑ वर्ध॒दिन्द्रे॑
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ vo dhiyā́ paramáyā purājā́m ajáram índram abhy ànūṣy arkaíḥ bráhmā ca gíro dadhiré sám asmin mahā́ṃś ca stómo ádhi vardhad índre
stanzas.translation: Him have I sung with my best song and praises, Indra of ancient birth and Everlasting. For prayer and songs in him are concentrated: let laud wax mighty when addressed to Indra:

translations.griffith: Him have I sung with my best song and praises, Indra of ancient birth and Everlasting. For prayer and songs in him are concentrated: let laud wax mighty when addressed to Indra:

stanzas.sanskrit: वर्धा॒द्यं य॒ज्ञ उ॒त सोम॒ इन्द्रं॒ वर्धा॒द्ब्रह्म॒ गिर॑ उ॒क्था च॒ मन्म॑ वर्धाहै॑नमु॒षसो॒ याम॑न्न॒क्तोर्वर्धा॒न्मासाः॑ श॒रदो॒ द्याव॒ इन्द्र॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: várdhād yáṃ yajñá utá sóma índraṃ várdhād bráhma gíra ukthā́ ca mánma várdhā́hainam uṣáso yā́mann aktór várdhān mā́sāḥ śarádo dyā́va índram
stanzas.translation: Indra, whom sacrifice shall strengthen, Soma, and song and hymn, and praises and devotion, Whom Dawns shall strengthen when the night departeth, Indra whom days shall strengthen, months, and autumns.

translations.griffith: Indra, whom sacrifice shall strengthen, Soma, and song and hymn, and praises and devotion, Whom Dawns shall strengthen when the night departeth, Indra whom days shall strengthen, months, and autumns.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वा ज॑ज्ञा॒नं सह॑से॒ असा॑मि वावृधा॒नं राध॑से च श्रु॒ताय॑ म॒हामु॒ग्रमव॑से विप्र नू॒नमा वि॑वासेम वृत्र॒तूर्ये॑षु
stanzas.transliteration: evā́ jajñānáṃ sáhase ásāmi vāvr̥dhānáṃ rā́dhase ca śrutā́ya mahā́m ugrám ávase vipra nūnám ā́ vivāsema vr̥tratū́ryeṣu
stanzas.translation: Him, born for conquering might in full perfection, and waxen strongfor bounty and for glory, Great, Powerful, will we to-day, O singer, invite to aid. us and to quell our foemen.

translations.griffith: Him, born for conquering might in full perfection, and waxen strongfor bounty and for glory, Great, Powerful, will we to-day, O singer, invite to aid. us and to quell our foemen.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒न्द्रस्य॑ क॒वेर्दि॒व्यस्य॒ वह्ने॒र्विप्र॑मन्मनो वच॒नस्य॒ मध्वः॑ अपा॑ न॒स्तस्य॑ सच॒नस्य॑ दे॒वेषो॑ युवस्व गृण॒ते गोअ॑ग्राः
stanzas.transliteration: mandrásya kavér divyásya váhner vípramanmano vacanásya mádhvaḥ ápā nas tásya sacanásya deva- -íṣo yuvasva gr̥ṇaté góagrāḥ
