stanzas.translation: OF this our charming, our celestial Soma, eloquent, wise, Priest, with inspired devotion, Of this thy close attendant, hast thou drunken. God, send the singer food with milk to grace it.

translations.griffith: OF this our charming, our celestial Soma, eloquent, wise, Priest, with inspired devotion, Of this thy close attendant, hast thou drunken. God, send the singer food with milk to grace it.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यमु॑शा॒नः पर्यद्रि॑मु॒स्रा ऋ॒तधी॑तिभिर्ऋत॒युग्यु॑जा॒नः रु॒जदरु॑ग्णं॒ वि व॒लस्य॒ सानुं॑ प॒णीँर्वचो॑भिर॒भि यो॑ध॒दिन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ayám uśānáḥ páry ádrim usrā́ḥ- r̥tádhītibhir r̥tayúg yujānáḥ rujád árugṇaṃ ví valásya sā́num paṇī́m̐r vácobhir abhí yodhad índraḥ
stanzas.translation: Craving the kine, rushing against the mountain led on by Law, with holyminded comrades, He broke the never-broken ridge of Vala. With words of might Indra subdued the Paṇis.

translations.griffith: Craving the kine, rushing against the mountain led on by Law, with holyminded comrades, He broke the never-broken ridge of Vala. With words of might Indra subdued the Paṇis.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यं द्यो॑तयद॒द्युतो॒ व्य१॒॑क्तून्दो॒षा वस्तोः॑ श॒रद॒ इन्दु॑रिन्द्र इ॒मं के॒तुम॑दधु॒र्नू चि॒दह्नां॒ शुचि॑जन्मन उ॒षस॑श्चकार
stanzas.transliteration: ayáṃ dyotayad adyúto vy àktū́n doṣā́ vástoḥ śaráda índur indra imáṃ ketúm adadhur nū́ cid áhnāṃ śúcijanmana uṣásaś cakāra
stanzas.translation: This Indu lighted darksome nights, O Indra, throughout the years, at morning and at evening. Him have they stablished as the days' bright ensign. He made the Mornings to be born in splendour.

translations.griffith: This Indu lighted darksome nights, O Indra, throughout the years, at morning and at evening. Him have they stablished as the days' bright ensign. He made the Mornings to be born in splendour.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यं रो॑चयद॒रुचो॑ रुचा॒नो॒३॒॑ऽयं वा॑सय॒द्व्यृ१॒॑तेन॑ पू॒र्वीः अ॒यमी॑यत ऋत॒युग्भि॒रश्वैः॑ स्व॒र्विदा॒ नाभि॑ना चर्षणि॒प्राः
stanzas.transliteration: ayáṃ rocayad arúco rucānáḥ- -ayáṃ vāsayad vy r̥̀téna pūrvī́ḥ ayám īyata r̥tayúgbhir áśvaiḥ svarvídā nā́bhinā carṣaṇiprā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: He shone and caused to shme the worlds that shone not. By Law he lighted up the host of Mornings. He moves with Steeds yoked by eternal Order, contenting men with nave that finds the sunlight.

translations.griffith: He shone and caused to shme the worlds that shone not. By Law he lighted up the host of Mornings. He moves with Steeds yoked by eternal Order, contenting men with nave that finds the sunlight.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू गृ॑णा॒नो गृ॑ण॒ते प्र॑त्न राज॒न्निषः॑ पिन्व वसु॒देया॑य पू॒र्वीः अ॒प ओष॑धीरवि॒षा वना॑नि॒ गा अर्व॑तो॒ नॄनृ॒चसे॑ रिरीहि
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ gr̥ṇānó gr̥ṇaté pratna rājann íṣaḥ pinva vasudéyāya pūrvī́ḥ apá óṣadhīr aviṣā́ vánāni gā́ árvato nr̥̄́n r̥cáse rirīhi
stanzas.translation: Now, praised, O Ancient King! fill thou the singer with plenteous food that he may deal forth treasures. Give waters, herbs that have no poison, forests, and kine, and steeds, and men, to him who lauds thee.

translations.griffith: Now, praised, O Ancient King! fill thou the singer with plenteous food that he may deal forth treasures. Give waters, herbs that have no poison, forests, and kine, and steeds, and men, to him who lauds thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॒ पिब॒ तुभ्यं॑ सु॒तो मदा॒याव॑ स्य॒ हरी॒ वि मु॑चा॒ सखा॑या उ॒त प्र गा॑य ग॒ण आ नि॒षद्याथा॑ य॒ज्ञाय॑ गृण॒ते वयो॑ धाः
stanzas.transliteration: índra píba túbhyaṃ sutó mádāya- -áva sya hárī ví mucā sákhāyā utá prá gāya gaṇá ā́ niṣádya- -áthā yajñā́ya gr̥ṇaté váyo dhāḥ
stanzas.translation: DRINK, Indra; juice is shed to make thee joyful: loose thy Bay Steeds and give thy friends their freedom. Begin the song, seated in our assembly. Give strength for sacrifice to him who singeth.

translations.griffith: DRINK, Indra; juice is shed to make thee joyful: loose thy Bay Steeds and give thy friends their freedom. Begin the song, seated in our assembly. Give strength for sacrifice to him who singeth.

stanzas.sanskrit: अस्य॑ पिब॒ यस्य॑ जज्ञा॒न इ॑न्द्र॒ मदा॑य॒ क्रत्वे॒ अपि॑बो विरप्शिन् तमु॑ ते॒ गावो॒ नर॒ आपो॒ अद्रि॒रिन्दुं॒ सम॑ह्यन्पी॒तये॒ सम॑स्मै
stanzas.transliteration: ásya piba yásya jajñāná indra mádāya krátve ápibo virapśin tám u te gā́vo nára ā́po ádrir índuṃ sám ahyan pītáye sám asmai
stanzas.translation: Drink thou of this whereof at birth, O Indra, thou drankest, Mighty One for power and rapture. The men, the pressing-stones, the cows, the waters have made this Soma ready for thy drinking.

translations.griffith: Drink thou of this whereof at birth, O Indra, thou drankest, Mighty One for power and rapture. The men, the pressing-stones, the cows, the waters have made this Soma ready for thy drinking.

stanzas.sanskrit: समि॑द्धे अ॒ग्नौ सु॒त इ॑न्द्र॒ सोम॒ आ त्वा॑ वहन्तु॒ हर॑यो॒ वहि॑ष्ठाः त्वा॒य॒ता मन॑सा जोहवी॒मीन्द्रा या॑हि सुवि॒ताय॑ म॒हे नः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sámiddhe agnaú sutá indra sóme- ā́ tvā vahantu hárayo váhiṣṭhāḥ tvāyatā́ mánasā johavīmi- -índrā́ yāhi suvitā́ya mahé naḥ
stanzas.translation: The fire is kindled, Soma pressed, O Indra: let thy Bays, best to draw, convey thee hither. With mind devoted, Indra, I invoke thee. Come, for our great prosperity approach us.

translations.griffith: The fire is kindled, Soma pressed, O Indra: let thy Bays, best to draw, convey thee hither. With mind devoted, Indra, I invoke thee. Come, for our great prosperity approach us.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ या॑हि॒ शश्व॑दुश॒ता य॑या॒थेन्द्र॑ म॒हा मन॑सा सोम॒पेय॑म् उप॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि शृणव इ॒मा नोऽथा॑ ते य॒ज्ञस्त॒न्वे॒३॒॑ वयो॑ धात्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yāhi śáśvad uśatā́ yayātha- -índra mahā́ mánasā somapéyam úpa bráhmāṇi śr̥ṇava imā́ naḥ- -áthā te yajñás tanvè váyo dhāt
stanzas.translation: Indra, come hither: evermore thou camest through our great strong desire to drink the Soma. Listen and hear the prayers which now we offer, and let this sacrifice increase thy vigour.

translations.griffith: Indra, come hither: evermore thou camest through our great strong desire to drink the Soma. Listen and hear the prayers which now we offer, and let this sacrifice increase thy vigour.

stanzas.sanskrit: यदि॑न्द्र दि॒वि पार्ये॒ यदृध॒ग्यद्वा॒ स्वे सद॑ने॒ यत्र॒ वासि॑ अतो॑ नो य॒ज्ञमव॑से नि॒युत्वा॑न्त्स॒जोषाः॑ पाहि गिर्वणो म॒रुद्भिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yád indra diví pā́rye yád ŕ̥dhag yád vā své sádane yátra vā́si áto no yajñám ávase niyútvān sajóṣāḥ pāhi girvaṇo marúdbhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Mayst thou, O Indra, on the day of trial, present or absent, wheresoe'er thou dwellest, Thence, with thy team, accordant with the Maruts, Song-lover! guard our sacrifice, to help us.

translations.griffith: Mayst thou, O Indra, on the day of trial, present or absent, wheresoe'er thou dwellest, Thence, with thy team, accordant with the Maruts, Song-lover! guard our sacrifice, to help us.

stanzas.sanskrit: अहे॑ळमान॒ उप॑ याहि य॒ज्ञं तुभ्यं॑ पवन्त॒ इन्द॑वः सु॒तासः॑ गावो॒ न व॑ज्रि॒न्त्स्वमोको॒ अच्छेन्द्रा ग॑हि प्रथ॒मो य॒ज्ञिया॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: áheḷamāna úpa yāhi yajñáṃ túbhyam pavanta índavaḥ sutā́saḥ gā́vo ná vajrin svám óko áchā- -índrā́ gahi prathamó yajñíyānām
stanzas.translation: COME gracious to our sacrifice, O Indra: pressed Soma-drops are purified to please thee. As cattle seek their home, so Thunderwielder, come, Indra, first of those who claim our worship.

translations.griffith: COME gracious to our sacrifice, O Indra: pressed Soma-drops are purified to please thee. As cattle seek their home, so Thunderwielder, come, Indra, first of those who claim our worship.

stanzas.sanskrit: या ते॑ का॒कुत्सुकृ॑ता॒ या वरि॑ष्ठा॒ यया॒ शश्व॒त्पिब॑सि॒ मध्व॑ ऊ॒र्मिम् तया॑ पाहि॒ प्र ते॑ अध्व॒र्युर॑स्था॒त्सं ते॒ वज्रो॑ वर्ततामिन्द्र ग॒व्युः
stanzas.transliteration: yā́ te kākút súkr̥tā yā́ váriṣṭhā yáyā śáśvat píbasi mádhva ūrmím táyā pāhi prá te adhvaryúr asthāt sáṃ te vájro vartatām indra gavyúḥ
stanzas.translation: With that well-formed most wide-extending palate, wherewith thou ever drinkest streams of sweetness, Drink thou; the Adhvaryu standeth up before thee: let thy spoil-winning thunderbolt attend thee.

translations.griffith: With that well-formed most wide-extending palate, wherewith thou ever drinkest streams of sweetness, Drink thou; the Adhvaryu standeth up before thee: let thy spoil-winning thunderbolt attend thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒ष द्र॒प्सो वृ॑ष॒भो वि॒श्वरू॑प॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ वृष्णे॒ सम॑कारि॒ सोमः॑ ए॒तं पि॑ब हरिवः स्थातरुग्र॒ यस्येशि॑षे प्र॒दिवि॒ यस्ते॒ अन्न॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: eṣá drapsó vr̥ṣabhó viśvárūpaḥ- índrāya vŕ̥ṣṇe sám akāri sómaḥ etám piba hariva sthātar ugra yásyéśiṣe pradívi yás te ánnam
stanzas.translation: This drop, steer-strong and omniform, the Soma, hath been made ready for the Bull, for India. Drink this, Lord of the Bays, thou Strong Supporter, this that is thine of old, thy food for ever.

translations.griffith: This drop, steer-strong and omniform, the Soma, hath been made ready for the Bull, for India. Drink this, Lord of the Bays, thou Strong Supporter, this that is thine of old, thy food for ever.

stanzas.sanskrit: सु॒तः सोमो॒ असु॑तादिन्द्र॒ वस्या॑न॒यं श्रेया॑ञ्चिकि॒तुषे॒ रणा॑य ए॒तं ति॑तिर्व॒ उप॑ याहि य॒ज्ञं तेन॒ विश्वा॒स्तवि॑षी॒रा पृ॑णस्व
stanzas.transliteration: sutáḥ sómo ásutād indra vásyān ayáṃ śréyāñ cikitúṣe ráṇāya etáṃ titirva úpa yāhi yajñáṃ téna víśvās táviṣīr ā́ pr̥ṇasva
stanzas.translation: Soma when pressed excels the unpressed Soma, better, for one who knows, to give him pleasure. Come to this sacrifice of ours, O Victor replenish all thy powers with this libation.

translations.griffith: Soma when pressed excels the unpressed Soma, better, for one who knows, to give him pleasure. Come to this sacrifice of ours, O Victor replenish all thy powers with this libation.

stanzas.sanskrit: ह्वया॑मसि॒ त्वेन्द्र॑ याह्य॒र्वाङरं॑ ते॒ सोम॑स्त॒न्वे॑ भवाति शत॑क्रतो मा॒दय॑स्वा सु॒तेषु॒ प्रास्माँ अ॑व॒ पृत॑नासु॒ प्र वि॒क्षु
stanzas.transliteration: hváyāmasi tvéndra yāhy arvā́ṅ áraṃ te sómas tanvè bhavāti śátakrato mādáyasvā sutéṣu prā́smā́m̐ ava pŕ̥tanāsu prá vikṣú
stanzas.translation: We call on thee, O Indra: come thou hither: sufficient be the Soma for thy body. Rejoice thee, Ṣatakratu! in the juices guard us in wars, guard us among our people.

translations.griffith: We call on thee, O Indra: come thou hither: sufficient be the Soma for thy body. Rejoice thee, Ṣatakratu! in the juices guard us in wars, guard us among our people.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्रत्य॑स्मै॒ पिपी॑षते॒ विश्वा॑नि वि॒दुषे॑ भर अ॒रं॒ग॒माय॒ जग्म॒येऽप॑श्चाद्दघ्वने॒ नरे॑
stanzas.transliteration: práty asmai pípīṣate víśvāni vidúṣe bhara araṃgamā́ya jágmaye- -ápaścāddaghvane náre
stanzas.translation: BRING sacrificial gifts to him, Omniscient, for he longs to drink, The Wanderer who comes with speed, the Hero ever in the van.

translations.griffith: BRING sacrificial gifts to him, Omniscient, for he longs to drink, The Wanderer who comes with speed, the Hero ever in the van.

stanzas.sanskrit: एमे॑नं प्र॒त्येत॑न॒ सोमे॑भिः सोम॒पात॑मम् अम॑त्रेभिर्ऋजी॒षिण॒मिन्द्रं॑ सु॒तेभि॒रिन्दु॑भिः
stanzas.transliteration: ém enam pratyétana sómebhiḥ somapā́tamam ámatrebhir r̥jīṣíṇam índraṃ sutébhir índubhiḥ
stanzas.translation: With Soma go ye nigh to him chief drinker of the Soma's juice: With beakers to the Impetuous God, to Indra with the drops effused.

translations.griffith: With Soma go ye nigh to him chief drinker of the Soma's juice: With beakers to the Impetuous God, to Indra with the drops effused.

stanzas.sanskrit: यदी॑ सु॒तेभि॒रिन्दु॑भिः॒ सोमे॑भिः प्रति॒भूष॑थ वेदा॒ विश्व॑स्य॒ मेधि॑रो धृ॒षत्तंत॒मिदेष॑ते
stanzas.transliteration: yádī sutébhir índubhiḥ sómebhiḥ pratibhū́ṣatha védā víśvasya médhiro dhr̥ṣát táṃ-tam íd éṣate
stanzas.translation: What time, with Soma, with the juice effused, ye come before the God, Full wise he knows the hope of each, and, Bold One, strikes this foe and that.

translations.griffith: What time, with Soma, with the juice effused, ye come before the God, Full wise he knows the hope of each, and, Bold One, strikes this foe and that.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्माअ॑स्मा॒ इदन्ध॒सोऽध्व॑र्यो॒ प्र भ॑रा सु॒तम् कु॒वित्स॑मस्य॒ जेन्य॑स्य॒ शर्ध॑तो॒ऽभिश॑स्तेरव॒स्पर॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: asmā́-asmā íd ándhasaḥ- -ádhvaryo prá bharā sutám kuvít samasya jényasya śárdhato -abhíśaster avaspárat
stanzas.translation: To him, Adhvaryu! yea, to him give offerings of the juice expressed. Will he not keep us safely from the spiteful curse of each presumptuous high-born foe?

translations.griffith: To him, Adhvaryu! yea, to him give offerings of the juice expressed. Will he not keep us safely from the spiteful curse of each presumptuous high-born foe?

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्य॒ त्यच्छम्ब॑रं॒ मदे॒ दिवो॑दासाय र॒न्धयः॑ अ॒यं स सोम॑ इन्द्र ते सु॒तः पिब॑
stanzas.transliteration: yásya tyác chámbaram máde dívodāsāya randháyaḥ ayáṃ sá sóma indra te sutáḥ píba
stanzas.translation: IN whose wild joy thou madest once Ṣambara Divodâsa's prey, This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra: drink!

translations.griffith: IN whose wild joy thou madest once Ṣambara Divodâsa's prey, This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra: drink!

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्य॑ तीव्र॒सुतं॒ मदं॒ मध्य॒मन्तं॑ च॒ रक्ष॑से अ॒यं स सोम॑ इन्द्र ते सु॒तः पिब॑
stanzas.transliteration: yásya tīvrasútam mádam mádhyam ántaṃ ca rákṣase ayáṃ sá sóma indra te sutáḥ píba
stanzas.translation: Whose gladdening draught, shed from the points, thou guardest in the midst and end, This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra drink!

translations.griffith: Whose gladdening draught, shed from the points, thou guardest in the midst and end, This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra drink!

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्य॒ गा अ॒न्तरश्म॑नो॒ मदे॑ दृ॒ळ्हा अ॒वासृ॑जः अ॒यं स सोम॑ इन्द्र ते सु॒तः पिब॑
stanzas.transliteration: yásya gā́ antár áśmano máde dr̥ḷhā́ avā́sr̥jaḥ ayáṃ sá sóma indra te sutáḥ píba
stanzas.translation: In whose wild joy thou settest free the kine held fast within the rock, This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra: drink!

translations.griffith: In whose wild joy thou settest free the kine held fast within the rock, This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra: drink!

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्य॑ मन्दा॒नो अन्ध॑सो॒ माघो॑नं दधि॒षे शवः॑ अ॒यं स सोम॑ इन्द्र ते सु॒तः पिब॑
stanzas.transliteration: yásya mandānó ándhaso mā́ghonaṃ dadhiṣé śávaḥ ayáṃ sá sóma indra te sutáḥ píba
stanzas.translation: This, in whose juice delighting thou gainest the might of Maghavan, This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra drink!

translations.griffith: This, in whose juice delighting thou gainest the might of Maghavan, This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra drink!

stanzas.sanskrit: यो र॑यिवो र॒यिंत॑मो॒ यो द्यु॒म्नैर्द्यु॒म्नव॑त्तमः सोमः॑ सु॒तः स इ॑न्द्र॒ तेऽस्ति॑ स्वधापते॒ मदः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yó rayivo rayíṃtamo yó dyumnaír dyumnávattamaḥ sómaḥ sutáḥ sá indra te- -ásti svadhāpate mádaḥ
stanzas.translation: THAT which is wealthiest, Wealthy God in splendoursmost illustrious, Soma is pressed: thy gladdening draught, Indra! libation's Lord! is this.

translations.griffith: THAT which is wealthiest, Wealthy God in splendoursmost illustrious, Soma is pressed: thy gladdening draught, Indra! libation's Lord! is this.

stanzas.sanskrit: यः श॒ग्मस्तु॑विशग्म ते रा॒यो दा॒मा म॑ती॒नाम् सोमः॑ सु॒तः स इ॑न्द्र॒ तेऽस्ति॑ स्वधापते॒ मदः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yáḥ śagmás tuviśagma te rāyó dāmā́ matīnā́m sómaḥ sutáḥ sá indra te- -ásti svadhāpate mádaḥ
stanzas.translation: Effectual, Most Effectual One! thine, as bestowing wealth of hymns, Soma is pressed: thy gladdening draught, Indra! libation's Lord! is this.

translations.griffith: Effectual, Most Effectual One! thine, as bestowing wealth of hymns, Soma is pressed: thy gladdening draught, Indra! libation's Lord! is this.

stanzas.sanskrit: येन॑ वृ॒द्धो न शव॑सा तु॒रो न स्वाभि॑रू॒तिभिः॑ सोमः॑ सु॒तः स इ॑न्द्र॒ तेऽस्ति॑ स्वधापते॒ मदः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yéna vr̥ddhó ná śávasā turó ná svā́bhir ūtíbhiḥ sómaḥ sutáḥ sá indra te- -ásti svadhāpate mádaḥ
stanzas.translation: Wherewith thou art increased in strength, and conquerest with thy proper aids, Soma is pressed: thy gladdening draught, Indra! libation's Lord! is this.

translations.griffith: Wherewith thou art increased in strength, and conquerest with thy proper aids, Soma is pressed: thy gladdening draught, Indra! libation's Lord! is this.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्यमु॑ वो॒ अप्र॑हणं गृणी॒षे शव॑स॒स्पति॑म् इन्द्रं॑ विश्वा॒साहं॒ नरं॒ मंहि॑ष्ठं वि॒श्वच॑र्षणिम्
stanzas.transliteration: tyám u vo áprahaṇaṃ gr̥ṇīṣé śávasas pátim índraṃ viśvāsā́haṃ náram máṃhiṣṭhaṃ viśvácarṣaṇim
stanzas.translation: Him for your sake I glorify as Lord of Strength who wrongeth none, The Hero Indra, conquering all, Most Bounteous, God of all the tribes.

translations.griffith: Him for your sake I glorify as Lord of Strength who wrongeth none, The Hero Indra, conquering all, Most Bounteous, God of all the tribes.

stanzas.sanskrit: यं व॒र्धय॒न्तीद्गिरः॒ पतिं॑ तु॒रस्य॒ राध॑सः तमिन्न्व॑स्य॒ रोद॑सी दे॒वी शुष्मं॑ सपर्यतः
stanzas.transliteration: yáṃ vardháyantī́d gíraḥ pátiṃ turásya rā́dhasaḥ tám ín nv àsya ródasī devī́ śúṣmaṃ saparyataḥ
stanzas.translation: Those Goddesses, both Heaven and Earth, revere the power and might of him, Him whom our songs increase in strength, the Lord of bounty swift to come.

translations.griffith: Those Goddesses, both Heaven and Earth, revere the power and might of him, Him whom our songs increase in strength, the Lord of bounty swift to come.

stanzas.sanskrit: तद्व॑ उ॒क्थस्य॑ ब॒र्हणेन्द्रा॑योपस्तृणी॒षणि॑ विपो॒ न यस्यो॒तयो॒ वि यद्रोह॑न्ति स॒क्षितः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tád va ukthásya barháṇā- -índrāyopastr̥ṇīṣáṇi vípo ná yásyotáyo ví yád róhanti sakṣítaḥ
stanzas.translation: To seat your Indra, I will spread abroad with power this song of praise. The saving succours that abide in him, like songs, extend and grow.

translations.griffith: To seat your Indra, I will spread abroad with power this song of praise. The saving succours that abide in him, like songs, extend and grow.

stanzas.sanskrit: अवि॑द॒द्दक्षं॑ मि॒त्रो नवी॑यान्पपा॒नो दे॒वेभ्यो॒ वस्यो॑ अचैत् स॒स॒वान्त्स्तौ॒लाभि॑र्धौ॒तरी॑भिरुरु॒ष्या पा॒युर॑भव॒त्सखि॑भ्यः
stanzas.transliteration: ávidad dákṣam mitró návīyān papānó devébhyo vásyo acait sasavā́n staulā́bhir dhautárībhir uruṣyā́ pāyúr abhavat sákhibhyaḥ
stanzas.translation: A recent Friend, he found the skilful priest: he drank, and showed forth treasure from the Gods. He conquered, borne by strong all-shaking mares, and was with far-spread power his friends' Protector.

translations.griffith: A recent Friend, he found the skilful priest: he drank, and showed forth treasure from the Gods. He conquered, borne by strong all-shaking mares, and was with far-spread power his friends' Protector.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒तस्य॑ प॒थि वे॒धा अ॑पायि श्रि॒ये मनां॑सि दे॒वासो॑ अक्रन् दधा॑नो॒ नाम॑ म॒हो वचो॑भि॒र्वपु॑र्दृ॒शये॑ वे॒न्यो व्या॑वः
stanzas.transliteration: r̥tásya pathí vedhā́ apāyi śriyé mánāṃsi devā́so akran dádhāno nā́ma mahó vácobhir vápur dr̥śáye venyó vy ā̀vaḥ
stanzas.translation: In course of Law the sapient juice was quaffed: the Deities to glory turned their mind. Winning through hymns a lofty title, he, the Lovely, made his beauteous form apparent.

translations.griffith: In course of Law the sapient juice was quaffed: the Deities to glory turned their mind. Winning through hymns a lofty title, he, the Lovely, made his beauteous form apparent.

stanzas.sanskrit: द्यु॒मत्त॑मं॒ दक्षं॑ धेह्य॒स्मे सेधा॒ जना॑नां पू॒र्वीररा॑तीः वर्षी॑यो॒ वयः॑ कृणुहि॒ शची॑भि॒र्धन॑स्य सा॒ताव॒स्माँ अ॑विड्ढि
stanzas.transliteration: dyumáttamaṃ dákṣaṃ dhehy asmé sédhā jánānām pūrvī́r árātīḥ várṣīyo váyaḥ kr̥ṇuhi śácībhir dhánasya sātā́v asmā́m̐ aviḍḍhi
stanzas.translation: Bestow on us the most illustrious strength ward off men's manifold malignities. Give with thy might abundant vital force, and aid us graciously in gaining riches.

translations.griffith: Bestow on us the most illustrious strength ward off men's manifold malignities. Give with thy might abundant vital force, and aid us graciously in gaining riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॒ तुभ्य॒मिन्म॑घवन्नभूम व॒यं दा॒त्रे ह॑रिवो॒ मा वि वे॑नः नकि॑रा॒पिर्द॑दृशे मर्त्य॒त्रा किम॒ङ्ग र॑ध्र॒चोद॑नं त्वाहुः
stanzas.transliteration: índra túbhyam ín maghavann abhūma vayáṃ dātré harivo mā́ ví venaḥ nákir āpír dadr̥śe martyatrā́ kím aṅgá radhracódanaṃ tvāhuḥ
stanzas.translation: We turn to thee as Giver, liberal Indra. Lord of the Bay Steeds, be not thou ungracious. No friend among mankind have we to lookto: why have men called thee him who spurs the niggard?

translations.griffith: We turn to thee as Giver, liberal Indra. Lord of the Bay Steeds, be not thou ungracious. No friend among mankind have we to lookto: why have men called thee him who spurs the niggard?

stanzas.sanskrit: मा जस्व॑ने वृषभ नो ररीथा॒ मा ते॑ रे॒वतः॑ स॒ख्ये रि॑षाम पू॒र्वीष्ट॑ इन्द्र नि॒ष्षिधो॒ जने॑षु ज॒ह्यसु॑ष्वी॒न्प्र वृ॒हापृ॑णतः
stanzas.transliteration: mā́ jásvane vr̥ṣabha no rarīthāḥ- mā́ te revátaḥ sakhyé riṣāma pūrvī́ṣ ṭa indra niṣṣídho jáneṣu jahy ásuṣvīn prá vr̥hā́pr̥ṇataḥ
stanzas.translation: Give us not up, Strong Hero! to the hungry: unharmed be we whom thou, so rich, befriendest. Full many a boon hast thou for men demolish those who present no gifts nor pour oblations.

translations.griffith: Give us not up, Strong Hero! to the hungry: unharmed be we whom thou, so rich, befriendest. Full many a boon hast thou for men demolish those who present no gifts nor pour oblations.

stanzas.sanskrit: उद॒भ्राणी॑व स्त॒नय॑न्निय॒र्तीन्द्रो॒ राधां॒स्यश्व्या॑नि॒ गव्या॑ त्वम॑सि प्र॒दिवः॑ का॒रुधा॑या॒ मा त्वा॑दा॒मान॒ आ द॑भन्म॒घोनः॑
stanzas.transliteration: úd abhrā́ṇīva stanáyann iyarti- -índro rā́dhāṃsy áśvyāni gávyā tvám asi pradívaḥ kārúdhāyāḥ- mā́ tvādāmā́na ā́ dabhan maghónaḥ
stanzas.translation: As Indra thundering impels the rain-clouds, so doth he send us store of kine and horses. Thou art of old the Cherisher of singers let not the rich who bring no gifts deceive thee.

translations.griffith: As Indra thundering impels the rain-clouds, so doth he send us store of kine and horses. Thou art of old the Cherisher of singers let not the rich who bring no gifts deceive thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध्व॑र्यो वीर॒ प्र म॒हे सु॒ताना॒मिन्द्रा॑य भर॒ स ह्य॑स्य॒ राजा॑ यः पू॒र्व्याभि॑रु॒त नूत॑नाभिर्गी॒र्भिर्वा॑वृ॒धे गृ॑ण॒तामृषी॑णाम्
stanzas.transliteration: ádhvaryo vīra prá mahé sutā́nām índrāya bhara sá hy àsya rā́jā yáḥ pūrvyā́bhir utá nū́tanābhir gīrbhír vāvr̥dhé gr̥ṇatā́m ŕ̥ṣīṇām
stanzas.translation: Adbyaryu, hero, bring to mighty Indrafor he is King thereof-the pressed-out juices; To him exalted by the hymns and praises, ancient and modern, of the singing R̥ishis.

translations.griffith: Adbyaryu, hero, bring to mighty Indrafor he is King thereof-the pressed-out juices; To him exalted by the hymns and praises, ancient and modern, of the singing R̥ishis.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्य मदे॑ पु॒रु वर्पां॑सि वि॒द्वानिन्द्रो॑ वृ॒त्राण्य॑प्र॒ती ज॑घान तमु॒ प्र हो॑षि॒ मधु॑मन्तमस्मै॒ सोमं॑ वी॒राय॑ शि॒प्रिणे॒ पिब॑ध्यै
stanzas.transliteration: asyá máde purú várpāṃsi vidvā́n índro vr̥trā́ṇy apratī́ jaghāna tám u prá hoṣi mádhumantam asmai sómaṃ vīrā́ya śipríṇe píbadhyai
stanzas.translation: In the wild joy of this hath Indra, knowing full many a form, struck down resistless Vr̥itras. Proclaim aloud to him the savoury Soma so that the Hero, strong of jaw, may drink it.

translations.griffith: In the wild joy of this hath Indra, knowing full many a form, struck down resistless Vr̥itras. Proclaim aloud to him the savoury Soma so that the Hero, strong of jaw, may drink it.

stanzas.sanskrit: पाता॑ सु॒तमिन्द्रो॑ अस्तु॒ सोमं॒ हन्ता॑ वृ॒त्रं वज्रे॑ण मन्दसा॒नः गन्ता॑ य॒ज्ञं प॑रा॒वत॑श्चि॒दच्छा॒ वसु॑र्धी॒नाम॑वि॒ता का॒रुधा॑याः
stanzas.transliteration: pā́tā sutám índro astu sómam hántā vr̥tráṃ vájreṇa mandasānáḥ gántā yajñám parāvátaś cid áchā vásur dhīnā́m avitā́ kārúdhāyāḥ
stanzas.translation: May Indra drink this Soma poured to please him, and cheered therewith slay Vr̥itra with his thunder. Come to our sacrifice even from a distance, good lover of our songs, the bard's Supporter.

translations.griffith: May Indra drink this Soma poured to please him, and cheered therewith slay Vr̥itra with his thunder. Come to our sacrifice even from a distance, good lover of our songs, the bard's Supporter.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒दं त्यत्पात्र॑मिन्द्र॒पान॒मिन्द्र॑स्य प्रि॒यम॒मृत॑मपायि मत्स॒द्यथा॑ सौमन॒साय॑ दे॒वं व्य१॒॑स्मद्द्वेषो॑ यु॒यव॒द्व्यंहः॑
stanzas.transliteration: idáṃ tyát pā́tram indrapā́nam índrasya priyám amŕ̥tam apāyi mátsad yáthā saumanasā́ya deváṃ vy àsmád dvéṣo yuyávad vy áṃhaḥ
stanzas.translation: The cup whence Indra drinks the draught is present: the Amrit dear to Indra hath been drunken, That it may cheer the God to gracious favour, and keep far from us hatred and affliction.

translations.griffith: The cup whence Indra drinks the draught is present: the Amrit dear to Indra hath been drunken, That it may cheer the God to gracious favour, and keep far from us hatred and affliction.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒ना म॑न्दा॒नो ज॒हि शू॑र॒ शत्रू॑ञ्जा॒मिमजा॑मिं मघवन्न॒मित्रा॑न् अ॒भि॒षे॒णाँ अ॒भ्या॒३॒॑देदि॑शाना॒न्परा॑च इन्द्र॒ प्र मृ॑णा ज॒ही च॑
stanzas.transliteration: enā́ mandānó jahí śūra śátrūñ jāmím ájāmim maghavann amítrān abhiṣeṇā́m̐ abhy ā̀dédiśānān párāca indra prá mr̥ṇā jahī́ ca
stanzas.translation: Therewith enraptured, Hero, slay our foemen, the unfriendly, Maghavan be they kin or strangers, Those who still aim their hostile darts to smite us, turn them to flight, O Indra, crush and kill them.

translations.griffith: Therewith enraptured, Hero, slay our foemen, the unfriendly, Maghavan be they kin or strangers, Those who still aim their hostile darts to smite us, turn them to flight, O Indra, crush and kill them.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ॒सु ष्मा॑ णो मघवन्निन्द्र पृ॒त्स्व१॒॑स्मभ्यं॒ महि॒ वरि॑वः सु॒गं कः॑ अ॒पां तो॒कस्य॒ तन॑यस्य जे॒ष इन्द्र॑ सू॒रीन्कृ॑णु॒हि स्मा॑ नो अ॒र्धम्
stanzas.transliteration: āsú ṣmā ṇo maghavann indra pr̥tsú- -asmábhyam máhi várivaḥ sugáṃ kaḥ apā́ṃ tokásya tánayasya jeṣé índra sūrī́n kr̥ṇuhí smā no ardhám
stanzas.translation: O Indra Maghavan, in these our battles win easy paths for us and ample freedom. That we may gain waters and seed and offspring, set thou our princes on thy side, O Indra.

translations.griffith: O Indra Maghavan, in these our battles win easy paths for us and ample freedom. That we may gain waters and seed and offspring, set thou our princes on thy side, O Indra.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ त्वा॒ हर॑यो॒ वृष॑णो युजा॒ना वृष॑रथासो॒ वृष॑रश्म॒योऽत्याः॑ अ॒स्म॒त्राञ्चो॒ वृष॑णो वज्र॒वाहो॒ वृष्णे॒ मदा॑य सु॒युजो॑ वहन्तु
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ tvā hárayo vŕ̥ṣaṇo yujānā́ḥ- vŕ̥ṣarathāso vŕ̥ṣaraśmayó 'tyāḥ asmatrā́ñco vŕ̥ṣaṇo vajravā́ho vŕ̥ṣṇe mádāya suyújo vahantu
stanzas.translation: Let thy Bay Stallions, harnessed, bring thee hither, Steeds with strong chariot and strong reins to hold them, Strong Horses, speeding hither, bearing thunder, well-harnessed, for the strong exciting potion.

translations.griffith: Let thy Bay Stallions, harnessed, bring thee hither, Steeds with strong chariot and strong reins to hold them, Strong Horses, speeding hither, bearing thunder, well-harnessed, for the strong exciting potion.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ ते॑ वृष॒न्वृष॑णो॒ द्रोण॑मस्थुर्घृत॒प्रुषो॒ नोर्मयो॒ मद॑न्तः इन्द्र॒ प्र तुभ्यं॒ वृष॑भिः सु॒तानां॒ वृष्णे॑ भरन्ति वृष॒भाय॒ सोम॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ te vr̥ṣan vŕ̥ṣaṇo dróṇam asthur ghr̥taprúṣo nórmáyo mádantaḥ índra prá túbhyaṃ vŕ̥ṣabhiḥ sutā́nāṃ vŕ̥ṣṇe bharanti vr̥ṣabhā́ya sómam
stanzas.translation: Beside the vat, Strong God! stand thy strong Horses, shining with holy oil, like waves exulting. Indra, they bring to thee, the Strong and Mighty, Soma of juices shed by mighty press-stones.

translations.griffith: Beside the vat, Strong God! stand thy strong Horses, shining with holy oil, like waves exulting. Indra, they bring to thee, the Strong and Mighty, Soma of juices shed by mighty press-stones.

stanzas.sanskrit: वृषा॑सि दि॒वो वृ॑ष॒भः पृ॑थि॒व्या वृषा॒ सिन्धू॑नां वृष॒भः स्तिया॑नाम् वृष्णे॑ त॒ इन्दु॑र्वृषभ पीपाय स्वा॒दू रसो॑ मधु॒पेयो॒ वरा॑य
stanzas.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣāsi divó vr̥ṣabháḥ pr̥thivyā́ḥ- vŕ̥ṣā síndhūnāṃ vr̥ṣabhá stíyānām vŕ̥ṣṇe ta índur vr̥ṣabha pīpāya svādū́ ráso madhupéyo várāya
stanzas.translation: Thou art the Bull of earth, the Bull of heaven, Bull of the rivers, Bull of standing waters. For thee, the Strong, O Bull, hath Indu swollen. juice pleasant, sweet to drink, for thine election.

translations.griffith: Thou art the Bull of earth, the Bull of heaven, Bull of the rivers, Bull of standing waters. For thee, the Strong, O Bull, hath Indu swollen. juice pleasant, sweet to drink, for thine election.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यं दे॒वः सह॑सा॒ जाय॑मान॒ इन्द्रे॑ण यु॒जा प॒णिम॑स्तभायत् अ॒यं स्वस्य॑ पि॒तुरायु॑धा॒नीन्दु॑रमुष्णा॒दशि॑वस्य मा॒याः
stanzas.transliteration: ayáṃ deváḥ sáhasā jā́yamānaḥ- índreṇa yujā́ paṇím astabhāyat ayáṃ svásya pitúr ā́yudhāni- -índur amuṣṇād áśivasya māyā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: This God, with might, when first he had his being, with Indra for ally, held fast the Paṇi. This Indu stole away the warlike weapons, and foiled the arts of his malignant father.

translations.griffith: This God, with might, when first he had his being, with Indra for ally, held fast the Paṇi. This Indu stole away the warlike weapons, and foiled the arts of his malignant father.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यम॑कृणोदु॒षसः॑ सु॒पत्नी॑र॒यं सूर्ये॑ अदधा॒ज्ज्योति॑र॒न्तः अ॒यं त्रि॒धातु॑ दि॒वि रो॑च॒नेषु॑ त्रि॒तेषु॑ विन्दद॒मृतं॒ निगू॑ळ्हम्
stanzas.transliteration: ayám akr̥ṇod uṣásaḥ supátnīr ayáṃ sū́rye adadhāj jyótir antáḥ ayáṃ tridhā́tu diví rocanéṣu tritéṣu vindad amŕ̥taṃ nígūḷham
stanzas.translation: The Dawns he wedded to a glorious Consort, and set within the Sun the light that lights him. He found in heaven, in the third lucid regions, the threefold Amrit in its close concealment.

translations.griffith: The Dawns he wedded to a glorious Consort, and set within the Sun the light that lights him. He found in heaven, in the third lucid regions, the threefold Amrit in its close concealment.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यं द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी वि ष्क॑भायद॒यं रथ॑मयुनक्स॒प्तर॑श्मिम् अ॒यं गोषु॒ शच्या॑ प॒क्वम॒न्तः सोमो॑ दाधार॒ दश॑यन्त्र॒मुत्स॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ayáṃ dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ ví ṣkabhāyad ayáṃ rátham ayunak saptáraśmim ayáṃ góṣu śácyā pakvám antáḥ sómo dādhāra dáśayantram útsam
stanzas.translation: He stayed and held the heaven and earth asunder: the chariot with the sevenfold reins he harnessed. This Soma Set with power within the milch-kine a spring whose ripe contents ten fingers empty.

translations.griffith: He stayed and held the heaven and earth asunder: the chariot with the sevenfold reins he harnessed. This Soma Set with power within the milch-kine a spring whose ripe contents ten fingers empty.

stanzas.sanskrit: य आन॑यत्परा॒वतः॒ सुनी॑ती तु॒र्वशं॒ यदु॑म् इन्द्रः॒ स नो॒ युवा॒ सखा॑
stanzas.transliteration: yá ā́nayat parāvátaḥ súnītī turváśaṃ yádum índraḥ sá no yúvā sákhā
stanzas.translation: THAT Indra is our youthful Friend, who with his trusty guidance led Turvaṣa, Yadu from afar.

translations.griffith: THAT Indra is our youthful Friend, who with his trusty guidance led Turvaṣa, Yadu from afar.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒वि॒प्रे चि॒द्वयो॒ दध॑दना॒शुना॑ चि॒दर्व॑ता इन्द्रो॒ जेता॑ हि॒तं धन॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: avipré cid váyo dádhad anāśúnā cid árvatā índro jétā hitáṃ dhánam
stanzas.translation: Even to the dull and uninspired Indra, gives vital power, and wins Even with slow steed the offered prize.

translations.griffith: Even to the dull and uninspired Indra, gives vital power, and wins Even with slow steed the offered prize.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒हीर॑स्य॒ प्रणी॑तयः पू॒र्वीरु॒त प्रश॑स्तयः नास्य॑ क्षीयन्त ऊ॒तयः॑
stanzas.transliteration: mahī́r asya práṇītayaḥ pūrvī́r utá práśastayaḥ nā́sya kṣīyanta ūtáyaḥ
stanzas.translation: Great are his ways of guiding us, and!nanilbld are Ins eulogies: His kind protections never fail.

translations.griffith: Great are his ways of guiding us, and!nanilbld are Ins eulogies: His kind protections never fail.

stanzas.sanskrit: सखा॑यो॒ ब्रह्म॑वाह॒सेऽर्च॑त॒ प्र च॑ गायत स हि नः॒ प्रम॑तिर्म॒ही
stanzas.transliteration: sákhāyo bráhmavāhase- -árcata prá ca gāyata sá hí naḥ prámatir mahī́
stanzas.translation: Friends, sing your psalm and offer praise to him to whom the prayer is brought: For our great Providence is he.

translations.griffith: Friends, sing your psalm and offer praise to him to whom the prayer is brought: For our great Providence is he.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वमेक॑स्य वृत्रहन्नवि॒ता द्वयो॑रसि उ॒तेदृशे॒ यथा॑ व॒यम्
stanzas.transliteration: tvám ékasya vr̥trahann avitā́ dváyor asi utédŕ̥śe yáthā vayám
stanzas.translation: Thou, Slaughterer of Vr̥itra, art Guardian and Friend of one and two, Yea, of a man like one of us.

translations.griffith: Thou, Slaughterer of Vr̥itra, art Guardian and Friend of one and two, Yea, of a man like one of us.

stanzas.sanskrit: नय॒सीद्वति॒ द्विषः॑ कृ॒णोष्यु॑क्थशं॒सिनः॑ नृभिः॑ सु॒वीर॑ उच्यसे
stanzas.transliteration: náyasī́d v áti dvíṣaḥ kr̥ṇóṣy ukthaśaṃsínaḥ nŕ̥bhiḥ suvī́ra ucyase
stanzas.translation: Beyond men's hate thou leadest us, and givest cause to sing thy praise: Good hero art thou called by men.

translations.griffith: Beyond men's hate thou leadest us, and givest cause to sing thy praise: Good hero art thou called by men.

stanzas.sanskrit: ब्र॒ह्माणं॒ ब्रह्म॑वाहसं गी॒र्भिः सखा॑यमृ॒ग्मिय॑म् गां न दो॒हसे॑ हुवे
stanzas.transliteration: brahmā́ṇam bráhmavāhasaṃ gīrbhíḥ sákhāyam r̥gmíyam gā́ṃ ná doháse huve
stanzas.translation: I call with hymns, as 'twere a cow to milk, the Friend who merits praise, The Brahman who accepts the prayer.

translations.griffith: I call with hymns, as 'twere a cow to milk, the Friend who merits praise, The Brahman who accepts the prayer.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्य॒ विश्वा॑नि॒ हस्त॑योरू॒चुर्वसू॑नि॒ नि द्वि॒ता वी॒रस्य॑ पृतना॒षहः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yásya víśvāni hástayoḥ ūcúr vásūni ní dvitā́ vīrásya pr̥tanāṣáhaḥ
stanzas.translation: Him in whose hands they say are stored all treasures from the days of old, The Hero, conquering in the fight.

translations.griffith: Him in whose hands they say are stored all treasures from the days of old, The Hero, conquering in the fight.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि दृ॒ळ्हानि॑ चिदद्रिवो॒ जना॑नां शचीपते वृ॒ह मा॒या अ॑नानत
stanzas.transliteration: ví dr̥ḷhā́ni cid adrivo jánānāṃ śacīpate vr̥há māyā́ anānata
stanzas.translation: Lord of Strength, Caster of the Stone, destroy the firm forts built by men, And foil their arts, unbending God!

translations.griffith: Lord of Strength, Caster of the Stone, destroy the firm forts built by men, And foil their arts, unbending God!

stanzas.sanskrit: तमु॑ त्वा सत्य सोमपा॒ इन्द्र॑ वाजानां पते अहू॑महि श्रव॒स्यवः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tám u tvā satya somapāḥ- índra vājānām pate áhūmahi śravasyávaḥ
stanzas.translation: Thee, thee as such, O Lord of Power, O Indra, Soma-drinker, true, We, fain for glory, have invoked.

translations.griffith: Thee, thee as such, O Lord of Power, O Indra, Soma-drinker, true, We, fain for glory, have invoked.

stanzas.sanskrit: तमु॑ त्वा॒ यः पु॒रासि॑थ॒ यो वा॑ नू॒नं हि॒ते धने॑ हव्यः॒ स श्रु॑धी॒ हव॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: tám u tvā yáḥ purā́sitha yó vā nūnáṃ hité dháne hávyaḥ sá śrudhī hávam
stanzas.translation: Such as thou wast of old, and art now to be called on when the prize lies ready, listen to our call.

translations.griffith: Such as thou wast of old, and art now to be called on when the prize lies ready, listen to our call.

stanzas.sanskrit: धी॒भिरर्व॑द्भि॒रर्व॑तो॒ वाजाँ॑ इन्द्र श्र॒वाय्या॑न् त्वया॑ जेष्म हि॒तं धन॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: dhībhír árvadbhir árvato vā́jām̐ indra śravā́yyān tváyā jeṣma hitáṃ dhánam
stanzas.translation: With hymns and coursers we will gain, Indra, through thee, both steeds and spoil Most glorious, and the proffered prize.

translations.griffith: With hymns and coursers we will gain, Indra, through thee, both steeds and spoil Most glorious, and the proffered prize.

stanzas.sanskrit: अभू॑रु वीर गिर्वणो म॒हाँ इ॑न्द्र॒ धने॑ हि॒ते भरे॑ वितन्त॒साय्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ábhūr u vīra girvaṇo mahā́m̐ indra dháne hité bháre vitantasā́yyaḥ
stanzas.translation: Thou, Indra, Lover of the Song, whom men must stir to help, hast been Great in the contest for the prize.

translations.griffith: Thou, Indra, Lover of the Song, whom men must stir to help, hast been Great in the contest for the prize.

stanzas.sanskrit: या त॑ ऊ॒तिर॑मित्रहन्म॒क्षूज॑वस्त॒मास॑ति तया॑ नो हिनुही॒ रथ॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: yā́ ta ūtír amitrahan makṣū́javastamā́sati táyā no hinuhī rátham
stanzas.translation: Slayer of foes, whatever aid of thine imparts the swiftest course, With that impel our car to speed.

translations.griffith: Slayer of foes, whatever aid of thine imparts the swiftest course, With that impel our car to speed.

stanzas.sanskrit: स रथे॑न र॒थीत॑मो॒ऽस्माके॑नाभि॒युग्व॑ना जेषि॑ जिष्णो हि॒तं धन॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: sá ráthena rathī́tamo -asmā́kenābhiyúgvanā jéṣi jiṣṇo hitáṃ dhánam
stanzas.translation: As skilfullest of those who drive the chariot, with our art and aim, O Conqueror, win the proffered prize.

translations.griffith: As skilfullest of those who drive the chariot, with our art and aim, O Conqueror, win the proffered prize.

stanzas.sanskrit: य एक॒ इत्तमु॑ ष्टुहि कृष्टी॒नां विच॑र्षणिः पति॑र्ज॒ज्ञे वृष॑क्रतुः
stanzas.transliteration: yá éka ít tám u ṣṭuhi kr̥ṣṭīnā́ṃ vícarṣaṇiḥ pátir jajñé vŕ̥ṣakratuḥ
stanzas.translation: Praise him who, Matchless and Alone, was born the Lord of living men, Most active, with heroic soul.

translations.griffith: Praise him who, Matchless and Alone, was born the Lord of living men, Most active, with heroic soul.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो गृ॑ण॒तामिदासि॑था॒पिरू॒ती शि॒वः सखा॑ स त्वं न॑ इन्द्र मृळय
stanzas.transliteration: yó gr̥ṇatā́m íd ā́sitha- -āpír ūtī́ śiváḥ sákhā sá tváṃ na indra mr̥ḷaya
stanzas.translation: Thou who hast been the singers' Friend, a Friend auspicious with thine aid, As such, O Indra, favour us.

translations.griffith: Thou who hast been the singers' Friend, a Friend auspicious with thine aid, As such, O Indra, favour us.

stanzas.sanskrit: धि॒ष्व वज्रं॒ गभ॑स्त्यो रक्षो॒हत्या॑य वज्रिवः सा॒स॒ही॒ष्ठा अ॒भि स्पृधः॑
stanzas.transliteration: dhiṣvá vájraṃ gábhastyo rakṣohátyāya vajrivaḥ sāsahīṣṭhā́ abhí spŕ̥dhaḥ
stanzas.translation: Grasp in thine arms the thunderbolt, O Thunder-armed, to slay the fiends: Mayst thou subdue the foemen's host.

translations.griffith: Grasp in thine arms the thunderbolt, O Thunder-armed, to slay the fiends: Mayst thou subdue the foemen's host.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र॒त्नं र॑यी॒णां युजं॒ सखा॑यं कीरि॒चोद॑नम् ब्रह्म॑वाहस्तमं हुवे
stanzas.transliteration: pratnáṃ rayīṇā́ṃ yújaṃ sákhāyaṃ kīricódanam bráhmavāhastamaṃ huve
stanzas.translation: I call the ancient Friend, allied with wealth, who speeds the lowly man, Him to whom chiefly prayer is brought.

translations.griffith: I call the ancient Friend, allied with wealth, who speeds the lowly man, Him to whom chiefly prayer is brought.

stanzas.sanskrit: स हि विश्वा॑नि॒ पार्थि॑वाँ॒ एको॒ वसू॑नि॒ पत्य॑ते गिर्व॑णस्तमो॒ अध्रि॑गुः
stanzas.transliteration: sá hí víśvāni pā́rthivām̐ éko vásūni pátyate gírvaṇastamo ádhriguḥ
stanzas.translation: For he alone is Lord of all the treasures of the earth: he speeds Hither, chief Lover of the Song.

translations.griffith: For he alone is Lord of all the treasures of the earth: he speeds Hither, chief Lover of the Song.

stanzas.sanskrit: स नो॑ नि॒युद्भि॒रा पृ॑ण॒ कामं॒ वाजे॑भिर॒श्विभिः॑ गोम॑द्भिर्गोपते धृ॒षत्
stanzas.transliteration: sá no niyúdbhir ā́ pr̥ṇa kā́maṃ vā́jebhir aśvíbhiḥ gómadbhir gopate dhr̥ṣát
stanzas.translation: So with thy yoked teams satisfy our wish with power and wealth in steeds And cattle, boldly, Lord of kine!

translations.griffith: So with thy yoked teams satisfy our wish with power and wealth in steeds And cattle, boldly, Lord of kine!

stanzas.sanskrit: तद्वो॑ गाय सु॒ते सचा॑ पुरुहू॒ताय॒ सत्व॑ने शं यद्गवे॒ न शा॒किने॑
stanzas.transliteration: tád vo gāya suté sácā puruhūtā́ya sátvane śáṃ yád gáve ná śākíne
stanzas.translation: Sing this, what time the ' juice is pressed, to him your Hero, Much-invoked, To please him as a mighty Steer.

translations.griffith: Sing this, what time the ' juice is pressed, to him your Hero, Much-invoked, To please him as a mighty Steer.

stanzas.sanskrit: न घा॒ वसु॒र्नि य॑मते दा॒नं वाज॑स्य॒ गोम॑तः यत्सी॒मुप॒ श्रव॒द्गिरः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ná ghā vásur ní yamate dānáṃ vā́jasya gómataḥ yát sīm úpa śrávad gíraḥ
stanzas.translation: He, Excellent, withholdeth not his gift of power and wealth in kine, When he hath listened to our songs.

translations.griffith: He, Excellent, withholdeth not his gift of power and wealth in kine, When he hath listened to our songs.

stanzas.sanskrit: कु॒वित्स॑स्य॒ प्र हि व्र॒जं गोम॑न्तं दस्यु॒हा गम॑त् शची॑भि॒रप॑ नो वरत्
stanzas.transliteration: kuvítsasya prá hí vrajáṃ gómantaṃ dasyuhā́ gámat śácībhir ápa no varat
stanzas.translation: May he with might unclose for us the cow's stall, whosesoe'er it be, To which the Dasyu-slayer goes.

translations.griffith: May he with might unclose for us the cow's stall, whosesoe'er it be, To which the Dasyu-slayer goes.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मा उ॑ त्वा शतक्रतो॒ऽभि प्र णो॑नुवु॒र्गिरः॑ इन्द्र॑ व॒त्सं न मा॒तरः॑
stanzas.transliteration: imā́ u tvā śatakrato -abhí prá ṇonuvur gíraḥ índra vatsáṃ ná mātáraḥ
stanzas.translation: O Indra Ṣatakratu, these our songs have called aloud to thee, Like mother cows to meet their calves.

translations.griffith: O Indra Ṣatakratu, these our songs have called aloud to thee, Like mother cows to meet their calves.

stanzas.sanskrit: दू॒णाशं॑ स॒ख्यं तव॒ गौर॑सि वीर गव्य॒ते अश्वो॑ अश्वाय॒ते भ॑व
stanzas.transliteration: dūṇā́śaṃ sakhyáṃ táva gaúr asi vīra gavyaté áśvo aśvāyaté bhava
stanzas.translation: Hard is thy love to win: thou art a Steer to him who longs for steers: Be to one craving steeds a Steed.

translations.griffith: Hard is thy love to win: thou art a Steer to him who longs for steers: Be to one craving steeds a Steed.

stanzas.sanskrit: स म॑न्दस्वा॒ ह्यन्ध॑सो॒ राध॑से त॒न्वा॑ म॒हे न स्तो॒तारं॑ नि॒दे क॑रः
stanzas.transliteration: sá mandasvā hy ándhaso rā́dhase tanvā̀ mahé ná stotā́raṃ nidé karaḥ
stanzas.translation: Delight thee with the juice we pour for thine own great munificence: Yield not thy singer to reproach.

translations.griffith: Delight thee with the juice we pour for thine own great munificence: Yield not thy singer to reproach.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मा उ॑ त्वा सु॒तेसु॑ते॒ नक्ष॑न्ते गिर्वणो॒ गिरः॑ व॒त्सं गावो॒ न धे॒नवः॑
stanzas.transliteration: imā́ u tvā suté-sute nákṣante girvaṇo gíraḥ vatsáṃ gā́vo ná dhenávaḥ
stanzas.translation: These songs with every draught we pour come, Lover of the Song, to thee, As milch-kine hasten to their young

translations.griffith: These songs with every draught we pour come, Lover of the Song, to thee, As milch-kine hasten to their young

stanzas.sanskrit: पु॒रू॒तमं॑ पुरू॒णां स्तो॑तॄ॒णां विवा॑चि वाजे॑भिर्वाजय॒ताम्
stanzas.transliteration: purūtámam purūṇā́m stotr̥̄ṇā́ṃ vívāci vā́jebhir vājayatā́m
stanzas.translation: To thee most oft invoked, amid the many singers' rivalry Who beg with all their might for wealth.

translations.griffith: To thee most oft invoked, amid the many singers' rivalry Who beg with all their might for wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒स्माक॑मिन्द्र भूतु ते॒ स्तोमो॒ वाहि॑ष्ठो॒ अन्त॑मः अ॒स्मान्रा॒ये म॒हे हि॑नु
stanzas.transliteration: asmā́kam indra bhūtu te stómo vā́hiṣṭho ántamaḥ asmā́n rāyé mahé hinu
stanzas.translation: Nearest and most attractive may our laud, O Indra come to thee. Urge thou us on to ample wealth.

translations.griffith: Nearest and most attractive may our laud, O Indra come to thee. Urge thou us on to ample wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: अधि॑ बृ॒बुः प॑णी॒नां वर्षि॑ष्ठे मू॒र्धन्न॑स्थात् उ॒रुः कक्षो॒ न गा॒ङ्ग्यः
stanzas.transliteration: ádhi br̥búḥ paṇīnā́ṃ várṣiṣṭhe mūrdhánn asthāt urúḥ kákṣo ná gāṅgyáḥ
stanzas.translation: Br̥ibu hath set himself above the Paṇis, o'er their highest head, Like the wide bush on Gangâ's bank.

translations.griffith: Br̥ibu hath set himself above the Paṇis, o'er their highest head, Like the wide bush on Gangâ's bank.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्य॑ वा॒योरि॑व द्र॒वद्भ॒द्रा रा॒तिः स॑ह॒स्रिणी॑ स॒द्यो दा॒नाय॒ मंह॑ते
stanzas.transliteration: yásya vāyór iva dravád bhadrā́ rātíḥ sahasríṇī sadyó dānā́ya máṃhate
stanzas.translation: He whose good bounty, thousandfold, swift as the rushing of the wind, Suddenly offers as a gift.

translations.griffith: He whose good bounty, thousandfold, swift as the rushing of the wind, Suddenly offers as a gift.

stanzas.sanskrit: तत्सु नो॒ विश्वे॑ अ॒र्य आ सदा॑ गृणन्ति का॒रवः॑ बृ॒बुं स॑हस्र॒दात॑मं सू॒रिं स॑हस्र॒सात॑मम्
stanzas.transliteration: tát sú no víśve aryá ā́ sádā gr̥ṇanti kārávaḥ br̥búṃ sahasradā́tamaṃ sūríṃ sahasrasā́tamam
stanzas.translation: So all our singers ever praise the pious Br̥ibu's noble deed, Chief, best to give his thousands, best to give a thousand liberal gifts.

translations.griffith: So all our singers ever praise the pious Br̥ibu's noble deed, Chief, best to give his thousands, best to give a thousand liberal gifts.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वामिद्धि हवा॑महे सा॒ता वाज॑स्य का॒रवः॑ त्वां वृ॒त्रेष्वि॑न्द्र॒ सत्प॑तिं॒ नर॒स्त्वां काष्ठा॒स्वर्व॑तः
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́m íd dhí hávāmahe sātā́ vā́jasya kārávaḥ tvā́ṃ vr̥tréṣv indra sátpatiṃ náras tvā́ṃ kā́ṣṭhāsv árvataḥ
stanzas.translation: THAT we may win us wealth and power we poets, verily, call on thee: In war men call on thee, Indra, the hero's Lord, in the steed's race-course call on thee.

translations.griffith: THAT we may win us wealth and power we poets, verily, call on thee: In war men call on thee, Indra, the hero's Lord, in the steed's race-course call on thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: स त्वं न॑श्चित्र वज्रहस्त धृष्णु॒या म॒हः स्त॑वा॒नो अ॑द्रिवः गामश्वं॑ र॒थ्य॑मिन्द्र॒ सं कि॑र स॒त्रा वाजं॒ न जि॒ग्युषे॑
stanzas.transliteration: sá tváṃ naś citra vajrahasta dhr̥ṣṇuyā́ mahá stavānó adrivaḥ gā́m áśvaṃ rathyàm indra sáṃ kira satrā́ vā́jaṃ ná jigyúṣe
stanzas.translation: As such, O Wonderful, whose hand holds thunder, praised as mighty, Caster of the Stone! Pour on us boldly, Indra, kine and chariotsteeds, ever to be the conqueror's strength.

translations.griffith: As such, O Wonderful, whose hand holds thunder, praised as mighty, Caster of the Stone! Pour on us boldly, Indra, kine and chariotsteeds, ever to be the conqueror's strength.

stanzas.sanskrit: यः स॑त्रा॒हा विच॑र्षणि॒रिन्द्रं॒ तं हू॑महे व॒यम् सह॑स्रमुष्क॒ तुवि॑नृम्ण॒ सत्प॑ते॒ भवा॑ स॒मत्सु॑ नो वृ॒धे
stanzas.transliteration: yáḥ satrāhā́ vícarṣaṇir índraṃ táṃ hūmahe vayám sáhasramuṣka túvinr̥mṇa sátpate bhávā samátsu no vr̥dhé
stanzas.translation: We call upon that Indra, who, most active, ever slays the foe: Lord of the brave, Most Manly, with a thousand powers, help thou and prosper us in fight.

translations.griffith: We call upon that Indra, who, most active, ever slays the foe: Lord of the brave, Most Manly, with a thousand powers, help thou and prosper us in fight.

stanzas.sanskrit: बाध॑से॒ जना॑न्वृष॒भेव॑ म॒न्युना॒ घृषौ॑ मी॒ळ्ह ऋ॑चीषम अ॒स्माकं॑ बोध्यवि॒ता म॑हाध॒ने त॒नूष्व॒प्सु सूर्ये॑
stanzas.transliteration: bā́dhase jánān vr̥ṣabhéva manyúnā ghŕ̥ṣau mīḷhá r̥cīṣama asmā́kam bodhy avitā́ mahādhané tanū́ṣv apsú sū́rye
stanzas.translation: Rcisama, thou forcest men as with a bull, with anger, in the furious fray. Be thou our Helper in the mighty battle fought for sunlight, water, and for life.

translations.griffith: Rcisama, thou forcest men as with a bull, with anger, in the furious fray. Be thou our Helper in the mighty battle fought for sunlight, water, and for life.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॒ ज्येष्ठं॑ न॒ आ भ॑रँ॒ ओजि॑ष्ठं॒ पपु॑रि॒ श्रवः॑ येने॒मे चि॑त्र वज्रहस्त॒ रोद॑सी॒ ओभे सु॑शिप्र॒ प्राः
stanzas.transliteration: índra jyéṣṭhaṃ na ā́ bharam̐ ójiṣṭham pápuri śrávaḥ yénemé citra vajrahasta ródasī óbhé suśipra prā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: O Indra, bring us name and fame, enriching, mightiest, excellent, Wherewith, O Wondrous God, fair-visored, thunder-armed, thou hast filled full this earth and heaven.

translations.griffith: O Indra, bring us name and fame, enriching, mightiest, excellent, Wherewith, O Wondrous God, fair-visored, thunder-armed, thou hast filled full this earth and heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वामु॒ग्रमव॑से चर्षणी॒सहं॒ राज॑न्दे॒वेषु॑ हूमहे विश्वा॒ सु नो॑ विथु॒रा पि॑ब्द॒ना व॑सो॒ऽमित्रा॑न्त्सु॒षहा॑न्कृधि
stanzas.transliteration: tvā́m ugrám ávase carṣaṇīsáhaṃ rā́jan devéṣu hūmahe víśvā sú no vithurā́ pibdanā́ vaso -amítrān suṣáhān kr̥dhi
stanzas.translation: We call on thee, O King, Mighty amid the Gods, Ruler of men, to succour us. All that is weak in us, Excellent God, make firm: make our foes easy to subdue.

translations.griffith: We call on thee, O King, Mighty amid the Gods, Ruler of men, to succour us. All that is weak in us, Excellent God, make firm: make our foes easy to subdue.

stanzas.sanskrit: यदि॑न्द्र॒ नाहु॑षी॒ष्वाँ ओजो॑ नृ॒म्णं च॑ कृ॒ष्टिषु॑ यद्वा॒ पञ्च॑ क्षिती॒नां द्यु॒म्नमा भ॑र स॒त्रा विश्वा॑नि॒ पौंस्या॑
stanzas.transliteration: yád indra nā́huṣīṣv ā́m̐ ójo nr̥mṇáṃ ca kr̥ṣṭíṣu yád vā páñca kṣitīnā́ṃ dyumnám ā́ bhara satrā́ víśvāni paúṃsyā
stanzas.translation: All strength and valour that is found, Indra, in tribes of Nahushas, and all the splendid fame that the Five Tribes enjoy Bring, yea, all manly powers at once.

translations.griffith: All strength and valour that is found, Indra, in tribes of Nahushas, and all the splendid fame that the Five Tribes enjoy Bring, yea, all manly powers at once.

stanzas.sanskrit: यद्वा॑ तृ॒क्षौ म॑घवन्द्रु॒ह्यावा जने॒ यत्पू॒रौ कच्च॒ वृष्ण्य॑म् अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ तद्रि॑रीहि॒ सं नृ॒षाह्ये॒ऽमित्रा॑न्पृ॒त्सु तु॒र्वणे॑
stanzas.transliteration: yád vā tr̥kṣaú maghavan druhyā́v ā́ jáne yát pūraú kác ca vŕ̥ṣṇyam asmábhyaṃ tád rirīhi sáṃ nr̥ṣā́hye -amítrān pr̥tsú turváṇe
stanzas.translation: Or, Maghavan, what vigorous strength in Tr̥ikshi lay, in Druhyus or in Pûru's folk, Fully bestow on us, that, in the conquering fray, we may subdue our foes in fight.

translations.griffith: Or, Maghavan, what vigorous strength in Tr̥ikshi lay, in Druhyus or in Pûru's folk, Fully bestow on us, that, in the conquering fray, we may subdue our foes in fight.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॑ त्रि॒धातु॑ शर॒णं त्रि॒वरू॑थं स्वस्ति॒मत् छ॒र्दिर्य॑च्छ म॒घव॑द्भ्यश्च॒ मह्यं॑ च या॒वया॑ दि॒द्युमे॑भ्यः
stanzas.transliteration: índra tridhā́tu śaraṇáṃ trivárūthaṃ svastimát chardír yacha maghávadbhyaś ca máhyaṃ ca yāváyā didyúm ebhyaḥ
stanzas.translation: O Indra, grant a happy home, a triple refuge triply strong. Bestow a dwelling-place on the rich lords and me, and keep thy dart afar from these.

translations.griffith: O Indra, grant a happy home, a triple refuge triply strong. Bestow a dwelling-place on the rich lords and me, and keep thy dart afar from these.

stanzas.sanskrit: ये ग॑व्य॒ता मन॑सा॒ शत्रु॑माद॒भुर॑भिप्र॒घ्नन्ति॑ धृष्णु॒या अध॑ स्मा नो मघवन्निन्द्र गिर्वणस्तनू॒पा अन्त॑मो भव
stanzas.transliteration: yé gavyatā́ mánasā śátrum ādabhúr abhipraghnánti dhr̥ṣṇuyā́ ádha smā no maghavann indra girvaṇas tanūpā́ ántamo bhava
stanzas.translation: They who with minds intent on spoil subdue the foe, boldly attack and smite him down,– From these, O Indra Maghavan who lovest song, be closest guardian of our lives.

translations.griffith: They who with minds intent on spoil subdue the foe, boldly attack and smite him down,– From these, O Indra Maghavan who lovest song, be closest guardian of our lives.

stanzas.sanskrit: अध॑ स्मा नो वृ॒धे भ॒वेन्द्र॑ ना॒यम॑वा यु॒धि यद॒न्तरि॑क्षे प॒तय॑न्ति प॒र्णिनो॑ दि॒द्यव॑स्ति॒ग्ममू॑र्धानः
stanzas.transliteration: ádha smā no vr̥dhé bhava- -índra nāyám avā yudhí yád antárikṣe patáyanti parṇíno didyávas tigmámūrdhānaḥ
stanzas.translation: And now, O Indra, strengthen us: come near and aid us in the fight, What time the feathered shafts are flying in the air, the arrows with their sharpened points.

translations.griffith: And now, O Indra, strengthen us: come near and aid us in the fight, What time the feathered shafts are flying in the air, the arrows with their sharpened points.

stanzas.sanskrit: यत्र॒ शूरा॑सस्त॒न्वो॑ वितन्व॒ते प्रि॒या शर्म॑ पितॄ॒णाम् अध॑ स्मा यच्छ त॒न्वे॒३॒॑ तने॑ च छ॒र्दिर॒चित्तं॑ या॒वय॒ द्वेषः॑
stanzas.transliteration: yátra śū́rāsas tanvò vitanvaté priyā́ śárma pitr̥̄ṇā́m ádha smā yacha tanvè táne ca chardír acíttaṃ yāváya dvéṣaḥ
stanzas.translation: Give us, where heroes strain their bodies in the fight, the shelter that our fathers loved. To us and to our sons give refuge: keep afar all unobserved hostility.

translations.griffith: Give us, where heroes strain their bodies in the fight, the shelter that our fathers loved. To us and to our sons give refuge: keep afar all unobserved hostility.

stanzas.sanskrit: यदि॑न्द्र॒ सर्गे॒ अर्व॑तश्चो॒दया॑से महाध॒ने अ॒स॒म॒ने अध्व॑नि वृजि॒ने प॒थि श्ये॒नाँ इ॑व श्रवस्य॒तः
stanzas.transliteration: yád indra sárge árvataś codáyāse mahādhané asamané ádhvani vr̥jiné pathí śyenā́m̐ iva śravasyatáḥ
stanzas.translation: When, Indra, in the mighty fray thou urgest chargers to their speed, On the uneven road and on a toilsome path, like falcons, eager for renown,

translations.griffith: When, Indra, in the mighty fray thou urgest chargers to their speed, On the uneven road and on a toilsome path, like falcons, eager for renown,

stanzas.sanskrit: सिन्धूँ॑रिव प्रव॒ण आ॑शु॒या य॒तो यदि॒ क्लोश॒मनु॒ ष्वणि॑ आ ये वयो॒ न वर्वृ॑त॒त्यामि॑षि गृभी॒ता बा॒ह्वोर्गवि॑
stanzas.transliteration: síndhūm̐r iva pravaṇá āśuyā́ yató yádi klóśam ánu ṣváṇi ā́ yé váyo ná várvr̥taty ā́miṣi gr̥bhītā́ bāhvór gávi
stanzas.translation: Speeding like rivers rushing down a steep descent, responsive to the urging call, That come like birds attracted to the bait, held in by reins in both the driver's hands.

translations.griffith: Speeding like rivers rushing down a steep descent, responsive to the urging call, That come like birds attracted to the bait, held in by reins in both the driver's hands.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्वा॒दुष्किला॒यं मधु॑माँ उ॒तायं ती॒व्रः किला॒यं रस॑वाँ उ॒तायम् उ॒तो न्व१॒॑स्य प॑पि॒वांस॒मिन्द्रं॒ न कश्च॒न स॑हत आह॒वेषु॑
stanzas.transliteration: svādúṣ kílāyám mádhumām̐ utā́yáṃ tīvráḥ kílāyáṃ rásavām̐ utā́yám utó nv àsyá papivā́ṃsam índraṃ ná káś caná sahata āhavéṣu
stanzas.translation: YEA, this is good to taste and full of. sweetness, verily it is strong and rich in flavour. No one may conquer Indra in the battle when he hath drunken of the draught we offer.

translations.griffith: YEA, this is good to taste and full of. sweetness, verily it is strong and rich in flavour. No one may conquer Indra in the battle when he hath drunken of the draught we offer.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यं स्वा॒दुरि॒ह मदि॑ष्ठ आस॒ यस्येन्द्रो॑ वृत्र॒हत्ये॑ म॒माद॑ पु॒रूणि॒ यश्च्यौ॒त्ना शम्ब॑रस्य॒ वि न॑व॒तिं नव॑ च दे॒ह्यो॒३॒॑ हन्
stanzas.transliteration: ayáṃ svādúr ihá mádiṣṭha āsa yásyéndro vr̥trahátye mamā́da purū́ṇi yáś cyautnā́ śámbarasya ví navatíṃ náva ca dehyò hán
stanzas.translation: This sweet juice here had mightiest power to gladden: it boldened Indra when he siaughtered Vr̥itra, When he defeated Ṣambara's many onslaughts, and battered down his nineand ninety ramparts.

translations.griffith: This sweet juice here had mightiest power to gladden: it boldened Indra when he siaughtered Vr̥itra, When he defeated Ṣambara's many onslaughts, and battered down his nineand ninety ramparts.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यं मे॑ पी॒त उदि॑यर्ति॒ वाच॑म॒यं म॑नी॒षामु॑श॒तीम॑जीगः अ॒यं षळु॒र्वीर॑मिमीत॒ धीरो॒ न याभ्यो॒ भुव॑नं॒ कच्च॒नारे
stanzas.transliteration: ayám me pītá úd iyarti vā́cam ayám manīṣā́m uśatī́m ajīgaḥ ayáṃ ṣáḷ urvī́r amimīta dhī́ro ná yā́bhyo bhúvanaṃ kác canā́ré
stanzas.translation: This stirreth up my voice when I have drunk it: this hath aroused from sleep my yearning spirit. This Sage hath measured out the six expanses from which no single creature is excluded.

translations.griffith: This stirreth up my voice when I have drunk it: this hath aroused from sleep my yearning spirit. This Sage hath measured out the six expanses from which no single creature is excluded.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यं स यो व॑रि॒माणं॑ पृथि॒व्या व॒र्ष्माणं॑ दि॒वो अकृ॑णोद॒यं सः अ॒यं पी॒यूषं॑ ति॒सृषु॑ प्र॒वत्सु॒ सोमो॑ दाधारो॒र्व१॒॑न्तरि॑क्षम्
stanzas.transliteration: ayáṃ sá yó varimā́ṇam pr̥thivyā́ḥ- varṣmā́ṇaṃ divó ákr̥ṇod ayáṃ sáḥ ayám pīyū́ṣaṃ tisŕ̥ṣu pravátsu sómo dādhārorv àntárikṣam
stanzas.translation: This, even this, is he who hath created the breadth of earth, the lofty height of heaven. He formed the nectar in three headlong rivers. Soma supports the wide mid-air above us.

translations.griffith: This, even this, is he who hath created the breadth of earth, the lofty height of heaven. He formed the nectar in three headlong rivers. Soma supports the wide mid-air above us.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒यं वि॑दच्चित्र॒दृशी॑क॒मर्णः॑ शु॒क्रस॑द्मनामु॒षसा॒मनी॑के अ॒यं म॒हान्म॑ह॒ता स्कम्भ॑ने॒नोद्द्याम॑स्तभ्नाद्वृष॒भो म॒रुत्वा॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: ayáṃ vidac citradŕ̥śīkam árṇaḥ śukrásadmanām uṣásām ánīke ayám mahā́n mahatā́ skámbhanena- -úd dyā́m astabhnād vr̥ṣabhó marútvān
stanzas.translation: He found the wavy sea of brilliant colours in forefront of the Dawns who dwell in brightness. This Mighty One, the Steer begirt by Maruts, hath propped the heavens up with a mighty pillar.

translations.griffith: He found the wavy sea of brilliant colours in forefront of the Dawns who dwell in brightness. This Mighty One, the Steer begirt by Maruts, hath propped the heavens up with a mighty pillar.

stanzas.sanskrit: धृ॒षत्पि॑ब क॒लशे॒ सोम॑मिन्द्र वृत्र॒हा शू॑र सम॒रे वसू॑नाम् माध्यं॑दिने॒ सव॑न॒ आ वृ॑षस्व रयि॒स्थानो॑ र॒यिम॒स्मासु॑ धेहि
stanzas.transliteration: dhr̥ṣát piba kaláśe sómam indra vr̥trahā́ śūra samaré vásūnām mā́dhyaṃdine sávana ā́ vr̥ṣasva rayisthā́no rayím asmā́su dhehi
stanzas.translation: Drink Soma boldly from the beaker, Indra, in war for treasures, Hero, Vr̥itra-slayer! Fill thyself full at the mid-day libation, and give us wealth, thou Treasury of riches.

translations.griffith: Drink Soma boldly from the beaker, Indra, in war for treasures, Hero, Vr̥itra-slayer! Fill thyself full at the mid-day libation, and give us wealth, thou Treasury of riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॒ प्र णः॑ पुरए॒तेव॑ पश्य॒ प्र नो॑ नय प्रत॒रं वस्यो॒ अच्छ॑ भवा॑ सुपा॒रो अ॑तिपार॒यो नो॒ भवा॒ सुनी॑तिरु॒त वा॒मनी॑तिः
stanzas.transliteration: índra prá ṇaḥ puraetéva paśya prá no naya prataráṃ vásyo ácha bhávā supāró atipārayó no bhávā súnītir utá vāmánītiḥ
stanzas.translation: Look out for us, O Indra, as our Leader, and guide us on to gain yet goodlier treasure. Excellent Guardian, bear us well through peril, and lead us on to wealth with careful guidance.

translations.griffith: Look out for us, O Indra, as our Leader, and guide us on to gain yet goodlier treasure. Excellent Guardian, bear us well through peril, and lead us on to wealth with careful guidance.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒रुं नो॑ लो॒कमनु॑ नेषि वि॒द्वान्त्स्व॑र्व॒ज्ज्योति॒रभ॑यं स्व॒स्ति ऋ॒ष्वा त॑ इन्द्र॒ स्थवि॑रस्य बा॒हू उप॑ स्थेयाम शर॒णा बृ॒हन्ता॑
stanzas.transliteration: urúṃ no lokám ánu neṣi vidvā́n svàrvaj jyótir ábhayaṃ svastí r̥ṣvā́ ta indra sthávirasya bāhū́ úpa stheyāma śaraṇā́ br̥hántā
stanzas.translation: Lead us to ample room, O thou who knowest, to happiness, security, and sunlight. High, Indra, are the arms of thee the Mighty: may we betake. us to their lofty shelter.

translations.griffith: Lead us to ample room, O thou who knowest, to happiness, security, and sunlight. High, Indra, are the arms of thee the Mighty: may we betake. us to their lofty shelter.

stanzas.sanskrit: वरि॑ष्ठे न इन्द्र व॒न्धुरे॑ धा॒ वहि॑ष्ठयोः शताव॒न्नश्व॑यो॒रा इष॒मा व॑क्षी॒षां वर्षि॑ष्ठां॒ मा न॑स्तारीन्मघव॒न्रायो॑ अ॒र्यः
stanzas.transliteration: váriṣṭhe na indra vandhúre dhāḥ- váhiṣṭhayoḥ śatāvann áśvayor ā́ íṣam ā́ vakṣīṣā́ṃ várṣiṣṭhām mā́ nas tārīn maghavan rā́yo aryáḥ
stanzas.translation: Set us on widest chariot-seat, O Indra, with two steeds best to draw, O Lord of Hundreds! Bring us the best among all sorts of viands: let not the foe's wealth, Maghavan, subdue us.

translations.griffith: Set us on widest chariot-seat, O Indra, with two steeds best to draw, O Lord of Hundreds! Bring us the best among all sorts of viands: let not the foe's wealth, Maghavan, subdue us.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॑ मृ॒ळ मह्यं॑ जी॒वातु॑मिच्छ चो॒दय॒ धिय॒मय॑सो॒ न धारा॑म् यत्किं चा॒हं त्वा॒युरि॒दं वदा॑मि॒ तज्जु॑षस्व कृ॒धि मा॑ दे॒वव॑न्तम्
stanzas.transliteration: índra mr̥ḷá máhyaṃ jīvā́tum icha codáya dhíyam áyaso ná dhā́rām yát kíṃ cāháṃ tvāyúr idáṃ vádāmi táj juṣasva kr̥dhí mā devávantam
stanzas.translation: Be gracious, Indra, let my days be lengthened: sharpen my thought as 'twere a blade of iron Approve whatever words I speak, dependent on thee, and grant me thy divine protection.

translations.griffith: Be gracious, Indra, let my days be lengthened: sharpen my thought as 'twere a blade of iron Approve whatever words I speak, dependent on thee, and grant me thy divine protection.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्रा॒तार॒मिन्द्र॑मवि॒तार॒मिन्द्रं॒ हवे॑हवे सु॒हवं॒ शूर॒मिन्द्र॑म् ह्वया॑मि श॒क्रं पु॑रुहू॒तमिन्द्रं॑ स्व॒स्ति नो॑ म॒घवा॑ धा॒त्विन्द्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: trātā́ram índram avitā́ram índraṃ háve-have suhávaṃ śū́ram índram hváyāmi śakrám puruhūtám índraṃ svastí no maghávā dhātv índraḥ
stanzas.translation: Indra the Rescuer, Indra the Helper, Hero who listens at each invocation, Ṣakra I call, Indra invoked of many. May Indra Maghavan prosper and bless us.

translations.griffith: Indra the Rescuer, Indra the Helper, Hero who listens at each invocation, Ṣakra I call, Indra invoked of many. May Indra Maghavan prosper and bless us.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रः॑ सु॒त्रामा॒ स्ववाँ॒ अवो॑भिः सुमृळी॒को भ॑वतु वि॒श्ववे॑दाः बाध॑तां॒ द्वेषो॒ अभ॑यं कृणोतु सु॒वीर्य॑स्य॒ पत॑यः स्याम
stanzas.transliteration: índraḥ sutrā́mā svávām̐ ávobhiḥ sumr̥ḷīkó bhavatu viśvávedāḥ bā́dhatāṃ dvéṣo ábhayaṃ kr̥ṇotu suvī́ryasya pátayaḥ syāma
stanzas.translation: May helpful Indra as our good Protector, Lord of all treasures, favour us with succour, Baffle our foes, and give us rest and safety, and may we be the lords of hero vigour.

translations.griffith: May helpful Indra as our good Protector, Lord of all treasures, favour us with succour, Baffle our foes, and give us rest and safety, and may we be the lords of hero vigour.

stanzas.sanskrit: तस्य॑ व॒यं सु॑म॒तौ य॒ज्ञिय॒स्यापि॑ भ॒द्रे सौ॑मन॒से स्या॑म स सु॒त्रामा॒ स्ववाँ॒ इन्द्रो॑ अ॒स्मे आ॒राच्चि॒द्द्वेषः॑ सनु॒तर्यु॑योतु
stanzas.transliteration: tásya vayáṃ sumataú yajñíyasya- -ápi bhadré saumanasé syāma sá sutrā́mā svávām̐ índro asmé ārā́c cid dvéṣaḥ sanutár yuyotu
stanzas.translation: May we enjoy the grace of him the Holy, yea, may we dwell in his auspicious favour. May helpful Indra as our good Preserver drive from us, even from afar, our foemen.

translations.griffith: May we enjoy the grace of him the Holy, yea, may we dwell in his auspicious favour. May helpful Indra as our good Preserver drive from us, even from afar, our foemen.

stanzas.sanskrit: अव॒ त्वे इ॑न्द्र प्र॒वतो॒ नोर्मिर्गिरो॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि नि॒युतो॑ धवन्ते उ॒रू न राधः॒ सव॑ना पु॒रूण्य॒पो गा व॑ज्रिन्युवसे॒ समिन्दू॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: áva tvé indra praváto nórmír gíro bráhmāṇi niyúto dhavante urū́ ná rā́dhaḥ sávanā purū́ṇi- apó gā́ vajrin yuvase sám índūn
stanzas.translation: Like rivers rushing down a slope, O Indra, to thee haste songs and prayers and linked verses. Thou gatherest, Thunderer! like widespread bounty, kine, water, drops, and manifold libations.

translations.griffith: Like rivers rushing down a slope, O Indra, to thee haste songs and prayers and linked verses. Thou gatherest, Thunderer! like widespread bounty, kine, water, drops, and manifold libations.

stanzas.sanskrit: क ईं॑ स्तव॒त्कः पृ॑णा॒त्को य॑जाते॒ यदु॒ग्रमिन्म॒घवा॑ वि॒श्वहावे॑त् पादा॑विव प्र॒हर॑न्न॒न्यम॑न्यं कृ॒णोति॒ पूर्व॒मप॑रं॒ शची॑भिः
stanzas.transliteration: ká īṃ stavat káḥ pr̥ṇāt kó yajāte yád ugrám ín maghávā viśváhā́vet pā́dāv iva prahárann anyám-anyaṃ kr̥ṇóti pū́rvam áparaṃ śácībhiḥ
stanzas.translation: Who lauds him, satisfies him, pays him worship? E'en the rich noble still hath found him mighty. With power, as when one moves his feet alternate, he makes the last precede, the foremost follow.

translations.griffith: Who lauds him, satisfies him, pays him worship? E'en the rich noble still hath found him mighty. With power, as when one moves his feet alternate, he makes the last precede, the foremost follow.

stanzas.sanskrit: शृ॒ण्वे वी॒र उ॒ग्रमु॑ग्रं दमा॒यन्न॒न्यम॑न्यमतिनेनी॒यमा॑नः ए॒ध॒मा॒न॒द्विळु॒भय॑स्य॒ राजा॑ चोष्कू॒यते॒ विश॒ इन्द्रो॑ मनु॒ष्या॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: śr̥ṇvé vīrá ugrám-ugraṃ damāyánn anyám-anyam atinenīyámānaḥ edhamānadvíḷ ubháyasya rā́jā coṣkūyáte víśa índro manuṣyā̀n
stanzas.translation: Famed is the Hero as each strong man's tamer, ever advancing one and then another. King of both worlds, hating the high and haughty, Indra protects the men who are his people.

translations.griffith: Famed is the Hero as each strong man's tamer, ever advancing one and then another. King of both worlds, hating the high and haughty, Indra protects the men who are his people.

stanzas.sanskrit: परा॒ पूर्वे॑षां स॒ख्या वृ॑णक्ति वि॒तर्तु॑राणो॒ अप॑रेभिरेति अना॑नुभूतीरवधून्वा॒नः पू॒र्वीरिन्द्रः॑ श॒रद॑स्तर्तरीति
stanzas.transliteration: párā pū́rveṣāṃ sakhyā́ vr̥ṇakti vitárturāṇo áparebhir eti ánānubhūtīr avadhūnvānáḥ pūrvī́r índraḥ śarádas tartarīti
stanzas.translation: He loves no more the men he loved aforetime: he turns and moves away allied with others. Rejecting those who disregard his worship, Indra victorious lives through many autumns.

translations.griffith: He loves no more the men he loved aforetime: he turns and moves away allied with others. Rejecting those who disregard his worship, Indra victorious lives through many autumns.

stanzas.sanskrit: रू॒पंरू॑पं॒ प्रति॑रूपो बभूव॒ तद॑स्य रू॒पं प्र॑ति॒चक्ष॑णाय इन्द्रो॑ मा॒याभिः॑ पुरु॒रूप॑ ईयते यु॒क्ता ह्य॑स्य॒ हर॑यः श॒ता दश॑
stanzas.transliteration: rūpáṃ-rūpam prátirūpo babhūva tád asya rūpám praticákṣaṇāya índro māyā́bhiḥ pururū́pa īyate yuktā́ hy àsya hárayaḥ śatā́ dáśa
stanzas.translation: In every figure he hath been the mode: this is his only form for us to look on. Indra moves multiform by his illusions; for his Bay Steeds are yoked, ten times a hundred.

translations.griffith: In every figure he hath been the mode: this is his only form for us to look on. Indra moves multiform by his illusions; for his Bay Steeds are yoked, ten times a hundred.

stanzas.sanskrit: यु॒जा॒नो ह॒रिता॒ रथे॒ भूरि॒ त्वष्टे॒ह रा॑जति को वि॒श्वाहा॑ द्विष॒तः पक्ष॑ आसत उ॒तासी॑नेषु सू॒रिषु॑
stanzas.transliteration: yujānó harítā ráthe bhū́ri tváṣṭehá rājati kó viśvā́hā dviṣatáḥ pákṣa āsate- utā́sīneṣu sūríṣu
stanzas.translation: Here Tvashṭar, yoking to the car the Bay Steeds, hath extended sway. Who will for ever stand upon the foeman's side, even when our princes sit at ease?

translations.griffith: Here Tvashṭar, yoking to the car the Bay Steeds, hath extended sway. Who will for ever stand upon the foeman's side, even when our princes sit at ease?

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ग॒व्यू॒ति क्षेत्र॒माग॑न्म देवा उ॒र्वी स॒ती भूमि॑रंहूर॒णाभू॑त् बृह॑स्पते॒ प्र चि॑कित्सा॒ गवि॑ष्टावि॒त्था स॒ते ज॑रि॒त्र इ॑न्द्र॒ पन्था॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: agavyūtí kṣétram ā́ganma devāḥ- urvī́ satī́ bhū́mir aṃhūraṇā́bhūt bŕ̥haspate prá cikitsā gáviṣṭāv itthā́ saté jaritrá indra pánthām
stanzas.translation: Gods, we have reached a country void of pasture the land, though spacious, was too small to hold us. Br̥ihaspati, provide in war for cattle; find a path, Indra, for this faithful singer.

translations.griffith: Gods, we have reached a country void of pasture the land, though spacious, was too small to hold us. Br̥ihaspati, provide in war for cattle; find a path, Indra, for this faithful singer.

stanzas.sanskrit: दि॒वेदि॑वे स॒दृशी॑र॒न्यमर्धं॑ कृ॒ष्णा अ॑सेध॒दप॒ सद्म॑नो॒ जाः अह॑न्दा॒सा वृ॑ष॒भो व॑स्न॒यन्तो॒दव्र॑जे व॒र्चिनं॒ शम्ब॑रं च
stanzas.transliteration: divé-dive sadŕ̥śīr anyám árdhaṃ kr̥ṣṇā́ asedhad ápa sádmano jā́ḥ áhan dāsā́ vr̥ṣabhó vasnayántā- -udávraje varcínaṃ śámbaraṃ ca
stanzas.translation: Day after day far from their seat he drove them, alike, from place to place, those darksome creatures. The Hero slew the meanly-huckstering Dâsas, Varcin and Ṣambara, where the waters gather.

translations.griffith: Day after day far from their seat he drove them, alike, from place to place, those darksome creatures. The Hero slew the meanly-huckstering Dâsas, Varcin and Ṣambara, where the waters gather.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र॒स्तो॒क इन्नु राध॑सस्त इन्द्र॒ दश॒ कोश॑यी॒र्दश॑ वा॒जिनो॑ऽदात् दिवो॑दासादतिथि॒ग्वस्य॒ राधः॑ शाम्ब॒रं वसु॒ प्रत्य॑ग्रभीष्म
stanzas.transliteration: prastoká ín nú rā́dhasas ta indra dáśa kóśayīr dáśa vājíno 'dāt dívodāsād atithigvásya rā́dhaḥ śāmbaráṃ vásu práty agrabhīṣma
stanzas.translation: Out of thy bounty, Indra, hath Prastoka bestowed ten coffers and ten mettled horses. We have received in turn from Divodâsa Ṣambara's wealth, the gift of Âtithigva.

translations.griffith: Out of thy bounty, Indra, hath Prastoka bestowed ten coffers and ten mettled horses. We have received in turn from Divodâsa Ṣambara's wealth, the gift of Âtithigva.

stanzas.sanskrit: दशाश्वा॒न्दश॒ कोशा॒न्दश॒ वस्त्राधि॑भोजना दशो॑ हिरण्यपि॒ण्डान्दिवो॑दासादसानिषम्
stanzas.transliteration: dáśā́śvān dáśa kóśān dáśa vástrā́dhibhojanā dáśo hiraṇyapiṇḍā́n dívodāsād asāniṣam
stanzas.translation: Ten horses and ten treasure-chests, ten garments as an added gift, These and ten lumps of gold have I received from Divodâsa's hand.

translations.griffith: Ten horses and ten treasure-chests, ten garments as an added gift, These and ten lumps of gold have I received from Divodâsa's hand.

stanzas.sanskrit: दश॒ रथा॒न्प्रष्टि॑मतः श॒तं गा अथ॑र्वभ्यः अ॒श्व॒थः पा॒यवे॑ऽदात्
stanzas.transliteration: dáśa ráthān práṣṭimataḥ śatáṃ gā́ átharvabhyaḥ aśvatháḥ pāyáve 'dāt
stanzas.translation: Ten cars with extra steed to each, for the Atharvans hundred cows, Hath Aṣvatha to Pâyu given.

translations.griffith: Ten cars with extra steed to each, for the Atharvans hundred cows, Hath Aṣvatha to Pâyu given.

stanzas.sanskrit: महि॒ राधो॑ वि॒श्वज॑न्यं॒ दधा॑नान्भ॒रद्वा॑जान्त्सार्ञ्ज॒यो अ॒भ्य॑यष्ट
stanzas.transliteration: máhi rā́dho viśvájanyaṃ dádhānān bharádvājān sārñjayó abhy àyaṣṭa
stanzas.translation: Thus Sr̥injaya's son honoured the Bharadvâjas, recipients of all noble gifts and bounty.

translations.griffith: Thus Sr̥injaya's son honoured the Bharadvâjas, recipients of all noble gifts and bounty.

stanzas.sanskrit: वन॑स्पते वी॒ड्व॑ङ्गो॒ हि भू॒या अ॒स्मत्स॑खा प्र॒तर॑णः सु॒वीरः॑ गोभिः॒ संन॑द्धो असि वी॒ळय॑स्वास्था॒ता ते॑ जयतु॒ जेत्वा॑नि
stanzas.transliteration: vánaspate vīḍvàṅgo hí bhūyā́ḥ- asmátsakhā pratáraṇaḥ suvī́raḥ góbhiḥ sáṃnaddho asi vīḷáyasva- -āsthātā́ te jayatu jétvāni
stanzas.translation: Lord of the wood, be firm and strong in body: be, bearing us, a brave victorious hero Show forth thy strength, compact with straps of leather, and let thy rider win all spoils of battle.

translations.griffith: Lord of the wood, be firm and strong in body: be, bearing us, a brave victorious hero Show forth thy strength, compact with straps of leather, and let thy rider win all spoils of battle.

stanzas.sanskrit: दि॒वस्पृ॑थि॒व्याः पर्योज॒ उद्भृ॑तं॒ वन॒स्पति॑भ्यः॒ पर्याभृ॑तं॒ सहः॑ अ॒पामो॒ज्मानं॒ परि॒ गोभि॒रावृ॑त॒मिन्द्र॑स्य॒ वज्रं॑ ह॒विषा॒ रथं॑ यज
stanzas.transliteration: divás pr̥thivyā́ḥ páry ója údbhr̥taṃ vánaspátibhyaḥ páry ā́bhr̥taṃ sáhaḥ apā́m ojmā́nam pári góbhir ā́vr̥tam índrasya vájraṃ havíṣā ráthaṃ yaja
stanzas.translation: Its mighty strength was borrowed from the heaven and earth: its conquering force was brought from sovrans of the wood. Honour with holy gifts the Car like Indra's bolt, the Car bound round with straps, the vigour of the floods.

translations.griffith: Its mighty strength was borrowed from the heaven and earth: its conquering force was brought from sovrans of the wood. Honour with holy gifts the Car like Indra's bolt, the Car bound round with straps, the vigour of the floods.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्र॑स्य॒ वज्रो॑ म॒रुता॒मनी॑कं मि॒त्रस्य॒ गर्भो॒ वरु॑णस्य॒ नाभिः॑ सेमां नो॑ ह॒व्यदा॑तिं जुषा॒णो देव॑ रथ॒ प्रति॑ ह॒व्या गृ॑भाय
stanzas.transliteration: índrasya vájro marútām ánīkam mitrásya gárbho váruṇasya nā́bhiḥ sémā́ṃ no havyádātiṃ juṣāṇó déva ratha práti havyā́ gr̥bhāya
stanzas.translation: Thou Bolt of Indra, Vanguard of the Maruts, close knit to Varuṇa and Child of Mitra,– As such, accepting gifts which here we offer, receive, O Godlike Chariot, these oblations.

translations.griffith: Thou Bolt of Indra, Vanguard of the Maruts, close knit to Varuṇa and Child of Mitra,– As such, accepting gifts which here we offer, receive, O Godlike Chariot, these oblations.

stanzas.sanskrit: उप॑ श्वासय पृथि॒वीमु॒त द्यां पु॑रु॒त्रा ते॑ मनुतां॒ विष्ठि॑तं॒ जग॑त् स दु॑न्दुभे स॒जूरिन्द्रे॑ण दे॒वैर्दू॒राद्दवी॑यो॒ अप॑ सेध॒ शत्रू॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: úpa śvāsaya pr̥thivī́m utá dyā́m purutrā́ te manutāṃ víṣṭhitaṃ jágat sá dundubhe sajū́r índreṇa devaír dūrā́d dávīyo ápa sedha śátrūn
stanzas.translation: Send forth thy voice aloud through earth and heaven, and let the world in all its breadth regard thee; O Drum, accordant with the Gods and Indra, drive thou afar, yea, very far, our foemen.

translations.griffith: Send forth thy voice aloud through earth and heaven, and let the world in all its breadth regard thee; O Drum, accordant with the Gods and Indra, drive thou afar, yea, very far, our foemen.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ क्र॑न्दय॒ बल॒मोजो॑ न॒ आ धा॒ निः ष्ट॑निहि दुरि॒ता बाध॑मानः अप॑ प्रोथ दुन्दुभे दु॒च्छुना॑ इ॒त इन्द्र॑स्य मु॒ष्टिर॑सि वी॒ळय॑स्व
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ krandaya bálam ójo na ā́ dhāḥ- ní ṣṭanihi duritā́ bā́dhamānaḥ ápa protha dundubhe duchúnā itáḥ- índrasya muṣṭír asi vīḷáyasva
stanzas.translation: Thunder out strength and fill us full of vigour: yea, thunder forth and drive away all dangers. Drive hence, O War-drum, drive away misfortune: thou art the Fist of Indra: show thy firmness.

translations.griffith: Thunder out strength and fill us full of vigour: yea, thunder forth and drive away all dangers. Drive hence, O War-drum, drive away misfortune: thou art the Fist of Indra: show thy firmness.

stanzas.sanskrit: आमूर॑ज प्र॒त्याव॑र्तये॒माः के॑तु॒मद्दु॑न्दु॒भिर्वा॑वदीति समश्व॑पर्णा॒श्चर॑न्ति नो॒ नरो॒ऽस्माक॑मिन्द्र र॒थिनो॑ जयन्तु
stanzas.transliteration: ā́mū́r aja pratyā́vartayemā́ḥ ketumád dundubhír vāvadīti sám áśvaparṇāś cáranti no náro -asmā́kam indra rathíno jayantu
stanzas.translation: Drive hither those, and these again bring hither: the War-drum speaks aloud as battle's signal. Our heroes, winged with horses, come together. Let our car-warriors, Indra, be triumphant.

translations.griffith: Drive hither those, and these again bring hither: the War-drum speaks aloud as battle's signal. Our heroes, winged with horses, come together. Let our car-warriors, Indra, be triumphant.

stanzas.sanskrit: य॒ज्ञाय॑ज्ञा वो अ॒ग्नये॑ गि॒रागि॑रा च॒ दक्ष॑से प्रप्र॑ व॒यम॒मृतं॑ जा॒तवे॑दसं प्रि॒यं मि॒त्रं न शं॑सिषम्
stanzas.transliteration: yajñā́-yajñā vo agnáye girā́-girā ca dákṣase prá-pra vayám amŕ̥taṃ jātávedasam priyám mitráṃ ná śaṃsiṣam
stanzas.translation: SING to your Agni with each song, at every sacrifice, for strength. Come, let us praise the Wise and Everlasting God, even as a well-beloved Friend,

translations.griffith: SING to your Agni with each song, at every sacrifice, for strength. Come, let us praise the Wise and Everlasting God, even as a well-beloved Friend,

stanzas.sanskrit: ऊ॒र्जो नपा॑तं॒ स हि॒नायम॑स्म॒युर्दाशे॑म ह॒व्यदा॑तये भुव॒द्वाजे॑ष्ववि॒ता भुव॑द्वृ॒ध उ॒त त्रा॒ता त॒नूना॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: ūrjó nápātaṃ sá hinā́yám asmayúr dā́śema havyádātaye bhúvad vā́jeṣv avitā́ bhúvad vr̥dháḥ- utá trātā́ tanū́nām
stanzas.translation: The Son of Strength; for is he not our gracious Lord? Let us serve him who bears our gifts. In battle may he be our help and strengthener, yea, be the saviour of our lives.

translations.griffith: The Son of Strength; for is he not our gracious Lord? Let us serve him who bears our gifts. In battle may he be our help and strengthener, yea, be the saviour of our lives.

stanzas.sanskrit: वृषा॒ ह्य॑ग्ने अ॒जरो॑ म॒हान्वि॒भास्य॒र्चिषा॑ अज॑स्रेण शो॒चिषा॒ शोशु॑चच्छुचे सुदी॒तिभिः॒ सु दी॑दिहि
stanzas.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣā hy àgne ajáro mahā́n vibhā́sy arcíṣā ájasreṇa śocíṣā śóśucac chuce sudītíbhiḥ sú dīdihi
stanzas.translation: Agni, thou beamest forth with light, great Hero, never changed by time. Shining, pure Agni! with a light that never fades, beam with thy fair beams brilliantly.

translations.griffith: Agni, thou beamest forth with light, great Hero, never changed by time. Shining, pure Agni! with a light that never fades, beam with thy fair beams brilliantly.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒हो दे॒वान्यज॑सि॒ यक्ष्या॑नु॒षक्तव॒ क्रत्वो॒त दं॒सना॑ अ॒र्वाचः॑ सीं कृणुह्य॒ग्नेऽव॑से॒ रास्व॒ वाजो॒त वं॑स्व
stanzas.transliteration: mahó devā́n yájasi yákṣy ānuṣák táva krátvotá daṃsánā arvā́caḥ sīṃ kr̥ṇuhy agné 'vase rā́sva vā́jotá vaṃsva
stanzas.translation: Thou worshippest great Gods: bring them without delay by wisdom and thy wondrous power. O Agni, make them turn hither to succour us. Give strength, and win it for thyself.

translations.griffith: Thou worshippest great Gods: bring them without delay by wisdom and thy wondrous power. O Agni, make them turn hither to succour us. Give strength, and win it for thyself.

stanzas.sanskrit: यमापो॒ अद्र॑यो॒ वना॒ गर्भ॑मृ॒तस्य॒ पिप्र॑ति सह॑सा॒ यो म॑थि॒तो जाय॑ते॒ नृभिः॑ पृथि॒व्या अधि॒ सान॑वि
stanzas.transliteration: yám ā́po ádrayo vánā gárbham r̥tásya píprati sáhasā yó mathitó jā́yate nŕ̥bhiḥ pr̥thivyā́ ádhi sā́navi
stanzas.translation: He whom floods, stones, and trees support, the offspring of eternal Law; He who when rubbed with force is brought to life by men upon the lofty height of earth;

translations.griffith: He whom floods, stones, and trees support, the offspring of eternal Law; He who when rubbed with force is brought to life by men upon the lofty height of earth;

stanzas.sanskrit: आ यः प॒प्रौ भा॒नुना॒ रोद॑सी उ॒भे धू॒मेन॑ धावते दि॒वि ति॒रस्तमो॑ ददृश॒ ऊर्म्या॒स्वा श्या॒वास्व॑रु॒षो वृषा श्या॒वा अ॑रु॒षो वृषा॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yáḥ papraú bhānúnā ródasī ubhé dhūména dhāvate diví tirás támo dadr̥śa ū́rmyāsv~ā́ śyāvā́sv aruṣó vŕ̥ṣā- -ā́ śyāvā́ aruṣó vŕ̥ṣā
stanzas.translation: He who hath filled both worlds fult with his brilliant shine, who hastens with his smoke to heaven; He made himself apparent through the gloom by night, the Red Bull in the darksome nights, the Red Bull in the darksome nights.

translations.griffith: He who hath filled both worlds fult with his brilliant shine, who hastens with his smoke to heaven; He made himself apparent through the gloom by night, the Red Bull in the darksome nights, the Red Bull in the darksome nights.

stanzas.sanskrit: बृ॒हद्भि॑रग्ने अ॒र्चिभिः॑ शु॒क्रेण॑ देव शो॒चिषा॑ भ॒रद्वा॑जे समिधा॒नो य॑विष्ठ्य रे॒वन्नः॑ शुक्र दीदिहि द्यु॒मत्पा॑वक दीदिहि
stanzas.transliteration: br̥hádbhir agne arcíbhiḥ śukréṇa deva śocíṣā bharádvāje samidhānó yaviṣṭhya reván naḥ śukra dīdihi dyumát pāvaka dīdihi
stanzas.translation: O Agni, with thy lofty beams, with thy pure brilliancy, O God, Kindled, Most Youthful One! by Bharadvâja's hand, shine on us, O pure God, with wealth, shine, Purifier! splendidly.

translations.griffith: O Agni, with thy lofty beams, with thy pure brilliancy, O God, Kindled, Most Youthful One! by Bharadvâja's hand, shine on us, O pure God, with wealth, shine, Purifier! splendidly.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वा॑सां गृ॒हप॑तिर्वि॒शाम॑सि॒ त्वम॑ग्ने॒ मानु॑षीणाम् श॒तं पू॒र्भिर्य॑विष्ठ पा॒ह्यंह॑सः समे॒द्धारं॑ श॒तं हिमाः॑ स्तो॒तृभ्यो॒ ये च॒ दद॑ति
stanzas.transliteration: víśvāsāṃ gr̥hápatir viśā́m asi tvám agne mā́nuṣīṇām śatám pūrbhír yaviṣṭha pāhy áṃhasaḥ sameddhā́raṃ śatáṃ hímāḥ- stotŕ̥bhyo yé ca dádati
