stanzas.translation: Thou art the Lord of house and home of all the tribes, O Agni, of all tribes of men. Guard with a hundred forts thy kindler from distress, through hundred winters, Youngest God! and those who make thy singers rich.

translations.griffith: Thou art the Lord of house and home of all the tribes, O Agni, of all tribes of men. Guard with a hundred forts thy kindler from distress, through hundred winters, Youngest God! and those who make thy singers rich.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं न॑श्चि॒त्र ऊ॒त्या वसो॒ राधां॑सि चोदय अ॒स्य रा॒यस्त्वम॑ग्ने र॒थीर॑सि वि॒दा गा॒धं तु॒चे तु नः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ naś citrá ūtyā́ váso rā́dhāṃsi codaya asyá rāyás tvám agne rathī́r asi vidā́ gādháṃ tucé tú naḥ
stanzas.translation: Wonderful, with thy favouring help, send us thy bounties, gracious Lord. Thou art the Charioteer, Agni, of earthly wealth: find rest and safety for our seed.

translations.griffith: Wonderful, with thy favouring help, send us thy bounties, gracious Lord. Thou art the Charioteer, Agni, of earthly wealth: find rest and safety for our seed.

stanzas.sanskrit: पर्षि॑ तो॒कं तन॑यं प॒र्तृभि॒ष्ट्वमद॑ब्धै॒रप्र॑युत्वभिः अग्ने॒ हेळां॑सि॒ दैव्या॑ युयोधि॒ नोऽदे॑वानि॒ ह्वरां॑सि च
stanzas.transliteration: párṣi tokáṃ tánayam partŕ̥bhiṣ ṭvám ádabdhair áprayutvabhiḥ ágne héḷāṃsi daívyā yuyodhi naḥ- -ádevāni hvárāṃsi ca
stanzas.translation: With guards unfailing never negligent speed thou our children and our progeny. Keep far from us, O Agni, all celestial wrath and wickedness of godless men.

translations.griffith: With guards unfailing never negligent speed thou our children and our progeny. Keep far from us, O Agni, all celestial wrath and wickedness of godless men.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ स॑खायः सब॒र्दुघां॑ धे॒नुम॑जध्व॒मुप॒ नव्य॑सा॒ वचः॑ सृ॒जध्व॒मन॑पस्फुराम्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ sakhāyaḥ sabardúghāṃ dhenúm ajadhvam úpa návyasā vácaḥ sr̥jádhvam ánapasphurām
stanzas.translation: Hither, O friends, with newest song drive her who freely pours her milk; Loose her who never turns away;

translations.griffith: Hither, O friends, with newest song drive her who freely pours her milk; Loose her who never turns away;

stanzas.sanskrit: या शर्धा॑य॒ मारु॑ताय॒ स्वभा॑नवे॒ श्रवोऽमृ॑त्यु॒ धुक्ष॑त या मृ॑ळी॒के म॒रुतां॑ तु॒राणां॒ या सु॒म्नैरे॑व॒याव॑री
stanzas.transliteration: yā́ śárdhāya mā́rutāya svábhānave śrávó 'mr̥tyu dhúkṣata yā́ mr̥ḷīké marútāṃ turā́ṇāṃ yā́ sumnaír evayā́varī
stanzas.translation: Who, for the host of Maruts bright with native sheen, hath shed immortal fame like milk; Whom the impetuous Maruts look upon with love, who moves in splendour on their ways.

translations.griffith: Who, for the host of Maruts bright with native sheen, hath shed immortal fame like milk; Whom the impetuous Maruts look upon with love, who moves in splendour on their ways.

stanzas.sanskrit: भ॒रद्वा॑जा॒याव॑ धुक्षत द्वि॒ता धे॒नुं च॑ वि॒श्वदो॑हस॒मिषं॑ च वि॒श्वभो॑जसम्
stanzas.transliteration: bharádvājāyā́va dhukṣata dvitā́ dhenúṃ ca viśvádohasam íṣaṃ ca viśvábhojasam
stanzas.translation: For Bharadvâja she poured down in days of old The milch-cow yielding milk for all, and food that gives all nourishment.

translations.griffith: For Bharadvâja she poured down in days of old The milch-cow yielding milk for all, and food that gives all nourishment.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं व॒ इन्द्रं॒ न सु॒क्रतुं॒ वरु॑णमिव मा॒यिन॑म् अ॒र्य॒मणं॒ न म॒न्द्रं सृ॒प्रभो॑जसं॒ विष्णुं॒ न स्तु॑ष आ॒दिशे॑
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ va índraṃ ná sukrátuṃ váruṇam iva māyínam aryamáṇaṃ ná mandráṃ sr̥prábhojasaṃ víṣṇuṃ ná stuṣa ādíśe
stanzas.translation: Your friend like Indra passing wise, with magic power like Varuṇa. Like Aryaman joy-giving, bringing plenteous food like ViSnxu for my wish, I praise,

translations.griffith: Your friend like Indra passing wise, with magic power like Varuṇa. Like Aryaman joy-giving, bringing plenteous food like ViSnxu for my wish, I praise,

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वे॒षं शर्धो॒ न मारु॑तं तुवि॒ष्वण्य॑न॒र्वाणं॑ पू॒षणं॒ सं यथा॑ श॒ता सं स॒हस्रा॒ कारि॑षच्चर्ष॒णिभ्य॒ आँ आ॒विर्गू॒ळ्हा वसू॑ करत्सु॒वेदा॑ नो॒ वसू॑ करत्
stanzas.transliteration: tveṣáṃ śárdho ná mā́rutaṃ tuviṣváṇi- anarvā́ṇam pūṣáṇaṃ sáṃ yáthā śatā́ sáṃ sahásrā kā́riṣac carṣaṇíbhya ā́m̐ āvír gūḷhā́ vásū karat suvédā no vásū karat
stanzas.translation: Bright as the host of Maruts mighty in their roar. May they bring Pûshan free from foes; May they bring hither hundreds, thousands for our men: may they bring hidden stores to light, and make wealth easy to be found.

translations.griffith: Bright as the host of Maruts mighty in their roar. May they bring Pûshan free from foes; May they bring hither hundreds, thousands for our men: may they bring hidden stores to light, and make wealth easy to be found.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ मा॑ पूष॒न्नुप॑ द्रव॒ शंसि॑षं॒ नु ते॑ अपिक॒र्ण आ॑घृणे अ॒घा अ॒र्यो अरा॑तयः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ mā pūṣann úpa drava śáṃsiṣaṃ nú te apikarṇá āghr̥ṇe aghā́ aryó árātayaḥ
stanzas.translation: Haste to me, Pûshan, in thine car, bright Deity: I fain would speak: Most sinful is our foeman's hate.

translations.griffith: Haste to me, Pûshan, in thine car, bright Deity: I fain would speak: Most sinful is our foeman's hate.

stanzas.sanskrit: मा का॑क॒म्बीर॒मुद्वृ॑हो॒ वन॒स्पति॒मश॑स्ती॒र्वि हि नीन॑शः मोत सूरो॒ अह॑ ए॒वा च॒न ग्री॒वा आ॒दध॑ते॒ वेः
stanzas.transliteration: mā́ kākambī́ram úd vr̥ho vánaspátim áśastīr ví hí nī́naśaḥ mótá sū́ro áha evā́ caná grīvā́ ādádhate véḥ
stanzas.translation: Tear not up by the roots the Kâkambîra tree: destroy thou all malignity. Let them not snare by day the neck of that Celestial Bird the Sun.

translations.griffith: Tear not up by the roots the Kâkambîra tree: destroy thou all malignity. Let them not snare by day the neck of that Celestial Bird the Sun.

stanzas.sanskrit: दृते॑रिव तेऽवृ॒कम॑स्तु स॒ख्यम् अच्छि॑द्रस्य दध॒न्वतः॒ सुपू॑र्णस्य दध॒न्वतः॑
stanzas.transliteration: dŕ̥ter iva te 'vr̥kám astu sakhyám áchidrasya dadhanvátaḥ súpūrṇasya dadhanvátaḥ
stanzas.translation: Uninjured let thy friendship be, like the smooth surface of a skin, A flawless skin, containing curds, full to the mouth, containing curds.

translations.griffith: Uninjured let thy friendship be, like the smooth surface of a skin, A flawless skin, containing curds, full to the mouth, containing curds.

stanzas.sanskrit: प॒रो हि मर्त्यै॒रसि॑ स॒मो दे॒वैरु॒त श्रि॒या अ॒भि ख्यः॑ पूष॒न्पृत॑नासु न॒स्त्वमवा॑ नू॒नं यथा॑ पु॒रा
stanzas.transliteration: paró hí mártyair ási samó devaír utá śriyā́ abhí khyaḥ pūṣan pŕ̥tanāsu nas tvám ávā nūnáṃ yáthā purā́
stanzas.translation: For thou art high above mankind, in glory equal to the Gods. Therefore, O Pûshan, look upon us in the fight: now help us as in days of old.

translations.griffith: For thou art high above mankind, in glory equal to the Gods. Therefore, O Pûshan, look upon us in the fight: now help us as in days of old.

stanzas.sanskrit: वा॒मी वा॒मस्य॑ धूतयः॒ प्रणी॑तिरस्तु सू॒नृता॑ दे॒वस्य॑ वा मरुतो॒ मर्त्य॑स्य वेजा॒नस्य॑ प्रयज्यवः
stanzas.transliteration: vāmī́ vāmásya dhūtayaḥ práṇītir astu sūnŕ̥tā devásya vā maruto mártyasya vā- -ījānásya prayajyavaḥ
stanzas.translation: May the kind excellence of him the Kind, loud Roarers! be our guide, Be it the God's, O Maruts, or a mortal man's who worships, ye impetuous Ones!

translations.griffith: May the kind excellence of him the Kind, loud Roarers! be our guide, Be it the God's, O Maruts, or a mortal man's who worships, ye impetuous Ones!

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒द्यश्चि॒द्यस्य॑ चर्कृ॒तिः परि॒ द्यां दे॒वो नैति॒ सूर्यः॑ त्वे॒षं शवो॑ दधिरे॒ नाम॑ य॒ज्ञियं॑ म॒रुतो॑ वृत्र॒हं शवो॒ ज्येष्ठं॑ वृत्र॒हं शवः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sadyáś cid yásya carkr̥tíḥ pári dyā́ṃ devó naíti sū́ryaḥ tveṣáṃ śávo dadhire nā́ma yajñíyam marúto vr̥traháṃ śávo jyéṣṭhaṃ vr̥traháṃ śávaḥ
stanzas.translation: They whose high glory in a moment like the God, the Sun, goes round the space of heaven, The Maruts have obtained bright strength, a sacred name, strength that destroys the Vr̥itras, strength Vr̥itra-destroying excellent.

translations.griffith: They whose high glory in a moment like the God, the Sun, goes round the space of heaven, The Maruts have obtained bright strength, a sacred name, strength that destroys the Vr̥itras, strength Vr̥itra-destroying excellent.

stanzas.sanskrit: स॒कृद्ध॒ द्यौर॑जायत स॒कृद्भूमि॑रजायत पृश्न्या॑ दु॒ग्धं स॒कृत्पय॒स्तद॒न्यो नानु॑ जायते
stanzas.transliteration: sakŕ̥d dha dyaúr ajāyata sakŕ̥d bhū́mir ajāyata pŕ̥śnyā dugdháṃ sakŕ̥t páyas tád anyó nā́nu jāyate
stanzas.translation: Once, only once, the heaven was made, once only once, the earth was formed- Once, only Pr̥iṣni's milk was shed: no second, after this, is born.

translations.griffith: Once, only once, the heaven was made, once only once, the earth was formed- Once, only Pr̥iṣni's milk was shed: no second, after this, is born.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्तु॒षे जनं॑ सुव्र॒तं नव्य॑सीभिर्गी॒र्भिर्मि॒त्रावरु॑णा सुम्न॒यन्ता॑ त आ ग॑मन्तु॒ त इ॒ह श्रु॑वन्तु सुक्ष॒त्रासो॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॒ग्निः
stanzas.transliteration: stuṣé jánaṃ suvratáṃ návyasībhir gīrbhír mitrā́váruṇā sumnayántā tá ā́ gamantu tá ihá śruvantu sukṣatrā́so váruṇo mitró agníḥ
stanzas.translation: I LAUD with newest songs the Righteous People, Mitra and Varuṇa who make us happy. Let them approach, here let them listen,Agni, Varuṇa, Mitra, Lords of fair dominion.

translations.griffith: I LAUD with newest songs the Righteous People, Mitra and Varuṇa who make us happy. Let them approach, here let them listen,Agni, Varuṇa, Mitra, Lords of fair dominion.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒शोवि॑श॒ ईड्य॑मध्व॒रेष्वदृ॑प्तक्रतुमर॒तिं यु॑व॒त्योः दि॒वः शिशुं॒ सह॑सः सू॒नुम॒ग्निं य॒ज्ञस्य॑ के॒तुम॑रु॒षं यज॑ध्यै
stanzas.transliteration: viśó-viśa ī́ḍyam adhvaréṣu- ádr̥ptakratum aratíṃ yuvatyóḥ diváḥ śíśuṃ sáhasaḥ sūnúm agníṃ yajñásya ketúm aruṣáṃ yájadhyai
stanzas.translation: Him, to be praised at each tribe's sacrifices, the Two young Matrons' sober-minded Herald, The Son of Strength, the Child of Heaven, the signal of sacrifice, red Agni will I worship.

translations.griffith: Him, to be praised at each tribe's sacrifices, the Two young Matrons' sober-minded Herald, The Son of Strength, the Child of Heaven, the signal of sacrifice, red Agni will I worship.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒रु॒षस्य॑ दुहि॒तरा॒ विरू॑पे॒ स्तृभि॑र॒न्या पि॑पि॒शे सूरो॑ अ॒न्या मि॒थ॒स्तुरा॑ वि॒चर॑न्ती पाव॒के मन्म॑ श्रु॒तं न॑क्षत ऋ॒च्यमा॑ने
stanzas.transliteration: aruṣásya duhitárā vírūpe stŕ̥bhir anyā́ pipiśé sū́ro anyā́ mithastúrā vicárantī pāvaké mánma śrutáṃ nakṣata r̥cyámāne
stanzas.translation: Unlike in form are the Red God's two Daughters: one is the Sun's, and stars bedeck the other. Apart, the Sanctifiers, in succession, come to the famed hymn, praised in holy verses.

translations.griffith: Unlike in form are the Red God's two Daughters: one is the Sun's, and stars bedeck the other. Apart, the Sanctifiers, in succession, come to the famed hymn, praised in holy verses.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र वा॒युमच्छा॑ बृह॒ती म॑नी॒षा बृ॒हद्र॑यिं वि॒श्ववा॑रं रथ॒प्राम् द्यु॒तद्या॑मा नि॒युतः॒ पत्य॑मानः क॒विः क॒विमि॑यक्षसि प्रयज्यो
stanzas.transliteration: prá vāyúm áchā br̥hatī́ manīṣā́ br̥hádrayiṃ viśvávāraṃ rathaprā́m dyutádyāmā niyútaḥ pátyamānaḥ kavíḥ kavím iyakṣasi prayajyo
stanzas.translation: I with a lofty song call hither Vâyu, all-bounteous, filler of his car, most wealthy. Thou, Sage, with bright path, Lord of harnessed horses, impetuous, promptly honourest the prudent.

translations.griffith: I with a lofty song call hither Vâyu, all-bounteous, filler of his car, most wealthy. Thou, Sage, with bright path, Lord of harnessed horses, impetuous, promptly honourest the prudent.

stanzas.sanskrit: स मे॒ वपु॑श्छदयद॒श्विनो॒र्यो रथो॑ वि॒रुक्मा॒न्मन॑सा युजा॒नः येन॑ नरा नासत्येष॒यध्यै॑ व॒र्तिर्या॒थस्तन॑याय॒ त्मने॑ च
stanzas.transliteration: sá me vápuś chadayad aśvínor yó rátho virúkmān mánasā yujānáḥ yéna narā nāsatyeṣayádhyai vartír yāthás tánayāya tmáne ca
stanzas.translation: That chariot of the Aṣvins, fair to look on, pleaseth me well, yoked with a thought, refulgent, Wherewith, Nâsatyas, Chiefs, ye seek our dwelling, to give new strength to us and to our children.

translations.griffith: That chariot of the Aṣvins, fair to look on, pleaseth me well, yoked with a thought, refulgent, Wherewith, Nâsatyas, Chiefs, ye seek our dwelling, to give new strength to us and to our children.

stanzas.sanskrit: पर्ज॑न्यवाता वृषभा पृथि॒व्याः पुरी॑षाणि जिन्वत॒मप्या॑नि सत्य॑श्रुतः कवयो॒ यस्य॑ गी॒र्भिर्जग॑तः स्थात॒र्जग॒दा कृ॑णुध्वम्
stanzas.transliteration: párjanyavātā vr̥ṣabhā pr̥thivyā́ḥ púrīṣāṇi jinvatam ápyāni sátyaśrutaḥ kavayo yásya gīrbhír jágata sthātar jágad ā́ kr̥ṇudhvam
stanzas.translation: Bulls of the Earth, O Vâta and Parjanya, stir up for us the regions of the water. Hearers of truth, ye, Sages, World-Supporters, increase his living wealth whose songs delight you.

translations.griffith: Bulls of the Earth, O Vâta and Parjanya, stir up for us the regions of the water. Hearers of truth, ye, Sages, World-Supporters, increase his living wealth whose songs delight you.

stanzas.sanskrit: पावी॑रवी क॒न्या॑ चि॒त्रायुः॒ सर॑स्वती वी॒रप॑त्नी॒ धियं॑ धात् ग्नाभि॒रच्छि॑द्रं शर॒णं स॒जोषा॑ दुरा॒धर्षं॑ गृण॒ते शर्म॑ यंसत्
stanzas.transliteration: pā́vīravī kanyā̀ citrā́yuḥ sárasvatī vīrápatnī dhíyaṃ dhāt gnā́bhir áchidraṃ śaraṇáṃ sajóṣāḥ- durādhárṣaṃ gr̥ṇaté śárma yaṃsat
stanzas.translation: So may Sarasvatî, the Hero's Consort, brisk with rare life, the lightning's Child, inspire us, And, with the Dames accordant, give the singer a refuge unassailable and flawless.

translations.griffith: So may Sarasvatî, the Hero's Consort, brisk with rare life, the lightning's Child, inspire us, And, with the Dames accordant, give the singer a refuge unassailable and flawless.

stanzas.sanskrit: प॒थस्प॑थः॒ परि॑पतिं वच॒स्या कामे॑न कृ॒तो अ॒भ्या॑नळ॒र्कम् स नो॑ रासच्छु॒रुध॑श्च॒न्द्राग्रा॒ धियं॑धियं सीषधाति॒ प्र पू॒षा
stanzas.transliteration: pathás-pathaḥ páripatiṃ vacasyā́ kā́mena kr̥tó abhy ā̀naḷ arkám sá no rāsac churúdhaś candrā́grāḥ- dhíyaṃ-dhiyaṃ sīṣadhāti prá pūṣā́
stanzas.translation: I praise with eloquence him who guards all pathways. He, when his love impelled him, went to Arka. May he vouchsafe us gear with gold to grace it: may Pûshan make each prayer of ours efective.

translations.griffith: I praise with eloquence him who guards all pathways. He, when his love impelled him, went to Arka. May he vouchsafe us gear with gold to grace it: may Pûshan make each prayer of ours efective.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र॒थ॒म॒भाजं॑ य॒शसं॑ वयो॒धां सु॑पा॒णिं दे॒वं सु॒गभ॑स्ति॒मृभ्व॑म् होता॑ यक्षद्यज॒तं प॒स्त्या॑नाम॒ग्निस्त्वष्टा॑रं सु॒हवं॑ वि॒भावा॑
stanzas.transliteration: prathamabhā́jaṃ yaśásaṃ vayodhā́ṃ supāṇíṃ deváṃ sugábhastim ŕ̥bhvam hótā yakṣad yajatám pastyā̀nām agnís tváṣṭāraṃ suhávaṃ vibhā́vā
stanzas.translation: May Herald Agni, fulgent, bring for worship Tvashṭar adored, in homes and swift to listen, Glorious, first to share, the life-bestower, the ever active God, fair-armed, fair-handed.

translations.griffith: May Herald Agni, fulgent, bring for worship Tvashṭar adored, in homes and swift to listen, Glorious, first to share, the life-bestower, the ever active God, fair-armed, fair-handed.

stanzas.sanskrit: भुव॑नस्य पि॒तरं॑ गी॒र्भिरा॒भी रु॒द्रं दिवा॑ व॒र्धया॑ रु॒द्रम॒क्तौ बृ॒हन्त॑मृ॒ष्वम॒जरं॑ सुषु॒म्नमृध॑ग्घुवेम क॒विने॑षि॒तासः॑
stanzas.transliteration: bhúvanasya pitáraṃ gīrbhír ābhíḥ- rudráṃ dívā vardháyā rudrám aktaú br̥hántam r̥ṣvám ajáraṃ suṣumnám ŕ̥dhag ghuvema kavíneṣitā́saḥ
stanzas.translation: Rudra by day, Rudra at night we honour with these our songs, the Universe's Father. Him great and lofty, blissful, undecaying let us call specially as the Sage impels us.

translations.griffith: Rudra by day, Rudra at night we honour with these our songs, the Universe's Father. Him great and lofty, blissful, undecaying let us call specially as the Sage impels us.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ यु॑वानः कवयो यज्ञियासो॒ मरु॑तो ग॒न्त गृ॑ण॒तो व॑र॒स्याम् अ॒चि॒त्रं चि॒द्धि जिन्व॑था वृ॒धन्त॑ इ॒त्था नक्ष॑न्तो नरो अङ्गिर॒स्वत्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yuvānaḥ kavayo yajñiyāso máruto gantá gr̥ṇató varasyā́m acitráṃ cid dhí jínvathā vr̥dhántaḥ- itthā́ nákṣanto naro aṅgirasvát
stanzas.translation: Ye who are youthful, wise, and meet for worship, come, Martits, to the longing of the singer. Coming, as erst to Angiras, O Heroes, ye animate and quicken e'en the desert.

translations.griffith: Ye who are youthful, wise, and meet for worship, come, Martits, to the longing of the singer. Coming, as erst to Angiras, O Heroes, ye animate and quicken e'en the desert.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र वी॒राय॒ प्र त॒वसे॑ तु॒रायाजा॑ यू॒थेव॑ पशु॒रक्षि॒रस्त॑म् स पि॑स्पृशति त॒न्वि॑ श्रु॒तस्य॒ स्तृभि॒र्न नाकं॑ वच॒नस्य॒ विपः॑
stanzas.transliteration: prá vīrā́ya prá taváse turā́ya- -ájā yūthéva paśurákṣir ástam sá pispr̥śati tanvì śrutásya stŕ̥bhir ná nā́kaṃ vacanásya vípaḥ
stanzas.translation: Even as the herdsman driveth home his cattle, I urge my songs to him the strong swift Hero May he, the glorious, lay upon his body the singer's hymns, as stars bedeck the heaven.

translations.griffith: Even as the herdsman driveth home his cattle, I urge my songs to him the strong swift Hero May he, the glorious, lay upon his body the singer's hymns, as stars bedeck the heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो रजां॑सि विम॒मे पार्थि॑वानि॒ त्रिश्चि॒द्विष्णु॒र्मन॑वे बाधि॒ताय॑ तस्य॑ ते॒ शर्म॑न्नुपद॒द्यमा॑ने रा॒या म॑देम त॒न्वा॒३॒॑ तना॑ च
stanzas.transliteration: yó rájāṃsi vimamé pā́rthivāni tríś cid víṣṇur mánave bādhitā́ya tásya te śármann upadadyámāne rāyā́ madema tanvā̀ tánā ca
stanzas.translation: He who for man's behoof in his afiliction thrice measured out the earthly regions, Vishṇu- When one so great as thou affordeth shelter, may we with wealth and with ourselves be happy.

translations.griffith: He who for man's behoof in his afiliction thrice measured out the earthly regions, Vishṇu- When one so great as thou affordeth shelter, may we with wealth and with ourselves be happy.

stanzas.sanskrit: तन्नोऽहि॑र्बु॒ध्न्यो॑ अ॒द्भिर॒र्कैस्तत्पर्व॑त॒स्तत्स॑वि॒ता चनो॑ धात् तदोष॑धीभिर॒भि रा॑ति॒षाचो॒ भगः॒ पुरं॑धिर्जिन्वतु॒ प्र रा॒ये
stanzas.transliteration: tán nó 'hir budhnyò adbhír arkaís tát párvatas tát savitā́ cáno dhāt tád óṣadhībhir abhí rātiṣā́co bhágaḥ púraṃdhir jinvatu prá rāyé
stanzas.translation: Sweet be this song of mine to Ahibudhnya, Parvata, Savitar, with Floods and Lightnings; Sweet, with the Plants, to Gods who seek oblations. May liberal Bhaga speed us on to riches.

translations.griffith: Sweet be this song of mine to Ahibudhnya, Parvata, Savitar, with Floods and Lightnings; Sweet, with the Plants, to Gods who seek oblations. May liberal Bhaga speed us on to riches.

stanzas.sanskrit: नु नो॑ र॒यिं र॒थ्यं॑ चर्षणि॒प्रां पु॑रु॒वीरं॑ म॒ह ऋ॒तस्य॑ गो॒पाम् क्षयं॑ दाता॒जरं॒ येन॒ जना॒न्त्स्पृधो॒ अदे॑वीर॒भि च॒ क्रमा॑म॒ विश॒ आदे॑वीर॒भ्य१॒॑श्नवा॑म
stanzas.transliteration: nú no rayíṃ rathyàṃ carṣaṇiprā́m puruvī́ram mahá r̥tásya gopā́m kṣáyaṃ dātājáraṃ yéna jánān spŕ̥dho ádevīr abhí ca krámāma víśa ā́devīr abhy àśnávāma
stanzas.translation: Give riches borne on cars, with many heroes, contenting men, the guard of mighty Order. Give us a lasting home that we may battle with godless bands of men who fight against us, and meet with tribes to whom the Gods are gracious.

translations.griffith: Give riches borne on cars, with many heroes, contenting men, the guard of mighty Order. Give us a lasting home that we may battle with godless bands of men who fight against us, and meet with tribes to whom the Gods are gracious.

stanzas.sanskrit: हु॒वे वो॑ दे॒वीमदि॑तिं॒ नमो॑भिर्मृळी॒काय॒ वरु॑णं मि॒त्रम॒ग्निम् अ॒भि॒क्ष॒दाम॑र्य॒मणं॑ सु॒शेवं॑ त्रा॒तॄन्दे॒वान्त्स॑वि॒तारं॒ भगं॑ च
stanzas.transliteration: huvé vo devī́m áditiṃ námobhir mr̥ḷīkā́ya váruṇam mitrám agním abhikṣadā́m aryamáṇaṃ suśévaṃ trātr̥̄́n devā́n savitā́ram bhágaṃ ca
stanzas.translation: I CALL with prayers on Aditi your Goddess, on Agni, Mitra, Varuṇa for favour, On Aryaman who gives unasked, the gracious, on Gods who save, on Savitar and Bhaga.

translations.griffith: I CALL with prayers on Aditi your Goddess, on Agni, Mitra, Varuṇa for favour, On Aryaman who gives unasked, the gracious, on Gods who save, on Savitar and Bhaga.

stanzas.sanskrit: सु॒ज्योति॑षः सूर्य॒ दक्ष॑पितॄननागा॒स्त्वे सु॑महो वीहि दे॒वान् द्वि॒जन्मा॑नो॒ य ऋ॑त॒सापः॑ स॒त्याः स्व॑र्वन्तो यज॒ता अ॑ग्निजि॒ह्वाः
stanzas.transliteration: sujyótiṣaḥ sūrya dákṣapitr̥̄n anāgāstvé sumaho vīhi devā́n dvijánmāno yá r̥tasā́paḥ satyā́ḥ svàrvanto yajatā́ agnijihvā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: Visit, to prove us free from sin, O Sûrya Lord of great might, the bright Gods sprung from Daksha, Twice-born and true, observing sacred duties, Holy and full of light, whose tongue is Agni.

translations.griffith: Visit, to prove us free from sin, O Sûrya Lord of great might, the bright Gods sprung from Daksha, Twice-born and true, observing sacred duties, Holy and full of light, whose tongue is Agni.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त द्या॑वापृथिवी क्ष॒त्रमु॒रु बृ॒हद्रो॑दसी शर॒णं सु॑षुम्ने म॒हस्क॑रथो॒ वरि॑वो॒ यथा॑ नो॒ऽस्मे क्षया॑य धिषणे अने॒हः
stanzas.transliteration: utá dyāvāpr̥thivī kṣatrám urú br̥hád rodasī śaraṇáṃ suṣumne mahás karatho várivo yáthā naḥ- -asmé kṣáyāya dhiṣaṇe aneháḥ
stanzas.translation: And, O ye Heaven and Earth, a wide dominion, O ye most blissful Worlds, our lofty shelter, Give ample room and freedom for our dwelling, a home, ye Hemispheres, which none may rival.

translations.griffith: And, O ye Heaven and Earth, a wide dominion, O ye most blissful Worlds, our lofty shelter, Give ample room and freedom for our dwelling, a home, ye Hemispheres, which none may rival.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ नो॑ रु॒द्रस्य॑ सू॒नवो॑ नमन्ताम॒द्या हू॒तासो॒ वस॒वोऽधृ॑ष्टाः यदी॒मर्भे॑ मह॒ति वा॑ हि॒तासो॑ बा॒धे म॒रुतो॒ अह्वा॑म दे॒वान्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ no rudrásya sūnávo namantām adyā́ hūtā́so vásavó 'dhr̥ṣṭāḥ yád īm árbhe mahatí vā hitā́so bādhé marúto áhvāma devā́n
stanzas.translation: This day invited may the Sons of Rudra, resistless, excellent, stoop down to meet us; For, when beset with slight or sore affliction, we ever call upon the Gods, the Maruts;

translations.griffith: This day invited may the Sons of Rudra, resistless, excellent, stoop down to meet us; For, when beset with slight or sore affliction, we ever call upon the Gods, the Maruts;

stanzas.sanskrit: मि॒म्यक्ष॒ येषु॑ रोद॒सी नु दे॒वी सिष॑क्ति पू॒षा अ॑भ्यर्ध॒यज्वा॑ श्रु॒त्वा हवं॑ मरुतो॒ यद्ध॑ या॒थ भूमा॑ रेजन्ते॒ अध्व॑नि॒ प्रवि॑क्ते
stanzas.transliteration: mimyákṣa yéṣu rodasī́ nú devī́ síṣakti pūṣā́ abhyardhayájvā śrutvā́ hávam maruto yád dha yāthá bhū́mā rejante ádhvani právikte
stanzas.translation: To whom the Goddess Rodasî clings closely, whom Pûshan follows bringing ample bounty. What time ye hear our call and come, O Maruts, upon your separate path all creatures tremble.

translations.griffith: To whom the Goddess Rodasî clings closely, whom Pûshan follows bringing ample bounty. What time ye hear our call and come, O Maruts, upon your separate path all creatures tremble.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भि त्यं वी॒रं गिर्व॑णसम॒र्चेन्द्रं॒ ब्रह्म॑णा जरित॒र्नवे॑न श्रव॒दिद्धव॒मुप॑ च॒ स्तवा॑नो॒ रास॒द्वाजाँ॒ उप॑ म॒हो गृ॑णा॒नः
stanzas.transliteration: abhí tyáṃ vīráṃ gírvaṇasam arca- -índram bráhmaṇā jaritar návena śrávad íd dhávam úpa ca stávāno rā́sad vā́jām̐ úpa mahó gr̥ṇānáḥ
stanzas.translation: With a new hymn extol, O thou who singest, the Lover of the Song, the Hero Indra. May he, exalted, hear our invocation, and grant us mighty wealth and strength when lauded.

translations.griffith: With a new hymn extol, O thou who singest, the Lover of the Song, the Hero Indra. May he, exalted, hear our invocation, and grant us mighty wealth and strength when lauded.

stanzas.sanskrit: ओ॒मान॑मापो मानुषी॒रमृ॑क्तं॒ धात॑ तो॒काय॒ तन॑याय॒ शं योः यू॒यं हि ष्ठा भि॒षजो॑ मा॒तृत॑मा॒ विश्व॑स्य स्था॒तुर्जग॑तो॒ जनि॑त्रीः
stanzas.transliteration: omā́nam āpo mānuṣīr ámr̥ktaṃ dhā́ta tokā́ya tánayāya śáṃ yóḥ yūyáṃ hí ṣṭhā́ bhiṣájo mātŕ̥tamāḥ- víśvasya sthātúr jágato jánitrīḥ
stanzas.translation: Give full protection, Friends of man, ye Waters, in peace and trouble, to our sons and grandsons. For ye are our most motherly physicians, parents of all that standeth, all that moveth.

translations.griffith: Give full protection, Friends of man, ye Waters, in peace and trouble, to our sons and grandsons. For ye are our most motherly physicians, parents of all that standeth, all that moveth.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ नो॑ दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता त्राय॑माणो॒ हिर॑ण्यपाणिर्यज॒तो ज॑गम्यात् यो दत्र॑वाँ उ॒षसो॒ न प्रती॑कं व्यूर्णु॒ते दा॒शुषे॒ वार्या॑णि
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ no deváḥ savitā́ trā́yamāṇo híraṇyapāṇir yajató jagamyāt yó dátravām̐ uṣáso ná prátīkaṃ vyūrṇuté dāśúṣe vā́ryāṇi
stanzas.translation: May Savitar come hither and approach us, the God who rescues, Holy, goldenhanded, The God who, bounteous as the face of Morning, discloses precious gifts for him who worships.

translations.griffith: May Savitar come hither and approach us, the God who rescues, Holy, goldenhanded, The God who, bounteous as the face of Morning, discloses precious gifts for him who worships.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त त्वं सू॑नो सहसो नो अ॒द्या दे॒वाँ अ॒स्मिन्न॑ध्व॒रे व॑वृत्याः स्याम॒हं ते॒ सद॒मिद्रा॒तौ तव॑ स्याम॒ग्नेऽव॑सा सु॒वीरः॑
stanzas.transliteration: utá tváṃ sūno sahaso no adyá- -ā́ devā́m̐ asmínn adhvaré vavr̥tyāḥ syā́m aháṃ te sádam íd rātaú táva syām agné 'vasā suvī́raḥ
stanzas.translation: And thou, O Son of Strength, do thou turn hither the Gods to-day to this our holy service. May I for evermore enjoy thy bounty and, Agni, by thy grace be rich in heroes.

translations.griffith: And thou, O Son of Strength, do thou turn hither the Gods to-day to this our holy service. May I for evermore enjoy thy bounty and, Agni, by thy grace be rich in heroes.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त त्या मे॒ हव॒मा ज॑ग्म्यातं॒ नास॑त्या धी॒भिर्यु॒वम॒ङ्ग वि॑प्रा अत्रिं॒ न म॒हस्तम॑सोऽमुमुक्तं॒ तूर्व॑तं नरा दुरि॒ताद॒भीके॑
stanzas.transliteration: utá tyā́ me hávam ā́ jagmyātaṃ nā́satyā dhībhír yuvám aṅgá viprā átriṃ ná mahás támaso 'mumuktaṃ tū́rvataṃ narā duritā́d abhī́ke
stanzas.translation: Come also to my call, O ye Nâsatyas, yea, verily, through my prayers, ye Holy Sages. As from great darkness ye delivered Atri, protect us, Chiefs, from danger in the conflict.

translations.griffith: Come also to my call, O ye Nâsatyas, yea, verily, through my prayers, ye Holy Sages. As from great darkness ye delivered Atri, protect us, Chiefs, from danger in the conflict.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते नो॑ रा॒यो द्यु॒मतो॒ वाज॑वतो दा॒तारो॑ भूत नृ॒वतः॑ पुरु॒क्षोः द॒श॒स्यन्तो॑ दि॒व्याः पार्थि॑वासो॒ गोजा॑ता॒ अप्या॑ मृ॒ळता॑ च देवाः
stanzas.transliteration: té no rāyó dyumáto vā́javato dātā́ro bhūta nr̥vátaḥ purukṣóḥ daśasyánto divyā́ḥ pā́rthivāso gójātā ápyā mr̥ḷátā ca devāḥ
stanzas.translation: O Gods, bestow upon us riches, splendid with strength and heroes, bringing food in plenty. Be gracious, helpful Gods of earth, of heaven, born of the Cow, and dwellers in the waters.

translations.griffith: O Gods, bestow upon us riches, splendid with strength and heroes, bringing food in plenty. Be gracious, helpful Gods of earth, of heaven, born of the Cow, and dwellers in the waters.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते नो॑ रु॒द्रः सर॑स्वती स॒जोषा॑ मी॒ळ्हुष्म॑न्तो॒ विष्णु॑र्मृळन्तु वा॒युः ऋ॒भु॒क्षा वाजो॒ दैव्यो॑ विधा॒ता प॒र्जन्या॒वाता॑ पिप्यता॒मिषं॑ नः
stanzas.transliteration: té no rudráḥ sárasvatī sajóṣāḥ- mīḷhúṣmanto víṣṇur mr̥ḷantu vāyúḥ r̥bhukṣā́ vā́jo daívyo vidhātā́ parjányāvā́tā pipyatām íṣaṃ naḥ
stanzas.translation: May Rudra and Sarasvatî, accordant, Vishṇu and Vâyu, pour down gifts and bless us; R̥ibhukshan, Vâja, and divine Vidhâtar, Parjanya, Vâta make our food abundant.

translations.griffith: May Rudra and Sarasvatî, accordant, Vishṇu and Vâyu, pour down gifts and bless us; R̥ibhukshan, Vâja, and divine Vidhâtar, Parjanya, Vâta make our food abundant.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त स्य दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता भगो॑ नो॒ऽपां नपा॑दवतु॒ दानु॒ पप्रिः॑ त्वष्टा॑ दे॒वेभि॒र्जनि॑भिः स॒जोषा॒ द्यौर्दे॒वेभिः॑ पृथि॒वी स॑मु॒द्रैः
stanzas.transliteration: utá syá deváḥ savitā́ bhágo no -apā́ṃ nápād avatu dā́nu pápriḥ tváṣṭā devébhir jánibhiḥ sajóṣāḥ- dyaúr devébhiḥ pr̥thivī́ samudraíḥ
stanzas.translation: May this God Savitar, the Lord, the Offspring of Waters, pouring down his dew be gracious, And, with the Gods and Dames accordant, Tvashṭar; Dyaus with the Gods and Pr̥ithivî with oceans.

translations.griffith: May this God Savitar, the Lord, the Offspring of Waters, pouring down his dew be gracious, And, with the Gods and Dames accordant, Tvashṭar; Dyaus with the Gods and Pr̥ithivî with oceans.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त नोऽहि॑र्बु॒ध्न्यः॑ शृणोत्व॒ज एक॑पात्पृथि॒वी स॑मु॒द्रः विश्वे॑ दे॒वा ऋ॑ता॒वृधो॑ हुवा॒नाः स्तु॒ता मन्त्राः॑ कविश॒स्ता अ॑वन्तु
stanzas.transliteration: utá nó 'hir budhnyàḥ śr̥ṇotu- ajá ékapāt pr̥thivī́ samudráḥ víśve devā́ r̥tāvŕ̥dho huvānā́ḥ- stutā́ mántrāḥ kaviśastā́ avantu
stanzas.translation: May Aja-Ekapad and Ahibudhnya, and Earth and Ocean hear our invocation; All Gods who strengthen Law, invoked and lauded, and holy texts uttered by sages, help us.

translations.griffith: May Aja-Ekapad and Ahibudhnya, and Earth and Ocean hear our invocation; All Gods who strengthen Law, invoked and lauded, and holy texts uttered by sages, help us.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒वा नपा॑तो॒ मम॒ तस्य॑ धी॒भिर्भ॒रद्वा॑जा अ॒भ्य॑र्चन्त्य॒र्कैः ग्ना हु॒तासो॒ वस॒वोऽधृ॑ष्टा॒ विश्वे॑ स्तु॒तासो॑ भूता यजत्राः
stanzas.transliteration: evā́ nápāto máma tásya dhībhír bharádvājā abhy àrcanty arkaíḥ gnā́ hutā́so vásavó 'dhr̥ṣṭāḥ- víśve stutā́so bhūtā yajatrāḥ
stanzas.translation: So with my thoughts and hymns of praise the children of Bharadvâja sing aloud to please you. The Dames invoked, and the resistless Vasus, and all ye Holy Ones have been exalted.

translations.griffith: So with my thoughts and hymns of praise the children of Bharadvâja sing aloud to please you. The Dames invoked, and the resistless Vasus, and all ye Holy Ones have been exalted.

stanzas.sanskrit: उदु॒ त्यच्चक्षु॒र्महि॑ मि॒त्रयो॒राँ एति॑ प्रि॒यं वरु॑णयो॒रद॑ब्धम् ऋ॒तस्य॒ शुचि॑ दर्श॒तमनी॑कं रु॒क्मो न दि॒व उदि॑ता॒ व्य॑द्यौत्
stanzas.transliteration: úd u tyác cákṣur máhi mitráyor ā́m̐ éti priyáṃ váruṇayor ádabdham r̥tásya śúci darśatám ánīkaṃ rukmó ná divá úditā vy àdyaut
stanzas.translation: THAT mighty eye of Varuṇa and Mitra, infallible and dear, is moving upward. The pure and lovely face of holy Order hath shone like gold of heaven in its arising.

translations.griffith: THAT mighty eye of Varuṇa and Mitra, infallible and dear, is moving upward. The pure and lovely face of holy Order hath shone like gold of heaven in its arising.

stanzas.sanskrit: वेद॒ यस्त्रीणि॑ वि॒दथा॑न्येषां दे॒वानां॒ जन्म॑ सनु॒तरा च॒ विप्रः॑ ऋ॒जु मर्ते॑षु वृजि॒ना च॒ पश्य॑न्न॒भि च॑ष्टे॒ सूरो॑ अ॒र्य एवा॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: véda yás trī́ṇi vidáthāny eṣāṃ devā́nāṃ jánma sanutár ā́ ca vípraḥ r̥jú márteṣu vr̥jinā́ ca páśyan abhí caṣṭe sū́ro aryá évān
stanzas.translation: The Sage who knows these Gods' three ranks and orders, and all their generations near and distant, Beholding good and evil acts of mortals, Sura marks well the doing of the pious.

translations.griffith: The Sage who knows these Gods' three ranks and orders, and all their generations near and distant, Beholding good and evil acts of mortals, Sura marks well the doing of the pious.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्तु॒ष उ॑ वो म॒ह ऋ॒तस्य॑ गो॒पानदि॑तिं मि॒त्रं वरु॑णं सुजा॒तान् अ॒र्य॒मणं॒ भग॒मद॑ब्धधीती॒नच्छा॑ वोचे सध॒न्यः॑ पाव॒कान्
stanzas.transliteration: stuṣá u vo mahá r̥tásya gopā́n áditim mitráṃ váruṇaṃ sujātā́n aryamáṇam bhágam ádabdhadhītīn áchā voce sadhanyàḥ pāvakā́n
stanzas.translation: I praise you Guards of mighty Law eternal, Aditi, Mitra, Varuṇa, the noble, Aryaman, Bhaga, all whose thoughts are faithful: hither I call the Bright who share in common.

translations.griffith: I praise you Guards of mighty Law eternal, Aditi, Mitra, Varuṇa, the noble, Aryaman, Bhaga, all whose thoughts are faithful: hither I call the Bright who share in common.

stanzas.sanskrit: रि॒शाद॑सः॒ सत्प॑तीँ॒रद॑ब्धान्म॒हो राज्ञः॑ सुवस॒नस्य॑ दा॒तॄन् यूनः॑ सुक्ष॒त्रान्क्षय॑तो दि॒वो नॄना॑दि॒त्यान्या॒म्यदि॑तिं दुवो॒यु
stanzas.transliteration: riśā́dasaḥ sátpatīm̐r ádabdhān mahó rā́jñaḥ suvasanásya dātr̥̄́n yū́naḥ sukṣatrā́n kṣáyato divó nr̥̄́n ādityā́n yāmy áditiṃ duvoyú
stanzas.translation: Lords of the brave, infallible, foe-destroyers, great Kings, bestowers of fair homes to dwell in, Young, Heroes, ruling heaven with strong dominion, Âdityas, Aditi I seek with worship.

translations.griffith: Lords of the brave, infallible, foe-destroyers, great Kings, bestowers of fair homes to dwell in, Young, Heroes, ruling heaven with strong dominion, Âdityas, Aditi I seek with worship.

stanzas.sanskrit: द्यौ॒३॒॑ष्पितः॒ पृथि॑वि॒ मात॒रध्रु॒गग्ने॑ भ्रातर्वसवो मृ॒ळता॑ नः विश्व॑ आदित्या अदिते स॒जोषा॑ अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ शर्म॑ बहु॒लं वि य॑न्त
stanzas.transliteration: dyaùṣ pítaḥ pŕ̥thivi mā́tar ádhrug ágne bhrātar vasavo mr̥ḷátā naḥ víśva ādityā adite sajóṣāḥ- asmábhyaṃ śárma bahuláṃ ví yanta
stanzas.translation: O Heaven our Father, Earth our guileless Mother, O Brother Agni, and ye Vasus, bless us. Grant us, O Aditi and ye Âdityas, all of one mind, your manifold protection.

translations.griffith: O Heaven our Father, Earth our guileless Mother, O Brother Agni, and ye Vasus, bless us. Grant us, O Aditi and ye Âdityas, all of one mind, your manifold protection.

stanzas.sanskrit: मा नो॒ वृका॑य वृ॒क्ये॑ समस्मा अघाय॒ते री॑रधता यजत्राः यू॒यं हि ष्ठा र॒थ्यो॑ नस्त॒नूनां॑ यू॒यं दक्ष॑स्य॒ वच॑सो बभू॒व
stanzas.transliteration: mā́ no vŕ̥kāya vr̥kyè samasmai- aghāyaté rīradhatā yajatrāḥ yūyáṃ hí ṣṭhā́ rathyò nas tanū́nāṃ yūyáṃ dákṣasya vácaso babhūvá
stanzas.translation: Give us not up to any evil creature, as spoil to wolf or she-wolf, O ye Holy. For ye are they who guide aright our bodies, ye are the rulers of our speech and vigour.

translations.griffith: Give us not up to any evil creature, as spoil to wolf or she-wolf, O ye Holy. For ye are they who guide aright our bodies, ye are the rulers of our speech and vigour.

stanzas.sanskrit: मा व॒ एनो॑ अ॒न्यकृ॑तं भुजेम॒ मा तत्क॑र्म वसवो॒ यच्चय॑ध्वे विश्व॑स्य॒ हि क्षय॑थ विश्वदेवाः स्व॒यं रि॒पुस्त॒न्वं॑ रीरिषीष्ट
stanzas.transliteration: mā́ va éno anyákr̥tam bhujema mā́ tát karma vasavo yác cáyadhve víśvasya hí kṣáyatha viśvadevāḥ svayáṃ ripús tanvàṃ rīriṣīṣṭa
stanzas.translation: Let us not suffer for the sin of others, nor do the deed which ye, O Vasus, punish. Ye, Universal Gods! are all-controllers: may he do harm unto himself who hates Me.

translations.griffith: Let us not suffer for the sin of others, nor do the deed which ye, O Vasus, punish. Ye, Universal Gods! are all-controllers: may he do harm unto himself who hates Me.

stanzas.sanskrit: नम॒ इदु॒ग्रं नम॒ आ वि॑वासे॒ नमो॑ दाधार पृथि॒वीमु॒त द्याम् नमो॑ दे॒वेभ्यो॒ नम॑ ईश एषां कृ॒तं चि॒देनो॒ नम॒सा वि॑वासे
stanzas.transliteration: náma íd ugráṃ náma ā́ vivāse námo dādhāra pr̥thivī́m utá dyā́m námo devébhyo náma īśa eṣāṃ kr̥táṃ cid éno námasā́ vivāse
stanzas.translation: Mighty is homage: I adopt and use it. Homage hath held in place the earth and heaven. Homage to Gods! Homage commands and rules them. I banish even committed sin by homage

translations.griffith: Mighty is homage: I adopt and use it. Homage hath held in place the earth and heaven. Homage to Gods! Homage commands and rules them. I banish even committed sin by homage

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋ॒तस्य॑ वो र॒थ्यः॑ पू॒तद॑क्षानृ॒तस्य॑ पस्त्य॒सदो॒ अद॑ब्धान् ताँ आ नमो॑भिरुरु॒चक्ष॑सो॒ नॄन्विश्वा॑न्व॒ आ न॑मे म॒हो य॑जत्राः
stanzas.transliteration: r̥tásya vo rathyàḥ pūtádakṣān r̥tásya pastyasádo ádabdhān tā́m̐ ā́ námobhir urucákṣaso nr̥̄́n víśvān va ā́ name mahó yajatrāḥ
stanzas.translation: You Furtherers of Law, pure in your spirit, infallible, dwellers in the home of Order, To you all Heroes mighty and far-seeing I bow me down, O Holy Ones, with homage.

translations.griffith: You Furtherers of Law, pure in your spirit, infallible, dwellers in the home of Order, To you all Heroes mighty and far-seeing I bow me down, O Holy Ones, with homage.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते हि श्रेष्ठ॑वर्चस॒स्त उ॑ नस्ति॒रो विश्वा॑नि दुरि॒ता नय॑न्ति सु॒क्ष॒त्रासो॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॒ग्निर्ऋ॒तधी॑तयो वक्म॒राज॑सत्याः
stanzas.transliteration: té hí śréṣṭhavarcasas tá u nas tiró víśvāni duritā́ náyanti sukṣatrā́so váruṇo mitró agníḥ r̥tádhītayo vakmarā́jasatyāḥ
stanzas.translation: For these are they who shine with noblest splendour; through all our troubles these conduct us safely- Varuṇa, Mitra, Agni, mighty Rulers, trueminded, faithful to the hymn's controllers.

translations.griffith: For these are they who shine with noblest splendour; through all our troubles these conduct us safely- Varuṇa, Mitra, Agni, mighty Rulers, trueminded, faithful to the hymn's controllers.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते न॒ इन्द्रः॑ पृथि॒वी क्षाम॑ वर्धन्पू॒षा भगो॒ अदि॑तिः॒ पञ्च॒ जनाः॑ सु॒शर्मा॑णः॒ स्वव॑सः सुनी॒था भव॑न्तु नः सुत्रा॒त्रासः॑ सुगो॒पाः
stanzas.transliteration: té na índraḥ pr̥thivī́ kṣā́ma vardhan pūṣā́ bhágo áditiḥ páñca jánāḥ suśármāṇaḥ svávasaḥ sunīthā́ḥ- bhávantu naḥ sutrātrā́saḥ sugopā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: May they, Earth, Aditi, Indra, Bhaga, Pûshan increase our laud, increase the Fivefold people. Giving good help, good refuge, goodly guidance, be they our good deliverers, good protectors.

translations.griffith: May they, Earth, Aditi, Indra, Bhaga, Pûshan increase our laud, increase the Fivefold people. Giving good help, good refuge, goodly guidance, be they our good deliverers, good protectors.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू स॒द्मानं॑ दि॒व्यं नंशि॑ देवा॒ भार॑द्वाजः सुम॒तिं या॑ति॒ होता॑ आ॒सा॒नेभि॒र्यज॑मानो मि॒येधै॑र्दे॒वानां॒ जन्म॑ वसू॒युर्व॑वन्द
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ sadmā́naṃ divyáṃ náṃśi devāḥ- bhā́radvājaḥ sumatíṃ yāti hótā āsānébhir yájamāno miyédhair devā́nāṃ jánma vasūyúr vavanda
stanzas.translation: Come now, O Gods, to your celestial station: the Bharadvâjas' priest entreats your favour. He, sacrificing, fain for wealth, hath honoured the Gods vath those who sit and share oblations.

translations.griffith: Come now, O Gods, to your celestial station: the Bharadvâjas' priest entreats your favour. He, sacrificing, fain for wealth, hath honoured the Gods vath those who sit and share oblations.

stanzas.sanskrit: अप॒ त्यं वृ॑जि॒नं रि॒पुं स्ते॒नम॑ग्ने दुरा॒ध्य॑म् द॒वि॒ष्ठम॑स्य सत्पते कृ॒धी सु॒गम्
stanzas.transliteration: ápa tyáṃ vr̥jináṃ ripúṃ stenám agne durādhyàm daviṣṭhám asya satpate kr̥dhī́ sugám
stanzas.translation: Agni, drive thou the wicked foe, the evil-hearted thief away, Far, far, Lord of the brave I and give us easy paths.

translations.griffith: Agni, drive thou the wicked foe, the evil-hearted thief away, Far, far, Lord of the brave I and give us easy paths.

stanzas.sanskrit: ग्रावा॑णः सोम नो॒ हि कं॑ सखित्व॒नाय॑ वाव॒शुः ज॒ही न्य१॒॑त्रिणं॑ प॒णिं वृको॒ हि षः
stanzas.transliteration: grā́vāṇaḥ soma no hí kaṃ sakhitvanā́ya vāvaśúḥ jahī́ ny àtríṇam paṇíṃ vŕ̥ko hí ṣáḥ
stanzas.translation: Soma, these pressing-stones have called aloud to win thee for our Friend. Destroy the greedy Paṇi, for a wolf is he.

translations.griffith: Soma, these pressing-stones have called aloud to win thee for our Friend. Destroy the greedy Paṇi, for a wolf is he.

stanzas.sanskrit: यू॒यं हि ष्ठा सु॑दानव॒ इन्द्र॑ज्येष्ठा अ॒भिद्य॑वः कर्ता॑ नो॒ अध्व॒न्ना सु॒गं गो॒पा अ॒मा
stanzas.transliteration: yūyáṃ hí ṣṭhā́ sudānavaḥ índrajyeṣṭhā abhídyavaḥ kártā no ádhvann ā́ sugáṃ gopā́ amā́
stanzas.translation: Ye, O most bountiful, are they who, led by Indra, seek the sky. Give us good paths for travel: guard us ivell at home.

translations.griffith: Ye, O most bountiful, are they who, led by Indra, seek the sky. Give us good paths for travel: guard us ivell at home.

stanzas.sanskrit: अपि॒ पन्था॑मगन्महि स्वस्ति॒गाम॑ने॒हस॑म् येन॒ विश्वाः॒ परि॒ द्विषो॑ वृ॒णक्ति॑ वि॒न्दते॒ वसु॑
stanzas.transliteration: ápi pánthām aganmahi svastigā́m anehásam yéna víśvāḥ pári dvíṣo vr̥ṇákti vindáte vásu
stanzas.translation: Now have we entered on the road that leads to bliss, without a foe, The road whereon a man escapes all enemies and gathers wealth.

translations.griffith: Now have we entered on the road that leads to bliss, without a foe, The road whereon a man escapes all enemies and gathers wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: न तद्दि॒वा न पृ॑थि॒व्यानु॑ मन्ये॒ न य॒ज्ञेन॒ नोत शमी॑भिरा॒भिः उ॒ब्जन्तु॒ तं सु॒भ्व१॒॑ः पर्व॑तासो॒ नि ही॑यतामतिया॒जस्य॑ य॒ष्टा
stanzas.transliteration: ná tád divā́ ná pr̥thivyā́nu manye ná yajñéna nótá śámībhir ābhíḥ ubjántu táṃ subhvàḥ párvatāso ní hīyatām atiyājásya yaṣṭā́
stanzas.translation: THIS I allow not in the earth or heaven, at sacrifice or in these holy duties. May the huge mountains crush him down: degraded be Atiyaja's sacrificing patron.

translations.griffith: THIS I allow not in the earth or heaven, at sacrifice or in these holy duties. May the huge mountains crush him down: degraded be Atiyaja's sacrificing patron.

stanzas.sanskrit: अति॑ वा॒ यो म॑रुतो॒ मन्य॑ते नो॒ ब्रह्म॑ वा॒ यः क्रि॒यमा॑णं॒ निनि॑त्सात् तपूं॑षि॒ तस्मै॑ वृजि॒नानि॑ सन्तु ब्रह्म॒द्विष॑म॒भि तं शो॑चतु॒ द्यौः
stanzas.transliteration: áti vā yó maruto mányate no bráhma vā yáḥ kriyámāṇaṃ nínitsāt tápūṃṣi tásmai vr̥jinā́ni santu brahmadvíṣam abhí táṃ śocatu dyaúḥ
stanzas.translation: Or he who holds us in contempt, O Maruts, or seeks to blame the prayer that we are making, May agonies of burning be his portion. May the sky scorch the man who hates devotion.

translations.griffith: Or he who holds us in contempt, O Maruts, or seeks to blame the prayer that we are making, May agonies of burning be his portion. May the sky scorch the man who hates devotion.

stanzas.sanskrit: किम॒ङ्ग त्वा॒ ब्रह्म॑णः सोम गो॒पां किम॒ङ्ग त्वा॑हुरभिशस्ति॒पां नः॑ किम॒ङ्ग नः॑ पश्यसि नि॒द्यमा॑नान्ब्रह्म॒द्विषे॒ तपु॑षिं हे॒तिम॑स्य
stanzas.transliteration: kím aṅgá tvā bráhmaṇaḥ soma gopā́ṃ kím aṅgá tvāhur abhiśastipā́ṃ naḥ kím aṅgá naḥ paśyasi nidyámānān brahmadvíṣe tápuṣiṃ hetím asya
stanzas.translation: Why then, O Soma, do they call thee keeper of prayer? Why then our guardian from reproaches? Why then beholdest thou how men revile us? Cast thy hot dart at him who hates devotion.

translations.griffith: Why then, O Soma, do they call thee keeper of prayer? Why then our guardian from reproaches? Why then beholdest thou how men revile us? Cast thy hot dart at him who hates devotion.

stanzas.sanskrit: अव॑न्तु॒ मामु॒षसो॒ जाय॑माना॒ अव॑न्तु मा॒ सिन्ध॑वः॒ पिन्व॑मानाः अव॑न्तु मा॒ पर्व॑तासो ध्रु॒वासोऽव॑न्तु मा पि॒तरो॑ दे॒वहू॑तौ
stanzas.transliteration: ávantu mā́m uṣáso jā́yamānāḥ- ávantu mā síndhavaḥ pínvamānāḥ ávantu mā párvatāso dhruvā́saḥ- -ávantu mā pitáro deváhūtau
stanzas.translation: May Mornings as they spring to life, protect me, and may the Rivers as they swell preserve me. My guardians be the firmly-seated mountains: the Fathers, when I call on Gods, defend me!

translations.griffith: May Mornings as they spring to life, protect me, and may the Rivers as they swell preserve me. My guardians be the firmly-seated mountains: the Fathers, when I call on Gods, defend me!

stanzas.sanskrit: वि॒श्व॒दानीं॑ सु॒मन॑सः स्याम॒ पश्ये॑म॒ नु सूर्य॑मु॒च्चर॑न्तम् तथा॑ कर॒द्वसु॑पति॒र्वसू॑नां दे॒वाँ ओहा॒नोऽव॒साग॑मिष्ठः
stanzas.transliteration: viśvadā́nīṃ sumánasaḥ syāma páśyema nú sū́ryam uccárantam táthā karad vásupatir vásūnāṃ devā́m̐ óhānó 'vasā́gamiṣṭhaḥ
stanzas.translation: Through all our days may we be healthy. minded, and look upon the Sun when he arises. Grant this the Treasure-Lord of treasures, coming, observant, oftenest of Gods, with succour!

translations.griffith: Through all our days may we be healthy. minded, and look upon the Sun when he arises. Grant this the Treasure-Lord of treasures, coming, observant, oftenest of Gods, with succour!

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रो॒ नेदि॑ष्ठ॒मव॒साग॑मिष्ठः॒ सर॑स्वती॒ सिन्धु॑भिः॒ पिन्व॑माना प॒र्जन्यो॑ न॒ ओष॑धीभिर्मयो॒भुर॒ग्निः सु॒शंसः॑ सु॒हवः॑ पि॒तेव॑
stanzas.transliteration: índro nédiṣṭham ávasā́gamiṣṭhaḥ sárasvatī síndhubhiḥ pínvamānā parjányo na óṣadhībhir mayobhúr agníḥ suśáṃsaḥ suhávaḥ pitéva
stanzas.translation: Most near, most oft comes Indra with protection, and she Sarasvatî, who swells with rivers – Parjanya, bringing health with herbs, and Agni, well lauded swift to listen, like a father.

translations.griffith: Most near, most oft comes Indra with protection, and she Sarasvatî, who swells with rivers – Parjanya, bringing health with herbs, and Agni, well lauded swift to listen, like a father.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वे॑ देवास॒ आ ग॑त शृणु॒ता म॑ इ॒मं हव॑म् एदं ब॒र्हिर्नि षी॑दत
stanzas.transliteration: víśve devāsa ā́ gata śr̥ṇutā́ ma imáṃ hávam édám barhír ní ṣīdata
stanzas.translation: Hear this mine invocation; come hither, O Universal Gods, Be seated on this holy grass.

translations.griffith: Hear this mine invocation; come hither, O Universal Gods, Be seated on this holy grass.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो वो॑ देवा घृ॒तस्नु॑ना ह॒व्येन॑ प्रति॒भूष॑ति तं विश्व॒ उप॑ गच्छथ
stanzas.transliteration: yó vo devā ghr̥tásnunā havyéna pratibhū́ṣati táṃ víśva úpa gachatha
stanzas.translation: To him who comes to meet you, Gods, with offerings bathed in holy oil- Approach ye, one and all, to him.

translations.griffith: To him who comes to meet you, Gods, with offerings bathed in holy oil- Approach ye, one and all, to him.

stanzas.sanskrit: उप॑ नः सू॒नवो॒ गिरः॑ शृ॒ण्वन्त्व॒मृत॑स्य॒ ये सु॒मृ॒ळी॒का भ॑वन्तु नः
stanzas.transliteration: úpa naḥ sūnávo gíraḥ śr̥ṇvántv amŕ̥tasya yé sumr̥ḷīkā́ bhavantu naḥ
stanzas.translation: All Sons of Immortality shall listen to the songs we sing, And be exceeding good to us.

translations.griffith: All Sons of Immortality shall listen to the songs we sing, And be exceeding good to us.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वे॑ दे॒वा ऋ॑ता॒वृध॑ ऋ॒तुभि॑र्हवन॒श्रुतः॑ जु॒षन्तां॒ युज्यं॒ पयः॑
stanzas.transliteration: víśve devā́ r̥tāvŕ̥dhaḥ- r̥túbhir havanaśrútaḥ juṣántāṃ yújyam páyaḥ
stanzas.translation: May all the Gods who strengthen Law, with Rtus, listening to our call, Be pleased with theit appropriate draught.

translations.griffith: May all the Gods who strengthen Law, with Rtus, listening to our call, Be pleased with theit appropriate draught.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्तो॒त्रमिन्द्रो॑ म॒रुद्ग॑ण॒स्त्वष्टृ॑मान्मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा इ॒मा ह॒व्या जु॑षन्त नः
stanzas.transliteration: stotrám índro marúdgaṇas tváṣṭr̥mān mitró aryamā́ imā́ havyā́ juṣanta naḥ
stanzas.translation: May Indra, with the Marut host, with Tvashṭar, Mitra, Aryaman, Accept the laud and these our gifts.

translations.griffith: May Indra, with the Marut host, with Tvashṭar, Mitra, Aryaman, Accept the laud and these our gifts.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मं नो॑ अग्ने अध्व॒रं होत॑र्वयुन॒शो य॑ज चि॒कि॒त्वान्दैव्यं॒ जन॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: imáṃ no agne adhvaráṃ hótar vayunaśó yaja cikitvā́n daívyaṃ jánam
stanzas.translation: O Agni, Priest, as rules ordain, offer this sacrifice of ours, Remembering the Heavenly Folk.

translations.griffith: O Agni, Priest, as rules ordain, offer this sacrifice of ours, Remembering the Heavenly Folk.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वे॑ देवाः शृणु॒तेमं हवं॑ मे॒ ये अ॒न्तरि॑क्षे॒ य उप॒ द्यवि॒ ष्ठ ये अ॑ग्निजि॒ह्वा उ॒त वा॒ यज॑त्रा आ॒सद्या॒स्मिन्ब॒र्हिषि॑ मादयध्वम्
stanzas.transliteration: víśve devāḥ śr̥ṇutémáṃ hávam me yé antárikṣe yá úpa dyávi ṣṭhá yé agnijihvā́ utá vā yájatrāḥ- āsádyāsmín barhíṣi mādayadhvam
stanzas.translation: Listen, All-Gods, to this mine invocation, Ye who inhabit heaven, and air's midregions, All ye, O Holy Ones, whose tongue is Agni, seated upon this sacred grass, be joyful.

translations.griffith: Listen, All-Gods, to this mine invocation, Ye who inhabit heaven, and air's midregions, All ye, O Holy Ones, whose tongue is Agni, seated upon this sacred grass, be joyful.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वे॑ दे॒वा मम॑ शृण्वन्तु य॒ज्ञिया॑ उ॒भे रोद॑सी अ॒पां नपा॑च्च॒ मन्म॑ मा वो॒ वचां॑सि परि॒चक्ष्या॑णि वोचं सु॒म्नेष्विद्वो॒ अन्त॑मा मदेम
stanzas.transliteration: víśve devā́ máma śr̥ṇvantu yajñíyāḥ- ubhé ródasī apā́ṃ nápāc ca mánma mā́ vo vácāṃsi paricákṣyāṇi vocaṃ sumnéṣv íd vo ántamā madema
stanzas.translation: May the All-Gods who claim our worship hear my thought; may the two World-halves hear it, and the Waters' Child. Let me not utter words that ye may disregard. Closely allied with you may we rejoice in bliss.

translations.griffith: May the All-Gods who claim our worship hear my thought; may the two World-halves hear it, and the Waters' Child. Let me not utter words that ye may disregard. Closely allied with you may we rejoice in bliss.

stanzas.sanskrit: ये के च॒ ज्मा म॒हिनो॒ अहि॑माया दि॒वो ज॑ज्ञि॒रे अ॒पां स॒धस्थे॑ ते अ॒स्मभ्य॑मि॒षये॒ विश्व॒मायुः॒ क्षप॑ उ॒स्रा व॑रिवस्यन्तु दे॒वाः
stanzas.transliteration: yé ké ca jmā́ mahíno áhimāyāḥ- divó jajñiré apā́ṃ sadhásthe té asmábhyam iṣáye víśvam ā́yuḥ kṣápa usrā́ varivasyantu devā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: And those who, Mighty, with the wiles of serpents, were born on earth, in heaven, where waters gather- May they vouchsafe us life of full duration. May the Gods kindly give us nights and mornings.

translations.griffith: And those who, Mighty, with the wiles of serpents, were born on earth, in heaven, where waters gather- May they vouchsafe us life of full duration. May the Gods kindly give us nights and mornings.

stanzas.sanskrit: अग्नी॑पर्जन्या॒वव॑तं॒ धियं॑ मे॒ऽस्मिन्हवे॑ सुहवा सुष्टु॒तिं नः॑ इळा॑म॒न्यो ज॒नय॒द्गर्भ॑म॒न्यः प्र॒जाव॑ती॒रिष॒ आ ध॑त्तम॒स्मे
stanzas.transliteration: ágnīparjanyāv ávataṃ dhíyam me -asmín háve suhavā suṣṭutíṃ naḥ íḷām anyó janáyad gárbham anyáḥ prajā́vatīr íṣa ā́ dhattam asmé
stanzas.translation: At this my call, O Agni and Parjanya, help, swift to hear, my thought and our laudation. One generates holy food, the other offspring, so grant us food enough with store of children.

translations.griffith: At this my call, O Agni and Parjanya, help, swift to hear, my thought and our laudation. One generates holy food, the other offspring, so grant us food enough with store of children.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्ती॒र्णे ब॒र्हिषि॑ समिधा॒ने अ॒ग्नौ सू॒क्तेन॑ म॒हा नम॒सा वि॑वासे अ॒स्मिन्नो॑ अ॒द्य वि॒दथे॑ यजत्रा॒ विश्वे॑ देवा ह॒विषि॑ मादयध्वम्
stanzas.transliteration: stīrṇé barhíṣi samidhāné agnaú- sūkténa mahā́ námasā́ vivāse asmín no adyá vidáthe yajatrāḥ- víśve devā havíṣi mādayadhvam
stanzas.translation: When holy grass is strewn and fire enkindled, with hymn and lowly homage I invite you. All-Gods, to day in this our great assembly rejoice, ye Holy, in the gifts we offer.

translations.griffith: When holy grass is strewn and fire enkindled, with hymn and lowly homage I invite you. All-Gods, to day in this our great assembly rejoice, ye Holy, in the gifts we offer.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒यमु॑ त्वा पथस्पते॒ रथं॒ न वाज॑सातये धि॒ये पू॑षन्नयुज्महि
stanzas.transliteration: vayám u tvā pathas pate ráthaṃ ná vā́jasātaye dhiyé pūṣann ayujmahi
stanzas.translation: LORD of the path, O Pûshan, we have yoked and bound thee to our hymn, Even as a car, to win the prize.

translations.griffith: LORD of the path, O Pûshan, we have yoked and bound thee to our hymn, Even as a car, to win the prize.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒भि नो॒ नर्यं॒ वसु॑ वी॒रं प्रय॑तदक्षिणम् वा॒मं गृ॒हप॑तिं नय
stanzas.transliteration: abhí no náryaṃ vásu vīrám práyatadakṣiṇam vāmáṃ gr̥hápatiṃ naya
stanzas.translation: Bring us the wealth that men require, a manly master of a house, Free-handed with the liberal meed.

translations.griffith: Bring us the wealth that men require, a manly master of a house, Free-handed with the liberal meed.

stanzas.sanskrit: अदि॑त्सन्तं चिदाघृणे॒ पूष॒न्दाना॑य चोदय प॒णेश्चि॒द्वि म्र॑दा॒ मनः॑
stanzas.transliteration: áditsantaṃ cid āghr̥ṇe pū́ṣan dā́nāya codaya paṇéś cid ví mradā mánaḥ
stanzas.translation: Even him who would not give, do thou, O glowing Pûshan, urge to give, And make the niggard's soul grow soft.

translations.griffith: Even him who would not give, do thou, O glowing Pûshan, urge to give, And make the niggard's soul grow soft.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि प॒थो वाज॑सातये चिनु॒हि वि मृधो॑ जहि साध॑न्तामुग्र नो॒ धियः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ví pathó vā́jasātaye cinuhí ví mŕ̥dho jahi sā́dhantām ugra no dhíyaḥ
stanzas.translation: Clear paths that we may win the prize; scatter our enemies afar. Strong God, be all our thoughts fulfilled.

translations.griffith: Clear paths that we may win the prize; scatter our enemies afar. Strong God, be all our thoughts fulfilled.

stanzas.sanskrit: परि॑ तृन्धि पणी॒नामार॑या॒ हृद॑या कवे अथे॑म॒स्मभ्यं॑ रन्धय
stanzas.transliteration: pári tr̥ndhi paṇīnā́m ā́rayā hŕ̥dayā kave áthem asmábhyaṃ randhaya
stanzas.translation: Penetrate with an awl, O Sage, the hearts of avaricious churls, And make them subject to our will.

translations.griffith: Penetrate with an awl, O Sage, the hearts of avaricious churls, And make them subject to our will.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि पू॑ष॒न्नार॑या तुद प॒णेरि॑च्छ हृ॒दि प्रि॒यम् अथे॑म॒स्मभ्यं॑ रन्धय
stanzas.transliteration: ví pūṣann ā́rayā tuda paṇér icha hr̥dí priyám áthem asmábhyaṃ randhaya
stanzas.translation: Thrust with thine awl, O Pûshan: seek that which the niggard's heart holds dear, And make him subject to our will.

translations.griffith: Thrust with thine awl, O Pûshan: seek that which the niggard's heart holds dear, And make him subject to our will.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ रि॑ख किकि॒रा कृ॑णु पणी॒नां हृद॑या कवे अथे॑म॒स्मभ्यं॑ रन्धय
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ rikha kikirā́ kr̥ṇu paṇīnā́ṃ hŕ̥dayā kave áthem asmábhyaṃ randhaya
stanzas.translation: Tear up and read in pieces, Sage, the hearts of avaricious churls, And make them subject to our will.

translations.griffith: Tear up and read in pieces, Sage, the hearts of avaricious churls, And make them subject to our will.

stanzas.sanskrit: यां पू॑षन्ब्रह्म॒चोद॑नी॒मारां॒ बिभ॑र्ष्याघृणे तया॑ समस्य॒ हृद॑य॒मा रि॑ख किकि॒रा कृ॑णु
stanzas.transliteration: yā́m pūṣan brahmacódanīm ā́rām bíbharṣy āghr̥ṇe táyā samasya hŕ̥dayam ā́ rikha kikirā́ kr̥ṇu
stanzas.translation: Thou, glowing Pûshan, carriest an awl that urges men to prayer; Therewith do thou tear up and rend to shreds the heart of every one.

translations.griffith: Thou, glowing Pûshan, carriest an awl that urges men to prayer; Therewith do thou tear up and rend to shreds the heart of every one.

stanzas.sanskrit: या ते॒ अष्ट्रा॒ गोओ॑प॒शाघृ॑णे पशु॒साध॑नी तस्या॑स्ते सु॒म्नमी॑महे
stanzas.transliteration: yā́ te áṣṭrā góopaśā- -ā́ghr̥ṇe paśusā́dhanī tásyās te sumnám īmahe
stanzas.translation: Thou bearest, glowing Lord! a goad with horny point that guides the cows Thence do we seek thy gift of bliss.

translations.griffith: Thou bearest, glowing Lord! a goad with horny point that guides the cows Thence do we seek thy gift of bliss.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त नो॑ गो॒षणिं॒ धिय॑मश्व॒सां वा॑ज॒सामु॒त नृ॒वत्कृ॑णुहि वी॒तये॑
stanzas.transliteration: utá no goṣáṇiṃ dhíyam aśvasā́ṃ vājasā́m utá nr̥vát kr̥ṇuhi vītáye
stanzas.translation: And make this hymn of ours produce kine, horses, and a store of wealth For our delight and use as men.

translations.griffith: And make this hymn of ours produce kine, horses, and a store of wealth For our delight and use as men.

stanzas.sanskrit: सं पू॑षन्वि॒दुषा॑ नय॒ यो अञ्ज॑सानु॒शास॑ति य ए॒वेदमिति॒ ब्रव॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: sám pūṣan vidúṣā naya yó áñjasānuśā́sati yá evédám íti brávat
stanzas.translation: O Pûshan, bring us to the man who knows, who shall direct us straight, And say unto us, It is here.

translations.griffith: O Pûshan, bring us to the man who knows, who shall direct us straight, And say unto us, It is here.

stanzas.sanskrit: समु॑ पू॒ष्णा ग॑मेमहि॒ यो गृ॒हाँ अ॑भि॒शास॑ति इ॒म ए॒वेति॑ च॒ ब्रव॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: sám u pūṣṇā́ gamemahi yó gr̥hā́m̐ abhiśā́sati imá evéti ca brávat
stanzas.translation: May we go forth with Pûshan who shall point the houses out to us, And say to us, These same are they.

translations.griffith: May we go forth with Pûshan who shall point the houses out to us, And say to us, These same are they.

stanzas.sanskrit: पू॒ष्णश्च॒क्रं न रि॑ष्यति॒ न कोशोऽव॑ पद्यते नो अ॑स्य व्यथते प॒विः
stanzas.transliteration: pūṣṇáś cakráṃ ná riṣyati ná kóśó 'va padyate nó asya vyathate pavíḥ
stanzas.translation: Unharmed is Pûshan's chariot wheel; the box ne'er falleth to the ground, Nor doth the loosened felIy shake.

translations.griffith: Unharmed is Pûshan's chariot wheel; the box ne'er falleth to the ground, Nor doth the loosened felIy shake.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो अ॑स्मै ह॒विषावि॑ध॒न्न तं पू॒षापि॑ मृष्यते प्र॒थ॒मो वि॑न्दते॒ वसु॑
stanzas.transliteration: yó asmai havíṣā́vidhat- ná tám pūṣā́pi mr̥ṣyate prathamó vindate vásu
stanzas.translation: Pûshan forgetteth not the man who serveth him with offered gift: That man is first to gather wealth.

translations.griffith: Pûshan forgetteth not the man who serveth him with offered gift: That man is first to gather wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: पू॒षा गा अन्वे॑तु नः पू॒षा र॑क्ष॒त्वर्व॑तः पू॒षा वाजं॑ सनोतु नः
stanzas.transliteration: pūṣā́ gā́ ánv etu naḥ pūṣā́ rakṣatv árvataḥ pūṣā́ vā́jaṃ sanotu naḥ
stanzas.translation: May Pûshan follow near our kine; may Pûshan keep our horses safe: May Pûshan gather gear for us.

translations.griffith: May Pûshan follow near our kine; may Pûshan keep our horses safe: May Pûshan gather gear for us.

stanzas.sanskrit: पूष॒न्ननु॒ प्र गा इ॑हि॒ यज॑मानस्य सुन्व॒तः अ॒स्माकं॑ स्तुव॒तामु॒त
stanzas.transliteration: pū́ṣann ánu prá gā́ ihi yájamānasya sunvatáḥ asmā́kaṃ stuvatā́m utá
stanzas.translation: Follow the kine of him who pours libations out and worships thee; And ours who sing thee songs of praise.

translations.griffith: Follow the kine of him who pours libations out and worships thee; And ours who sing thee songs of praise.

stanzas.sanskrit: माकि॑र्नेश॒न्माकीं॑ रिष॒न्माकीं॒ सं शा॑रि॒ केव॑टे अथारि॑ष्टाभि॒रा ग॑हि
stanzas.transliteration: mā́kir neśan mā́kīṃ riṣat- mā́kīṃ sáṃ śāri kévaṭe áthā́riṣṭābhir ā́ gahi
stanzas.translation: Let none be lost, none injured, none sink in a pit and break a limb. Return with these all safe and sound.

translations.griffith: Let none be lost, none injured, none sink in a pit and break a limb. Return with these all safe and sound.

stanzas.sanskrit: शृ॒ण्वन्तं॑ पू॒षणं॑ व॒यमिर्य॒मन॑ष्टवेदसम् ईशा॑नं रा॒य ई॑महे
stanzas.transliteration: śr̥ṇvántam pūṣáṇaṃ vayám íryam ánaṣṭavedasam ī́śānaṃ rāyá īmahe
stanzas.translation: Pûshan who listens to our prayers, the Strong whose wealth is never lost, The Lord of riches, we implore.

translations.griffith: Pûshan who listens to our prayers, the Strong whose wealth is never lost, The Lord of riches, we implore.

stanzas.sanskrit: पूष॒न्तव॑ व्र॒ते व॒यं न रि॑ष्येम॒ कदा॑ च॒न स्तो॒तार॑स्त इ॒ह स्म॑सि
stanzas.transliteration: pū́ṣan táva vraté vayáṃ ná riṣyema kádā caná stotā́ras ta ihá smasi
stanzas.translation: Secure in thy protecting care, O Pûshan, never may we fail. We here are they who sing thy praise.

translations.griffith: Secure in thy protecting care, O Pûshan, never may we fail. We here are they who sing thy praise.

stanzas.sanskrit: परि॑ पू॒षा प॒रस्ता॒द्धस्तं॑ दधातु॒ दक्षि॑णम् पुन॑र्नो न॒ष्टमाज॑तु
stanzas.transliteration: pári pūṣā́ parástād -hástaṃ dadhātu dákṣiṇam púnar no naṣṭám ā́jatu
stanzas.translation: From out the distance, far and wide, may Pûshan stretch his right hand forth, And drive our lost again to us.

translations.griffith: From out the distance, far and wide, may Pûshan stretch his right hand forth, And drive our lost again to us.

stanzas.sanskrit: एहि॒ वां वि॑मुचो नपा॒दाघृ॑णे॒ सं स॑चावहै र॒थीर्ऋ॒तस्य॑ नो भव
stanzas.transliteration: éhi vā́ṃ vimuco napād ā́ghr̥ṇe sáṃ sacāvahai rathī́r r̥tásya no bhava
stanzas.translation: SON of Deliverance, come, bright God! Let us twain go together: be our charioteer of sacrifice.

translations.griffith: SON of Deliverance, come, bright God! Let us twain go together: be our charioteer of sacrifice.

stanzas.sanskrit: र॒थीत॑मं कप॒र्दिन॒मीशा॑नं॒ राध॑सो म॒हः रा॒यः सखा॑यमीमहे
stanzas.transliteration: rathī́tamaṃ kapardínam ī́śānaṃ rā́dhaso maháḥ rāyáḥ sákhāyam īmahe
stanzas.translation: We pray for wealth to thee most skilled of charioteers, with braided hair, Lord of great riches, and our Friend.

translations.griffith: We pray for wealth to thee most skilled of charioteers, with braided hair, Lord of great riches, and our Friend.

stanzas.sanskrit: रा॒यो धारा॑स्याघृणे॒ वसो॑ रा॒शिर॑जाश्व धीव॑तोधीवतः॒ सखा॑
stanzas.transliteration: rāyó dhā́rāsy āghr̥ṇe váso rāśír ajāśva dhī́vato-dhīvataḥ sákhā
stanzas.translation: Bright God whose steeds are goats, thou art a stream of wealth, a treasure-heap, The Friend of every pious man.

translations.griffith: Bright God whose steeds are goats, thou art a stream of wealth, a treasure-heap, The Friend of every pious man.

stanzas.sanskrit: पू॒षणं॒ न्व१॒॑जाश्व॒मुप॑ स्तोषाम वा॒जिन॑म् स्वसु॒र्यो जा॒र उ॒च्यते॑
stanzas.transliteration: pūṣáṇaṃ nv àjā́śvam úpa stoṣāma vājínam svásur yó jārá ucyáte
stanzas.translation: Pûshan, who driveth goats for steeds, the strong and Mighty, who is called His Sister's lover, will we laud.

translations.griffith: Pûshan, who driveth goats for steeds, the strong and Mighty, who is called His Sister's lover, will we laud.

stanzas.sanskrit: मा॒तुर्दि॑धि॒षुम॑ब्रवं॒ स्वसु॑र्जा॒रः शृ॑णोतु नः भ्रातेन्द्र॑स्य॒ सखा॒ मम॑
stanzas.transliteration: mātúr didhiṣúm abravaṃ svásur jāráḥ śr̥ṇotu naḥ bhrā́téndrasya sákhā máma
stanzas.translation: His Mother's suitor I address. May he who loves his Sister hear, Brother of Indra, and my Friend.

translations.griffith: His Mother's suitor I address. May he who loves his Sister hear, Brother of Indra, and my Friend.

stanzas.sanskrit: आजासः॑ पू॒षणं॒ रथे॑ निशृ॒म्भास्ते ज॑न॒श्रिय॑म् दे॒वं व॑हन्तु॒ बिभ्र॑तः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́jā́saḥ pūṣáṇaṃ ráthe niśr̥mbhā́s té janaśríyam deváṃ vahantu bíbhrataḥ
stanzas.translation: May the sure-footed goats come nigh, conveying Pûshan on his car, The God who visiteth mankind.

translations.griffith: May the sure-footed goats come nigh, conveying Pûshan on his car, The God who visiteth mankind.

stanzas.sanskrit: य ए॑नमा॒दिदे॑शति कर॒म्भादिति॑ पू॒षण॑म् न तेन॑ दे॒व आ॒दिशे॑
stanzas.transliteration: yá enam ādídeśati karambhā́d íti pūṣáṇam ná téna devá ādíśe
stanzas.translation: WHOSO remembers Pûshan as cater of mingled curd and meal Need think no more upon the God.

translations.griffith: WHOSO remembers Pûshan as cater of mingled curd and meal Need think no more upon the God.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त घा॒ स र॒थीत॑मः॒ सख्या॒ सत्प॑तिर्यु॒जा इन्द्रो॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ जिघ्नते
stanzas.transliteration: utá ghā sá rathī́tamaḥ sákhyā sátpatir yujā́ índro vr̥trā́ṇi jighnate
stanzas.translation: And he is best of charioteers. Indra, the hero's Lord, allied With him as Friend, destroys the foes.

translations.griffith: And he is best of charioteers. Indra, the hero's Lord, allied With him as Friend, destroys the foes.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒तादः प॑रु॒षे गवि॒ सूर॑श्च॒क्रं हि॑र॒ण्यय॑म् न्यै॑रयद्र॒थीत॑मः
stanzas.transliteration: utā́dáḥ paruṣé gávi sū́raś cakráṃ hiraṇyáyam ny aìrayad rathī́tamaḥ
stanzas.translation: And there the best of charioteers hath guided through the speckled cloud The golden wheel of Sura's car.

translations.griffith: And there the best of charioteers hath guided through the speckled cloud The golden wheel of Sura's car.

stanzas.sanskrit: यद॒द्य त्वा॑ पुरुष्टुत॒ ब्रवा॑म दस्र मन्तुमः तत्सु नो॒ मन्म॑ साधय
stanzas.transliteration: yád adyá tvā puruṣṭuta brávāma dasra mantumaḥ tát sú no mánma sādhaya
stanzas.translation: Whate'er we speak this day to thee, Wise, Wondrous God whom many praise, Give thou fulfilment of our thought.

translations.griffith: Whate'er we speak this day to thee, Wise, Wondrous God whom many praise, Give thou fulfilment of our thought.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒मं च॑ नो ग॒वेष॑णं सा॒तये॑ सीषधो ग॒णम् आ॒रात्पू॑षन्नसि श्रु॒तः
stanzas.transliteration: imáṃ ca no gavéṣaṇaṃ sātáye sīṣadho gaṇám ārā́t pūṣann asi śrutáḥ
stanzas.translation: Lead on this company of ours, that longs for kine, to win the spoil: Thou, Pûshan, art renowned afar.

translations.griffith: Lead on this company of ours, that longs for kine, to win the spoil: Thou, Pûshan, art renowned afar.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ ते॑ स्व॒स्तिमी॑मह आ॒रेअ॑घा॒मुपा॑वसुम् अ॒द्या च॑ स॒र्वता॑तये॒ श्वश्च॑ स॒र्वता॑तये
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ te svastím īmahe- āréaghām úpāvasum adyā́ ca sarvátātaye śváś ca sarvátātaye
stanzas.translation: Prosperity we crave from thee, afar from sin and near to wealth, Tending to perfect happiness both for to. morrow and to-day.

translations.griffith: Prosperity we crave from thee, afar from sin and near to wealth, Tending to perfect happiness both for to. morrow and to-day.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॒ नु पू॒षणा॑ व॒यं स॒ख्याय॑ स्व॒स्तये॑ हु॒वेम॒ वाज॑सातये
stanzas.transliteration: índrā nú pūṣáṇā vayáṃ sakhyā́ya svastáye huvéma vā́jasātaye
stanzas.translation: INDRA and Pûshan will we call for friend ship and prosperity And for the winning of the spoil.

translations.griffith: INDRA and Pûshan will we call for friend ship and prosperity And for the winning of the spoil.

stanzas.sanskrit: सोम॑म॒न्य उपा॑सद॒त्पात॑वे च॒म्वोः॑ सु॒तम् क॒र॒म्भम॒न्य इ॑च्छति
stanzas.transliteration: sómam anyá úpāsadat pā́tave camvòḥ sutám karambhám anyá ichati
stanzas.translation: One by the Soma sits to drink juice which the mortar hath expressed: The other longs for curd and meal.

translations.griffith: One by the Soma sits to drink juice which the mortar hath expressed: The other longs for curd and meal.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒जा अ॒न्यस्य॒ वह्न॑यो॒ हरी॑ अ॒न्यस्य॒ सम्भृ॑ता ताभ्यां॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ जिघ्नते
stanzas.transliteration: ajā́ anyásya váhnayo hárī anyásya sámbhr̥tā tā́bhyāṃ vr̥trā́ṇi jighnate
stanzas.translation: Goats are the team that draws the one: the other hath Bay Steeds at hand; With both of these he slays the fiends.

translations.griffith: Goats are the team that draws the one: the other hath Bay Steeds at hand; With both of these he slays the fiends.

stanzas.sanskrit: यदिन्द्रो॒ अन॑य॒द्रितो॑ म॒हीर॒पो वृष॑न्तमः तत्र॑ पू॒षाभ॑व॒त्सचा॑
stanzas.transliteration: yád índro ánayad ríto mahī́r apó vŕ̥ṣantamaḥ tátra pūṣā́bhavat sácā
stanzas.translation: When Indra, wondrous strong, brought down the streams, the mighty waterfloods, Pûshan was standing by his side.

translations.griffith: When Indra, wondrous strong, brought down the streams, the mighty waterfloods, Pûshan was standing by his side.

stanzas.sanskrit: तां पू॒ष्णः सु॑म॒तिं व॒यं वृ॒क्षस्य॒ प्र व॒यामि॑व इन्द्र॑स्य॒ चा र॑भामहे
stanzas.transliteration: tā́m pūṣṇáḥ sumatíṃ vayáṃ vr̥kṣásya prá vayā́m iva índrasya cā́ rabhāmahe
stanzas.translation: To this, to Pûshan's favouring love, and Indra's, may we closely cling, As to a tree's extended bough.

translations.griffith: To this, to Pûshan's favouring love, and Indra's, may we closely cling, As to a tree's extended bough.

stanzas.sanskrit: उत्पू॒षणं॑ युवामहे॒ऽभीशूँ॑रिव॒ सार॑थिः म॒ह्या इन्द्रं॑ स्व॒स्तये॑
stanzas.transliteration: út pūṣáṇaṃ yuvāmahe -abhī́śūm̐r iva sā́rathiḥ mahyā́ índraṃ svastáye
stanzas.translation: As one who drives a car draws in his reins, may we draw Pûshan near, And Indra, for our great success.

translations.griffith: As one who drives a car draws in his reins, may we draw Pûshan near, And Indra, for our great success.

stanzas.sanskrit: शु॒क्रं ते॑ अ॒न्यद्य॑ज॒तं ते॑ अ॒न्यद्विषु॑रूपे॒ अह॑नी॒ द्यौरि॑वासि विश्वा॒ हि मा॒या अव॑सि स्वधावो भ॒द्रा ते॑ पूषन्नि॒ह रा॒तिर॑स्तु
stanzas.transliteration: śukráṃ te anyád yajatáṃ te anyád víṣurūpe áhanī dyaúr ivāsi víśvā hí māyā́ ávasi svadhāvo bhadrā́ te pūṣann ihá rātír astu
stanzas.translation: LIKE heaven art thou: one form is bright, one holy, like Day and Night dissimilar in colour. All magic powers thou aidest, self-depen. dent! Auspicious be thy bounty here, O Pûshan.

translations.griffith: LIKE heaven art thou: one form is bright, one holy, like Day and Night dissimilar in colour. All magic powers thou aidest, self-depen. dent! Auspicious be thy bounty here, O Pûshan.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒जाश्वः॑ पशु॒पा वाज॑पस्त्यो धियंजि॒न्वो भुव॑ने॒ विश्वे॒ अर्पि॑तः अष्ट्रां॑ पू॒षा शि॑थि॒रामु॒द्वरी॑वृजत्सं॒चक्षा॑णो॒ भुव॑ना दे॒व ई॑यते
stanzas.transliteration: ajā́śvaḥ paśupā́ vā́japastyo dhiyaṃjinvó bhúvane víśve árpitaḥ áṣṭrām pūṣā́ śithirā́m udvárīvr̥jat saṃcákṣāṇo bhúvanā devá īyate
stanzas.translation: Goat-borne, the guard of cattle, he whose home is strength, inspirer of the hymn, set over all the world; Brandishing here and there his lightly. moving goad, beholding every creature, Pûshan, God, goes forth.

translations.griffith: Goat-borne, the guard of cattle, he whose home is strength, inspirer of the hymn, set over all the world; Brandishing here and there his lightly. moving goad, beholding every creature, Pûshan, God, goes forth.

stanzas.sanskrit: यास्ते॑ पूष॒न्नावो॑ अ॒न्तः स॑मु॒द्रे हि॑र॒ण्ययी॑र॒न्तरि॑क्षे॒ चर॑न्ति ताभि॑र्यासि दू॒त्यां सूर्य॑स्य॒ कामे॑न कृत॒ श्रव॑ इ॒च्छमा॑नः
stanzas.transliteration: yā́s te pūṣan nā́vo antáḥ samudré hiraṇyáyīr antárikṣe cáranti tā́bhir yāsi dūtyā́ṃ sū́ryasya kā́mena kr̥ta śráva ichámānaḥ
stanzas.translation: O Pûshan, with thy golden ships that travel across the ocean, in the air's mid-region, Thou goest on an embassy to Sûrya, subdued by love, desirous of the glory.

translations.griffith: O Pûshan, with thy golden ships that travel across the ocean, in the air's mid-region, Thou goest on an embassy to Sûrya, subdued by love, desirous of the glory.

stanzas.sanskrit: पू॒षा सु॒बन्धु॑र्दि॒व आ पृ॑थि॒व्या इ॒ळस्पति॑र्म॒घवा॑ द॒स्मव॑र्चाः यं दे॒वासो॒ अद॑दुः सू॒र्यायै॒ कामे॑न कृ॒तं त॒वसं॒ स्वञ्च॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: pūṣā́ subándhur divá ā́ pr̥thivyā́ḥ- iḷás pátir maghávā dasmávarcāḥ yáṃa devā́so ádaduḥ sūryā́yai kā́mena kr̥táṃ tavásaṃ sváñcam
stanzas.translation: Near kinsman of the heaven and earth is Pûshan, liberal, Lord of food, of wondrous lustre, Whom strong and vigorous and swiftlymoving, subdued by love, the Deities gave to Sûryâ.

translations.griffith: Near kinsman of the heaven and earth is Pûshan, liberal, Lord of food, of wondrous lustre, Whom strong and vigorous and swiftlymoving, subdued by love, the Deities gave to Sûryâ.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र नु वो॑चा सु॒तेषु॑ वां वी॒र्या॒३॒॑ यानि॑ च॒क्रथुः॑ ह॒तासो॑ वां पि॒तरो॑ दे॒वश॑त्रव॒ इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ जीव॑थो यु॒वम्
stanzas.transliteration: prá nú vocā sutéṣu vāṃ vīryā̀ yā́ni cakráthuḥ hatā́so vām pitáro deváśatravaḥ- índrāgnī jī́vatho yuvám
stanzas.translation: I WILL declare, while juices flow, the manly deeds that ye have done: Your Fathers, enemies of Gods, were smitten down, and, Indra-Agni, ye survive.

translations.griffith: I WILL declare, while juices flow, the manly deeds that ye have done: Your Fathers, enemies of Gods, were smitten down, and, Indra-Agni, ye survive.

stanzas.sanskrit: बळि॒त्था म॑हि॒मा वा॒मिन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ पनि॑ष्ठ॒ आ स॒मा॒नो वां॑ जनि॒ता भ्रात॑रा यु॒वं य॒मावि॒हेह॑मातरा
stanzas.transliteration: báḷ itthā́ mahimā́ vām índrāgnī pániṣṭha ā́ samānó vāṃ janitā́ bhrā́tarā yuváṃ yamā́v ihéhamātarā
stanzas.translation: Thus, Indra-Agnip verily your greatness merits loftiest praise, Sprung from one common Father, brothers, twins are ye; your Mother is in every place.

translations.griffith: Thus, Indra-Agnip verily your greatness merits loftiest praise, Sprung from one common Father, brothers, twins are ye; your Mother is in every place.

stanzas.sanskrit: ओ॒कि॒वांसा॑ सु॒ते सचाँ॒ अश्वा॒ सप्ती॑ इ॒वाद॑ने इन्द्रा॒ न्व१॒॑ग्नी अव॑से॒ह व॒ज्रिणा॑ व॒यं दे॒वा ह॑वामहे
stanzas.transliteration: okivā́ṃsā suté sácām̐ áśvā sáptī ivā́dane índrā nv àgnī́ ávasehá vajríṇā vayáṃ devā́ havāmahe
stanzas.translation: These who delight in flowing juice, like fellow horses at their food, Indra and Agni, Gods armed with the thunderbolt, we call this day to come with help.

translations.griffith: These who delight in flowing juice, like fellow horses at their food, Indra and Agni, Gods armed with the thunderbolt, we call this day to come with help.

stanzas.sanskrit: य इ॑न्द्राग्नी सु॒तेषु॑ वां॒ स्तव॒त्तेष्वृ॑तावृधा जो॒ष॒वा॒कं वद॑तः पज्रहोषिणा॒ न दे॑वा भ॒सथ॑श्च॒न
stanzas.transliteration: yá indrāgnī sutéṣu vāṃ stávat téṣv r̥tāvr̥dhā joṣavākáṃ vádataḥ pajrahoṣiṇā ná devā bhasáthaś caná
stanzas.translation: Indra and Agni, Friends of Law, served with rich gifts, your speech is kind To him who praises you while these libations flow: that man, O Gods, ye ne'er consume.

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, Friends of Law, served with rich gifts, your speech is kind To him who praises you while these libations flow: that man, O Gods, ye ne'er consume.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ को अ॒स्य वां॒ देवौ॒ मर्त॑श्चिकेतति विषू॑चो॒ अश्वा॑न्युयुजा॒न ई॑यत॒ एकः॑ समा॒न आ रथे॑
stanzas.transliteration: índrāgnī kó asyá vāṃ dévau mártaś ciketati víṣūco áśvān yuyujāná īyate- ékaḥ samāná ā́ ráthe
stanzas.translation: What mortal understands, O Gods, Indra and Agni, this your way? One of you, yoking Steeds that move to every side, advances in your common car.

translations.griffith: What mortal understands, O Gods, Indra and Agni, this your way? One of you, yoking Steeds that move to every side, advances in your common car.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी अ॒पादि॒यं पूर्वागा॑त्प॒द्वती॑भ्यः हि॒त्वी शिरो॑ जि॒ह्वया॒ वाव॑द॒च्चर॑त्त्रिं॒शत्प॒दा न्य॑क्रमीत्
stanzas.transliteration: índrāgnī apā́d iyám pū́rvā́gāt padvátībhyaḥ hitvī́ śíro jihváyā vā́vadac cárat triṃśát padā́ ny àkramīt
stanzas.translation: First, Indra-Agni, hath this Maid come footless unto those with feet. Stretching her head and speaking loudly with her tongue, she hath gone downward thirty steps.

translations.griffith: First, Indra-Agni, hath this Maid come footless unto those with feet. Stretching her head and speaking loudly with her tongue, she hath gone downward thirty steps.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ आ हि त॑न्व॒ते नरो॒ धन्वा॑नि बा॒ह्वोः मा नो॑ अ॒स्मिन्म॑हाध॒ने परा॑ वर्क्तं॒ गवि॑ष्टिषु
stanzas.transliteration: índrāgnī ā́ hí tanvaté náro dhánvāni bāhvóḥ mā́ no asmín mahādhané párā varktaṃ gáviṣṭiṣu
stanzas.translation: E'en now, O Indra-Agni, men hold in their arms and stretch their bows. Desert us not in this great fray, in battles for the sake of kine.

translations.griffith: E'en now, O Indra-Agni, men hold in their arms and stretch their bows. Desert us not in this great fray, in battles for the sake of kine.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ तप॑न्ति मा॒घा अ॒र्यो अरा॑तयः अप॒ द्वेषां॒स्या कृ॑तं युयु॒तं सूर्या॒दधि॑
stanzas.transliteration: índrāgnī tápanti mā- aghā́ aryó árātayaḥ ápa dvéṣāṃsy ā́ kr̥taṃ yuyutáṃ sū́ryād ádhi
stanzas.translation: The foeman's sinful enmities, Indra and Agni, vex me sore. Drive those who hate me far away, and keep them distant from the Sun.

translations.griffith: The foeman's sinful enmities, Indra and Agni, vex me sore. Drive those who hate me far away, and keep them distant from the Sun.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी यु॒वोरपि॒ वसु॑ दि॒व्यानि॒ पार्थि॑वा आ न॑ इ॒ह प्र य॑च्छतं र॒यिं वि॒श्वायु॑पोषसम्
stanzas.transliteration: índrāgnī yuvór ápi vásu divyā́ni pā́rthivā ā́ na ihá prá yachataṃ rayíṃ viśvā́yupoṣasam
stanzas.translation: Indra and Agni, yours are all the treasures of the heavens and earth. Here give ye us the opulence that prospers every living man.

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, yours are all the treasures of the heavens and earth. Here give ye us the opulence that prospers every living man.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी उक्थवाहसा॒ स्तोमे॑भिर्हवनश्रुता विश्वा॑भिर्गी॒र्भिरा ग॑तम॒स्य सोम॑स्य पी॒तये॑
stanzas.transliteration: índrāgnī ukthavāhasā stómebhir havanaśrutā víśvābhir gīrbhír ā́ gatam asyá sómasya pītáye
stanzas.translation: O Indra-Agni, who accept the laud, and hear us for our praise, Come near us, drawn by all our songs, to drink of this our Soma juice.

translations.griffith: O Indra-Agni, who accept the laud, and hear us for our praise, Come near us, drawn by all our songs, to drink of this our Soma juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: श्नथ॑द्वृ॒त्रमु॒त स॑नोति॒ वाज॒मिन्द्रा॒ यो अ॒ग्नी सहु॑री सप॒र्यात् इ॒र॒ज्यन्ता॑ वस॒व्य॑स्य॒ भूरेः॒ सह॑स्तमा॒ सह॑सा वाज॒यन्ता॑
stanzas.transliteration: śnáthad vr̥trám utá sanoti vā́jam índrā yó agnī́ sáhurī saparyā́t irajyántā vasavyàsya bhū́reḥ sáhastamā sáhasā vājayántā
stanzas.translation: HE slays the foe and wins the spoil who worships Indra and Agni, strong and mighty Heroes, Who rule as Sovrans over ample riches, victorious, showing forth their power in conquest.

translations.griffith: HE slays the foe and wins the spoil who worships Indra and Agni, strong and mighty Heroes, Who rule as Sovrans over ample riches, victorious, showing forth their power in conquest.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता यो॑धिष्टम॒भि गा इ॑न्द्र नू॒नम॒पः स्व॑रु॒षसो॑ अग्न ऊ॒ळ्हाः दिशः॒ स्व॑रु॒षस॑ इन्द्र चि॒त्रा अ॒पो गा अ॑ग्ने युवसे नि॒युत्वा॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ yodhiṣṭam abhí gā́ indra nūnám apáḥ svàr uṣáso agna ūḷhā́ḥ díśaḥ svàr uṣása indra citrā́ḥ- apó gā́ agne yuvase niyútvān
stanzas.translation: So battle now, O Indra and thou, Agni, for cows and waters, sunlight, stolen Mornings. Team-borne, thou makest kine thine own, O Agni: thou, Indra, light, Dawns, regions, wondrous waters.

translations.griffith: So battle now, O Indra and thou, Agni, for cows and waters, sunlight, stolen Mornings. Team-borne, thou makest kine thine own, O Agni: thou, Indra, light, Dawns, regions, wondrous waters.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ वृ॑त्रहणा वृत्र॒हभिः॒ शुष्मै॒रिन्द्र॑ या॒तं नमो॑भिरग्ने अ॒र्वाक् यु॒वं राधो॑भि॒रक॑वेभिरि॒न्द्राग्ने॑ अ॒स्मे भ॑वतमुत्त॒मेभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ vr̥trahaṇā vr̥trahábhiḥ śúṣmair índra yātáṃ námobhir agne arvā́k yuváṃ rā́dhobhir ákavebhir indra- -ágne asmé bhavatam uttamébhiḥ
stanzas.translation: With Vr̥itra-slaying might, Indra and Agni, come, drawn by homage, O ye Vr̥itra-slayers. Indra and Agni, show yourselves among us with your supreme and unrestricted bounties.

translations.griffith: With Vr̥itra-slaying might, Indra and Agni, come, drawn by homage, O ye Vr̥itra-slayers. Indra and Agni, show yourselves among us with your supreme and unrestricted bounties.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता हु॑वे॒ ययो॑रि॒दं प॒प्ने विश्वं॑ पु॒रा कृ॒तम् इ॒न्द्रा॒ग्नी न म॑र्धतः
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ huve yáyor idám papné víśvam purā́ kr̥tám indrāgnī́ ná mardhataḥ
stanzas.translation: I call the Twain whose deeds of old have all been famed in ancient days O Indra-Agni, harm us not.

translations.griffith: I call the Twain whose deeds of old have all been famed in ancient days O Indra-Agni, harm us not.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒ग्रा वि॑घ॒निना॒ मृध॑ इन्द्रा॒ग्नी ह॑वामहे ता नो॑ मृळात ई॒दृशे॑
stanzas.transliteration: ugrā́ vighanínā mŕ̥dhaḥ- indrāgnī́ havāmahe tā́ no mr̥ḷāta īdŕ̥śe
stanzas.translation: The Strong, the scatterers of the foe, Indra and Agni, we invoke; May they be kind to one like me.

translations.griffith: The Strong, the scatterers of the foe, Indra and Agni, we invoke; May they be kind to one like me.

stanzas.sanskrit: ह॒तो वृ॒त्राण्यार्या॑ ह॒तो दासा॑नि॒ सत्प॑ती ह॒तो विश्वा॒ अप॒ द्विषः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ható vr̥trā́ṇy ā́ryā ható dā́sāni sátpatī ható víśvā ápa dvíṣaḥ
stanzas.translation: They slay our Ârya foes, these Lords of heroes, slay our Dasyu foes And drive our enemies away.

translations.griffith: They slay our Ârya foes, these Lords of heroes, slay our Dasyu foes And drive our enemies away.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी यु॒वामि॒मे॒३॒॑ऽभि स्तोमा॑ अनूषत पिब॑तं शम्भुवा सु॒तम्
stanzas.transliteration: índrāgnī yuvā́m imé- -abhí stómā anūṣata píbataṃ śambhuvā sutám
stanzas.translation: Indra and Agni, these our songs of praise have sounded forth to you: Ye who bring blessings! drink the juice.

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, these our songs of praise have sounded forth to you: Ye who bring blessings! drink the juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: या वां॒ सन्ति॑ पुरु॒स्पृहो॑ नि॒युतो॑ दा॒शुषे॑ नरा इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ ताभि॒रा ग॑तम्
stanzas.transliteration: yā́ vāṃ sánti puruspŕ̥ho niyúto dāśúṣe narā índrāgnī tā́bhir ā́ gatam
stanzas.translation: Come, Indra-Agni, with those teams, desired of many, which ye have, O Heroes, for the worshipper.

translations.griffith: Come, Indra-Agni, with those teams, desired of many, which ye have, O Heroes, for the worshipper.

stanzas.sanskrit: ताभि॒रा ग॑च्छतं न॒रोपे॒दं सव॑नं सु॒तम् इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ सोम॑पीतये
