stanzas.transliteration: tā́bhir ā́ gachataṃ narā- úpedáṃ sávanaṃ sutám índrāgnī sómapītaye
stanzas.translation: With those to this libation poured, ye Heroes, Indra-Agni, come: Come ye to drink the Soma juice.

translations.griffith: With those to this libation poured, ye Heroes, Indra-Agni, come: Come ye to drink the Soma juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: तमी॑ळिष्व॒ यो अ॒र्चिषा॒ वना॒ विश्वा॑ परि॒ष्वज॑त् कृ॒ष्णा कृ॒णोति॑ जि॒ह्वया॑
stanzas.transliteration: tám īḷiṣva yó arcíṣā vánā víśvā pariṣvájat kr̥ṣṇā́ kr̥ṇóti jihváyā
stanzas.translation: Glorify him who compasses all forests with his glowing flame, And leaves them blackened with his tongue.

translations.griffith: Glorify him who compasses all forests with his glowing flame, And leaves them blackened with his tongue.

stanzas.sanskrit: य इ॒द्ध आ॒विवा॑सति सु॒म्नमिन्द्र॑स्य॒ मर्त्यः॑ द्यु॒म्नाय॑ सु॒तरा॑ अ॒पः
stanzas.transliteration: yá iddhá āvívāsati sumnám índrasya mártyaḥ dyumnā́ya sutárā apáḥ
stanzas.translation: He who gains Indra's bliss with fire enkindled finds an easy way Over the floods to happiness.

translations.griffith: He who gains Indra's bliss with fire enkindled finds an easy way Over the floods to happiness.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता नो॒ वाज॑वती॒रिष॑ आ॒शून्पि॑पृत॒मर्व॑तः इन्द्र॑म॒ग्निं च॒ वोळ्ह॑वे
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ no vā́javatīr íṣaḥ- āśū́n pipr̥tam árvataḥ índram agníṃ ca vóḷhave
stanzas.translation: Give us fleet coursers to convey Indra and Agni, and bestow Abundant strengthening food on us.

translations.griffith: Give us fleet coursers to convey Indra and Agni, and bestow Abundant strengthening food on us.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒भा वा॑मिन्द्राग्नी आहु॒वध्या॑ उ॒भा राध॑सः स॒ह मा॑द॒यध्यै॑ उ॒भा दा॒तारा॑वि॒षां र॑यी॒णामु॒भा वाज॑स्य सा॒तये॑ हुवे वाम्
stanzas.transliteration: ubhā́ vām indrāgnī āhuvádhyai- ubhā́ rā́dhasaḥ sahá mādayádhyai ubhā́ dātā́rāv iṣā́ṃ rayīṇā́m ubhā́ vā́jasya sātáye huve vām
stanzas.translation: Indra and Agni, I will call you hither and make you joyful with the gifts I offer. Ye Twain are givers both of food and riches: to win me strength and vigour I invoke you.

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, I will call you hither and make you joyful with the gifts I offer. Ye Twain are givers both of food and riches: to win me strength and vigour I invoke you.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ नो॒ गव्ये॑भि॒रश्व्यै॑र्वस॒व्यै॒३॒॑रुप॑ गच्छतम् सखा॑यौ दे॒वौ स॒ख्याय॑ श॒म्भुवे॑न्द्रा॒ग्नी ता ह॑वामहे
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ no gávyebhir áśvyair vasavyaìr úpa gachatam sákhāyau devaú sakhyā́ya śambhúvā- indrāgnī́ tā́ havāmahe
stanzas.translation: Come unto us with riches, come with wealth in horses and in kine. Indra and Agni, we invoke you both, the Gods, as Friends for friendship, bringing bliss.

translations.griffith: Come unto us with riches, come with wealth in horses and in kine. Indra and Agni, we invoke you both, the Gods, as Friends for friendship, bringing bliss.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी शृणु॒तं हवं॒ यज॑मानस्य सुन्व॒तः वी॒तं ह॒व्यान्या ग॑तं॒ पिब॑तं सो॒म्यं मधु॑
stanzas.transliteration: índrāgnī śr̥ṇutáṃ hávaṃ yájamānasya sunvatáḥ vītáṃ havyā́ny ā́ gatam píbataṃ somyám mádhu
stanzas.translation: Indra and Agni, hear his call who worships. with libations poured. Come and enjoy the offerings, drink the sweetly-flavoured Soma juice.

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, hear his call who worships. with libations poured. Come and enjoy the offerings, drink the sweetly-flavoured Soma juice.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒यम॑ददाद्रभ॒समृ॑ण॒च्युतं॒ दिवो॑दासं वध्र्य॒श्वाय॑ दा॒शुषे॑ या शश्व॑न्तमाच॒खादा॑व॒सं प॒णिं ता ते॑ दा॒त्राणि॑ तवि॒षा स॑रस्वति
stanzas.transliteration: iyám adadād rabhasám r̥ṇacyútaṃ dívodāsaṃ vadhryaśvā́ya dāśúṣe yā́ śáśvantam ācakhā́dāvasám paṇíṃ tā́ te dātrā́ṇi taviṣā́ sarasvati
stanzas.translation: To Vadhryaṣva when. be worshipped her with gifts she gave fierce Divodâsa, canceller of debts. Consumer of the churlish niggard, one and all, thine, O Sarasvatî, are these effectual boons.

translations.griffith: To Vadhryaṣva when. be worshipped her with gifts she gave fierce Divodâsa, canceller of debts. Consumer of the churlish niggard, one and all, thine, O Sarasvatî, are these effectual boons.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒यं शुष्मे॑भिर्बिस॒खा इ॑वारुज॒त्सानु॑ गिरी॒णां त॑वि॒षेभि॑रू॒र्मिभिः॑ पा॒रा॒व॒त॒घ्नीमव॑से सुवृ॒क्तिभिः॒ सर॑स्वती॒मा वि॑वासेम धी॒तिभिः॑
stanzas.transliteration: iyáṃ śúṣmebhir bisakhā́ ivārujat sā́nu girīṇā́ṃ taviṣébhir ūrmíbhiḥ pārāvataghnī́m ávase suvr̥ktíbhiḥ sárasvatīm ā́ vivāsema dhītíbhiḥ
stanzas.translation: She with her might, like one who digs for lotus-stems, hath burst with her strong waves the ridges of the hills. Let us invite with songs and holy hymns for help Sarasvatî who slayeth the Pârâvatas.

translations.griffith: She with her might, like one who digs for lotus-stems, hath burst with her strong waves the ridges of the hills. Let us invite with songs and holy hymns for help Sarasvatî who slayeth the Pârâvatas.

stanzas.sanskrit: सर॑स्वति देव॒निदो॒ नि ब॑र्हय प्र॒जां विश्व॑स्य॒ बृस॑यस्य मा॒यिनः॑ उ॒त क्षि॒तिभ्यो॒ऽवनी॑रविन्दो वि॒षमे॑भ्यो अस्रवो वाजिनीवति
stanzas.transliteration: sárasvati devanído ní barhaya prajā́ṃ víśvasya bŕ̥sayasya māyínaḥ utá kṣitíbhyo 'vánīr avindo viṣám ebhyo asravo vājinīvati
stanzas.translation: Thou castest down, Sarasvatî, those who scorned the Gods, the brood of every Br̥isaya skilled in magic arts. Thou hast discovered rivers for the tribes of men, and, rich in wealth! made poison flow away from them.

translations.griffith: Thou castest down, Sarasvatî, those who scorned the Gods, the brood of every Br̥isaya skilled in magic arts. Thou hast discovered rivers for the tribes of men, and, rich in wealth! made poison flow away from them.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र णो॑ दे॒वी सर॑स्वती॒ वाजे॑भिर्वा॒जिनी॑वती धी॒नाम॑वि॒त्र्य॑वतु
stanzas.transliteration: prá ṇo devī́ sárasvatī vā́jebhir vājínīvatī dhīnā́m avitry àvatu
stanzas.translation: May the divine Sarasvatî, rich in her wealth, protect us well, Furthering all our thoughts with might

translations.griffith: May the divine Sarasvatî, rich in her wealth, protect us well, Furthering all our thoughts with might

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्त्वा॑ देवि सरस्वत्युपब्रू॒ते धने॑ हि॒ते इन्द्रं॒ न वृ॑त्र॒तूर्ये॑
stanzas.transliteration: yás tvā devi sarasvati- upabrūté dháne hité índraṃ ná vr̥tratū́rye
stanzas.translation: Whoso, divine Sarasvatî, invokes thee where the prize is set, Like Indra when he smites the foe.

translations.griffith: Whoso, divine Sarasvatî, invokes thee where the prize is set, Like Indra when he smites the foe.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्वं दे॑वि सरस्व॒त्यवा॒ वाजे॑षु वाजिनि रदा॑ पू॒षेव॑ नः स॒निम्
stanzas.transliteration: tváṃ devi sarasvati- ávā vā́jeṣu vājini rádā pūṣéva naḥ saním
stanzas.translation: Aid us, divine Sarasvad, thou who art strong in wealth and power Like Pûshan, give us opulence.

translations.griffith: Aid us, divine Sarasvad, thou who art strong in wealth and power Like Pûshan, give us opulence.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त स्या नः॒ सर॑स्वती घो॒रा हिर॑ण्यवर्तनिः वृ॒त्र॒घ्नी व॑ष्टि सुष्टु॒तिम्
stanzas.transliteration: utá syā́ naḥ sárasvatī ghorā́ híraṇyavartaniḥ vr̥traghnī́ vaṣṭi suṣṭutím
stanzas.translation: Yea, this divine Sarasvatî, terrible with her golden path, Foe-slayer, claims our eulogy.

translations.griffith: Yea, this divine Sarasvatî, terrible with her golden path, Foe-slayer, claims our eulogy.

stanzas.sanskrit: यस्या॑ अन॒न्तो अह्रु॑तस्त्वे॒षश्च॑रि॒ष्णुर॑र्ण॒वः अम॒श्चर॑ति॒ रोरु॑वत्
stanzas.transliteration: yásyā anantó áhrutas tveṣáś cariṣṇúr arṇaváḥ ámaś cárati róruvat
stanzas.translation: Whose limitless unbroken flood, swift-moving with a rapid rush, Comes onward with tempestuous roar.

translations.griffith: Whose limitless unbroken flood, swift-moving with a rapid rush, Comes onward with tempestuous roar.

stanzas.sanskrit: सा नो॒ विश्वा॒ अति॒ द्विषः॒ स्वसॄ॑र॒न्या ऋ॒ताव॑री अत॒न्नहे॑व॒ सूर्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sā́ no víśvā áti dvíṣaḥ svásr̥̄r anyā́ r̥tā́varī átann áheva sū́ryaḥ
stanzas.translation: She hath spread us beyond all foes, beyond her Sisters, Holy One, As Sûrya spreadeth out the days.

translations.griffith: She hath spread us beyond all foes, beyond her Sisters, Holy One, As Sûrya spreadeth out the days.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त नः॑ प्रि॒या प्रि॒यासु॑ स॒प्तस्व॑सा॒ सुजु॑ष्टा सर॑स्वती॒ स्तोम्या॑ भूत्
stanzas.transliteration: utá naḥ priyā́ priyā́su saptásvasā sújuṣṭā sárasvatī stómyā bhūt
stanzas.translation: Yea, she most dear amid dear stream, Seven-sistered, graciously inclined, Sarasvatî hath earned our praise.

translations.griffith: Yea, she most dear amid dear stream, Seven-sistered, graciously inclined, Sarasvatî hath earned our praise.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ॒प॒प्रुषी॒ पार्थि॑वान्यु॒रु रजो॑ अ॒न्तरि॑क्षम् सर॑स्वती नि॒दस्पा॑तु
stanzas.transliteration: āpaprúṣī pā́rthivāni- urú rájo antárikṣam sárasvatī nidás pātu
stanzas.translation: Guard us from hate Sarasvatî, she who hath filled the realms of earth, And that wide tract, the firmament!

translations.griffith: Guard us from hate Sarasvatî, she who hath filled the realms of earth, And that wide tract, the firmament!

stanzas.sanskrit: त्रि॒ष॒धस्था॑ स॒प्तधा॑तुः॒ पञ्च॑ जा॒ता व॒र्धय॑न्ती वाजे॑वाजे॒ हव्या॑ भूत्
stanzas.transliteration: triṣadhásthā saptádhātuḥ páñca jātā́ vardháyantī vā́je-vāje hávyā bhūt
stanzas.translation: Seven-sistered, sprung from threefold source, the Five Tribes' prosperer, she must be Invoked in every deed of might.

translations.griffith: Seven-sistered, sprung from threefold source, the Five Tribes' prosperer, she must be Invoked in every deed of might.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र या म॑हि॒म्ना म॒हिना॑सु॒ चेकि॑ते द्यु॒म्नेभि॑र॒न्या अ॒पसा॑म॒पस्त॑मा रथ॑ इव बृह॒ती वि॒भ्वने॑ कृ॒तोप॒स्तुत्या॑ चिकि॒तुषा॒ सर॑स्वती
stanzas.transliteration: prá yā́ mahimnā́ mahínāsu cékite dyumnébhir anyā́ apásām apástamā rátha iva br̥hatī́ vibhváne kr̥tā́- -upastútyā cikitúṣā sárasvatī
stanzas.translation: Marked out by majesty among the Mighty Ones, in glory swifter than the other rapid Streams, Created vast for victory like a chariot, Sarasvatî must be extolled by every sage.

translations.griffith: Marked out by majesty among the Mighty Ones, in glory swifter than the other rapid Streams, Created vast for victory like a chariot, Sarasvatî must be extolled by every sage.

stanzas.sanskrit: सर॑स्वत्य॒भि नो॑ नेषि॒ वस्यो॒ माप॑ स्फरीः॒ पय॑सा॒ मा न॒ आ ध॑क् जु॒षस्व॑ नः स॒ख्या वे॒श्या॑ च॒ मा त्वत्क्षेत्रा॒ण्यर॑णानि गन्म
stanzas.transliteration: sárasvaty abhí no neṣi vásyo mā́pa spharīḥ páyasā mā́ na ā́ dhak juṣásva naḥ sakhyā́ veśyā̀ ca mā́ tvát kṣétrāṇy áraṇāni ganma
stanzas.translation: Guide us, Sarasvatî, to glorious treasure: refuse us not thy milk, nor spurn us from thee. Gladly accept our friendship and obedience: let us not go from thee to distant countries.

translations.griffith: Guide us, Sarasvatî, to glorious treasure: refuse us not thy milk, nor spurn us from thee. Gladly accept our friendship and obedience: let us not go from thee to distant countries.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्तु॒षे नरा॑ दि॒वो अ॒स्य प्र॒सन्ता॒श्विना॑ हुवे॒ जर॑माणो अ॒र्कैः या स॒द्य उ॒स्रा व्युषि॒ ज्मो अन्ता॒न्युयू॑षतः॒ पर्यु॒रू वरां॑सि
stanzas.transliteration: stuṣé nárā divó asyá prasántā- -aśvínā huve járamāṇo arkaíḥ yā́ sadyá usrā́ vyúṣi jmó ántān yúyūṣataḥ páry urū́ várāṃsi
stanzas.translation: I LAUD the Heroes Twain, this heaven's Controllers: singing with songs of praise I call the Aṣvins, Fain in a moment, when the morns are breaking, to part the earth's ends and the spacious regions.

translations.griffith: I LAUD the Heroes Twain, this heaven's Controllers: singing with songs of praise I call the Aṣvins, Fain in a moment, when the morns are breaking, to part the earth's ends and the spacious regions.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता य॒ज्ञमा शुचि॑भिश्चक्रमा॒णा रथ॑स्य भा॒नुं रु॑रुचू॒ रजो॑भिः पु॒रू वरां॒स्यमि॑ता॒ मिमा॑ना॒पो धन्वा॒न्यति॑ याथो॒ अज्रा॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ yajñám ā́ śúcibhiś cakramāṇā́ ráthasya bhānúṃ rurucū rájobhiḥ purū́ várāṃsy ámitā mímānā- -apó dhánvāny áti yātho ájrān
stanzas.translation: Moving to sacrifice through realms of lustre they light the radiance of the car that bears them. traversing many wide unmeasured spaces, over the wastes ye pass, and fields, and waters.

translations.griffith: Moving to sacrifice through realms of lustre they light the radiance of the car that bears them. traversing many wide unmeasured spaces, over the wastes ye pass, and fields, and waters.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता ह॒ त्यद्व॒र्तिर्यदर॑ध्रमुग्रे॒त्था धिय॑ ऊहथुः॒ शश्व॒दश्वैः॑ मनो॑जवेभिरिषि॒रैः श॒यध्यै॒ परि॒ व्यथि॑र्दा॒शुषो॒ मर्त्य॑स्य
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ ha tyád vartír yád áradhram ugrā- -itthā́ dhíya ūhathuḥ śáśvad áśvaiḥ mánojavebhir iṣiraíḥ śayádhyai pári vyáthir dāśúṣo mártyasya
stanzas.translation: Ye to that bounteous path of yours, ye mighty, have ever borne away our thoughts with horses, Mind-swift and full of vigour, that the trouble of man who offers gifts might cease and slumber.

translations.griffith: Ye to that bounteous path of yours, ye mighty, have ever borne away our thoughts with horses, Mind-swift and full of vigour, that the trouble of man who offers gifts might cease and slumber.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता नव्य॑सो॒ जर॑माणस्य॒ मन्मोप॑ भूषतो युयुजा॒नस॑प्ती शुभं॒ पृक्ष॒मिष॒मूर्जं॒ वह॑न्ता॒ होता॑ यक्षत्प्र॒त्नो अ॒ध्रुग्युवा॑ना
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ návyaso járamāṇasya mánma- -úpa bhūṣato yuyujānásaptī śúbham pŕ̥kṣam íṣam ū́rjaṃ váhantā hótā yakṣat pratnó adhrúg yúvānā
stanzas.translation: So ye, when ye have yoked your chariothorses, come to the hymn of the most recent singer. Our true and ancient Herald Priest shall bring you, the Youthful, bearing splendour, food, and vigour.

translations.griffith: So ye, when ye have yoked your chariothorses, come to the hymn of the most recent singer. Our true and ancient Herald Priest shall bring you, the Youthful, bearing splendour, food, and vigour.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता व॒ल्गू द॒स्रा पु॑रु॒शाक॑तमा प्र॒त्ना नव्य॑सा॒ वच॒सा वि॑वासे या शंस॑ते स्तुव॒ते शम्भ॑विष्ठा बभू॒वतु॑र्गृण॒ते चि॒त्ररा॑ती
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ valgū́ dasrā́ puruśā́katamā pratnā́ návyasā vácasā́ vivāse yā́ śáṃsate stuvaté śámbhaviṣṭhā babhūvátur gr̥ṇaté citrárātī
stanzas.translation: With newest hymn I call those Wonder-Workers, ancient and brilliant, and exceeding mighty, Bringers of bliss to him who lauds and praises, bestowing varied bounties on the singer.

translations.griffith: With newest hymn I call those Wonder-Workers, ancient and brilliant, and exceeding mighty, Bringers of bliss to him who lauds and praises, bestowing varied bounties on the singer.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता भु॒ज्युं विभि॑र॒द्भ्यः स॑मु॒द्रात्तुग्र॑स्य सू॒नुमू॑हथू॒ रजो॑भिः अ॒रे॒णुभि॒र्योज॑नेभिर्भु॒जन्ता॑ पत॒त्रिभि॒रर्ण॑सो॒ निरु॒पस्था॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ bhujyúṃ víbhir adbhyáḥ samudrā́t túgrasya sūnúm ūhathū rájobhiḥ areṇúbhir yójanebhir bhujántā patatríbhir árṇaso nír upásthāt
stanzas.translation: So ye, with birds, out of the sea and waters bore Bhujyu, son of Tugra, through the regions. Speeding with winged steeds through dustless spaces, out of the bosom of the flood they bore him.

translations.griffith: So ye, with birds, out of the sea and waters bore Bhujyu, son of Tugra, through the regions. Speeding with winged steeds through dustless spaces, out of the bosom of the flood they bore him.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि ज॒युषा॑ रथ्या यात॒मद्रिं॑ श्रु॒तं हवं॑ वृषणा वध्रिम॒त्याः द॒श॒स्यन्ता॑ श॒यवे॑ पिप्यथु॒र्गामिति॑ च्यवाना सुम॒तिं भु॑रण्यू
stanzas.transliteration: ví jayúṣā rathyā yātam ádriṃ śrutáṃ hávaṃ vr̥ṣaṇā vadhrimatyā́ḥ daśasyántā śayáve pipyathur gā́m íti cyavānā sumatím bhuraṇyū
stanzas.translation: Victors, car-borne, ye rent the rock asunder: Bulls, heard the calling of the eunuch's consort. Bounteous, ye filled the cow with milk for Ṣayu: thus, swift and zealous Ones, ye showed your favour.

translations.griffith: Victors, car-borne, ye rent the rock asunder: Bulls, heard the calling of the eunuch's consort. Bounteous, ye filled the cow with milk for Ṣayu: thus, swift and zealous Ones, ye showed your favour.

stanzas.sanskrit: यद्रो॑दसी प्र॒दिवो॒ अस्ति॒ भूमा॒ हेळो॑ दे॒वाना॑मु॒त म॑र्त्य॒त्रा तदा॑दित्या वसवो रुद्रियासो रक्षो॒युजे॒ तपु॑र॒घं द॑धात
stanzas.transliteration: yád rodasī pradívo ásti bhū́mā héḷo devā́nām utá martyatrā́ tád ādityā vasavo rudriyāso rakṣoyúje tápur agháṃ dadhāta
stanzas.translation: Whate'er from olden time, Heaven, Earth! existeth great object of the wrath of Gods and mortals, Make that, Âdityas, Vasus, sons of Rudra, an evil brand to one allied with demons.

translations.griffith: Whate'er from olden time, Heaven, Earth! existeth great object of the wrath of Gods and mortals, Make that, Âdityas, Vasus, sons of Rudra, an evil brand to one allied with demons.

stanzas.sanskrit: य ईं॒ राजा॑नावृतु॒था वि॒दध॒द्रज॑सो मि॒त्रो वरु॑ण॒श्चिके॑तत् ग॒म्भी॒राय॒ रक्ष॑से हे॒तिम॑स्य॒ द्रोघा॑य चि॒द्वच॑स॒ आन॑वाय
stanzas.transliteration: yá īṃ rā́jānāv r̥tuthā́ vidádhad rájaso mitró váruṇaś cíketat gambhīrā́ya rákṣase hetím asya dróghāya cid vácasa ā́navāya
stanzas.translation: May he who knows, as Varuṇa and Mitra, air's realm, appointing both the Kings in season, Against the secret fiend cast forth his weapon, against the lying words that strangers utter.

translations.griffith: May he who knows, as Varuṇa and Mitra, air's realm, appointing both the Kings in season, Against the secret fiend cast forth his weapon, against the lying words that strangers utter.

stanzas.sanskrit: अन्त॑रैश्च॒क्रैस्तन॑याय व॒र्तिर्द्यु॒मता या॑तं नृ॒वता॒ रथे॑न सनु॑त्येन॒ त्यज॑सा॒ मर्त्य॑स्य वनुष्य॒तामपि॑ शी॒र्षा व॑वृक्तम्
stanzas.transliteration: ántaraiś cakraís tánayāya vartír dyumátā́ yātaṃ nr̥vátā ráthena sánutyena tyájasā mártyasya vanuṣyatā́m ápi śīrṣā́ vavr̥ktam
stanzas.translation: Come to our home with friendly wheels, for offspring; come on your radiant chariot rich in heroes. Strike off, ye Twain, the heads of our assailants who with man's treacherous attack approach us.

translations.griffith: Come to our home with friendly wheels, for offspring; come on your radiant chariot rich in heroes. Strike off, ye Twain, the heads of our assailants who with man's treacherous attack approach us.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ प॑र॒माभि॑रु॒त म॑ध्य॒माभि॑र्नि॒युद्भि॑र्यातमव॒माभि॑र॒र्वाक् दृ॒ळ्हस्य॑ चि॒द्गोम॑तो॒ वि व्र॒जस्य॒ दुरो॑ वर्तं गृण॒ते चि॑त्रराती
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ paramā́bhir utá madhyamā́bhir niyúdbhir yātam avamā́bhir arvā́k dr̥ḷhásya cid gómato ví vrajásya dúro vartaṃ gr̥ṇaté citrarātī
stanzas.translation: Come hitherward to us with teams of horses, the highest and the midmost and the lowest. Bountiful Lords, throw open to the singer doors e'en of the firm-closed stall of cattle.

translations.griffith: Come hitherward to us with teams of horses, the highest and the midmost and the lowest. Bountiful Lords, throw open to the singer doors e'en of the firm-closed stall of cattle.

stanzas.sanskrit: क्व१॒॑ त्या व॒ल्गू पु॑रुहू॒ताद्य दू॒तो न स्तोमो॑ऽविद॒न्नम॑स्वान् आ यो अ॒र्वाङ्नास॑त्या व॒वर्त॒ प्रेष्ठा॒ ह्यस॑थो अस्य॒ मन्म॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: kvà tyā́ valgū́ puruhūtā́dyá dūtó ná stómo 'vidan námasvān ā́ yó arvā́ṅ nā́satyā vavárta préṣṭhā hy ásatho asya mánman
stanzas.translation: WHERE hath the hymn with reverence, like an envoy, found both fair Gods to-day, invoked of many- Hymn that hath brought the two Nâsatyas hither? To this man's thought be ye, both Gods, most friendly.

translations.griffith: WHERE hath the hymn with reverence, like an envoy, found both fair Gods to-day, invoked of many- Hymn that hath brought the two Nâsatyas hither? To this man's thought be ye, both Gods, most friendly.

stanzas.sanskrit: अरं॑ मे गन्तं॒ हव॑नाया॒स्मै गृ॑णा॒ना यथा॒ पिबा॑थो॒ अन्धः॑ परि॑ ह॒ त्यद्व॒र्तिर्या॑थो रि॒षो न यत्परो॒ नान्त॑रस्तुतु॒र्यात्
stanzas.transliteration: áram me gantaṃ hávanāyāsmaí gr̥ṇānā́ yáthā píbātho ándhaḥ pári ha tyád vartír yātho riṣó ná yát páro nā́ntaras tuturyā́t
stanzas.translation: Come readily to this mine invocation, lauded with songs, that ye may drink the juices. Compass this house to keep it from the foeman, that none may force it, either near or distant.

translations.griffith: Come readily to this mine invocation, lauded with songs, that ye may drink the juices. Compass this house to keep it from the foeman, that none may force it, either near or distant.

stanzas.sanskrit: अका॑रि वा॒मन्ध॑सो॒ वरी॑म॒न्नस्ता॑रि ब॒र्हिः सु॑प्राय॒णत॑मम् उ॒त्ता॒नह॑स्तो युव॒युर्व॑व॒न्दा वां॒ नक्ष॑न्तो॒ अद्र॑य आञ्जन्
stanzas.transliteration: ákāri vām ándhaso várīmann ástāri barhíḥ suprāyaṇátamam uttānáhasto yuvayúr vavanda- -ā́ vāṃ nákṣanto ádraya āñjan
stanzas.translation: Juice in wide room hath been prepared to feast you: for you the grass is strewn, most soft to tread on. With lifted hands your servant hath adored you. Yearningfor you the press-stones shed the liquid.

translations.griffith: Juice in wide room hath been prepared to feast you: for you the grass is strewn, most soft to tread on. With lifted hands your servant hath adored you. Yearningfor you the press-stones shed the liquid.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऊ॒र्ध्वो वा॑म॒ग्निर॑ध्व॒रेष्व॑स्था॒त्प्र रा॒तिरे॑ति जू॒र्णिनी॑ घृ॒ताची॑ प्र होता॑ गू॒र्तम॑ना उरा॒णोऽयु॑क्त॒ यो नास॑त्या॒ हवी॑मन्
stanzas.transliteration: ūrdhvó vām agnír adhvaréṣv asthāt prá rātír eti jūrṇínī ghr̥tā́cī prá hótā gūrtámanā urāṇó -áyukta yó nā́satyā hávīman
stanzas.translation: Agni uplifts him at your sacrifices: forth goes the oblation dropping oil and glowing. Up stands the grateful-minded priest, elected, appointed to invoke the two Nâsatyas.

translations.griffith: Agni uplifts him at your sacrifices: forth goes the oblation dropping oil and glowing. Up stands the grateful-minded priest, elected, appointed to invoke the two Nâsatyas.

stanzas.sanskrit: अधि॑ श्रि॒ये दु॑हि॒ता सूर्य॑स्य॒ रथं॑ तस्थौ पुरुभुजा श॒तोति॑म् प्र मा॒याभि॑र्मायिना भूत॒मत्र॒ नरा॑ नृतू॒ जनि॑मन्य॒ज्ञिया॑नाम्
stanzas.transliteration: ádhi śriyé duhitā́ sū́ryasya ráthaṃ tasthau purubhujā śatótim prá māyā́bhir māyinā bhūtam átra nárā nr̥tū jániman yajñíyānām
stanzas.translation: Lords of great wealth! for glory, Sûrya's Daughter mounted your car that brings a hundred succours. Famed for your magic arts were ye, magicians! amid the race of Gods, ye dancing Heroes!

translations.griffith: Lords of great wealth! for glory, Sûrya's Daughter mounted your car that brings a hundred succours. Famed for your magic arts were ye, magicians! amid the race of Gods, ye dancing Heroes!

stanzas.sanskrit: यु॒वं श्री॒भिर्द॑र्श॒ताभि॑रा॒भिः शु॒भे पु॒ष्टिमू॑हथुः सू॒र्यायाः॑ प्र वां॒ वयो॒ वपु॒षेऽनु॑ पप्त॒न्नक्ष॒द्वाणी॒ सुष्टु॑ता धिष्ण्या वाम्
stanzas.transliteration: yuváṃ śrībhír darśatā́bhir ābhíḥ śubhé puṣṭím ūhathuḥ sūryā́yāḥ prá vāṃ váyo vápuṣé 'nu paptan nákṣad vā́ṇī súṣṭutā dhiṣṇyā vām
stanzas.translation: Ye Twain, with these your glories fair to look on, brought, to win victory, rich gifts for Sûryâ. After you flew your birds, marvels of beauty: dear to our hearts! the song, well lauded, reached you.

translations.griffith: Ye Twain, with these your glories fair to look on, brought, to win victory, rich gifts for Sûryâ. After you flew your birds, marvels of beauty: dear to our hearts! the song, well lauded, reached you.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ वां॒ वयोऽश्वा॑सो॒ वहि॑ष्ठा अ॒भि प्रयो॑ नासत्या वहन्तु प्र वां॒ रथो॒ मनो॑जवा असर्जी॒षः पृ॒क्ष इ॒षिधो॒ अनु॑ पू॒र्वीः
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ váyó 'śvāso váhiṣṭhāḥ- abhí práyo nāsatyā vahantu prá vāṃ rátho mánojavā asarji- -iṣáḥ pr̥kṣá iṣídho ánu pūrvī́ḥ
stanzas.translation: May your winged coursers, best to draw. Nâsatyas! convey you to the object of your wishes. Swift as the thought, your car hath been sent onward to food of many a sort and dainty viands.

translations.griffith: May your winged coursers, best to draw. Nâsatyas! convey you to the object of your wishes. Swift as the thought, your car hath been sent onward to food of many a sort and dainty viands.

stanzas.sanskrit: पु॒रु हि वां॑ पुरुभुजा दे॒ष्णं धे॒नुं न॒ इषं॑ पिन्वत॒मस॑क्राम् स्तुत॑श्च वां माध्वी सुष्टु॒तिश्च॒ रसा॑श्च॒ ये वा॒मनु॑ रा॒तिमग्म॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: purú hí vām purubhujā deṣṇáṃ dhenúṃ na íṣam pinvatam ásakrām stútaś ca vām mādhvī suṣṭutíś ca rásāś ca yé vām ánu rātím ágman
stanzas.translation: Lords of great wealth, manifold is your bounty: ye filled our cow with food that never faileth. Lovers of sweetness! yours are praise and singers, and poured libations which have sought your favour.

translations.griffith: Lords of great wealth, manifold is your bounty: ye filled our cow with food that never faileth. Lovers of sweetness! yours are praise and singers, and poured libations which have sought your favour.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त म॑ ऋ॒ज्रे पुर॑यस्य र॒घ्वी सु॑मी॒ळ्हे श॒तं पे॑रु॒के च॑ प॒क्वा शा॒ण्डो दा॑द्धिर॒णिनः॒ स्मद्दि॑ष्टी॒न्दश॑ व॒शासो॑ अभि॒षाच॑ ऋ॒ष्वान्
stanzas.transliteration: utá ma r̥jré púrayasya raghvī́ sumīḷhé śatám peruké ca pakvā́ śāṇḍó dād dhiraṇínaḥ smáddiṣṭīn dáśa vaśā́so abhiṣā́ca r̥ṣvā́n
stanzas.translation: Mine were two mares of Puraya, brown, swift-footed; a hundred with Sumîḍha, food with Peruk. Ṣâṇḍa gave ten gold-decked and well-trained horses, tame and obedient and of lofty stature.

translations.griffith: Mine were two mares of Puraya, brown, swift-footed; a hundred with Sumîḍha, food with Peruk. Ṣâṇḍa gave ten gold-decked and well-trained horses, tame and obedient and of lofty stature.

stanzas.sanskrit: सं वां॑ श॒ता ना॑सत्या स॒हस्राश्वा॑नां पुरु॒पन्था॑ गि॒रे दा॑त् भ॒रद्वा॑जाय वीर॒ नू गि॒रे दा॑द्ध॒ता रक्षां॑सि पुरुदंससा स्युः
stanzas.transliteration: sáṃ vāṃ śatā́ nāsatyā sahásrā- -áśvānām purupánthā giré dāt bharádvājāya vīra nū́ giré dād -hatā́ rákṣāṃsi purudaṃsasā syuḥ
stanzas.translation: Nâsatyas! Purupanthas offered hundreds, thousands of steeds to him who sang your praises, Gave, Heroes! to the singer Bharadvâja. Ye-Wonder-Workers, let the fiends be slaughtered.

translations.griffith: Nâsatyas! Purupanthas offered hundreds, thousands of steeds to him who sang your praises, Gave, Heroes! to the singer Bharadvâja. Ye-Wonder-Workers, let the fiends be slaughtered.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ वां॑ सु॒म्ने वरि॑मन्त्सू॒रिभिः॑ ष्याम्
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ sumné váriman sūríbhiḥ ṣyām
stanzas.translation: May I with princes share your bliss in freedom.

translations.griffith: May I with princes share your bliss in freedom.

stanzas.sanskrit: उदु॑ श्रि॒य उ॒षसो॒ रोच॑माना॒ अस्थु॑र॒पां नोर्मयो॒ रुश॑न्तः कृ॒णोति॒ विश्वा॑ सु॒पथा॑ सु॒गान्यभू॑दु॒ वस्वी॒ दक्षि॑णा म॒घोनी॑
stanzas.transliteration: úd u śriyá uṣáso rócamānāḥ- ásthur apā́ṃ nórmáyo rúśantaḥ kr̥ṇóti víśvā supáthā sugā́ni- ábhūd u vásvī dákṣiṇā maghónī
stanzas.translation: THE radiant Dawns have risen up for glory, in their white splendour like the waves of waters. She maketh paths all easy, fair to travel, and, rich, hath shown herself benign and friendly.

translations.griffith: THE radiant Dawns have risen up for glory, in their white splendour like the waves of waters. She maketh paths all easy, fair to travel, and, rich, hath shown herself benign and friendly.

stanzas.sanskrit: भ॒द्रा द॑दृक्ष उर्वि॒या वि भा॒स्युत्ते॑ शो॒चिर्भा॒नवो॒ द्याम॑पप्तन् आ॒विर्वक्षः॑ कृणुषे शु॒म्भमा॒नोषो॑ देवि॒ रोच॑माना॒ महो॑भिः
stanzas.transliteration: bhadrā́ dadr̥kṣa urviyā́ ví bhāsi- út te śocír bhānávo dyā́m apaptan āvír vákṣaḥ kr̥ṇuṣe śumbhámānā- -úṣo devi rócamānā máhobhiḥ
stanzas.translation: We see that thou art good: far shines thy lustre; thy beams, thy splendours have flown up to heaven. Decking thyself, thou makest bare thy bosom, shining in majesty, thou Goddess Morning.

translations.griffith: We see that thou art good: far shines thy lustre; thy beams, thy splendours have flown up to heaven. Decking thyself, thou makest bare thy bosom, shining in majesty, thou Goddess Morning.

stanzas.sanskrit: वह॑न्ति सीमरु॒णासो॒ रुश॑न्तो॒ गावः॑ सु॒भगा॑मुर्वि॒या प्र॑था॒नाम् अपे॑जते॒ शूरो॒ अस्ते॑व॒ शत्रू॒न्बाध॑ते॒ तमो॑ अजि॒रो न वोळ्हा॑
stanzas.transliteration: váhanti sīm aruṇā́so rúśanto gā́vaḥ subhágām urviyā́ prathānā́m ápejate śū́ro ásteva śátrūn bā́dhate támo ajiró ná vóḷhā
stanzas.translation: Red are the kine and luminous that bear her the Blessed One who spreadeth through the distance. The foes she chaseth like a valiant archer, like a swift warrior she repelleth darkness.

translations.griffith: Red are the kine and luminous that bear her the Blessed One who spreadeth through the distance. The foes she chaseth like a valiant archer, like a swift warrior she repelleth darkness.

stanzas.sanskrit: सु॒गोत ते॑ सु॒पथा॒ पर्व॑तेष्ववा॒ते अ॒पस्त॑रसि स्वभानो सा न॒ आ व॑ह पृथुयामन्नृष्वे र॒यिं दि॑वो दुहितरिष॒यध्यै॑
stanzas.transliteration: sugótá te supáthā párvateṣu- avāté apás tarasi svabhāno sā́ na ā́ vaha pr̥thuyāmann r̥ṣve rayíṃ divo duhitar iṣayádhyai
stanzas.translation: Thy ways are easy on the hills: thou passest Invincible! Self-luminous! through waters. So lofty Goddess with thine ample pathway, Daughter of Heaven, bring wealth to give us comfort.

translations.griffith: Thy ways are easy on the hills: thou passest Invincible! Self-luminous! through waters. So lofty Goddess with thine ample pathway, Daughter of Heaven, bring wealth to give us comfort.

stanzas.sanskrit: सा व॑ह॒ योक्षभि॒रवा॒तोषो॒ वरं॒ वह॑सि॒ जोष॒मनु॑ त्वं दि॑वो दुहित॒र्या ह॑ दे॒वी पू॒र्वहू॑तौ मं॒हना॑ दर्श॒ता भूः॑
stanzas.transliteration: sā́ vaha yókṣábhir ávātā- -úṣo váraṃ váhasi jóṣam ánu tváṃ divo duhitar yā́ ha devī́ pūrváhūtau maṃhánā darśatā́ bhūḥ
stanzas.translation: Dawn, bring me wealth: untroubled, with thine oxen thou bearest riches at thy will and pleasure; Thou who, a Goddess, Child of Heaven, hast shown thee lovely through bounty when we called thee early.

translations.griffith: Dawn, bring me wealth: untroubled, with thine oxen thou bearest riches at thy will and pleasure; Thou who, a Goddess, Child of Heaven, hast shown thee lovely through bounty when we called thee early.

stanzas.sanskrit: उत्ते॒ वय॑श्चिद्वस॒तेर॑पप्त॒न्नर॑श्च॒ ये पि॑तु॒भाजो॒ व्यु॑ष्टौ अ॒मा स॒ते व॑हसि॒ भूरि॑ वा॒ममुषो॑ देवि दा॒शुषे॒ मर्त्या॑य
stanzas.transliteration: út te váyaś cid vasatér apaptan náraś ca yé pitubhā́jo vyùṣṭau amā́ saté vahasi bhū́ri vāmám úṣo devi dāśúṣe mártyāya
stanzas.translation: As the birds fly forth from their restingplaces, so men with store of food rise at thy dawning. Yea, to the liberal mortal who rernaineth at home, O Goddess Dawn, much good thou bringest.

translations.griffith: As the birds fly forth from their restingplaces, so men with store of food rise at thy dawning. Yea, to the liberal mortal who rernaineth at home, O Goddess Dawn, much good thou bringest.

stanzas.sanskrit: ए॒षा स्या नो॑ दुहि॒ता दि॑वो॒जाः क्षि॒तीरु॒च्छन्ती॒ मानु॑षीरजीगः या भा॒नुना॒ रुश॑ता रा॒म्यास्वज्ञा॑यि ति॒रस्तम॑सश्चिद॒क्तून्
stanzas.transliteration: eṣā́ syā́ no duhitā́ divojā́ḥ kṣitī́r uchántī mā́nuṣīr ajīgaḥ yā́ bhānúnā rúśatā rāmyā́su- ájñāyi tirás támasaś cid aktū́n
stanzas.translation: SHEDDING her light on human habitations this Child of Heaven hath called us from our slumber; She who at night-time with her argent lustre hath shown herself e'en through the shades of darkness.

translations.griffith: SHEDDING her light on human habitations this Child of Heaven hath called us from our slumber; She who at night-time with her argent lustre hath shown herself e'en through the shades of darkness.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि तद्य॑युररुण॒युग्भि॒रश्वै॑श्चि॒त्रं भा॑न्त्यु॒षस॑श्च॒न्द्रर॑थाः अग्रं॑ य॒ज्ञस्य॑ बृह॒तो नय॑न्ती॒र्वि ता बा॑धन्ते॒ तम॒ ऊर्म्या॑याः
stanzas.transliteration: ví tád yayur aruṇayúgbhir áśvaiś citrám bhānty uṣásaś candrárathāḥ ágraṃ yajñásya br̥ható náyantīr ví tā́ bādhante táma ū́rmyāyāḥ
stanzas.translation: All this with red-rayed steeds have they divided: the Dawns on bright cars shine in wondrous fashion. They, bringing near the stately rite's commencement, drive far away the night's surrounding shadows.

translations.griffith: All this with red-rayed steeds have they divided: the Dawns on bright cars shine in wondrous fashion. They, bringing near the stately rite's commencement, drive far away the night's surrounding shadows.

stanzas.sanskrit: श्रवो॒ वाज॒मिष॒मूर्जं॒ वह॑न्ती॒र्नि दा॒शुष॑ उषसो॒ मर्त्या॑य म॒घोनी॑र्वी॒रव॒त्पत्य॑माना॒ अवो॑ धात विध॒ते रत्न॑म॒द्य
stanzas.transliteration: śrávo vā́jam íṣam ū́rjaṃ váhantīr ní dāśúṣa uṣaso mártyāya maghónīr vīrávat pátyamānāḥ- ávo dhāta vidhaté rátnam adyá
stanzas.translation: Dawns, bringing hither, to the man who worships, glory and power and might and food and vigour, Opulent, with imperial sway like heroes, favour your servant and this day enrich him.

translations.griffith: Dawns, bringing hither, to the man who worships, glory and power and might and food and vigour, Opulent, with imperial sway like heroes, favour your servant and this day enrich him.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒दा हि वो॑ विध॒ते रत्न॒मस्ती॒दा वी॒राय॑ दा॒शुष॑ उषासः इ॒दा विप्रा॑य॒ जर॑ते॒ यदु॒क्था नि ष्म॒ माव॑ते वहथा पु॒रा चि॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: idā́ hí vo vidhaté rátnam ásti- -idā́ vīrā́ya dāśúṣa uṣāsaḥ idā́ víprāya járate yád ukthā́ ní ṣma mā́vate vahathā purā́ cit
stanzas.translation: Now is there treasure for the man who serves you, now for the hero, Dawns! who brings oblation; Now for the singer when he sings the praise-song. Even to one like me ye brought aforetime.

translations.griffith: Now is there treasure for the man who serves you, now for the hero, Dawns! who brings oblation; Now for the singer when he sings the praise-song. Even to one like me ye brought aforetime.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒दा हि त॑ उषो अद्रिसानो गो॒त्रा गवा॒मङ्गि॑रसो गृ॒णन्ति॑ व्य१॒॑र्केण॑ बिभिदु॒र्ब्रह्म॑णा च स॒त्या नृ॒णाम॑भवद्दे॒वहू॑तिः
stanzas.transliteration: idā́ hí ta uṣo adrisāno gotrā́ gávām áṅgiraso gr̥ṇánti vy àrkéṇa bibhidur bráhmaṇā ca satyā́ nr̥ṇā́m abhavad deváhūtiḥ
stanzas.translation: O Dawn who standest on the mountain ridges, Angirases now praise thy stalls of cattle. With prayer and holy hymn they burst them open: the heroes' calling on the Gods was fruitful.

translations.griffith: O Dawn who standest on the mountain ridges, Angirases now praise thy stalls of cattle. With prayer and holy hymn they burst them open: the heroes' calling on the Gods was fruitful.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒च्छा दि॑वो दुहितः प्रत्न॒वन्नो॑ भरद्वाज॒वद्वि॑ध॒ते म॑घोनि सु॒वीरं॑ र॒यिं गृ॑ण॒ते रि॑रीह्युरुगा॒यमधि॑ धेहि॒ श्रवो॑ नः
stanzas.transliteration: uchā́ divo duhitaḥ pratnaván no bharadvājavád vidhaté maghoni suvī́raṃ rayíṃ gr̥ṇaté rirīhi- urugāyám ádhi dhehi śrávo naḥ
stanzas.translation: Shine on us as of old, thou Child of Heaven,on him, rich Maid! who serves like Bharadvâja. Give to the singer wealth with noble heroes, and upon us bestow wide-spreading glory.

translations.griffith: Shine on us as of old, thou Child of Heaven,on him, rich Maid! who serves like Bharadvâja. Give to the singer wealth with noble heroes, and upon us bestow wide-spreading glory.

stanzas.sanskrit: वपु॒र्नु तच्चि॑कि॒तुषे॑ चिदस्तु समा॒नं नाम॑ धे॒नु पत्य॑मानम् मर्ते॑ष्व॒न्यद्दो॒हसे॑ पी॒पाय॑ स॒कृच्छु॒क्रं दु॑दुहे॒ पृश्नि॒रूधः॑
stanzas.transliteration: vápur nú tác cikitúṣe cid astu samānáṃ nā́ma dhenú pátyamānam márteṣv anyád doháse pīpā́ya sakŕ̥c chukráṃ duduhe pŕ̥śnir ū́dhaḥ
stanzas.translation: E'EN to the wise let that be still a wonder to which the general name of Cow is given. The one hath swelled among mankind for milking: Pr̥iṣni hath drained but once her fair bright udder.

translations.griffith: E'EN to the wise let that be still a wonder to which the general name of Cow is given. The one hath swelled among mankind for milking: Pr̥iṣni hath drained but once her fair bright udder.
translations.müller: This may well be a marvel, even to an intelligent man, that anything should have taken the same name dhenu, cow:—the one is always brimming to give milk among men, but Prisni (the cloud, the mother of the Maruts) poured out her bright udder once (only).

stanzas.sanskrit: ये अ॒ग्नयो॒ न शोशु॑चन्निधा॒ना द्विर्यत्त्रिर्म॒रुतो॑ वावृ॒धन्त॑ अ॒रे॒णवो॑ हिर॒ण्यया॑स एषां सा॒कं नृ॒म्णैः पौंस्ये॑भिश्च भूवन्
stanzas.transliteration: yé agnáyo ná śóśucann idhānā́ḥ- dvír yát trír marúto vāvr̥dhánta areṇávo hiraṇyáyāsa eṣāṃ sākáṃ nr̥mṇaíḥ paúṃsyebhiś ca bhūvan
stanzas.translation: They who like kindled flames of fire are glowing,. the Maruts, twice and thrice have waxen mighty. Golden and dustless were their cars, invested with their great strength and their heroic vigour.

translations.griffith: They who like kindled flames of fire are glowing,. the Maruts, twice and thrice have waxen mighty. Golden and dustless were their cars, invested with their great strength and their heroic vigour.
translations.müller: The Maruts who shone like kindled fires, as they grew stronger twice and thrice,—their golden, dustless (chariots 1) became full of manly courage and strength.

stanzas.sanskrit: रु॒द्रस्य॒ ये मी॒ळ्हुषः॒ सन्ति॑ पु॒त्रा याँश्चो॒ नु दाधृ॑वि॒र्भर॑ध्यै वि॒दे हि मा॒ता म॒हो म॒ही षा सेत्पृश्निः॑ सु॒भ्वे॒३॒॑ गर्भ॒माधा॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: rudrásya yé mīḷhúṣaḥ sánti putrā́ḥ- yā́ṃś co nú dā́dhr̥vir bháradhyai vidé hí mātā́ mahó mahī́ ṣā́ sét pŕ̥śniḥ subhvè gárbham ā́dhāt
stanzas.translation: They who are Sons of the rain-pouring Rudra, whom the long-lasting One had power to foster: The Mighty Ones whose germ great Mother Pr̥iṣni is known to have received for man's advantage.

translations.griffith: They who are Sons of the rain-pouring Rudra, whom the long-lasting One had power to foster: The Mighty Ones whose germ great Mother Pr̥iṣni is known to have received for man's advantage.
translations.müller: They who 1 are the sons of the bounteous Rudra, and whom she indeed was strong enough to bear; for she, the great, is known as the mother of the great, that very Prisni conceived the germ for the strong one (Rudra).

stanzas.sanskrit: न य ईष॑न्ते ज॒नुषोऽया॒ न्व१॒॑न्तः सन्तो॑ऽव॒द्यानि॑ पुना॒नाः निर्यद्दु॒ह्रे शुच॒योऽनु॒ जोष॒मनु॑ श्रि॒या त॒न्व॑मु॒क्षमा॑णाः
stanzas.transliteration: ná yá ī́ṣante janúṣó 'yā nú- -antáḥ sánto 'vadyā́ni punānā́ḥ nír yád duhré śúcayó 'nu jóṣam ánu śriyā́ tanvàm ukṣámāṇāḥ
stanzas.translation: They shrink not from the birth; in this same manner still resting there they purge away reproaches. When they have streamed forth, brilliant, at their pleasure, with their own splendour they bedew their bodies.

translations.griffith: They shrink not from the birth; in this same manner still resting there they purge away reproaches. When they have streamed forth, brilliant, at their pleasure, with their own splendour they bedew their bodies.
translations.müller: They who do not shrink from being born in this way 1, and who within (the womb) clean themselves from all impurity 2, when they have been brought forth brilliant, according to their pleasure, they sprinkle their bodies with splendour.

stanzas.sanskrit: म॒क्षू न येषु॑ दो॒हसे॑ चिद॒या आ नाम॑ धृ॒ष्णु मारु॑तं॒ दधा॑नाः न ये स्तौ॒ना अ॒यासो॑ म॒ह्ना नू चि॑त्सु॒दानु॒रव॑ यासदु॒ग्रान्
stanzas.transliteration: makṣū́ ná yéṣu doháse cid ayā́ḥ- ā́ nā́ma dhr̥ṣṇú mā́rutaṃ dádhānāḥ ná yé staunā́ ayā́so mahnā́ nū́ cit sudā́nur áva yāsad ugrā́n
stanzas.translation: Even those who bear the brave bold name of Maruts, whom not the active quickly wins for milking. Even the liberal wards not off those fierce ones, those who are light and agile in their greatness.

translations.griffith: Even those who bear the brave bold name of Maruts, whom not the active quickly wins for milking. Even the liberal wards not off those fierce ones, those who are light and agile in their greatness.
translations.müller: Among them there is no one who does not strive to be brought forth quickly; and they assume the defiant name of Maruts. They who are not (unkind 1), never tiring in strength 2, will the generous sacrificer be able to bring down these fierce ones?

stanzas.sanskrit: त इदु॒ग्राः शव॑सा धृ॒ष्णुषे॑णा उ॒भे यु॑जन्त॒ रोद॑सी सु॒मेके॑ अध॑ स्मैषु रोद॒सी स्वशो॑चि॒राम॑वत्सु तस्थौ॒ न रोकः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tá íd ugrā́ḥ śávasā dhr̥ṣṇúṣeṇāḥ- ubhé yujanta ródasī suméke ádha smaiṣu rodasī́ sváśocir ā́mavatsu tasthau ná rókaḥ
stanzas.translation: When, strong in strength and armed with potent weapons, they had united wellformed earth and heaven, Rodasl stood among these furious Heroes like splendour shining with her native brightness.

translations.griffith: When, strong in strength and armed with potent weapons, they had united wellformed earth and heaven, Rodasl stood among these furious Heroes like splendour shining with her native brightness.
translations.müller: Fierce in strength, followed by daring armies, these Maruts have brought together heaven and earth 1, both firmly established 2; then the self-shining Rodasî stood among the impetuous Maruts, like 3 a light.

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒ने॒नो वो॑ मरुतो॒ यामो॑ अस्त्वन॒श्वश्चि॒द्यमज॒त्यर॑थीः अ॒न॒व॒सो अ॑नभी॒शू र॑ज॒स्तूर्वि रोद॑सी प॒थ्या॑ याति॒ साध॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: anenó vo maruto yā́mo astu- anaśváś cid yám ájaty árathīḥ anavasó anabhīśū́ rajastū́r ví ródasī pathyā̀ yāti sā́dhan
stanzas.translation: No team of goats shall draw your car, O Maruts, no horse no charioteer be he who drives it. Halting not, reinless, through the air it travels, speeding alone its paths through earth and heaven.

translations.griffith: No team of goats shall draw your car, O Maruts, no horse no charioteer be he who drives it. Halting not, reinless, through the air it travels, speeding alone its paths through earth and heaven.
translations.müller: Even though your carriage, O Maruts, be without your deer 1, without horse's, and not driven by any charioteer, without drag 2, and without reins, yet, crossing the air 3, it passes between heaven and earth, finishing its courses.

stanzas.sanskrit: नास्य॑ व॒र्ता न त॑रु॒ता न्व॑स्ति॒ मरु॑तो॒ यमव॑थ॒ वाज॑सातौ तो॒के वा॒ गोषु॒ तन॑ये॒ यम॒प्सु स व्र॒जं दर्ता॒ पार्ये॒ अध॒ द्योः
stanzas.transliteration: nā́sya vartā́ ná tarutā́ nv àsti máruto yám ávatha vā́jasātau toké vā góṣu tánaye yám apsú sá vrajáṃ dártā pā́rye ádha dyóḥ
stanzas.translation: None may obstruct, none overtake, O Maruts, him whom ye succour in the strife of battle For sons and progeny, for kine and waters: he bursts the cow-stall on the day of trial.

translations.griffith: None may obstruct, none overtake, O Maruts, him whom ye succour in the strife of battle For sons and progeny, for kine and waters: he bursts the cow-stall on the day of trial.
translations.müller: No one can stop, no one can overcome him whom you, O Maruts, protect in battle. He whom you protect in his kith, his cattle, his kin, and his waters, he breaks the stronghold at the close of the day 1.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र चि॒त्रम॒र्कं गृ॑ण॒ते तु॒राय॒ मारु॑ताय॒ स्वत॑वसे भरध्वम् ये सहां॑सि॒ सह॑सा॒ सह॑न्ते॒ रेज॑ते अग्ने पृथि॒वी म॒खेभ्यः॑
stanzas.transliteration: prá citrám arkáṃ gr̥ṇaté turā́ya mā́rutāya svátavase bharadhvam yé sáhāṃsi sáhasā sáhante réjate agne pr̥thivī́ makhébhyaḥ
stanzas.translation: Bring a bright hymn to praise the band of Maruts, the Singers, rapid, strong in native vigour, Who conquer mighty strength with strength more mighty: earth shakes in terror at their wars, O Agni.

translations.griffith: Bring a bright hymn to praise the band of Maruts, the Singers, rapid, strong in native vigour, Who conquer mighty strength with strength more mighty: earth shakes in terror at their wars, O Agni.
translations.müller: Offer a beautiful song to the host of the Maruts, the singers, the quick, the strong, who resist violence with violence; O Agni, the earth trembles before the champions.

stanzas.sanskrit: त्विषी॑मन्तो अध्व॒रस्ये॑व दि॒द्युत्तृ॑षु॒च्यव॑सो जु॒ह्वो॒३॒॑ नाग्नेः अ॒र्चत्र॑यो॒ धुन॑यो॒ न वी॒रा भ्राज॑ज्जन्मानो म॒रुतो॒ अधृ॑ष्टाः
stanzas.transliteration: tvíṣīmanto adhvarásyeva didyút tr̥ṣucyávaso juhvò nā́gnéḥ arcátrayo dhúnayo ná vīrā́ḥ- bhrā́jajjanmāno marúto ádhr̥ṣṭāḥ
stanzas.translation: Bright like the flashing flames of sacrifices, like tongues of fire impetuous in their onset, Chanting their psalm, singing aloud, like heroes, splendid from birth, invincible, the Maruts.

translations.griffith: Bright like the flashing flames of sacrifices, like tongues of fire impetuous in their onset, Chanting their psalm, singing aloud, like heroes, splendid from birth, invincible, the Maruts.
translations.müller: Blazing like the flame of the sacrifices, flickering like the tongues of the fire, shouters, like roaring fighters, the flame-born Maruts are unassailable.

stanzas.sanskrit: तं वृ॒धन्तं॒ मारु॑तं॒ भ्राज॑दृष्टिं रु॒द्रस्य॑ सू॒नुं ह॒वसा वि॑वासे दि॒वः शर्धा॑य॒ शुच॑यो मनी॒षा गि॒रयो॒ नाप॑ उ॒ग्रा अ॑स्पृध्रन्
stanzas.transliteration: táṃ vr̥dhántam mā́rutam bhrā́jadr̥ṣṭiṃ rudrásya sūnúṃ havásā́ vivāse diváḥ śárdhāya śúcayo manīṣā́ḥ- giráyo nā́pa ugrā́ aspr̥dhran
stanzas.translation: That swelling band I call with invocation, the brood of Rudra, armed with glittering lances. Pure hymns are meet for that celestial army: like floods and mountains have the Strong Ones battled.

translations.griffith: That swelling band I call with invocation, the brood of Rudra, armed with glittering lances. Pure hymns are meet for that celestial army: like floods and mountains have the Strong Ones battled.
translations.müller: I invite with my call this strong and Marut-like son of Rudra 1, armed with flaming spears. Bright thoughts, like wild waters from the mountain 2, strove to reach the host of heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वे॑षां वः स॒तां ज्येष्ठ॑तमा गी॒र्भिर्मि॒त्रावरु॑णा वावृ॒धध्यै॑ सं या र॒श्मेव॑ य॒मतु॒र्यमि॑ष्ठा॒ द्वा जनाँ॒ अस॑मा बा॒हुभिः॒ स्वैः
stanzas.transliteration: víśveṣāṃ vaḥ satā́ṃ jyéṣṭhatamā gīrbhír mitrā́váruṇā vāvr̥dhádhyai sáṃ yā́ raśméva yamátur yámiṣṭhā dvā́ jánām̐ ásamā bāhúbhiḥ svaíḥ
stanzas.translation: NOW Mitra-Varuṇa shall be exalted high by your songs, noblest of all existing; They who, as 'twere with reins are best Controllers, unequalled with their arms to check the people.

translations.griffith: NOW Mitra-Varuṇa shall be exalted high by your songs, noblest of all existing; They who, as 'twere with reins are best Controllers, unequalled with their arms to check the people.

stanzas.sanskrit: इ॒यं मद्वां॒ प्र स्तृ॑णीते मनी॒षोप॑ प्रि॒या नम॑सा ब॒र्हिरच्छ॑ य॒न्तं नो॑ मित्रावरुणा॒वधृ॑ष्टं छ॒र्दिर्यद्वां॑ वरू॒थ्यं॑ सुदानू
stanzas.transliteration: iyám mád vām prá str̥ṇīte manīṣā́- -úpa priyā́ námasā barhír ácha yantáṃ no mitrāvaruṇāv ádhr̥ṣṭaṃ chardír yád vāṃ varūthyàṃ sudānū
stanzas.translation: To you Two Gods is this my thought extended, turned to the sacred grass with loving homage. Give us, O Mitra-Varuṇa, a dwelling safe from attack, which ye shall guard, Boon-Givers!

translations.griffith: To you Two Gods is this my thought extended, turned to the sacred grass with loving homage. Give us, O Mitra-Varuṇa, a dwelling safe from attack, which ye shall guard, Boon-Givers!

stanzas.sanskrit: आ या॑तं मित्रावरुणा सुश॒स्त्युप॑ प्रि॒या नम॑सा हू॒यमा॑ना सं याव॑प्नः॒स्थो अ॒पसे॑व॒ जना॑ञ्छ्रुधीय॒तश्चि॑द्यतथो महि॒त्वा
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ yātam mitrāvaruṇā suśastí- úpa priyā́ námasā hūyámānā sáṃ yā́v apnasthó apáseva jánāñ -śrudhīyatáś cid yatatho mahitvā́
stanzas.translation: Come hither, Mitra-Varuṇa, invited with eulogies and loving adoration, Ye who with your might, as Work-Controllers, urge even men who quickly hear to labour.

translations.griffith: Come hither, Mitra-Varuṇa, invited with eulogies and loving adoration, Ye who with your might, as Work-Controllers, urge even men who quickly hear to labour.

stanzas.sanskrit: अश्वा॒ न या वा॒जिना॑ पू॒तब॑न्धू ऋ॒ता यद्गर्भ॒मदि॑ति॒र्भर॑ध्यै प्र या महि॑ म॒हान्ता॒ जाय॑माना घो॒रा मर्ता॑य रि॒पवे॒ नि दी॑धः
stanzas.transliteration: áśvā ná yā́ vājínā pūtábandhū r̥tā́ yád gárbham áditir bháradhyai prá yā́ máhi mahā́ntā jā́yamānā ghorā́ mártāya ripáve ní dīdhaḥ
stanzas.translation: Whom, of pure origin, like two strong horses, Aditi bore as babes in proper season, Whom, Mighty at your birth, the Mighty Goddess brought forth as terrors to the mortal foeman.

translations.griffith: Whom, of pure origin, like two strong horses, Aditi bore as babes in proper season, Whom, Mighty at your birth, the Mighty Goddess brought forth as terrors to the mortal foeman.

stanzas.sanskrit: विश्वे॒ यद्वां॑ मं॒हना॒ मन्द॑मानाः क्ष॒त्रं दे॒वासो॒ अद॑धुः स॒जोषाः॑ परि॒ यद्भू॒थो रोद॑सी चिदु॒र्वी सन्ति॒ स्पशो॒ अद॑ब्धासो॒ अमू॑राः
stanzas.transliteration: víśve yád vām maṃhánā mándamānāḥ kṣatráṃ devā́so ádadhuḥ sajóṣāḥ pári yád bhūthó ródasī cid urvī́ sánti spáśo ádabdhāso ámūrāḥ
stanzas.translation: As all the Gods in their great joy and gladness gave you with one accord your high dominion, As ye surround both worlds, though wide and spacious your spies are ever true and never bewildered.

translations.griffith: As all the Gods in their great joy and gladness gave you with one accord your high dominion, As ye surround both worlds, though wide and spacious your spies are ever true and never bewildered.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता हि क्ष॒त्रं धा॒रये॑थे॒ अनु॒ द्यून्दृं॒हेथे॒ सानु॑मुप॒मादि॑व॒ द्योः दृ॒ळ्हो नक्ष॑त्र उ॒त वि॒श्वदे॑वो॒ भूमि॒माता॒न्द्यां धा॒सिना॒योः
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ hí kṣatráṃ dhāráyethe ánu dyū́n dr̥ṃhéthe sā́num upamā́d iva dyóḥ dr̥ḷhó nákṣatra utá viśvádevo bhū́mim ā́tān dyā́ṃ dhāsínāyóḥ
stanzas.translation: So, through the days maintaining princely power. ye prop the height as 'twere from loftiest heaven. The Star of all the Gods, established, filleth the heaven and earth with food of man who liveth.

translations.griffith: So, through the days maintaining princely power. ye prop the height as 'twere from loftiest heaven. The Star of all the Gods, established, filleth the heaven and earth with food of man who liveth.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता वि॒ग्रं धै॑थे ज॒ठरं॑ पृ॒णध्या॒ आ यत्सद्म॒ सभृ॑तयः पृ॒णन्ति॑ न मृ॑ष्यन्ते युव॒तयोऽवा॑ता॒ वि यत्पयो॑ विश्वजिन्वा॒ भर॑न्ते
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ vigráṃ dhaithe jaṭháram pr̥ṇádhyai- ā́ yát sádma sábhr̥tayaḥ pr̥ṇánti ná mr̥ṣyante yuvatáyó 'vātāḥ- ví yát páyo viśvajinvā bhárante
stanzas.translation: Take the strong drink, to quaff till ye are sated, when he and his attendants fill the chamber. The young Maids brook not that none seeks to win them, when, Quickeners of all! they scatter moisture.

translations.griffith: Take the strong drink, to quaff till ye are sated, when he and his attendants fill the chamber. The young Maids brook not that none seeks to win them, when, Quickeners of all! they scatter moisture.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता जि॒ह्वया॒ सद॒मेदं सु॑मे॒धा आ यद्वां॑ स॒त्यो अ॑र॒तिर्ऋ॒ते भूत् तद्वां॑ महि॒त्वं घृ॑तान्नावस्तु यु॒वं दा॒शुषे॒ वि च॑यिष्ट॒मंहः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ jihváyā sádam édáṃ sumedhā́ḥ- ā́ yád vāṃ satyó aratír r̥té bhū́t tád vām mahitváṃ ghr̥tānnāv astu yuváṃ dāśúṣe ví cayiṣṭam áṃhaḥ
stanzas.translation: So with your tongue come ever, when your envoy, faithful and very wise, attends our worship. Nourished by holy oil! he this yGur glory: annihilate the sacrificer's trouble.

translations.griffith: So with your tongue come ever, when your envoy, faithful and very wise, attends our worship. Nourished by holy oil! he this yGur glory: annihilate the sacrificer's trouble.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र यद्वां॑ मित्रावरुणा स्पू॒र्धन्प्रि॒या धाम॑ यु॒वधि॑ता मि॒नन्ति॑ न ये दे॒वास॒ ओह॑सा॒ न मर्ता॒ अय॑ज्ञसाचो॒ अप्यो॒ न पु॒त्राः
stanzas.transliteration: prá yád vām mitrāvaruṇā spūrdhán priyā́ dhā́ma yuvádhitā minánti ná yé devā́sa óhasā ná mártāḥ- áyajñasāco ápyo ná putrā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: When, Mitra-Varuṇa, they strive against you and break tlie friendly laws ye have established, They, neither Gods nor men in estimation, like Api's sons have godless sacrifices.

translations.griffith: When, Mitra-Varuṇa, they strive against you and break tlie friendly laws ye have established, They, neither Gods nor men in estimation, like Api's sons have godless sacrifices.

stanzas.sanskrit: वि यद्वाचं॑ की॒स्तासो॒ भर॑न्ते॒ शंस॑न्ति॒ के चि॑न्नि॒विदो॑ मना॒नाः आद्वां॑ ब्रवाम स॒त्यान्यु॒क्था नकि॑र्दे॒वेभि॑र्यतथो महि॒त्वा
stanzas.transliteration: ví yád vā́caṃ kīstā́so bhárante śáṃsanti ké cin nivído manānā́ḥ ā́d vām bravāma satyā́ny ukthā́ nákir devébhir yatatho mahitvā́
stanzas.translation: When singers in their song uplift their voices, some chant the Nivid texts with steady purpose. Then may we sing you lauds that shall be fruitful: dp ye not rival all the Gods in greatness?

translations.griffith: When singers in their song uplift their voices, some chant the Nivid texts with steady purpose. Then may we sing you lauds that shall be fruitful: dp ye not rival all the Gods in greatness?

stanzas.sanskrit: अ॒वोरि॒त्था वां॑ छ॒र्दिषो॑ अ॒भिष्टौ॑ यु॒वोर्मि॑त्रावरुणा॒वस्कृ॑धोयु अनु॒ यद्गावः॑ स्फु॒रानृ॑जि॒प्यं धृ॒ष्णुं यद्रणे॒ वृष॑णं यु॒नज॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: avór itthā́ vāṃ chardíṣo abhíṣṭau yuvór mitrāvaruṇāv áskr̥dhoyu ánu yád gā́va sphurā́n r̥jipyáṃ dhr̥ṣṇúṃ yád ráṇe vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ yunájan
stanzas.translation: O Mitra-Varuṇa, may your large bounty come to us hither, near to this our dwelling, When the kine haste to us, and when they harness the fleet-foot mettled stallion for the battle.

translations.griffith: O Mitra-Varuṇa, may your large bounty come to us hither, near to this our dwelling, When the kine haste to us, and when they harness the fleet-foot mettled stallion for the battle.

stanzas.sanskrit: श्रु॒ष्टी वां॑ य॒ज्ञ उद्य॑तः स॒जोषा॑ मनु॒ष्वद्वृ॒क्तब॑र्हिषो॒ यज॑ध्यै आ य इन्द्रा॒वरु॑णावि॒षे अ॒द्य म॒हे सु॒म्नाय॑ म॒ह आ॑व॒वर्त॑त्
stanzas.transliteration: śruṣṭī́ vāṃ yajñá údyataḥ sajóṣāḥ- manuṣvád vr̥ktábarhiṣo yájadhyai ā́ yá índrāváruṇāv iṣé adyá mahé sumnā́ya mahá āvavártat
stanzas.translation: HIS honouring rite whose grass is trimmed is offered swiftly to you, in Manu's wise, accordant, The rite which Indra-Varuṇa shall carry this day to high success and glorious issue.

translations.griffith: HIS honouring rite whose grass is trimmed is offered swiftly to you, in Manu's wise, accordant, The rite which Indra-Varuṇa shall carry this day to high success and glorious issue.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता हि श्रेष्ठा॑ दे॒वता॑ता तु॒जा शूरा॑णां॒ शवि॑ष्ठा॒ ता हि भू॒तम् म॒घोनां॒ मंहि॑ष्ठा तुवि॒शुष्म॑ ऋ॒तेन॑ वृत्र॒तुरा॒ सर्व॑सेना
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ hí śréṣṭhā devátātā tujā́ śū́rāṇāṃ śáviṣṭhā tā́ hí bhūtám maghónām máṃhiṣṭhā tuviśúṣmā- r̥téna vr̥tratúrā sárvasenā
stanzas.translation: For at Gods' worship they are best through vigour; they have become the strongest of the Heroes; With mighty strength, most liberal of the Princes, Chiefs of the host, by Law made Vr̥itra's slayers.

translations.griffith: For at Gods' worship they are best through vigour; they have become the strongest of the Heroes; With mighty strength, most liberal of the Princes, Chiefs of the host, by Law made Vr̥itra's slayers.

stanzas.sanskrit: ता गृ॑णीहि नम॒स्ये॑भिः शू॒षैः सु॒म्नेभि॒रिन्द्रा॒वरु॑णा चका॒ना वज्रे॑णा॒न्यः शव॑सा॒ हन्ति॑ वृ॒त्रं सिष॑क्त्य॒न्यो वृ॒जने॑षु॒ विप्रः॑
stanzas.transliteration: tā́ gr̥ṇīhi namasyèbhiḥ śūṣaíḥ sumnébhir índrāváruṇā cakānā́ vájreṇānyáḥ śávasā hánti vr̥tráṃ síṣakty anyó vr̥jáneṣu vípraḥ
stanzas.translation: Praise those Twain Gods for powers that merit worship, Indra and Varuṇa, for bliss, the joyous. One with his might and thunderbolt slays Vr̥itra; the other as a Sage stands near in troubles.

translations.griffith: Praise those Twain Gods for powers that merit worship, Indra and Varuṇa, for bliss, the joyous. One with his might and thunderbolt slays Vr̥itra; the other as a Sage stands near in troubles.

stanzas.sanskrit: ग्नाश्च॒ यन्नर॑श्च वावृ॒धन्त॒ विश्वे॑ दे॒वासो॑ न॒रां स्वगू॑र्ताः प्रैभ्य॑ इन्द्रावरुणा महि॒त्वा द्यौश्च॑ पृथिवि भूतमु॒र्वी
stanzas.transliteration: gnā́ś ca yán náraś ca vāvr̥dhánta víśve devā́so narā́ṃ svágūrtāḥ praíbhya indrāvaruṇā mahitvā́ dyaúś ca pr̥thivi bhūtam urvī́
stanzas.translation: Though dames and men have waxen strong and mighty, and all the Gods selfpraised among the Heroes, Ye, Indra-Varuṇa, have in might surpassed them, and thus were ye spread wide, O Earth and Heaven.

translations.griffith: Though dames and men have waxen strong and mighty, and all the Gods selfpraised among the Heroes, Ye, Indra-Varuṇa, have in might surpassed them, and thus were ye spread wide, O Earth and Heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: स इत्सु॒दानुः॒ स्ववाँ॑ ऋ॒तावेन्द्रा॒ यो वां॑ वरुण॒ दाश॑ति॒ त्मन् इ॒षा स द्वि॒षस्त॑रे॒द्दास्वा॒न्वंस॑द्र॒यिं र॑यि॒वत॑श्च॒ जना॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: sá ít sudā́nuḥ svávām̐ r̥tā́vā- -índrā yó vāṃ varuṇa dā́śati tmán iṣā́ sá dviṣás tared dā́svān váṃsad rayíṃ rayivátaś ca jánān
stanzas.translation: Righteous is he, and liberal and helpful who, Indra-Varuṇa, brings you gifts with gladness. That bounteous man through food shall conquer faemen, and win him opulence and wealthy people.

translations.griffith: Righteous is he, and liberal and helpful who, Indra-Varuṇa, brings you gifts with gladness. That bounteous man through food shall conquer faemen, and win him opulence and wealthy people.

stanzas.sanskrit: यं यु॒वं दा॒श्व॑ध्वराय देवा र॒यिं ध॒त्थो वसु॑मन्तं पुरु॒क्षुम् अ॒स्मे स इ॑न्द्रावरुणा॒वपि॑ ष्या॒त्प्र यो भ॒नक्ति॑ व॒नुषा॒मश॑स्तीः
stanzas.transliteration: yáṃ yuváṃ dāśvàdhvarāya devā rayíṃ dhatthó vásumantam purukṣúm asmé sá indrāvaruṇāv ápi ṣyāt prá yó bhanákti vanúṣām áśastīḥ
stanzas.translation: May wealth which ye bestow in food and treasure on him who brings you gifts and sacrifices, Wealth, Gods! which breaks the curse of those who vex us, be, Indra-Varuṇa, e'en our own possession.

translations.griffith: May wealth which ye bestow in food and treasure on him who brings you gifts and sacrifices, Wealth, Gods! which breaks the curse of those who vex us, be, Indra-Varuṇa, e'en our own possession.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒त नः॑ सुत्रा॒त्रो दे॒वगो॑पाः सू॒रिभ्य॑ इन्द्रावरुणा र॒यिः ष्या॑त् येषां॒ शुष्मः॒ पृत॑नासु सा॒ह्वान्प्र स॒द्यो द्यु॒म्ना ति॒रते॒ ततु॑रिः
stanzas.transliteration: utá naḥ sutrātró devágopāḥ sūríbhya indrāvaruṇā rayíḥ ṣyāt yéṣāṃ śúṣmaḥ pŕ̥tanāsu sāhvā́n prá sadyó dyumnā́ tiráte táturiḥ
stanzas.translation: So also, Indra-Varuṇa, may our princes have riches swift to save, with Gods to guard them- They whose great might gives victory in battles, and their triumphant glory spreads with swiftness.

translations.griffith: So also, Indra-Varuṇa, may our princes have riches swift to save, with Gods to guard them- They whose great might gives victory in battles, and their triumphant glory spreads with swiftness.

stanzas.sanskrit: नू न॑ इन्द्रावरुणा गृणा॒ना पृ॒ङ्क्तं र॒यिं सौ॑श्रव॒साय॑ देवा इ॒त्था गृ॒णन्तो॑ म॒हिन॑स्य॒ शर्धो॒ऽपो न ना॒वा दु॑रि॒ता त॑रेम
stanzas.transliteration: nū́ na indrāvaruṇā gr̥ṇānā́ pr̥ṅktáṃ rayíṃ sauśravasā́ya devā itthā́ gr̥ṇánto mahínasya śárdho -apó ná nāvā́ duritā́ tarema
stanzas.translation: Indra. and Varuṇa, Gods whom we are lauding, mingle ye wealth with our heroic glory. May we, who praise the strength of what is mighty, pass dangers, as with boats we cross the waters.

translations.griffith: Indra. and Varuṇa, Gods whom we are lauding, mingle ye wealth with our heroic glory. May we, who praise the strength of what is mighty, pass dangers, as with boats we cross the waters.

stanzas.sanskrit: प्र स॒म्राजे॑ बृह॒ते मन्म॒ नु प्रि॒यमर्च॑ दे॒वाय॒ वरु॑णाय स॒प्रथः॑ अ॒यं य उ॒र्वी म॑हि॒ना महि॑व्रतः॒ क्रत्वा॑ वि॒भात्य॒जरो॒ न शो॒चिषा॑
stanzas.transliteration: prá samrā́je br̥haté mánma nú priyám árca devā́ya váruṇāya sapráthaḥ ayáṃ yá urvī́ mahinā́ máhivrataḥ krátvā vibhā́ty ajáro ná śocíṣā
stanzas.translation: Now will I sing a dear and far-extending hymn to Varuṇa the God, sublime, imperial Lord, Who, mighty Governor, Eternal, as with flame, illumines both wide worlds with majesty and power.

translations.griffith: Now will I sing a dear and far-extending hymn to Varuṇa the God, sublime, imperial Lord, Who, mighty Governor, Eternal, as with flame, illumines both wide worlds with majesty and power.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑वरुणा सुतपावि॒मं सु॒तं सोमं॑ पिबतं॒ मद्यं॑ धृतव्रता यु॒वो रथो॑ अध्व॒रं दे॒ववी॑तये॒ प्रति॒ स्वस॑र॒मुप॑ याति पी॒तये॑
stanzas.transliteration: índrāvaruṇā sutapāv imáṃ sutáṃ sómam pibatam mádyaṃ dhr̥tavratā yuvó rátho adhvaráṃ devávītaye práti svásaram úpa yāti pītáye
stanzas.translation: True to Law, Indra-Varuṇa, drinkers of the juice, drink this pressed Soma which shall give you rapturous joy. Your chariot cometh to the banquet of the Gods, to sacrifice, as it were home, that ye may drink.

translations.griffith: True to Law, Indra-Varuṇa, drinkers of the juice, drink this pressed Soma which shall give you rapturous joy. Your chariot cometh to the banquet of the Gods, to sacrifice, as it were home, that ye may drink.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑वरुणा॒ मधु॑मत्तमस्य॒ वृष्णः॒ सोम॑स्य वृष॒णा वृ॑षेथाम् इ॒दं वा॒मन्धः॒ परि॑षिक्तम॒स्मे आ॒सद्या॒स्मिन्ब॒र्हिषि॑ मादयेथाम्
stanzas.transliteration: índrāvaruṇā mádhumattamasya vŕ̥ṣṇaḥ sómasya vr̥ṣaṇā́ vr̥ṣethām idáṃ vām ándhaḥ páriṣiktam asmé āsádyāsmín barhíṣi mādayethām
stanzas.translation: Indra and Varuṇa, drink your fill, ye Heroes, of this invigorating sweetest Soma. This juice is shed by us that ye may quaff it: on this trimmed grass be seated, and rejoice you

translations.griffith: Indra and Varuṇa, drink your fill, ye Heroes, of this invigorating sweetest Soma. This juice is shed by us that ye may quaff it: on this trimmed grass be seated, and rejoice you

stanzas.sanskrit: सं वां॒ कर्म॑णा॒ समि॒षा हि॑नो॒मीन्द्रा॑विष्णू॒ अप॑सस्पा॒रे अ॒स्य जु॒षेथां॑ य॒ज्ञं द्रवि॑णं च धत्त॒मरि॑ष्टैर्नः प॒थिभिः॑ पा॒रय॑न्ता
stanzas.transliteration: sáṃ vāṃ kármaṇā sám iṣā́ hinomi- -índrāviṣṇū ápasas pāré asyá juṣéthāṃ yajñáṃ dráviṇaṃ ca dhattam áriṣṭair naḥ pathíbhiḥ pāráyantā
stanzas.translation: INDRA and Vishṇu, at my task's completion I urge you on with food and sacred service. Accept the sacrifice and grant us riches, leading us on by unobstructed pathways.

translations.griffith: INDRA and Vishṇu, at my task's completion I urge you on with food and sacred service. Accept the sacrifice and grant us riches, leading us on by unobstructed pathways.

stanzas.sanskrit: या विश्वा॑सां जनि॒तारा॑ मती॒नामिन्द्रा॒विष्णू॑ क॒लशा॑ सोम॒धाना॑ प्र वां॒ गिरः॑ श॒स्यमा॑ना अवन्तु॒ प्र स्तोमा॑सो गी॒यमा॑नासो अ॒र्कैः
stanzas.transliteration: yā́ víśvāsāṃ janitā́rā matīnā́m índrāvíṣṇū kaláśā somadhā́nā prá vāṃ gíraḥ śasyámānā avantu prá stómāso gīyámānāso arkaíḥ
stanzas.translation: Ye who inspire all hymns, Indra and Vishṇu, ye vessels who contain the Soma juices, May hymns of praise that now are sung address you, the lauds that are recited by the singers.

translations.griffith: Ye who inspire all hymns, Indra and Vishṇu, ye vessels who contain the Soma juices, May hymns of praise that now are sung address you, the lauds that are recited by the singers.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑विष्णू मदपती मदाना॒मा सोमं॑ यातं॒ द्रवि॑णो॒ दधा॑ना सं वा॑मञ्जन्त्व॒क्तुभि॑र्मती॒नां सं स्तोमा॑सः श॒स्यमा॑नास उ॒क्थैः
stanzas.transliteration: índrāviṣṇū madapatī madānām ā́ sómaṃ yātaṃ dráviṇo dádhānā sáṃ vām añjantv aktúbhir matīnā́ṃ sáṃ stómāsaḥ śasyámānāsa ukthaíḥ
stanzas.translation: Lords of joy-giving draughts, Indra and Vishṇu, come, giving gifts of treasure, to the Soma. With brilliant rays of hymns let chanted praises, repeated with the lauds, adorn and deck you.

translations.griffith: Lords of joy-giving draughts, Indra and Vishṇu, come, giving gifts of treasure, to the Soma. With brilliant rays of hymns let chanted praises, repeated with the lauds, adorn and deck you.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ वा॒मश्वा॑सो अभिमाति॒षाह॒ इन्द्रा॑विष्णू सध॒मादो॑ वहन्तु जु॒षेथां॒ विश्वा॒ हव॑ना मती॒नामुप॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि शृणुतं॒ गिरो॑ मे
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ vām áśvāso abhimātiṣā́haḥ- índrāviṣṇū sadhamā́do vahantu juṣéthāṃ víśvā hávanā matīnā́m úpa bráhmāṇi śr̥ṇutaṃ gíro me
stanzas.translation: May your foe-conquering horses bring you hither, Indra and Vishṇu, sharers of the banquet. Of all our hymns accept the invocations list to my prayers and hear the songs I sing you.

translations.griffith: May your foe-conquering horses bring you hither, Indra and Vishṇu, sharers of the banquet. Of all our hymns accept the invocations list to my prayers and hear the songs I sing you.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑विष्णू॒ तत्प॑न॒याय्यं॑ वां॒ सोम॑स्य॒ मद॑ उ॒रु च॑क्रमाथे अकृ॑णुतम॒न्तरि॑क्षं॒ वरी॒योऽप्र॑थतं जी॒वसे॑ नो॒ रजां॑सि
stanzas.transliteration: índrāviṣṇū tát panayā́yyaṃ vāṃ sómasya máda urú cakramāthe ákr̥ṇutam antárikṣaṃ várīyaḥ- -áprathataṃ jīváse no rájāṃsi
stanzas.translation: This your deed, Indra-Vishṇu, must be lauded: widely ye strode in the wild joy of Soma. Ye made the firmament of larger compass, and made the regions broad for our existence.

translations.griffith: This your deed, Indra-Vishṇu, must be lauded: widely ye strode in the wild joy of Soma. Ye made the firmament of larger compass, and made the regions broad for our existence.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑विष्णू ह॒विषा॑ वावृधा॒नाग्रा॑द्वाना॒ नम॑सा रातहव्या घृता॑सुती॒ द्रवि॑णं धत्तम॒स्मे स॑मु॒द्रः स्थः॑ क॒लशः॑ सोम॒धानः॑
stanzas.transliteration: índrāviṣṇū havíṣā vāvr̥dhānā́- -ágrādvānā námasā rātahavyā ghŕ̥tāsutī dráviṇaṃ dhattam asmé samudrá sthaḥ kaláśaḥ somadhā́naḥ
stanzas.translation: Strengthened with sacred offerings, IndraVishṇu, first eaters, served with worship ana oblation, Fed with the holy oil, vouchsafe us riches ye are the lake, the vat that holds the Soma.

translations.griffith: Strengthened with sacred offerings, IndraVishṇu, first eaters, served with worship ana oblation, Fed with the holy oil, vouchsafe us riches ye are the lake, the vat that holds the Soma.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑विष्णू॒ पिब॑तं॒ मध्वो॑ अ॒स्य सोम॑स्य दस्रा ज॒ठरं॑ पृणेथाम् आ वा॒मन्धां॑सि मदि॒राण्य॑ग्म॒न्नुप॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि शृणुतं॒ हवं॑ मे
stanzas.transliteration: índrāviṣṇū píbatam mádhvo asyá sómasya dasrā jaṭháram pr̥ṇethām ā́ vām ándhāṃsi madirā́ṇy agmann úpa bráhmāṇi śr̥ṇutaṃ hávam me
stanzas.translation: Drink of this meath, O Indra, thou, and Vishṇu; drink ye your fill of Soma, Wonder-Workers. The sweet exhilarating juice hath reached you. Hear ye my prayers, give ear unto my calling.

translations.griffith: Drink of this meath, O Indra, thou, and Vishṇu; drink ye your fill of Soma, Wonder-Workers. The sweet exhilarating juice hath reached you. Hear ye my prayers, give ear unto my calling.

stanzas.sanskrit: उ॒भा जि॑ग्यथु॒र्न परा॑ जयेथे॒ न परा॑ जिग्ये कत॒रश्च॒नैनोः॑ इन्द्र॑श्च विष्णो॒ यदप॑स्पृधेथां त्रे॒धा स॒हस्रं॒ वि तदै॑रयेथाम्
stanzas.transliteration: ubhā́ jigyathur ná párā jayethe ná párā jigye kataráś canaínoḥ índraś ca viṣṇo yád ápaspr̥dhethāṃ tredhā́ sahásraṃ ví tád airayethām
stanzas.translation: Ye Twain have conquered, ne'er have yc been conquered: never hath either of the Twain been vanquished. Ye, Indra-Vishṇu, when ye fought the battle, produced this infinite with three divisions.

translations.griffith: Ye Twain have conquered, ne'er have yc been conquered: never hath either of the Twain been vanquished. Ye, Indra-Vishṇu, when ye fought the battle, produced this infinite with three divisions.

stanzas.sanskrit: घृ॒तव॑ती॒ भुव॑नानामभि॒श्रियो॒र्वी पृ॒थ्वी म॑धु॒दुघे॑ सु॒पेश॑सा द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी वरु॑णस्य॒ धर्म॑णा॒ विष्क॑भिते अ॒जरे॒ भूरि॑रेतसा
stanzas.transliteration: ghr̥távatī bhúvanānām abhiśríyā- -urvī́ pr̥thvī́ madhudúghe supéśasā dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ váruṇasya dhármaṇā víṣkabhite ajáre bhū́riretasā
stanzas.translation: FILLED full of fatness, compassing all things that be, wide, spacious, dropping meath, beautiful in their form, The Heaven and the Earth by Varuṇa's decree, unwasting, rich in germs, stand parted each from each.

translations.griffith: FILLED full of fatness, compassing all things that be, wide, spacious, dropping meath, beautiful in their form, The Heaven and the Earth by Varuṇa's decree, unwasting, rich in germs, stand parted each from each.

stanzas.sanskrit: अस॑श्चन्ती॒ भूरि॑धारे॒ पय॑स्वती घृ॒तं दु॑हाते सु॒कृते॒ शुचि॑व्रते राज॑न्ती अ॒स्य भुव॑नस्य रोदसी अ॒स्मे रेतः॑ सिञ्चतं॒ यन्मनु॑र्हितम्
stanzas.transliteration: ásaścantī bhū́ridhāre páyasvatī ghr̥táṃ duhāte sukŕ̥te śúcivrate rā́jantī asyá bhúvanasya rodasī asmé rétaḥ siñcataṃ yán mánurhitam
stanzas.translation: The Everlasting Pair, with full streams, rich in milk, in their pure rule pour fatness for the pious man. Ye who are Regents of this world, O Earth and Heaven, pour into us the genial flow that prospers meit.

translations.griffith: The Everlasting Pair, with full streams, rich in milk, in their pure rule pour fatness for the pious man. Ye who are Regents of this world, O Earth and Heaven, pour into us the genial flow that prospers meit.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो वा॑मृ॒जवे॒ क्रम॑णाय रोदसी॒ मर्तो॑ द॒दाश॑ धिषणे॒ स सा॑धति प्र प्र॒जाभि॑र्जायते॒ धर्म॑ण॒स्परि॑ यु॒वोः सि॒क्ता विषु॑रूपाणि॒ सव्र॑ता
stanzas.transliteration: yó vām r̥jáve krámaṇāya rodasī márto dadā́śa dhiṣaṇe sá sādhati prá prajā́bhir jāyate dhármaṇas pári yuvóḥ siktā́ víṣurūpāṇi sávratā
stanzas.translation: Whoso, for righteous life, pours offerings to you, O Heaven and Earth, ye Hemispheres, that man succeeds. He in his seed is born again and spreads by Law: from you flow things diverse in form, but ruled alike.

translations.griffith: Whoso, for righteous life, pours offerings to you, O Heaven and Earth, ye Hemispheres, that man succeeds. He in his seed is born again and spreads by Law: from you flow things diverse in form, but ruled alike.

stanzas.sanskrit: घृ॒तेन॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी अ॒भीवृ॑ते घृत॒श्रिया॑ घृत॒पृचा॑ घृता॒वृधा॑ उ॒र्वी पृ॒थ्वी हो॑तृ॒वूर्ये॑ पु॒रोहि॑ते॒ ते इद्विप्रा॑ ईळते सु॒म्नमि॒ष्टये॑
stanzas.transliteration: ghr̥téna dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ abhī́vr̥te ghr̥taśríyā ghr̥tapŕ̥cā ghr̥tāvŕ̥dhā urvī́ pr̥thvī́ hotr̥vū́rye puróhite té íd víprā īḷate sumnám iṣṭáye
stanzas.translation: Enclosed in fatness, Heaven and Earth are bright therewith: they mingle with the fatness which they still increase. Wide, broad, set foremost at election of the priest, to them the singers pray for bliss to further them.

translations.griffith: Enclosed in fatness, Heaven and Earth are bright therewith: they mingle with the fatness which they still increase. Wide, broad, set foremost at election of the priest, to them the singers pray for bliss to further them.

stanzas.sanskrit: मधु॑ नो॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी मि॑मिक्षतां मधु॒श्चुता॑ मधु॒दुघे॒ मधु॑व्रते दधा॑ने य॒ज्ञं द्रवि॑णं च दे॒वता॒ महि॒ श्रवो॒ वाज॑म॒स्मे सु॒वीर्य॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: mádhu no dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ mimikṣatām madhuścútā madhudúghe mádhuvrate dádhāne yajñáṃ dráviṇaṃ ca devátā máhi śrávo vā́jam asmé suvī́ryam
stanzas.translation: May Heaven and Earth pour down the balmy rain for us, balm-dropping, yielding balm, with balm upon your path, Bestowing by your Godhead sacrifice and wealth, great fame and strength for us and good heroic might.

translations.griffith: May Heaven and Earth pour down the balmy rain for us, balm-dropping, yielding balm, with balm upon your path, Bestowing by your Godhead sacrifice and wealth, great fame and strength for us and good heroic might.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऊर्जं॑ नो॒ द्यौश्च॑ पृथि॒वी च॑ पिन्वतां पि॒ता मा॒ता वि॑श्व॒विदा॑ सु॒दंस॑सा सं॒र॒रा॒णे रोद॑सी वि॒श्वश॑म्भुवा स॒निं वाजं॑ र॒यिम॒स्मे समि॑न्वताम्
stanzas.transliteration: ū́rjaṃ no dyaúś ca pr̥thivī́ ca pinvatām pitā́ mātā́ viśvavídā sudáṃsasā saṃrarāṇé ródasī viśváśambhuvā saníṃ vā́jaṃ rayím asmé sám invatām
stanzas.translation: May Heaven and Earth make food swell plenteously for us, all-knowing Father, jother, wondrous in their works. Pouring out bounties, may, in union, both the Worlds, all beneficial, send us gain, and power, and wealth.

translations.griffith: May Heaven and Earth make food swell plenteously for us, all-knowing Father, jother, wondrous in their works. Pouring out bounties, may, in union, both the Worlds, all beneficial, send us gain, and power, and wealth.

stanzas.sanskrit: उदु॒ ष्य दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता हि॑र॒ण्यया॑ बा॒हू अ॑यंस्त॒ सव॑नाय सु॒क्रतुः॑ घृ॒तेन॑ पा॒णी अ॒भि प्रु॑ष्णुते म॒खो युवा॑ सु॒दक्षो॒ रज॑सो॒ विध॑र्मणि
stanzas.transliteration: úd u ṣyá deváḥ savitā́ hiraṇyáyā bāhū́ ayaṃsta sávanāya sukrátuḥ ghr̥téna pāṇī́ abhí pruṣṇute makhó yúvā sudákṣo rájaso vídharmaṇi
stanzas.translation: FULL of effectual wisdom Savitar the God hath stretched out golden arms that he may bring forth life. Young and most skilful, while he holds the region up, the Warrior sprinkles fatness over both his hands.

translations.griffith: FULL of effectual wisdom Savitar the God hath stretched out golden arms that he may bring forth life. Young and most skilful, while he holds the region up, the Warrior sprinkles fatness over both his hands.
translations.macdonell: God Savitar, the dexterous, has stretched aloft His arms, that he may stimulate all things to life. Young, vigorous, most skilled, with fatness he His hands besprinkles in the wide expanse of air.

stanzas.sanskrit: दे॒वस्य॑ व॒यं स॑वि॒तुः सवी॑मनि॒ श्रेष्ठे॑ स्याम॒ वसु॑नश्च दा॒वने॑ यो विश्व॑स्य द्वि॒पदो॒ यश्चतु॑ष्पदो नि॒वेश॑ने प्रस॒वे चासि॒ भूम॑नः
stanzas.transliteration: devásya vayáṃ savitúḥ sávīmani śréṣṭhe syāma vásunaś ca dāváne yó víśvasya dvipádo yáś cátuṣpado nivéśane prasavé cā́si bhū́manaḥ
stanzas.translation: May we enjoy the noblest vivifying force of Savitar the God, that he may give us wealth: For thou art mighty to produce and lull to rest the world of life that moves on two feet and on four.

translations.griffith: May we enjoy the noblest vivifying force of Savitar the God, that he may give us wealth: For thou art mighty to produce and lull to rest the world of life that moves on two feet and on four.
translations.macdonell: May we possess god Savitar's most excellent Impulsion, and enjoy his lavish gifts of wealth. Thou art the god who sends to rest and wakes in turn To life the whole two-footed and four-footed world.

stanzas.sanskrit: अद॑ब्धेभिः सवितः पा॒युभि॒ष्ट्वं शि॒वेभि॑र॒द्य परि॑ पाहि नो॒ गय॑म् हिर॑ण्यजिह्वः सुवि॒ताय॒ नव्य॑से॒ रक्षा॒ माकि॑र्नो अ॒घशं॑स ईशत
stanzas.transliteration: ádabdhebhiḥ savitaḥ pāyúbhiṣ ṭváṃ śivébhir adyá pári pāhi no gáyam híraṇyajihvaḥ suvitā́ya návyase rákṣā mā́kir no agháśaṃsa īśata
stanzas.translation: Protect our habitation, Savitar, this day, with guardian aids around, auspicious, firm and true. God of the golden tongue, keep us for newest bliss: let not the evil-wisher have us in his power.

translations.griffith: Protect our habitation, Savitar, this day, with guardian aids around, auspicious, firm and true. God of the golden tongue, keep us for newest bliss: let not the evil-wisher have us in his power.
translations.macdonell: With guards that never fail, auspicious, Savitar, Protect our habitation all around to-day. God of the golden tongue, for welfare ever new Preserve us: let no plotter hold us in his grasp.

stanzas.sanskrit: उदु॒ ष्य दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता दमू॑ना॒ हिर॑ण्यपाणिः प्रतिदो॒षम॑स्थात् अयो॑हनुर्यज॒तो म॒न्द्रजि॑ह्व॒ आ दा॒शुषे॑ सुवति॒ भूरि॑ वा॒मम्
stanzas.transliteration: úd u ṣyá deváḥ savitā́ dámūnāḥ- híraṇyapāṇiḥ pratidoṣám asthāt áyohanur yajató mandrájihvaḥ- ā́ dāśúṣe suvati bhū́ri vāmám
stanzas.translation: This Savitar the God, the golden-handed, Friend of the home, hath risen to meet the twilight. With cheeks of brass, with pleasant tongue, the Holy, he sends the worshipper rich gifts in plenty.

translations.griffith: This Savitar the God, the golden-handed, Friend of the home, hath risen to meet the twilight. With cheeks of brass, with pleasant tongue, the Holy, he sends the worshipper rich gifts in plenty.

stanzas.sanskrit: उदू॑ अयाँ उपव॒क्तेव॑ बा॒हू हि॑र॒ण्यया॑ सवि॒ता सु॒प्रती॑का दि॒वो रोहां॑स्यरुहत्पृथि॒व्या अरी॑रमत्प॒तय॒त्कच्चि॒दभ्व॑म्
stanzas.transliteration: úd ū ayām̐ upavaktéva bāhū́ hiraṇyáyā savitā́ suprátīkā divó róhāṃsy aruhat pr̥thivyā́ḥ- árīramat patáyat kác cid ábhvam
stanzas.translation: Like a Director, Savitar hath extended his golden arms, exceeding fair to look on. He hath gone up the heights of earth and heaven, and made each monster fall and cease from troubling.

translations.griffith: Like a Director, Savitar hath extended his golden arms, exceeding fair to look on. He hath gone up the heights of earth and heaven, and made each monster fall and cease from troubling.
translations.macdonell: Like one who rouses, Savitar has stretched out His golden arms that are so fair of aspect. The heights of heaven and earth he has ascended, And made each flying monster cease from troubling.

stanzas.sanskrit: वा॒मम॒द्य स॑वितर्वा॒ममु॒ श्वो दि॒वेदि॑वे वा॒मम॒स्मभ्यं॑ सावीः वा॒मस्य॒ हि क्षय॑स्य देव॒ भूरे॑र॒या धि॒या वा॑म॒भाजः॑ स्याम
stanzas.transliteration: vāmám adyá savitar vāmám u śvó divé-dive vāmám asmábhyaṃ sāvīḥ vāmásya hí kṣáyasya deva bhū́rer ayā́ dhiyā́ vāmabhā́jaḥ syāma
stanzas.translation: Fair wealth, O Savitar, to-day, to-morrow, fair wealth produce for us each day that passes. May we through this our song be happy gainers, God, of a fair and spacious habitation.

translations.griffith: Fair wealth, O Savitar, to-day, to-morrow, fair wealth produce for us each day that passes. May we through this our song be happy gainers, God, of a fair and spacious habitation.
translations.macdonell: To-day wealth, Savitar, and wealth to-morrow. Bring wealth to us each day by thine impulsion; For over ample wealth, O god, thou rulest: Through this our hymn may we of wealth be sharers.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑सोमा॒ महि॒ तद्वां॑ महि॒त्वं यु॒वं म॒हानि॑ प्रथ॒मानि॑ चक्रथुः यु॒वं सूर्यं॑ विवि॒दथु॑र्यु॒वं स्व१॒॑र्विश्वा॒ तमां॑स्यहतं नि॒दश्च॑
stanzas.transliteration: índrāsomā máhi tád vām mahitváṃ yuvám mahā́ni prathamā́ni cakrathuḥ yuváṃ sū́ryaṃ vividáthur yuváṃ svàr víśvā támāṃsy ahataṃ nidáś ca
stanzas.translation: GREAT is this might of yours, Indra and Soma: the first high exploits were your own achievements. Ye found the Sun ye found the light of heaven: ye killed all darkness and the Gods' blasphemers.

translations.griffith: GREAT is this might of yours, Indra and Soma: the first high exploits were your own achievements. Ye found the Sun ye found the light of heaven: ye killed all darkness and the Gods' blasphemers.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑सोमा वा॒सय॑थ उ॒षास॒मुत्सूर्यं॑ नयथो॒ ज्योति॑षा स॒ह उप॒ द्यां स्क॒म्भथुः॒ स्कम्भ॑ने॒नाप्र॑थतं पृथि॒वीं मा॒तरं॒ वि
stanzas.transliteration: índrāsomā vāsáyatha uṣā́sam út sū́ryaṃ nayatho jyótiṣā sahá úpa dyā́ṃ skambháthu skámbhanena- -áprathatam pr̥thivī́m mātáraṃ ví
stanzas.translation: Ye, Indra-Soma, gave her light to Morning, and led the Sun on high with all his splendour. Ye stayed the heaven with a supporting pillar, and spread abroad apart, the Earth, the Mother.

translations.griffith: Ye, Indra-Soma, gave her light to Morning, and led the Sun on high with all his splendour. Ye stayed the heaven with a supporting pillar, and spread abroad apart, the Earth, the Mother.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑सोमा॒वहि॑म॒पः प॑रि॒ष्ठां ह॒थो वृ॒त्रमनु॑ वां॒ द्यौर॑मन्यत प्रार्णां॑स्यैरयतं न॒दीना॒मा स॑मु॒द्राणि॑ पप्रथुः पु॒रूणि॑
stanzas.transliteration: índrāsomāv áhim apáḥ pariṣṭhā́ṃ hathó vr̥trám ánu vāṃ dyaúr amanyata prā́rṇāṃsy airayataṃ nadī́nām ā́ samudrā́ṇi paprathuḥ purū́ṇi
stanzas.translation: Ye slew the flood -obstructing serpent Vr̥itra, Indra and Soma: Heaven approved your exploit. Ye urged to speed the currents of the rivers, and many seas have ye filled full with waters.

translations.griffith: Ye slew the flood -obstructing serpent Vr̥itra, Indra and Soma: Heaven approved your exploit. Ye urged to speed the currents of the rivers, and many seas have ye filled full with waters.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑सोमा प॒क्वमा॒मास्व॒न्तर्नि गवा॒मिद्द॑धथुर्व॒क्षणा॑सु ज॒गृ॒भथु॒रन॑पिनद्धमासु॒ रुश॑च्चि॒त्रासु॒ जग॑तीष्व॒न्तः
stanzas.transliteration: índrāsomā pakvám āmā́sv antár ní gávām íd dadhathur vakṣáṇāsu jagr̥bháthur ánapinaddham āsu rúśac citrā́su jágatīṣv antáḥ
stanzas.translation: Ye in the unripe udders of the milch-kine have set the ripe milk, Indra, thou, and Soma. Ye have held fast the unimpeded whiteness within these many-coloured moving creatures.

translations.griffith: Ye in the unripe udders of the milch-kine have set the ripe milk, Indra, thou, and Soma. Ye have held fast the unimpeded whiteness within these many-coloured moving creatures.

stanzas.sanskrit: इन्द्रा॑सोमा यु॒वम॒ङ्ग तरु॑त्रमपत्य॒साचं॒ श्रुत्यं॑ रराथे यु॒वं शुष्मं॒ नर्यं॑ चर्ष॒णिभ्यः॒ सं वि॑व्यथुः पृतना॒षाह॑मुग्रा
stanzas.transliteration: índrāsomā yuvám aṅgá tárutram apatyasā́caṃ śrútyaṃ rarāthe yuváṃ śúṣmaṃ náryaṃ carṣaṇíbhyaḥ sáṃ vivyathuḥ pr̥tanāṣā́ham ugrā
