stanzas.translation: Verily ye bestow, Indra and Soma, wealth, famed, victorious, passing to our children. Ye have invested men, ye Mighty Beings, with manly strength that conquers in the battle.

translations.griffith: Verily ye bestow, Indra and Soma, wealth, famed, victorious, passing to our children. Ye have invested men, ye Mighty Beings, with manly strength that conquers in the battle.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो अ॑द्रि॒भित्प्र॑थम॒जा ऋ॒तावा॒ बृह॒स्पति॑राङ्गिर॒सो ह॒विष्मा॑न् द्वि॒बर्ह॑ज्मा प्राघर्म॒सत्पि॒ता न॒ आ रोद॑सी वृष॒भो रो॑रवीति
stanzas.transliteration: yó adribhít prathamajā́ r̥tā́vā bŕ̥haspátir āṅgirasó havíṣmān dvibárhajmā prāgharmasát pitā́ naḥ- ā́ ródasī vr̥ṣabhó roravīti
stanzas.translation: SERVED with oblations, first-born, mountain-render, Angiras' son, Br̥ihaspati, the Holy, With twice-firm path, dwelling in light, our Father, roars loudly, as a bull, to Earth and Heaven.

translations.griffith: SERVED with oblations, first-born, mountain-render, Angiras' son, Br̥ihaspati, the Holy, With twice-firm path, dwelling in light, our Father, roars loudly, as a bull, to Earth and Heaven.

stanzas.sanskrit: जना॑य चि॒द्य ईव॑त उ लो॒कं बृह॒स्पति॑र्दे॒वहू॑तौ च॒कार॑ घ्नन्वृ॒त्राणि॒ वि पुरो॑ दर्दरीति॒ जय॒ञ्छत्रूँ॑र॒मित्रा॑न्पृ॒त्सु साह॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: jánāya cid yá ī́vata ulokám bŕ̥haspátir deváhūtau cakā́ra ghnán vr̥trā́ṇi ví púro dardarīti jáyañ chátrūm̐r amítrān pr̥tsú sā́han
stanzas.translation: Br̥ihaspati, who made for such a people wide room and verge when Gods were invocated, Slaying his enemies, breaks down their castles, quelling his foes and conquering those who hate him.

translations.griffith: Br̥ihaspati, who made for such a people wide room and verge when Gods were invocated, Slaying his enemies, breaks down their castles, quelling his foes and conquering those who hate him.

stanzas.sanskrit: बृह॒स्पतिः॒ सम॑जय॒द्वसू॑नि म॒हो व्र॒जान्गोम॑तो दे॒व ए॒षः अ॒पः सिषा॑स॒न्त्स्व१॒॑रप्र॑तीतो॒ बृह॒स्पति॒र्हन्त्य॒मित्र॑म॒र्कैः
stanzas.transliteration: bŕ̥haspátiḥ sám ajayad vásūni mahó vrajā́n gómato devá eṣáḥ apáḥ síṣāsan svàr ápratīto bŕ̥haspátir hánty amítram arkaíḥ
stanzas.translation: Br̥ihaspati in war hath won rich treasures, hath won, this God, the great stalls filled with cattle. Striving to win waters and light, resistless, Br̥ihaspati with lightning smites the foeman.

translations.griffith: Br̥ihaspati in war hath won rich treasures, hath won, this God, the great stalls filled with cattle. Striving to win waters and light, resistless, Br̥ihaspati with lightning smites the foeman.

stanzas.sanskrit: सोमा॑रुद्रा धा॒रये॑थामसु॒र्यं१॒॑ प्र वा॑मि॒ष्टयोऽर॑मश्नुवन्तु दमे॑दमे स॒प्त रत्ना॒ दधा॑ना॒ शं नो॑ भूतं द्वि॒पदे॒ शं चतु॑ष्पदे
stanzas.transliteration: sómārudrā dhāráyethām asuryàm prá vām iṣṭáyó 'ram aśnuvantu dáme-dame saptá rátnā dádhānā śáṃ no bhūtaṃ dvipáde śáṃ cátuṣpade
stanzas.translation: HOLD fast your Godlike sway, O Soma-Rudra: let these our sacrifices quickly reach you. Placing in every house your seven great treasures, bring blessing to our quadrupeds and bipeds.

translations.griffith: HOLD fast your Godlike sway, O Soma-Rudra: let these our sacrifices quickly reach you. Placing in every house your seven great treasures, bring blessing to our quadrupeds and bipeds.
translations.müller: Soma and Rudra, may you maintain your divine dominion, and may the oblations reach you properly. Bringing the seven treasures to every house, be kind to our children and our cattle.

stanzas.sanskrit: सोमा॑रुद्रा॒ वि वृ॑हतं॒ विषू॑ची॒ममी॑वा॒ या नो॒ गय॑मावि॒वेश॑ आ॒रे बा॑धेथां॒ निर्ऋ॑तिं परा॒चैर॒स्मे भ॒द्रा सौ॑श्रव॒सानि॑ सन्तु
stanzas.transliteration: sómārudrā ví vr̥hataṃ víṣūcīm ámīvā yā́ no gáyam āvivéśa āré bādhethāṃ nírr̥tim parācaír asmé bhadrā́ sauśravasā́ni santu
stanzas.translation: Soma and Rudra, chase to every quarter the sickness that hath visited our dwelling. Drive Nirr̥iti away into the distance, and give us excellent and happy glories.

translations.griffith: Soma and Rudra, chase to every quarter the sickness that hath visited our dwelling. Drive Nirr̥iti away into the distance, and give us excellent and happy glories.
translations.müller: Soma and Rudra, draw far away in every direction 1 the disease 2 which has entered our house. Drive far away Nirriti 3, and may auspicious glories belong to us!

stanzas.sanskrit: सोमा॑रुद्रा यु॒वमे॒तान्य॒स्मे विश्वा॑ त॒नूषु॑ भेष॒जानि॑ धत्तम् अव॑ स्यतं मु॒ञ्चतं॒ यन्नो॒ अस्ति॑ त॒नूषु॑ ब॒द्धं कृ॒तमेनो॑ अ॒स्मत्
stanzas.transliteration: sómārudrā yuvám etā́ny asmé víśvā tanū́ṣu bheṣajā́ni dhattam áva syatam muñcátaṃ yán no ásti tanū́ṣu baddháṃ kr̥tám éno asmát
stanzas.translation: Provide, O Soma-Rudra, for our bodies all needful medicines to heal and cure us. Set free and draw away the sin committed which we have still inherent in our persons.

translations.griffith: Provide, O Soma-Rudra, for our bodies all needful medicines to heal and cure us. Set free and draw away the sin committed which we have still inherent in our persons.
translations.müller: Soma and Rudra, bestow all these remedies on our bodies. Tear away and remove from us  1 whatever evil we have committed, which clings to our bodies.

stanzas.sanskrit: ति॒ग्मायु॑धौ ति॒ग्महे॑ती सु॒शेवौ॒ सोमा॑रुद्रावि॒ह सु मृ॑ळतं नः प्र नो॑ मुञ्चतं॒ वरु॑णस्य॒ पाशा॑द्गोपा॒यतं॑ नः सुमन॒स्यमा॑ना
stanzas.transliteration: tigmā́yudhau tigmáhetī suśévau sómārudrāv ihá sú mr̥ḷataṃ naḥ prá no muñcataṃ váruṇasya pā́śād gopāyátaṃ naḥ sumanasyámānā
stanzas.translation: Armed with keen shafts and weapons, kind and loving, be gracious unto us, Soma and Rudra. Release us from the noose of Varuṇa; keep us from sorrow, in your tender loving-kindness.

translations.griffith: Armed with keen shafts and weapons, kind and loving, be gracious unto us, Soma and Rudra. Release us from the noose of Varuṇa; keep us from sorrow, in your tender loving-kindness.
translations.müller: Soma and Rudra, wielding sharp weapons and sharp bolts, kind friends, be gracious unto us here! Deliver us from the snare of Varuna, and guard us, as kind-hearted gods!

stanzas.sanskrit: जी॒मूत॑स्येव भवति॒ प्रती॑कं॒ यद्व॒र्मी याति॑ स॒मदा॑मु॒पस्थे॑ अना॑विद्धया त॒न्वा॑ जय॒ त्वं स त्वा॒ वर्म॑णो महि॒मा पि॑पर्तु
stanzas.transliteration: jīmū́tasyeva bhavati prátīkaṃ yád varmī́ yā́ti samádām upásthe ánāviddhayā tanvā̀ jaya tváṃ sá tvā vármaṇo mahimā́ pipartu
stanzas.translation: THE warrior's look is like a thunderous rain-cloud's, when, armed with mail, he seeks the lap of battle. Be thou victorious with unwounded body: so let the thickness of thy mail protect thee.

translations.griffith: THE warrior's look is like a thunderous rain-cloud's, when, armed with mail, he seeks the lap of battle. Be thou victorious with unwounded body: so let the thickness of thy mail protect thee.

stanzas.sanskrit: धन्व॑ना॒ गा धन्व॑ना॒जिं ज॑येम॒ धन्व॑ना ती॒व्राः स॒मदो॑ जयेम धनुः॒ शत्रो॑रपका॒मं कृ॑णोति॒ धन्व॑ना॒ सर्वाः॑ प्र॒दिशो॑ जयेम
stanzas.transliteration: dhánvanā gā́ dhánvanājíṃ jayema dhánvanā tīvrā́ḥ samádo jayema dhánuḥ śátror apakāmáṃ kr̥ṇoti dhánvanā sárvāḥ pradíśo jayema
stanzas.translation: With Bow let us win kine, with Bow the battle, with Bow be victors in our hot encounters. The Bow brings grief and sorrow to the foeman: armed with the Bow may we subdue all regions.

translations.griffith: With Bow let us win kine, with Bow the battle, with Bow be victors in our hot encounters. The Bow brings grief and sorrow to the foeman: armed with the Bow may we subdue all regions.

stanzas.sanskrit: व॒क्ष्यन्ती॒वेदा ग॑नीगन्ति॒ कर्णं॑ प्रि॒यं सखा॑यं परिषस्वजा॒ना योषे॑व शिङ्क्ते॒ वित॒ताधि॒ धन्व॒ञ्ज्या इ॒यं सम॑ने पा॒रय॑न्ती
stanzas.transliteration: vakṣyántīvéd ā́ ganīganti kárṇam priyáṃ sákhāyam pariṣasvajānā́ yóṣeva śiṅkte vítatā́dhi dhánvañ jyā́ iyáṃ sámane pāráyantī
stanzas.translation: Close to his car, as fain to speak, She presses, holding her well-loved Friend in her embraces. Strained on the Bow, She whispers like a woman-this Bowstring that preserves us in the combat.

translations.griffith: Close to his car, as fain to speak, She presses, holding her well-loved Friend in her embraces. Strained on the Bow, She whispers like a woman-this Bowstring that preserves us in the combat.

stanzas.sanskrit: ते आ॒चर॑न्ती॒ सम॑नेव॒ योषा॑ मा॒तेव॑ पु॒त्रं बि॑भृतामु॒पस्थे॑ अप॒ शत्रू॑न्विध्यतां संविदा॒ने आर्त्नी॑ इ॒मे वि॑ष्फु॒रन्ती॑ अ॒मित्रा॑न्
stanzas.transliteration: té ācárantī sámaneva yóṣā mātéva putrám bibhr̥tām upásthe ápa śátrūn vidhyatāṃ saṃvidāné ā́rtnī imé viṣphurántī amítrān
stanzas.translation: These, meeting like a woman and her lover, bear, mother-like, their child upon their bosom. May the two Bow-ends, starting swift asunder, scatter, in unison, the foes who hate us.

translations.griffith: These, meeting like a woman and her lover, bear, mother-like, their child upon their bosom. May the two Bow-ends, starting swift asunder, scatter, in unison, the foes who hate us.

stanzas.sanskrit: ब॒ह्वी॒नां पि॒ता ब॒हुर॑स्य पु॒त्रश्चि॒श्चा कृ॑णोति॒ सम॑नाव॒गत्य॑ इ॒षु॒धिः सङ्काः॒ पृत॑नाश्च॒ सर्वाः॑ पृ॒ष्ठे निन॑द्धो जयति॒ प्रसू॑तः
stanzas.transliteration: bahvīnā́m pitā́ bahúr asya putráś ciścā́ kr̥ṇoti sámanāvagátya iṣudhíḥ sáṅkāḥ pŕ̥tanāś ca sárvāḥ pr̥ṣṭhé nínaddho jayati prásūtaḥ
stanzas.translation: With many a son, father of many daughters, He clangs and clashes as he goes to battle. Slung on the back, pouring his brood, the Quiver vanquishes all opposing bands and armies.

translations.griffith: With many a son, father of many daughters, He clangs and clashes as he goes to battle. Slung on the back, pouring his brood, the Quiver vanquishes all opposing bands and armies.

stanzas.sanskrit: रथे॒ तिष्ठ॑न्नयति वा॒जिनः॑ पु॒रो यत्र॑यत्र का॒मय॑ते सुषार॒थिः अ॒भीशू॑नां महि॒मानं॑ पनायत॒ मनः॑ प॒श्चादनु॑ यच्छन्ति र॒श्मयः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ráthe tíṣṭhan nayati vājínaḥ puró yátra-yatra kāmáyate suṣārathíḥ abhī́śūnām mahimā́nam panāyata mánaḥ paścā́d ánu yachanti raśmáyaḥ
stanzas.translation: Upstanding in the Car the skilful Charioteer guides his strong Horses on whithersoe'er he will. See and admire the strength of those controlling Reins which from behind declare the will of him who drives.

translations.griffith: Upstanding in the Car the skilful Charioteer guides his strong Horses on whithersoe'er he will. See and admire the strength of those controlling Reins which from behind declare the will of him who drives.

stanzas.sanskrit: ती॒व्रान्घोषा॑न्कृण्वते॒ वृष॑पाण॒योऽश्वा॒ रथे॑भिः स॒ह वा॒जय॑न्तः अ॒व॒क्राम॑न्तः॒ प्रप॑दैर॒मित्रा॑न्क्षि॒णन्ति॒ शत्रूँ॒रन॑पव्ययन्तः
stanzas.transliteration: tīvrā́n ghóṣān kr̥ṇvate vŕ̥ṣapāṇayaḥ- -áśvā ráthebhiḥ sahá vājáyantaḥ avakrā́mantaḥ prápadair amítrān kṣiṇánti śátrūm̐r ánapavyayantaḥ
stanzas.translation: Horses whose hoofs rain dust are neighing loudly, yoked to the Chariots, showing forth their vigour, With their forefeet descending on the foemen, they, never flinching, trample and destroy them.

translations.griffith: Horses whose hoofs rain dust are neighing loudly, yoked to the Chariots, showing forth their vigour, With their forefeet descending on the foemen, they, never flinching, trample and destroy them.

stanzas.sanskrit: र॒थ॒वाह॑नं ह॒विर॑स्य॒ नाम॒ यत्रायु॑धं॒ निहि॑तमस्य॒ वर्म॑ तत्रा॒ रथ॒मुप॑ श॒ग्मं स॑देम वि॒श्वाहा॑ व॒यं सु॑मन॒स्यमा॑नाः
stanzas.transliteration: rathavā́hanaṃ havír asya nā́ma yátrā́yudhaṃ níhitam asya várma tátrā rátham úpa śagmáṃ sadema viśvā́hā vayáṃ sumanasyámānāḥ
stanzas.translation: Car-bearer is the name of his oblation, whercon are laid his Weapons and his Armour. So let us here, each day that passes, honour the helpful Car with hearts exceeding joyful.

translations.griffith: Car-bearer is the name of his oblation, whercon are laid his Weapons and his Armour. So let us here, each day that passes, honour the helpful Car with hearts exceeding joyful.

stanzas.sanskrit: स्वा॒दु॒षं॒सदः॑ पि॒तरो॑ वयो॒धाः कृ॑च्छ्रे॒श्रितः॒ शक्ती॑वन्तो गभी॒राः चि॒त्रसे॑ना॒ इषु॑बला॒ अमृ॑ध्राः स॒तोवी॑रा उ॒रवो॑ व्रातसा॒हाः
stanzas.transliteration: svāduṣaṃsádaḥ pitáro vayodhā́ḥ kr̥chreśrítaḥ śáktīvanto gabhīrā́ḥ citrásenā íṣubalā ámr̥dhrāḥ satóvīrā urávo vrātasāhā́ḥ
stanzas.translation: In sweet association lived the fathers who gave us life, profound and strong in trouble, Unwearied, armed with shafts and wondrous weapons, free, real heroes, conquerors of armies.

translations.griffith: In sweet association lived the fathers who gave us life, profound and strong in trouble, Unwearied, armed with shafts and wondrous weapons, free, real heroes, conquerors of armies.

stanzas.sanskrit: ब्राह्म॑णासः॒ पित॑रः॒ सोम्या॑सः शि॒वे नो॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी अ॑ने॒हसा॑ पू॒षा नः॑ पातु दुरि॒तादृ॑तावृधो॒ रक्षा॒ माकि॑र्नो अ॒घशं॑स ईशत
stanzas.transliteration: brā́hmaṇāsaḥ pítaraḥ sómyāsaḥ śivé no dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ anehásā pūṣā́ naḥ pātu duritā́d r̥tāvr̥dho rákṣā mā́kir no agháśaṃsa īśata
stanzas.translation: The Brahmans, and the Fathers meet for Soma-draughts, and, graciously inclined, unequalled Heaven and Earth. Guard us trom evil, Pûshan, guard us strengtheners of Law: let not the evil-wisher master us.

translations.griffith: The Brahmans, and the Fathers meet for Soma-draughts, and, graciously inclined, unequalled Heaven and Earth. Guard us trom evil, Pûshan, guard us strengtheners of Law: let not the evil-wisher master us.

stanzas.sanskrit: सु॒प॒र्णं व॑स्ते मृ॒गो अ॑स्या॒ दन्तो॒ गोभिः॒ संन॑द्धा पतति॒ प्रसू॑ता यत्रा॒ नरः॒ सं च॒ वि च॒ द्रव॑न्ति॒ तत्रा॒स्मभ्य॒मिष॑वः॒ शर्म॑ यंसन्
stanzas.transliteration: suparṇáṃ vaste mr̥gó asyā dánto góbhiḥ sáṃnaddhā patati prásūtā yátrā náraḥ sáṃ ca ví ca drávanti tátrāsmábhyam íṣavaḥ śárma yaṃsan
stanzas.translation: Her tooth a deer, dressed in an eagle's feathers, bound with cow-hide, launched forth, She flieth onward. There where the heroes speed hither and thither, there may the Arrows shelter and protect us.

translations.griffith: Her tooth a deer, dressed in an eagle's feathers, bound with cow-hide, launched forth, She flieth onward. There where the heroes speed hither and thither, there may the Arrows shelter and protect us.

stanzas.sanskrit: ऋजी॑ते॒ परि॑ वृङ्धि॒ नोऽश्मा॑ भवतु नस्त॒नूः सोमो॒ अधि॑ ब्रवीतु॒ नोऽदि॑तिः॒ शर्म॑ यच्छतु
stanzas.transliteration: ŕ̥jīte pári vr̥ṅdhi naḥ- -áśmā bhavatu nas tanū́ḥ sómo ádhi bravītu naḥ- -áditiḥ śárma yachatu
stanzas.translation: Avoid us thou whose flight is straight, and let our bodies be as stone. May Soma kindly speak to us, and Aditi protect us well.

translations.griffith: Avoid us thou whose flight is straight, and let our bodies be as stone. May Soma kindly speak to us, and Aditi protect us well.

stanzas.sanskrit: आ ज॑ङ्घन्ति॒ सान्वे॑षां ज॒घनाँ॒ उप॑ जिघ्नते अश्वा॑जनि॒ प्रचे॑त॒सोऽश्वा॑न्त्स॒मत्सु॑ चोदय
stanzas.transliteration: ā́ jaṅghanti sā́nv eṣāṃ jaghánām̐ úpa jighnate áśvājani prácetasaḥ- -áśvān samátsu codaya
stanzas.translation: He lays his blows upon their backs, he deals his blows upon their thighs. Thou, Whip, who urgest horses, drive sagacious horses in the fray.

translations.griffith: He lays his blows upon their backs, he deals his blows upon their thighs. Thou, Whip, who urgest horses, drive sagacious horses in the fray.

stanzas.sanskrit: अहि॑रिव भो॒गैः पर्ये॑ति बा॒हुं ज्याया॑ हे॒तिं प॑रि॒बाध॑मानः ह॒स्त॒घ्नो विश्वा॑ व॒युना॑नि वि॒द्वान्पुमा॒न्पुमां॑सं॒ परि॑ पातु वि॒श्वतः॑
stanzas.transliteration: áhir iva bhogaíḥ páry eti bāhúṃ jyā́yā hetím paribā́dhamānaḥ hastaghnó víśvā vayúnāni vidvā́n púmān púmāṃsam pári pātu viśvátaḥ
stanzas.translation: It compasses the arm with serpent windings, fending away the friction of the bowstring: So may the Brace, well-skilled in all its duties, guard manfully the man from every quarter.

translations.griffith: It compasses the arm with serpent windings, fending away the friction of the bowstring: So may the Brace, well-skilled in all its duties, guard manfully the man from every quarter.

stanzas.sanskrit: आला॑क्ता॒ या रुरु॑शी॒र्ष्ण्यथो॒ यस्या॒ अयो॒ मुख॑म् इ॒दं प॒र्जन्य॑रेतस॒ इष्वै॑ दे॒व्यै बृ॒हन्नमः॑
stanzas.transliteration: ā́lāktā yā́ rúruśīrṣṇī- átho yásyā áyo múkham idám parjányaretase- íṣvai devyaí br̥hán námaḥ
stanzas.translation: Now to the Shaft with venom smeared, tipped with deer-horn, with iron mouth, Celestial, of Parjanya's seed, be this great adoration paid.

translations.griffith: Now to the Shaft with venom smeared, tipped with deer-horn, with iron mouth, Celestial, of Parjanya's seed, be this great adoration paid.

stanzas.sanskrit: अव॑सृष्टा॒ परा॑ पत॒ शर॑व्ये॒ ब्रह्म॑संशिते गच्छा॒मित्रा॒न्प्र प॑द्यस्व॒ मामीषां॒ कं च॒नोच्छि॑षः
stanzas.transliteration: ávasr̥ṣṭā párā pata śáravye bráhmasaṃśite gáchāmítrān prá padyasva mā́mī́ṣāṃ káṃ canóc chiṣaḥ
stanzas.translation: Loosed from the Bowstring fly away, thou Arrow, sharpened by our prayer. Go to the foemen, strike them home, and let not one be left alive.

translations.griffith: Loosed from the Bowstring fly away, thou Arrow, sharpened by our prayer. Go to the foemen, strike them home, and let not one be left alive.

stanzas.sanskrit: यत्र॑ बा॒णाः स॒म्पत॑न्ति कुमा॒रा वि॑शि॒खा इ॑व तत्रा॑ नो॒ ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पति॒रदि॑तिः॒ शर्म॑ यच्छतु वि॒श्वाहा॒ शर्म॑ यच्छतु
stanzas.transliteration: yátra bāṇā́ḥ sampátanti kumārā́ viśikhā́ iva tátrā no bráhmaṇas pátir -áditiḥ śárma yachatu viśvā́hā śárma yachatu
stanzas.translation: There where the flights of Arrows fall like boys whose locks are yet unshorn. Even there may Brahmaṇaspati, and Aditi protect us well, protect us well through all our days.

translations.griffith: There where the flights of Arrows fall like boys whose locks are yet unshorn. Even there may Brahmaṇaspati, and Aditi protect us well, protect us well through all our days.

stanzas.sanskrit: मर्मा॑णि ते॒ वर्म॑णा छादयामि॒ सोम॑स्त्वा॒ राजा॒मृते॒नानु॑ वस्ताम् उ॒रोर्वरी॑यो॒ वरु॑णस्ते कृणोतु॒ जय॑न्तं॒ त्वानु॑ दे॒वा म॑दन्तु
stanzas.transliteration: mármāṇi te vármaṇā chādayāmi sómas tvā rā́jāmŕ̥tenā́nu vastām urór várīyo váruṇas te kr̥ṇotu jáyantaṃ tvā́nu devā́ madantu
stanzas.translation: Thy vital parts I cover with thine Armour: with immortality King Soma clothe thee. Varuṇa give tliee what is more than ample, and in thy triumph may the Gods be joyful.

translations.griffith: Thy vital parts I cover with thine Armour: with immortality King Soma clothe thee. Varuṇa give tliee what is more than ample, and in thy triumph may the Gods be joyful.

stanzas.sanskrit: यो नः॒ स्वो अर॑णो॒ यश्च॒ निष्ट्यो॒ जिघां॑सति दे॒वास्तं सर्वे॑ धूर्वन्तु॒ ब्रह्म॒ वर्म॒ ममान्त॑रम्
stanzas.transliteration: yó naḥ svó áraṇo yáś ca níṣṭyo jíghāṃsati devā́s táṃ sárve dhūrvantu bráhma várma mámā́ntaram
stanzas.translation: Whoso would kill us, whether he be a strange foe or one of us, May all the Gods discomfit him. My nearest, closest Mail is prayer.

translations.griffith: Whoso would kill us, whether he be a strange foe or one of us, May all the Gods discomfit him. My nearest, closest Mail is prayer.
